If it is casting a spell of 4th level or higher, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability. The DC equals 10 + the spell's level. On a success, the creature's spell fails and has no effect.

At Higher Levels.

When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the interrupted spell has no effect if its level is less than or equal to the level of the spell slot you used.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Activated: Hold Monster - 5th
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
Choose a creature that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be &Reference[Paralyzed] for the Duration. This spell has no effect on Undead. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make another Wisdom saving throw. On a success, the spell ends on the target.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 5th. The creatures must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Activated: Soul Cage - 6th
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
This spell snatches the soul of a humanoid as it dies and traps it inside the tiny cage you use for the material component. A stolen soul remains inside the cage until the spell ends or until you destroy the cage, which ends the spell. While you have a soul inside the cage, you can exploit it in any of the ways described below. You can use a trapped soul up to six times. Once you exploit a soul for the sixth time, it is released, and the spell ends. While a soul is trapped, the dead humanoid it came from can't be revived.

Steal Life. You can use a bonus action to drain vigor from the soul and regain [[/r 2d8]] hit points for each exploit you choose to expend this way.

Query Soul. You ask the soul a question (no action required) and receive a brief telepathic answer, which you can understand regardless of the language used. The soul knows only what it knew in life, but it must answer you truthfully and to the best of its ability. The answer is no more than a sentence or two and might be cryptic.

Borrow Experience. When you make an attack roll, damage roll, ability check, or saving throw, you can expend one or more exploits to add a +1 bonus to the roll for each one.

Eyes of the Dead. You can use an action to name a place the humanoid saw in life, which creates an invisible sensor somewhere in that place if it is on the plane of existence you're currently on. The sensor remains for as long as you concentrate, up to 10 minutes (as if you were concentrating on a spell). You receive visual and auditory information from the sensor as if you were in its space using your senses.

A creature that can see the sensor (such as one using See Invisibility or &Reference[rule=truesight]) sees a translucent image of the tormented humanoid whose soul you caged.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Activated: Mental Prison - 6th
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
You attempt to bind a creature within an illusory cell that only it perceives. One creature you can see within range must make an Intelligence saving throw. The target succeeds automatically if it is immune to being &Reference[condition=charmed].

On a successful save, the target takes [[/damage 5d10 type=psychic]] damage, and the spell ends. On a failed save, the target takes [[/damage 5d10 type=psychic]] damage, and you make the area immediately around the target's space appear dangerous to it in some way. You might cause the target to perceive itself as being surrounded by fire, floating razors, or hideous maws filled with dripping teeth. Whatever form the illusion takes, the target is &Reference[blinded] and &Reference[deafened] to anything beyond it and is &Reference[restrained] for the spell's duration. If the target is moved out of the illusion, makes a melee attack through it, or reaches any part of its body through it, the target takes [[/damage 10d10 type=psychic]] damage, and the spell ends.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Activated: Shield - 1st
Fearghas MacAllistar.description: An invisible barrier of magical force appears and protects you. Until the start of your next turn, you have a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and you take no damage from magic missile.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Activated: Shield - 1st
Fearghas MacAllistar.description: An invisible barrier of magical force appears and protects you. Until the start of your next turn, you have a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and you take no damage from magic missile.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Triggered: Greater Restoration - 9th
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
Trigger: Whenever I'm inflicted with any effect this spell can remove apart from cursed.

You imbue a creature you touch with positive energy to undo a debilitating effect. You can reduce the target's exhaustion level by one, or end one of the following effects on the target:

One effect that &Reference[condition=charmed] or &Reference[condition=petrified] the target

One curse, including the target's attunement to a cursed magic item

Any reduction to one of the target's ability scores

One effect reducing the target's hit point maximum

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Polymorph
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
This spell transforms a creature that you can see within range into a new form. An unwilling creature must make a Wisdom saving throw to avoid the effect. The spell has no effect on a shapechanger or a creature with 0 hit points.

The transformation lasts for the duration, or until the target drops to 0 hit points or dies. The new form can be any beast whose challenge rating is equal to or less than the target's (or the target's level, if it doesn't have a challenge rating). The target's game statistics, including mental ability scores, are replaced by the statistics of the chosen beast. It retains its alignment and personality.

The target assumes the hit points of its new form. When it reverts to its normal form, the creature returns to the number of hit points it had before it transformed. If it reverts as a result of dropping to 0 hit points, any excess damage carries over to its normal form. As long as the excess damage doesn't reduce the creature's normal form to 0 hit points, it isn't knocked unconscious.

The creature is limited in the actions it can perform by the nature of its new form, and it can't speak, cast spells, or take any other action that requires hands or speech.

The target's gear melds into the new form. The creature can't activate, use, wield, or otherwise benefit from any of its equipment.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Small Bronze Hammer
Fearghas MacAllistar.description: You are certain that this hammer wasn't here when you entered…

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Potion of Diminution
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
The red in the potion's liquid continuously contracts to a tiny bead and then expands to color the clear liquid around it. Shaking the bottle fails to interrupt this process.

When you drink this potion, you gain the "reduce" effect of the enlarge/reduce spell for 1d4 hours (no concentration required):

While reduced, your size is decreased by one category and your weight is reduced to one-eight.
You have disadvantage on Strength checks and saving throws and your attacks with weapons deal 1d4 less damage.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Activated: Deadly Sting - 8th
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
You animate the thorn used as the material component of this spell, directing it to strike a creature in range. Make a melee spell attack against a creature you can see within range.

On a hit, the target takes [[/damage 1d4 type=piercing]] damage plus [[/damage 4d10 type=poison]] damage, and a creature must make a successful Constitution saving throw or become vulnerable to poison damage for the duration of the spell. Until the spell ends, you can make the attack again on each of your turns as an action.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Activated: Silence - 2nd
Fearghas MacAllistar.description: For the duration, no sound can be created within or pass through a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point you choose within range. Any creature or object entirely inside the sphere is immune to thunder damage, and creatures are Deafened while entirely inside it. Casting a spell that includes a verbal component is impossible there.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Activated: Greater Restoration - 9th
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
You imbue a creature you touch with positive energy to undo a debilitating effect. You can reduce the target's exhaustion level by one, or end one of the following effects on the target:

One effect that &Reference[condition=charmed] or &Reference[condition=petrified] the target

One curse, including the target's attunement to a cursed magic item

Any reduction to one of the target's ability scores

One effect reducing the target's hit point maximum

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Oathgold Coin
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
This brilliant, lusterous metal is sacred to the dwarves, said to be the very blood of Smednir, god of gold and gems, who was the first to forge enchanted relics. When he sought to share his love of gold and jewels with the dwarves, Torag forbade it, warning that such gifts would only sow greed and strife among them. But Smednir pleaded, swearing a solemn oath that he alone would bear the burden of greed, so that his kin might cherish wealth without being consumed by it.

Yet as the dwarves flourished, so too did their desires, and Smednir’s burden grew heavier with each passing age. In time, the weight proved too great, and inevitably, he faltered. For this failure, Torag beheaded him, and the blood that flowed from his severed neck sunk deep into the earth, forming veins of Oathgold.

To the dwarves, Smednir’s fall is no tale of treachery, but of tragedy. His story serves as both a warning against making promises one cannot keep and a solemn reminder that no oath, once sworn, is without consequence. Even the smallest broken word carries weight, and so it is said that consuming an Oathgold Coin may absolve a minor lapse, easing the burden of guilt in the eyes of the gods.

Oathbound Exchange

A creature holding an Oathgold Coin can consume it as a bonus action to immediately end attunement to one magical item and immediately attune to another magical item in its possession. This new attunement does not require a short rest.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Doom of Stacked Stones
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
You and up to three creatures of your choice within range must succeed on a Constitution saving throw when the spell is cast and again at the start of each of your turns while the spell is in effect. A creature whose saving throw fails is &Reference[condition=restrained]. If one of the three targeted creatures fails this saving throw, as many as two other creatures (per initial target), each within 30 feet of the initial target, must make the same save. A &Reference[condition=restrained] creature must continue to make saving throws at the start of each of their turns, ending the effect on themselves on a success, or their condition worsens on a failure, as follows:

Number of Turns AffectedCondition
1 (spell is cast)&Reference[restrained]
2&Reference[incapacitated]
3&Reference[stunned]
4&Reference[paralyzed]
5&Reference[petrified] (turned to stone)

If you maintain your concentration on this spell for the entire possible duration, each creature still petrified of CR of less than or equal to 1.5 times the spell's level is turned to stone until the effect is removed.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Whirlwind
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
A whirlwind howls down to a point that you can see on the ground within range. The whirlwind is a 10-foot-radius, 30-foot-high cylinder centered on that point. Until the spell ends, you can use your action to move the whirlwind up to 30 feet in any direction along the ground. The whirlwind sucks up any Medium or smaller objects that aren't secured to anything and that aren't worn or carried by anyone.

A creature must make a Dexterity saving throw the first time on a turn that it enters the whirlwind or that the whirlwind enters its space, including when the whirlwind first appears. A creature takes 10d6 bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. In addition, a Large or smaller creature that fails the save must succeed on a Strength saving throw or become Restrained in the whirlwind until the spell ends. When a creature starts its turn Restrained by the whirlwind, the creature is pulled 5 feet higher inside it, unless the creature is at the top. A Restrained creature moves with the whirlwind and falls when the spell ends, unless the creature has some means to stay aloft.

A Restrained creature can use an action to make a Strength or Dexterity check against your spell save DC. If successful, the creature is no longer Restrained by the whirlwind and is hurled 3d6 × 10 feet away from it in a random direction.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Water Flower
Fearghas MacAllistar.description: Flourishes in warm thermal springs. Its broad, floating leaves are star-shaped and create a dense canopy over the water's surface. The petals are translucent, allowing sunlight to filter through.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Potion of Water Breathing
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
Its cloudy green fluid smells of the sea and has a jellyfish-like bubble floating in it.

You can breathe underwater for 1 hour after drinking this potion.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Silver Tears
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
In the depths of Mestopheles' dungeons on Cania, the 8th layer of Hell, pain devils extract this silvery powder through the torture of captured celestials. Devils bound for the warfronts of Avernus take flasks and snuff boxes of the stuff to fortify themselves against exposure to the raw chaos of demons.

When you consume this substance as an action, you have advantage on saving throws against any effect from a demonic source for 8 hours.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Manual of Fiendish Flesh Golems
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
This tome contains information and incantations necessary to make a particular type of golem. To decipher and use the manual, you must be a spellcaster with at least two 5th-level spell slots. A creature that can't use a manual of golems and attempts to read it takes [[/damage 6d6 type=psychic]] damage.

To create a @UUID[Compendium.talia-custom.talia-actors.Actor.w3BwRqXWe2cDS6fr]{Fiendish Flesh Golem}, you must spend 60 days, working without interruption with the manual at hand and resting no more than 8 hours per day. You must also pay 50,000 gp to purchase supplies. Once you finish creating the golem, the book is consumed in eldritch flames. The golem becomes animate when the ashes of the manual are sprinkled on it. It is under your control, and it understands and obeys your spoken commands.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Soul Coin
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
Soul coins are about 5 inches across and about an inch thick, minted from infernal iron. Each coin weighs one-third of a pound, and is inscribed with Infernal writing and a spell that magically binds a single soul to the coin. Because each soul coin has a unique soul trapped within it, each has a story. A creature might have been imprisoned as a result of defaulting on a deal, while another might be the victim of a night hag's curse.

Carrying Soul Coins. To hold a soul coin is to feel the soul bound within it—overcome with rage or fraught with despair. An evil creature can carry as many soul coins as it wishes (up to its maximum weight allowance). A non-evil creature can carry a number of soul coins equal to or less than its Constitution modifier without penalty. A non-evil creature carrying a number of soul coins greater than its Constitution modifier has disadvantage on its attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws.

Freeing a Soul. Casting a spell that removes a curse on a soul coin frees the soul trapped within it, as does expending all of the coin's charges. The coin itself rusts from within and is destroyed once the soul is released. A freed soul travels to the realm of the god it served or the outer plane most closely tied to its alignment (DM's choice). The souls of lawful evil creatures released from soul coins typically emerge from the River Styx as devils.

Hellish Currency. Soul coins are a currency of the Nine Hells and are highly valued by devils. The coins are used among the infernal hierarchy to barter for favours, bribe the unwilling, and reward the faithful for services rendered. Soul coins are created by Mammon and his greater devils on Minauros, the third layer of the Nine Hells, in a vast chamber where the captured souls of evil mortals are bound into the coins. These coins are then distributed throughout the Nine Hells to be used for goods and services, infernal deals, dark bargains, and bribes.

Unmake a Soul. When casting a spell which requires repeated castings for it's effects to become permanent, soul coins can be expended as a material component and the souls trapped inside unmade. Each soul coin expended this way reduces the number of required castings by three. Unmaking a soul is different to freeing it as doing so erases the soul from existence itself, it's essence lost forever.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Hearthstone
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
The Hearthstone is a sacred item among all giantkin. These heavy, flat pieces of granite—typically 1 to 2 feet in diameter—are painstakingly carved by mighty runepriests, imbued with ancient magic to tether the bearer’s essence to a place of safety. Revered as both currency and a protective charm, Hearthstones are traded between giants with great reverence, their value lying not only in material worth but in the promise of an arduous but ultimately safe journey back home in death, for those strong enough to endure it.

Shattering. When a creature carrying a Hearthstone dies, the Hearthstone shatters. Upon doing so, the creature must make a [[/save con DC 18]] saving throw. On a successful save, the creature's body and any attuned items it carried at the time of its death instantly return to the location of its last extended rest. The body appears unconscious, afflicted by a deep fever, and remains in this state until the soul completes its return journey.

Unless the creature’s soul is captured at the time of the creature's death, it must travel through a cold and snow-covered woodland, eventually finding refuge in a warm cabin, symbolizing its body. The journey back to its body takes a number of weeks equal to 50 minus the result of the saving throw (minimum of 1 week). During this time, the creature cannot be revived by any means, including spells like revivify or raise dead.

Once the soul completes its journey, the creature’s fever breaks, and it awakens with 1 hit point. The Hearthstone is destroyed after use and cannot be restored or repaired.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Pyrope
Fearghas MacAllistar.description: Pyrope, a type of garnet known for its exquisite beauty, also holds military significance. It is believed that adorning weaponry with this garnet allows it to penetrate the thickest hides or demolish the strongest doors, aided by arcane forces.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Jade
Fearghas MacAllistar.description: Its primary form is called Jadeite, after cutting, it's mainly used in ornamental sculptures and figurines. Musicians of all kinds believed that if they wore Jade, they would improve their musical prowess

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Potion of Greater Healing
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
The potion's red liquid glimmers when agitated.

You regain 4d4 + 4 hit points when you drink this potion.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Potion of Speed
Fearghas MacAllistar.description: When you drink this potion, you gain the effect of the Haste spell for 1 minute (no concentration required). The potion's yellow fluid is streaked with black and swirls on its own.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Shimmerleaf
Fearghas MacAllistar.description: Found deep within dry caves, emitting a pale, ghostly glow in the darkness. Its slender, purple-green leaves shimmer faintly, casting an ethereal luminescence that illuminates the cavern's depths.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Potion of Supreme Healing
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
The potion's red liquid glimmers when agitated.

You regain 10d4 + 20 hit points when you drink this potion.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Dispelling Stone
Fearghas MacAllistar.description: This smooth, rainbow-colored, egg-shaped stone can be thrown up to 30 feet as an action and explodes in a 10-foot-radius sphere of magical energy on impact, destroying the stone. Any active spell of 5th level or lower in the sphere ends.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Activated: Scorching Ray - 2nd
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
You create three rays of fire and hurl them at targets within range. You can hurl them at one target or several.

Make a ranged spell attack for each ray. On a hit, the target takes [[/r 2d6]] fire damage.

At Higher Levels.

When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you create one additional ray for each slot level above 2nd.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Activated: Scorching Ray - 2nd
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
You create three rays of fire and hurl them at targets within range. You can hurl them at one target or several.

Make a ranged spell attack for each ray. On a hit, the target takes [[/r 2d6]] fire damage.

At Higher Levels.

When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you create one additional ray for each slot level above 2nd.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Activated: Scorching Ray - 2nd
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
You create three rays of fire and hurl them at targets within range. You can hurl them at one target or several.

Make a ranged spell attack for each ray. On a hit, the target takes [[/r 2d6]] fire damage.

At Higher Levels.

When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you create one additional ray for each slot level above 2nd.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Blight
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
Necromantic energy washes over a creature of your choice that you can see within range, draining moisture and vitality from it. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. The target takes [[/damage 8d8 type=necrotic]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

If you target a plant creature or a magical plant, it makes the saving throw with disadvantage, and the spell deals maximum damage to it.

If you target a nonmagical plant that isn't a creature, such as a tree or shrub, it doesn't make a saving throw, it simply withers and dies.

At Higher Levels

When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by [[/damage 1d8]] for each slot level above 4th.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Toll the Dead
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
You point at one creature you can see within range, and the sound of a dolorous bell fills the air around it for a moment. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or take [[/r 1d8]] necrotic damage. If the target is missing any of its hit points, it instead takes [[/r 1d12]] necrotic damage.

The spell's damage increases by one die when you reach 5th level ([[/r 2d8]] or [[/r 2d12]]), 11th level ([[/r 3d8]] or [[/r 3d12]]), and 17th level ([[/r 4d8]] or [[/r 4d12]]).

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Mage Wine
Fearghas MacAllistar.description: If you can cast spells from the wizard spell list, you can drink this rich red potion to regain an expended spell slot. Roll a [[/r d4]] to determine the slot's level. If you have no expended spell slots of the rolled level, you instead regain your lowest-level expended spell slot of 4th level or lower.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Sickle of Bloody Harvest
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
This magic sickle bears long, deep channels running from the tip of the blade to narrow openings in the handle. You can use this sickle as a spellcasting focus.

While holding this weapon, your attacks against creatures than aren't undead or constructs are empowered and gains the following abilities:

Bloodletting. You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon and with melee spell attacks.

Bountiful Harvest. When you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with an attack made with this weapon or a melee spell attack, you can harvest its body for alchemical ingredients one additional time.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Bugman’s Ale
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
This special brew was originally created by the legendary dwarven brewmaster Joseph Bugman, and he shared its recipe only with his most trusted apprentices.

When you drink this ale, you need to make a DC 30 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, you become immune to the &Reference[Frightened] condition for 8 hours.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Wine of the Winter Court
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
This wine, so dark red in color it is nearly black, pours from its bottle in a syrupy flow. When you drink it, you taste notes of sour apple, bitter ash, and jealousy, and your thoughts are occupied with vivid memories of heartbreak and loss.

When you drink this wine, you have disadvantage on Charisma ability checks for 1 hour, but you are immune to being &Reference[condition=charmed] and can add your proficiency bonus to Wisdom saving throws for the duration. If you already add your proficiency bonus to Wisdom saving throws, your bonus is instead doubled for the duration.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Tenser's Transformation
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
You endow yourself with endurance and martial prowess fueled by magic. Until the spell ends, you can't cast spells, and you gain the following benefits:

  • You gain 50 temporary hit points. If any of these remain when the spell ends, they are lost.

  • You have advantage on attack rolls that you make with simple and martial weapons.

  • When you hit a target with a weapon attack, that target takes an extra [[/damage 2d12 type=force]] damage.

  • You have proficiency with all armor, shields, simple weapons, and martial weapons.

  • You have proficiency in Strength and Constitution saving throws.

  • You can attack twice, instead of once, when you take the attack action on your turn. You ignore this benefit if you already have a feature, like Extra Attack, that gives you extra attacks.

Immediately after the spell ends, you must succeed on a [[/save ability=constitution dc=15]] saving throw or suffer one level of &Reference[condition=exhaustion].

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Flesh to Stone
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
You attempt to turn one creature that you can see within range into stone. If the target's body is made of flesh, the creature must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it is &Reference[condition=restrained] as its flesh begins to harden. On a successful save, the creature isn't affected.

A creature &Reference[condition=restrained] by this spell must make another Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns. If it successfully saves against this spell three times, the spell ends. If it fails its saves three times, it is turned to stone and subjected to the &Reference[condition=petrified] condition for the duration. The successes and failures don't need to be consecutive; keep track of both until the target collects three of a kind.

If the creature is physically broken while &Reference[condition=petrified], it suffers from similar deformities if it reverts to its original state.

If you maintain your &Reference[concentration] on this spell for the entire possible duration, the creature is turned to stone until the effect is removed.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Overchannel
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
Starting at 14th level, you can increase the power of your simpler spells. When you cast a wizard spell of 1st through 5th level that deals damage, you can deal maximum damage with that spell.

The first time you do so, you suffer no adverse effect. If you use this feature again before you finish a long rest, you take 2d12 necrotic damage for each level of the spell, immediately after you cast it. Each time you use this feature again before finishing a long rest, the damage per spell level increases by 1d12 necrotic. This damage ignores resistance and immunity.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Clockwork Looking Glass
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
This device is a complex marvel of brass and polished glass, a spyglass nested within a dizzying array of vanishingly small and perpetually spinning gears. Constructed by Axiomites in the Citadel of Resplendent Clockwork, the realm of Brigh, these looking glasses are used to understand the underlying mathematical and logical laws of the multiverse. Even though they are constructed to perfect precision and without any tolerances, they break as soon as anyone pears through them. The reason for this phenomenon is thought to be understood only by Brigh herself.

Mechanical Truth. You can use your bonus action to peer through the looking glass into the foundational, mechanical nature of reality, shattering the looking glass in the process. For 10 minutes, you count as a contruct when determining your creature type (such as for spells like Hold Person), are immune to the &Reference[frightened] and &Reference[charmed] conditions, and have advantage on checks and saving throws to reveal or resist illusions.
During this time, you experience reality in a strange and dissociated way. You see the world not through your own eyes but as if you were floating above your own head. When someone, including yourself, speaks, the voice sounds distant and as if it didn't originate from the speaker's mouth but from somewhere far above you. Moving your body feels like controlling a puppet on a string or a pawn on a chess board. After the effect ends, you recall the experience like strangely real dream.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Spell Scroll: Flawed Design
Fearghas MacAllistar.description: You identify a flaw in the design or construction of one artificial object or construct of your choice within range. The first attack roll made against the target during the duration of the spell is a critical hit. Then the spell ends.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Spell Scroll: Fly
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
You touch a willing creature. The target gains a flying speed of 60 feet for the duration. When the spell ends, the target falls if it is still aloft, unless it can stop the fall.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 3rd.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Spell Scroll: Scrying
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
You can see and hear a particular creature you choose that is on the same plane of existence as you. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw, which is modified by how well you know the target and the sort of physical connection you have to it. If a target knows you're casting this spell, it can fail the saving throw voluntarily if it wants to be observed.

Knowledge of TargetSave Modifier
Secondhand (you have heard of the target)+5
Firsthand (you have met the target)+0
Familiar (you know the target well)-5
Connection to TargetSave Modifier
Likeness or picture-2
Possession or garment-4
Body part, lock of hair, bit of nail, or the like-10

On a successful save, the target isn't affected, and you can't use this spell against it again for 24 hours.

On a failed save, the spell creates an invisible sensor within 10 feet of the target. You can see and hear through the sensor as if you were there. The sensor moves with the target, remaining within 10 feet of it for the duration. A creature that can see &Reference[condition=invisible] objects sees the sensor as a luminous orb about the size of your fist.

Instead of targeting a creature, you can choose a location you have seen before as the target of this spell. When you do, the sensor appears at that location and doesn't move.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Activated: Tenser's Transformation - 6th
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
You endow yourself with endurance and martial prowess fueled by magic. Until the spell ends, you can't cast spells, and you gain the following benefits:

  • You gain 50 temporary hit points. If any of these remain when the spell ends, they are lost.

  • You have advantage on attack rolls that you make with simple and martial weapons.

  • When you hit a target with a weapon attack, that target takes an extra [[/damage 2d12 type=force]] damage.

  • You have proficiency with all armor, shields, simple weapons, and martial weapons.

  • You have proficiency in Strength and Constitution saving throws.

  • You can attack twice, instead of once, when you take the attack action on your turn. You ignore this benefit if you already have a feature, like Extra Attack, that gives you extra attacks.

Immediately after the spell ends, you must succeed on a [[/save ability=constitution dc=15]] saving throw or suffer one level of &Reference[condition=exhaustion].

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Catapult
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
Choose one object weighing 1 to 5 pounds within range that isn't being worn or carried. The object flies in a straight line up to 90 feet in a direction you choose before falling to the ground, stopping early if it impacts against a solid surface. If the object would strike a creature, that creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the object strikes the target and stops moving. When the object strikes something, the object and what it strikes each take [[/damage 3d8 type=bludgeoning]] damage.

At Higher Levels.

When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the maximum weight of objects that you can target with this spell increases by 5 pounds, and the damage increases by [[/damage 1d8]], for each slot level above 1st.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Scrying
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
You can see and hear a particular creature you choose that is on the same plane of existence as you. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw, which is modified by how well you know the target and the sort of physical connection you have to it. If a target knows you're casting this spell, it can fail the saving throw voluntarily if it wants to be observed.

Knowledge of TargetSave Modifier
Secondhand (you have heard of the target)+5
Firsthand (you have met the target)+0
Familiar (you know the target well)-5
Connection to TargetSave Modifier
Likeness or picture-2
Possession or garment-4
Body part, lock of hair, bit of nail, or the like-10

On a successful save, the target isn't affected, and you can't use this spell against it again for 24 hours.

On a failed save, the spell creates an invisible sensor within 10 feet of the target. You can see and hear through the sensor as if you were there. The sensor moves with the target, remaining within 10 feet of it for the duration. A creature that can see &Reference[condition=invisible] objects sees the sensor as a luminous orb about the size of your fist.

Instead of targeting a creature, you can choose a location you have seen before as the target of this spell. When you do, the sensor appears at that location and doesn't move.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Flawed Design
Fearghas MacAllistar.description: You identify a flaw in the design or construction of one artificial object or construct of your choice within range. The first attack roll made against the target during the duration of the spell is a critical hit. Then the spell ends.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Fly
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
You touch a willing creature. The target gains a flying speed of 60 feet for the duration. When the spell ends, the target falls if it is still aloft, unless it can stop the fall.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 3rd.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Activated: Fly - 3rd
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
You touch a willing creature. The target gains a flying speed of 60 feet for the duration. When the spell ends, the target falls if it is still aloft, unless it can stop the fall.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 3rd.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Martyr's Locket
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
A Martyr's Locket is an unassuming and unadorned gold pendant, deliberately plain and with a blank canvas inside. Blessed by the divine light of Mount Celestia, they are offered by the angelic hosts of Heaven to those seeking to perform acts of true empathy - often given freely to poor sinners looking for penance.

The belief that the truest measure of a soul is not in avoiding hardship, but in the willingness to bear the burdens of others, is a belief not just common amongst the denizens of Heaven but also shared by their mortal followers. As such, many monasteries across the realms which are dedicated to lawful good deities or principles, welcome donations of used lockets and display them in quiet galleries where each captured portrait of a moment of sacrifice serves as a silent lesson in courage and compassion for all to witness. Novitiates spend hours in silent contemplation before them, learning not only from dusty tomes, but from the faces of ordinary people captured in their single greatest moment.

Moment of Martyrdom. When another creature you can see becomes affected by a curse (or an effect that can be ended or removed via the Remove Curse spell), you can activate the locket (no action required) to take the curse upon yourself instead. This ability cannot be used if the other creature isn't willing or if you are immune to any the curse's effects.

When the item is activated this way, the locket becomes a nonmagical @UUID[Compendium.talia-custom.customItems.Item.dQQKUD2XEIMNbGXl]{gold locket with a painted portrait inside} (DMG, p134), depicting you in the moment you took the curse upon yourself.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Blue-White Diamond
Fearghas MacAllistar.description: The most notable gem from the Diamond variations is usually the colorless one which does have a blue-white tint. The use of diamonds is mainly in the jewelry market. Due to its brilliance, hardness, and rarity, it is the most famous of all gemstones.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Spell Scroll: Freedom of the Winds
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
Wind wraps around your body, tugging at your hair and clothing as your feet lift off the ground. You gain a flying speed of 60 feet. Additionally, you have advantage on ability checks to avoid being &Reference[condition=grappled], and on saving throws against being &Reference[condition=restrained] or &Reference[condition=paralyzed].

When you are targeted by a spell or attack while this spell is in effect, you can use a reaction to teleport up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. If this movement takes you out of range of the triggering spell or attack, you are unaffected by it. This spell then ends when you reappear.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Spell Scroll: Planar Ally
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
You beseech an otherworldly entity for aid. The being must be known to you: a god, a primordial, a demon prince, or some other being of cosmic power. That entity sends a celestial, an elemental, or a fiend loyal to it to aid you, making the creature appear in an unoccupied space within range. If you know a specific creature's name, you can speak that name when you cast this spell to request that creature, though you might get a different creature anyway (DM's choice).

When the creature appears, it is under no compulsion to behave in any particular way. You can ask the creature to perform a service in exchange for payment, but it isn't obliged to do so. The requested task could range from simple (fly us across the chasm, or help us fight a battle) to complex (spy on our enemies, or protect us during our foray into the dungeon). You must be able to communicate with the creature to bargain for its services.

Payment can take a variety of forms. A celestial might require a sizable donation of gold or magic items to an allied temple, while a fiend might demand a living sacrifice or a gift of treasure. Some creatures might exchange their service for a quest undertaken by you.

As a rule of thumb, a task that can be measured in minutes requires a payment worth 100 gp per minute. A task measured in hours requires 1,000 gp per hour. And a task measured in days (up to 10 days) requires 10,000 gp per day. The DM can adjust these payments based on the circumstances under which you cast the spell. If the task is aligned with the creature's ethos, the payment might be halved or even waived. Nonhazardous tasks typically require only half the suggested payment, while especially dangerous tasks might require a greater gift. Creatures rarely accept tasks that seem suicidal.

After the creature completes the task, or when the agreed-upon duration of service expires, the creature returns to its home plane after reporting back to you, if appropriate to the task and if possible. If you are unable to agree on a price for the creature's service, the creature immediately returns to its home plane.

A creature enlisted to join your group counts as a member of it, receiving a full share of experience points awarded.

Fearghas MacAllistar.description:

If this movement takes you out of range of the triggering spell or attack, you are unaffected by it. This spell then ends when you reappear.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Monstrous Blood
Fearghas MacAllistar.description: Extracted from large-sized or larger monstrosity creatures upon their defeat. This viscous fluid ranges in color from deep crimson to murky black, pulsating with raw, primal energy.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Potion of Psychic Resistance
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
The potion is a plain indescriminate color and smells slightly foul.

When you drink this potion, you gain resistance to Psychic type damage for 1 hour.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Decanter of Endless Water
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
This stoppered flask sloshes when shaken, as if it contains water. The decanter weighs 2 pounds.

You can use an action to remove the stopper and speak one of three command words, whereupon an amount of fresh water or salt water (your choice) pours out of the flask. The water stops pouring out at the start of your next turn. Choose from the following options:

  • "Stream" produces 1 gallon of water.

  • "Fountain" produces 5 gallons of water.

  • "Geyser" produces 30 gallons of water that gushes forth in a geyser 30 feet long and 1 foot wide. As a Bonus Action while holding the decanter, you can aim the geyser at a creature you can see within 30 feet of you. The target must succeed on a [[/save str 16]] saving throw or take [[/damage 1d4 bludgeoning]] damage and fall &Reference[prone]. Instead of a creature, you can target an object that isn't being worn or carried and that weighs no more than 200 pounds. The object is either knocked over or pushed up to 15 feet away from you.

Additionally, once per day, you can use an action to cast Maelstrom at 5th level from it.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Maelstrom
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
A swirling mass of 5-foot-deep water appears in a 30-foot radius centered on a point you can see within range. The point must be on the ground or in a body of water.

Until the spell ends, that area is &Reference[difficult terrain], and any creature that starts its turn there must succeed on a Strength saving throw or take [[/damage 6d6 type=bludgeoning]] damage and be pulled 10 feet toward the center. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and is not pulled towards the center.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Waterskin
Fearghas MacAllistar.description: A leather hide sewn into an enclosed skin which can contain up to 4 pints of liquid. It weighs 5 pounds when full; a pint of water is approximately 1 pound.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Incense of Recovery (Minor)
Fearghas MacAllistar.description: This block of perfumed incense appears to be normal, nonmagical incense until lit. The incense burns for 8 hours and gives off a lavender scent, accompanied by pale mauve smoke that lightly obscures the area within 30 feet of it. A creature that falls asleep in the smoke does not wake until the incense is burnt up. Each spellcaster that takes a short rest in the smoke regains one expended spell slot of 4th level or lower at the end of the short rest.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Spell Scroll: Instant Siege Weapon
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
With this spell, you instantly transform raw materials into a siege engine of Large size or smaller (the GM has information on this topic). The raw materials for the spell don't need to be the actual components a siege weapon is normally built from; they just need to be manufactured goods made of the appropriate substances (typically including some form of finished wood and a few bits of worked metal) and have a gold piece value of no less than the weapon's hit points.

For example, a mangonel has 100 hit points. This spell will fashion any collection of raw materials worth at least 100 gp into a mangonel. Those materials might be lumber and fittings salvaged from a small house, or 100 gp worth of finished goods such as three wagons or two heavy crossbows. The spell also creates enough ammunition for ten shots, if the siege engine uses ammunition.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level, a Huge siege engine can be made; at 8th level, a Gargantuan siege engine can be made. In addition, for each slot level above 4th, the spell creates another ten shots' worth of ammunition.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Spell Scroll: Alarm
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
You set an alarm against unwanted intrusion. Choose a door, a window, or an area within range that is no larger than a 20-foot cube. Until the spell ends, an alarm alerts you whenever a Tiny or larger creature touches or enters the warded area. When you cast the spell, you can designate creatures that won't set off the alarm. You also choose whether the alarm is mental or audible.

A mental alarm alerts you with a ping in your mind if you are within 1 mile of the warded area. This ping awakens you if you are sleeping.

An audible alarm produces the sound of a hand bell for 10 seconds within 60 feet.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Spell Scroll: Instant Fortification
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
Through this spell, you transform a miniature statuette of a keep into an actual fort. The fortification springs from the ground in an unoccupied space within range. It is a 10-foot cube (including floor and roof).

Each wall has two arrow slits. One wall also includes a metal door with an arcane lock effect on it. You designate at the time of the fort's creation which creatures can ignore the lock and enter the fortification. The door has AC 20 and 60 hit points, and it can be broken open with a successful [[/skill ath 25]] check. The walls are made of stone (AC 15) and are immune to necrotic, poison, and psychic damage. Each 5-foot-square section of wall has 90 hit points. Reducing a section of wall to 0 hit points destroys it, allowing access to the inside of the fortification.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you can increase the length or width of the fortification by 5 feet for each slot level above 5th. You can make a different choice (width or length) for each slot level above 5th.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Soul Coin
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
Soul coins are about 5 inches across and about an inch thick, minted from infernal iron. Each coin weighs one-third of a pound, and is inscribed with Infernal writing and a spell that magically binds a single soul to the coin. Because each soul coin has a unique soul trapped within it, each has a story. A creature might have been imprisoned as a result of defaulting on a deal, while another might be the victim of a night hag's curse.

Carrying Soul Coins. To hold a soul coin is to feel the soul bound within it—overcome with rage or fraught with despair. An evil creature can carry as many soul coins as it wishes (up to its maximum weight allowance). A non-evil creature can carry a number of soul coins equal to or less than its Constitution modifier without penalty. A non-evil creature carrying a number of soul coins greater than its Constitution modifier has disadvantage on its attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws.

Freeing a Soul. Casting a spell that removes a curse on a soul coin frees the soul trapped within it, as does expending all of the coin's charges. The coin itself rusts from within and is destroyed once the soul is released. A freed soul travels to the realm of the god it served or the outer plane most closely tied to its alignment (DM's choice). The souls of lawful evil creatures released from soul coins typically emerge from the River Styx as devils.

Hellish Currency. Soul coins are a currency of the Nine Hells and are highly valued by devils. The coins are used among the infernal hierarchy to barter for favours, bribe the unwilling, and reward the faithful for services rendered. Soul coins are created by Mammon and his greater devils on Minauros, the third layer of the Nine Hells, in a vast chamber where the captured souls of evil mortals are bound into the coins. These coins are then distributed throughout the Nine Hells to be used for goods and services, infernal deals, dark bargains, and bribes.

Unmake a Soul. When casting a spell which requires repeated castings for it's effects to become permanent, soul coins can be expended as a material component and the souls trapped inside unmade. Each soul coin expended this way reduces the number of required castings by three. Unmaking a soul is different to freeing it as doing so erases the soul from existence itself, it's essence lost forever.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Guardian Scale of Necromancy
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
A creature can only have one Guardian Scale equipped at any given time.

While you have this scale equipped, you can cast @UUID[Compendium.talia-custom.customItems.Item.7qXGj7vNVMvB4eLt]{Blight} (1/day) and @UUID[Compendium.talia-custom.customItems.Item.RNG6ZTqax6UHOAwR]{Toll the Dead}.

The ancient magic of this scale alters these spells. They require no concentration or components, can be cast while raging and have a flat spell save DC of [[12 + @prof]] and a flat spell attack bonus of [[4+@prof]].

Additionally, the cantrip this item grants has a casting time of 1 bonus action.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Blight
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
Necromantic energy washes over a creature of your choice that you can see within range, draining moisture and vitality from it. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. The target takes [[/damage 8d8 type=necrotic]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

If you target a plant creature or a magical plant, it makes the saving throw with disadvantage, and the spell deals maximum damage to it.

If you target a nonmagical plant that isn't a creature, such as a tree or shrub, it doesn't make a saving throw, it simply withers and dies.

At Higher Levels

When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by [[/damage 1d8]] for each slot level above 4th.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Toll the Dead
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
You point at one creature you can see within range, and the sound of a dolorous bell fills the air around it for a moment. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or take [[/r 1d8]] necrotic damage. If the target is missing any of its hit points, it instead takes [[/r 1d12]] necrotic damage.

The spell's damage increases by one die when you reach 5th level ([[/r 2d8]] or [[/r 2d12]]), 11th level ([[/r 3d8]] or [[/r 3d12]]), and 17th level ([[/r 4d8]] or [[/r 4d12]]).

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Blue Quartz
Fearghas MacAllistar.description: Preferred by glassmiths or gaffers, to make different types of cups and vases and with help from the blacksmiths, it is used to ornate tankards. Magic wielders use this gemstone to see across the lands or through someone's deceit.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Black Sapphire
Fearghas MacAllistar.description: Mainly called Star Sapphire, when cut into shape, the reflection of the gem forms into a distinct, six-rayed star. Its magical proprieties have been almost forgotten these days, but it is assumed that its magic involves the passage of time and the ability to control it.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Eyes of Minute Seeing
Fearghas MacAllistar.description: These crystal lenses fit over the eyes. While wearing them, you can see much better than normal out to a range of 1 foot. You have advantage on [[/skill inv]] checks that rely on sight while searching an area or studying an object within that range.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Wardstone
Fearghas MacAllistar.description: If you hold this stone in the palm of your hand and use an action to speak it's command word, it grows warm and glows with gentle light (shedding dim light to 5 feet) when actively hostile creatures come within 100 feet of you.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Lost Page of Iggwilv
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
This page of blank parchment has been ripped from the Demonomicon of Iggwilv, an expansive treatise documenting the Abyss's infinite layers and inhabitants, and the most thorough and blasphemous tome of demonology in the multiverse.

Containment. While the page is blank and you're holding it, you can use an action to target a demon you can see that is trapped within a magic circle. The demon must make a [[/save cha 20]] saving throw with disadvantage. On a failure, the demon is trapped within the page, which fills with writing detailing the demon's widely known name, its depravities, and other information (determined by the DM). On a successful save, the demon is unaffected and this action can't be used again until the next dawn.

Possession. A trapped demon can attempt to possess you or any other humanoid creature that studied the page's script since the demon was contained. The demon's target must be asleep or otherwise unconscious, and must be on the same plane of existence as the page. The target must make a [[/save cha 20]] saving throw. On a failure, the demon is freed from the page, which turns blank again, and possesses the target. The demon controls the possessed creature like a puppet and can release it as an action, in which case the demon appears in the closest unoccupied space. On a successful save, the demon can't use this feature again for 7 days.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Blackened Steel Scythe
Fearghas MacAllistar.description: A crescent blade is mounted on the end of a tall metal shaft. This polearm provies the ability to attack with deadly efficiency from greater range than typical melee weapons.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Potion of Giant Size
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
This potion is a pale white liquid made from the tongue of a giant clam, with a pungent aroma akin to that of rotting algae. It tastes sweet, however, when consumed.

When you drink this potion, your size increases by up to two categories for 24 hours. For that duration, your Strength becomes 25, if it isn't already higher, and your hit point maximum is doubled (your current hit points are doubled when you drink the potion). In addition, the reach of your melee attacks increases by 5 feet.

Everything you are carrying and wearing also increases in size for the duration. When rolling damage for weapons enlarged in this manner, roll three times the normal number of dice; for example, an enlarged longsword would deal [[/r 3d8]] slashing damage (instead of [[/r 1d8]]), or [[/r 3d10]] slashing damage (instead of [[/r 1d10]]) when used with two hands.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Activated: Polymorph - 4th
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
This spell transforms a creature that you can see within range into a new form. An unwilling creature must make a Wisdom saving throw to avoid the effect. The spell has no effect on a shapechanger or a creature with 0 hit points.

The transformation lasts for the duration, or until the target drops to 0 hit points or dies. The new form can be any beast whose challenge rating is equal to or less than the target's (or the target's level, if it doesn't have a challenge rating). The target's game statistics, including mental ability scores, are replaced by the statistics of the chosen beast. It retains its alignment and personality.

The target assumes the hit points of its new form. When it reverts to its normal form, the creature returns to the number of hit points it had before it transformed. If it reverts as a result of dropping to 0 hit points, any excess damage carries over to its normal form. As long as the excess damage doesn't reduce the creature's normal form to 0 hit points, it isn't knocked unconscious.

The creature is limited in the actions it can perform by the nature of its new form, and it can't speak, cast spells, or take any other action that requires hands or speech.

The target's gear melds into the new form. The creature can't activate, use, wield, or otherwise benefit from any of its equipment.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Activated: See Invisibility - 2nd
Fearghas MacAllistar.description: For the duration, you see &Reference[condition=invisible] creatures and objects as if they were visible, and you can see into the Ethereal Plane. Ethereal creatures and objects appear ghostly and translucent.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Activated: Detect Thoughts - 2nd
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
For the duration, you can read the thoughts of certain creatures. When you cast the spell and as your action on each turn until the spell ends, you can focus your mind on any one creature that you can see within 30 feet of you. If the creature you choose has an Intelligence of 3 or lower or doesn't speak any language, the creature is unaffected.

You initially learn the surface thoughts of the creature—what is most on its mind in that moment. As an action, you can either shift your attention to another creature's thoughts or attempt to probe deeper into the same creature's mind. If you probe deeper, the target must make a Wisdom saving throw. If it fails, you gain insight into its reasoning (if any), its emotional state, and something that looms large in its mind (such as something it worries over, loves, or hates). If it succeeds, the spell ends. Either way, the target knows that you are probing into its mind, and unless you shift your attention to another creature's thoughts, the creature can use its action on its turn to make an Intelligence check contested by your Intelligence check; if it succeeds, the spell ends.

Questions verbally directed at the target creature naturally shape the course of its thoughts, so this spell is particularly effective as part of an interrogation.

You can also use this spell to detect the presence of thinking creatures you can't see. When you cast the spell or as your action during the duration, you can search for thoughts within 30 feet of you. The spell can penetrate barriers, but 2 feet of rock, 2 inches of any metal other than lead, or a thin sheet of lead blocks you. You can't detect a creature with an Intelligence of 3 or lower or one that doesn't speak any language.

Once you detect the presence of a creature in this way, you can read its thoughts for the rest of the duration as described above, even if you can't see it, but it must still be within range.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Activated: Borrowed Knowledge - 2nd
Fearghas MacAllistar.description: You draw on knowledge from spirits of the past. Choose one skill in which you lack proficiency. For the spell's duration, you have proficiency in the chosen skill. The spell ends early if you cast it again.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Activated: Feather Fall - 1st
Fearghas MacAllistar.description: Choose up to five falling creatures within range. A falling creature's rate of descent slows to 60 feet per round until the spell ends. If the creature lands before the spell ends, it takes no falling damage and can land on its feet, and the spell ends for that creature.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Activated: Feather Fall - 1st
Fearghas MacAllistar.description: Choose up to five falling creatures within range. A falling creature's rate of descent slows to 60 feet per round until the spell ends. If the creature lands before the spell ends, it takes no falling damage and can land on its feet, and the spell ends for that creature.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Shapechanger
Kyrin Niteshade.description:
As an action, you can change your appearance and your voice. You determine the specifics of the changes, including your coloration, hair length, and sex. You can also adjust your height and weight, but not so much that your size changes. You can make yourself appear as a member of another race, though none of your game statistics change. You can't duplicate the appearance of a creature you've never seen, and you must adopt a form that has the same basic arrangement of limbs that you have. Your clothing and equipment aren't changed by this trait.

You stay in the new form until you use an action to revert to your true form or until you die.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: City Secrets
Kyrin Niteshade.description: You know the secret patterns and flow to cities and can find passages through the urban sprawl that others would miss. When you are not in combat, you (and companions you lead) can travel between any two locations in the city twice as fast as your speed would normally allow.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Thieves' Cant
Kyrin Niteshade.description:
During your rogue training you learned thieves' cant, a secret mix of dialect, jargon, and code that allows you to hide messages in seemingly normal conversation. Only another creature that knows thieves' cant understands such messages. It takes four times longer to convey such a message than it does to speak the same idea plainly.

In addition, you understand a set of secret signs and symbols used to convey short, simple messages, such as whether an area is dangerous or the territory of a thieves' guild, whether loot is nearby, or whether the people in an area are easy marks or will provide a safe house for thieves on the run.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Sneak Attack
Kyrin Niteshade.description:
Beginning at 1st level, you know how to strike subtly and exploit a foe's distraction. Once per turn, you can deal an extra 1d6 damage to one creature you hit with an attack if you have advantage on the attack roll. The attack must use a finesse or a ranged weapon.

You don't need advantage on the attack roll if another enemy of the target is within 5 feet of it, that enemy isn't incapacitated, and you don't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Cunning Action
Kyrin Niteshade.description: Starting at 2nd level, your quick thinking and agility allow you to move and act quickly. You can take a bonus action on each of your turns in combat. This action can be used only to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Actor
Kyrin Niteshade.description:
Skilled at mimicry and dramatics, you gain the following benefits:

Increase your Charisma score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

You have advantage on &Reference[skill=Deception] and &Reference[skill=Performance] checks when trying to pass yourself off as a different person.

You can mimic the speech of another person or the sounds made by other creatures. You must have heard the person speaking, or heard the creature make the sound, for at least 1 minute. A successful &Reference[skill=Insight] check contested by your &Reference[skill=Deception] check allows a listener to determine that the effect is faked.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Uncanny Dodge
Kyrin Niteshade.description: Starting at 5th level, when an attacker that you can see hits you with an attack, you can use your reaction to halve the attack's damage against you.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Evasion
Kyrin Niteshade.description: At 7th level, your instinctive agility lets you dodge out of the way of certain area effects, such as a blue dragon's lightning breath or a fireball spell. When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Mobile
Kyrin Niteshade.description:
You are exceptionally speedy and agile. You gain the following benefits:

  • Your speed increases by 10 feet.

  • When you use the Dash action, &Reference[rule=difficultterrain]{difficult terrain} doesn't cost you extra movement on that turn.

  • When you make a melee attack against a creature, you don't provoke opportunity attacks from that creature for the rest of the turn, whether you hit or not.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Skill Expert
Kyrin Niteshade.description:
You have honed your proficiency with particular skills, granting you the following benefits:

  • Increase one ability score of your choice by 1, to a maximum of 20.

  • You gain proficiency in one skill of your choice.

  • Choose one skill in which you have proficiency. You gain expertise with that skill, which means your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make with it. The skill you choose must be one that isn't already benefiting from a feature, such as Expertise, that doubles your proficiency bonus.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Reliable Talent
Kyrin Niteshade.description: By 11th level, you have refined your chosen skills until they approach perfection. Whenever you make an ability check that lets you add your proficiency bonus, you can treat a d20 roll of 9 or lower as a 10.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Psychic Blade
Kyrin Niteshade.description: You can manifest your psionic power as shimmering blades of psychic energy. Whenever you take the Attack action, you can manifest a psychic blade from your free hand and make the attack with that blade. This magic blade is a simple melee weapon with the finesse and thrown properties. It has a normal range of 60 feet and no long range, and on a hit, it deals [[/damage 1d6 psychic]] plus the ability modifier you used for the attack roll. The blade vanishes immediately after it hits or misses its target, and it leaves no mark on its target if it deals damage. After you make an attack with a melee weapon, you can make an attack with a psychic blade as a bonus action on the same turn, provided you have a free hand to create it.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Psychic Blade (Thrown)
Kyrin Niteshade.description: You can manifest your psionic power as shimmering blades of psychic energy. Whenever you take the Attack action, you can manifest a psychic blade from your free hand and make the attack with that blade. This magic blade is a simple melee weapon with the finesse and thrown properties. It has a normal range of 60 feet and no long range, and on a hit, it deals [[/damage 1d6 psychic]] plus the ability modifier you used for the attack roll. The blade vanishes immediately after it hits or misses its target, and it leaves no mark on its target if it deals damage. After you make an attack with a melee weapon, you can make an attack with a psychic blade as a bonus action on the same turn, provided you have a free hand to create it.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Psy-Bolstered Knack
Kyrin Niteshade.description: When your nonpsionic training fails you, your psionic power can help: if you fail an ability check using a skill or tool with which you have proficiency, you can roll one Psionic Energy die and add the number rolled to the check, potentially turning failure into success. You expend the die only if the roll succeeds.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Psychic Whispers
Kyrin Niteshade.description:
You can establish telepathic communication between yourself and others-perfect for quiet infiltration. As an action, choose one or more creatures you can see, up to a number of creatures equal to your proficiency bonus, and then roll one Psionic Energy die. For a number of hours equal to the number rolled, the chosen creatures can speak telepathically with you, and you can speak telepathically with them. To send or receive a message (no action required), you and the other creature must be within 1 mile of each other. A creature can't use this telepathy if it can't speak any languages, and a creature can end the telepathic connection at any time (no action required). You and the creature don't need to speak a common language to understand each other.

The first time you use this power after each long rest, you don't expend the Psionic Energy die. All other times you use the power, you expend the die.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Mark Soul
Kyrin Niteshade.description: When you deal Sneak Attack damage to a creature, you can expend one Psionic Energy die to mark the creature's soul until the end of your next turn. Attacks you make against marked creatures cannot have disadvantage and deal extra psychic damage equal to one roll of your Psionic Energy die.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Phantom Pain
Kyrin Niteshade.description: If you make a melee attack with a finesse weapon, you can roll one Psionic Energy die and add the number rolled to the attack roll. If this attack hits, you can choose another creature within 10 feet of the target. The damage of this attack is dealt to the chosen creature in addition to the original target.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Psionic Energy
Kyrin Niteshade.description:
You harbor a wellspring of psionic energy within yourself. This energy is represented by your Psionic Energy dice, which are each a [[/r d6]]. You have a number of these dice equal to twice your proficiency bonus, and they fuel various psionic powers you have, which are detailed below.

Some of your powers expend the Psionic Energy die they use, as specified in a power's description, and you can't use a power if it requires you to use a die when your dice are all expended. You regain all your expended Psionic Energy dice when you finish a long rest. In addition, as a bonus action, you can regain one expended Psionic Energy die, but you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

When you reach certain levels in this class, the size of your Psionic Energy dice increases: at 5th level ([[/r d8]]), 11th level ([[/r d10]]), and 17th level ([[/r d12]]).

If a Psionic Power requires your target to make a saving throw to resist the power's effects, the saving throw DC is calculated as follows:

Psionic save DC = 8 + Intelligence Modifier + Proficiency Bonus

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Psychic Teleportation
Kyrin Niteshade.description: As a bonus action, you manifest one of your Psychic Blades, expend one Psionic Energy die and roll it, and throw the blade at an unoccupied space you can see, up to a number of feet away equal to 10 times the maximum possible roll of your Psionic Energy die. You then teleport to that space, and the blade vanishes. If you rolled a 6 or higher, you regain the expended Psionic Energy die.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Psychic Veil
Kyrin Niteshade.description:
You can weave a veil of psychic static to mask yourself. As an action, you can magically become &Reference[condition=invisible], along with anything you are wearing or carrying, for 1 hour or until you dismiss this effect (no action required). This invisibility ends early immediately after you deal damage to a creature or you force a creature to make a saving throw, unless you choose to expend a Psionic Energy die.

Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest, unless you expend a Psionic Energy die to use this feature again.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Living Shadow
Kyrin Niteshade.description:
The shadow you cast is animate and ever-present, even when lighting conditions would otherwise prevent it. Your shadow occasionally moves out of sync with you. Sometimes it appears to be undertaking random but mundane tasks, while at other times it acts out your darker impulses, threatening or even attacking other shadows. With effort, you can bend this shadow puppetry to your will.

Grasping Shadow. You learn the mage hand cantrip if you don't already know it, and require no components to cast it. The hand created by the spell is shadowy but is not bound to your actual shadow. Your spellcasting ability for this spell is Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma (your choice when you gain this Dark Gift).

Shadow Strike. When you make a melee attack roll, you can increase your reach for that attack by 10 feet. Your shadow stretches and delivers the attack as if it were you. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Ominous Will. Immediately after you make an attack roll, an ability check, or a saving throw and roll a 1 on the [[/r d20]], your shadow exerts a will of its own and might assist or hinder you or those around you. The next time you or a creature within 30 feet of you that you can see makes an attack roll, an ability check, or a saving throw, roll a [[/r d4]]. If the number is odd, reduce the total by the number rolled. If the number is even, increase the total by the number rolled. Once this effect occurs, it can't happen again until you finish a short or long rest.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Ominous Will
Kyrin Niteshade.description: Immediately after you make an attack roll, an ability check, or a saving throw and roll a 1 on the d20, your shadow exerts a will of its own and might assist or hinder you or those around you. The next time you or a creature within 30 feet of you that you can see makes an attack roll, an ability check, or a saving throw, roll a [[/r d4]]. If the number is odd, reduce the total by the number rolled. If the number is even, increase the total by the number rolled. Once this effect occurs, it can't happen again until you finish a short or long rest.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Shadow Strike
Kyrin Niteshade.description: When you make a melee attack roll, you can increase your reach for that attack by 10 feet. Your shadow stretches and delivers the attack as if it were you. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Grasping Shadow
Kyrin Niteshade.description: You learn the mage hand cantrip if you don't already know it, and require no components to cast it. The hand created by the spell is shadowy but is not bound to your actual shadow. Your spellcasting ability for this spell is Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma (your choice when you gain this Dark Gift).

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Shortbow +2
Kyrin Niteshade.description:
Whether through demonic blessing, celestial bequeathment, crazed experiment, or skillful craft, this weapon has been enhanced to bring more bloodshed by the bearer.

You have a bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Sun Blade
Kyrin Niteshade.description:
This item appears to be a longsword hilt. While grasping the hilt, you can use an object interaction to cause a blade of pure radiance to spring into existence, or make the blade disappear. While the blade exists, this magic longsword has the finesse property. If you are proficient with shortswords or longswords, you are proficient with the sun blade.

You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon, which deals radiant damage instead of slashing damage. When you hit an undead with it, that target takes an extra [[/damage 1d8 type=radiant]] damage.

The sword's luminous blade emits bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light for an additional 15 feet. The light is sunlight. While the blade persists, you can use an action to expand or reduce its radius of bright and dim light by 5 feet each, to a maximum of 30 feet each or a minimum of 10 feet each.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Glamoured Studded Leather
Kyrin Niteshade.description: While wearing this armor, you gain a +1 bonus to AC. You can also use a bonus action to speak the armor's command word and cause the armor to assume the appearance of a normal set of clothing or some other kind of armor. You decide what it looks like, including color, style, and accessories, but the armor retains its normal bulk and weight. The illusory appearance lasts until you use this property again or remove the armor.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Boots of Elvenkind
Kyrin Niteshade.description: While you wear these boots, your steps make no sound, regardless of the surface you are moving across. You also have advantage on &Reference[skill=Stealth] checks that rely on moving silently.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Cloak of Elvenkind
Kyrin Niteshade.description: While you wear this cloak with its hood up, &Reference[skill=Perception] checks made to see you have disadvantage, and you have advantage on &Reference[skill=Stealth] checks made to hide, as the cloak's color shifts to camouflage you. Pulling the hood up or down requires an action.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Rogue's Mantle
Kyrin Niteshade.description:
This dark, hooded mantle of thick cloth is infused with secretive and deceptive magic. While wearing it, you gain the following benefits:

Darkvision. You gain &Reference[rule=darkvision] within a range of 60 feet. If you already have &Reference[rule=darkvision], the mantle increases your &Reference[rule=darkvision]'s range by 60 feet instead.

Move in Shadows. While you are in &Reference[rule=dimlight]{dim light} or darkness, you can use a bonus action to teleport, along with anything you are wearing or carrying, up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see that is also in &Reference[rule=dimlight]{dim light} or darkness. You then have advantage on the first melee attack you make before the end of the turn.

Willful Enmity. You can cast the Antagonize spell (save DC 15) from the mantle. Once the mantle has cast the spell, it can't cast the spell again until the next dawn.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Antagonize
Kyrin Niteshade.description:
You whisper magical words that antagonize one creature of your choice within range. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes [[/damage 4d4 psychic]] damage and must immediately use its reaction to make a melee attack against another creature of your choice that you can see. If the target can't make this attack (for example, because there is no one within its reach or because its reaction is unavailable), the target instead has disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before the start of your next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage only.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by [[/damage 1d4]] for each slot level above 3rd.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Mage Hand
Kyrin Niteshade.description:
