A spectral, floating hand appears at a point you choose within range. The hand lasts for the duration or until you dismiss it as an action. The hand vanishes if it is ever more than 30 feet away from you or if you cast this spell again.

You can use your action to control the hand. You can use the hand to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contents out of a vial. You can move the hand up to 30 feet each time you use it.

The hand can't attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Echo Stone
Kyrin Niteshade.description: This dull-blue river stone is soft to the touch, and makes remarkably little sound if dropped. When an echo stone is squeezed as an action, it glows faintly for 1 minute. The stone records all sound made within 15 feet of it while glowing, then repeats that recorded sound at an equal volume once every 5 minutes. This cycle of repetition continues until the stone is squeezed again as an action, which silences it. Squeezing the stone twice in quick succession as an action causes it to play the sounds it has most recently recorded, rather than recording new sounds.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Charlatan's Die
Kyrin Niteshade.description: Whenever you roll this six-sided die, you can control which number it rolls.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Bag of Holding
Kyrin Niteshade.description:
This bag has an interior space considerably larger than its outside dimensions, roughly 2 feet in diameter at the mouth and 4 feet deep. The bag can hold up to 500 pounds, not exceeding a volume of 64 cubic feet. The bag weighs 15 pounds, regardless of its contents. Retrieving an item from the bag requires an action.

If the bag is overloaded, pierced, or torn, it ruptures and is destroyed, and its contents are scattered in the Astral Plane. If the bag is turned inside out, its contents spill forth, unharmed, but the bag must be put right before it can be used again. Breathing creatures inside the bag can survive up to a number of minutes equal to 10 divided by the number of creatures (minimum 1 minute), after which time they begin to suffocate.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Portable Hole
Kyrin Niteshade.description:
This fine black cloth, soft as silk, is folded up to the dimensions of a handkerchief. It unfolds into a circular sheet 6 feet in diameter.

You can use an action to unfold a portable hole and place it on or against a solid surface, whereupon the portable hole creates an extradimensional hole 10 feet deep. The cylindrical space within the hole exists on a different plane, so it can't be used to create open passages. Any creature inside an open portable hole can exit the hole by climbing out of it.

You can use an action to close a portable hole by taking hold of the edges of the cloth and folding it up. Folding the cloth closes the hole, and any creatures or objects within remain in the extradimensional space. No matter what's in it, the hole weighs next to nothing.

If the hole is folded up, a creature within the hole's extradimensional space can use an action to make a [[/save ability=strength dc=10]] check. On a successful check, the creature forces its way out and appears within 5 feet of the portable hole or the creature carrying it. A breathing creature within a closed portable hole can survive for up to 10 minutes, after which time it begins to suffocate.

If the portable hole is overloaded, pierced, or torn, it ruptures and is destroyed, and its contents are scattered in the Astral Plane. Placing a portable hole inside an extradimensional space created by a bag of holding or similar item, or vice versa, instantly destroys both items.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Amulet of Proof against Detection and Location
Kyrin Niteshade.description: While wearing this amulet, you are hidden from divination magic. You can't be targeted by such magic or perceived through magical scrying sensors.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Ioun Stone, Dwarven Language Knowledge
Kyrin Niteshade.description:
An Ioun stone is named after Ioun, a god of knowledge and prophecy revered on some worlds. Many types of Ioun stone exist, each type a distinct combination of shape and color.

When you use an action to toss one of these stones into the air, the stone orbits your head at a distance of [[/r 1d3]] feet and confers a benefit to you. Thereafter, another creature must use an action to grasp or net the stone to separate it from you, either by making a successful attack roll against AC 24 or a successful [[/skill acr dc=24]] check. You can use an action to seize and stow the stone, ending its effect.

A stone has AC 24, 10 hit points, and resistance to all damage. It is considered to be an object that is being worn while it orbits your head.

You are fluent in one additional language while this pulsating bit of red jeweled crystal orbits your head. The DM chooses the language bestowed by the stone.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Potion of Healing
Kyrin Niteshade.description:
The potion's red liquid glimmers when agitated.

You regain 2d4+2 hit points when you drink this potion.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Potion of Greater Healing
Kyrin Niteshade.description:
The potion's red liquid glimmers when agitated.

You regain 4d4 + 4 hit points when you drink this potion.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Potion of Superior Healing
Kyrin Niteshade.description:
The potion's red liquid glimmers when agitated.

You regain 8d4 + 8 hit points when you drink this potion.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Arrow
Kyrin Niteshade.description: Standard ammunition used for bows of all varieties. These mundane arrows are made of smooth wooden shafts with goose feather fletching and hammer metal bodkins.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Thieves' Tools
Kyrin Niteshade.description: This set of tools includes a small file, a set of lock picks, a small mirror mounted on a metal handle, a set of narrow-bladed scissors, and a pair of pliers. Proficiency with these tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to disarm traps or open locks.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Disguise Kit
Kyrin Niteshade.description: This pouch of cosmetics, hair dye, and small props lets you create disguises that change your physical appearance. Proficiency with this kit lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to create a visual disguise.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Explorer's Pack
Kyrin Niteshade.description: A backpack can hold one cubic foot or 30 pounds of gear. You can also strap items, such as a bedroll or a coil of rope, to the outside of a backpack.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Tinderbox
Kyrin Niteshade.description: This small container holds flint, fire steel, and tinder (usually dry cloth soaked in light oil) used to kindle a fire. Using it to light a torch - or anything else with abundant, exposed fuel - takes an action. Lighting any other fire takes 1 minute.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Torch
Kyrin Niteshade.description: A torch burns for 1 hour, providing bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. If you make a melee attack with a burning torch and hit, it deals 1 fire damage.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Bedroll
Kyrin Niteshade.description: Roll of cloth used by traveller to sleep in.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Rations
Kyrin Niteshade.description: Rations consist of dry foods suitable for extended travel, including jerky, dried fruit, hardtack, and nuts.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Hempen Rope (50 ft.)
Kyrin Niteshade.description: Rope, whether made of hemp or silk, has 2 hit points and can be burst with a DC 17 Strength check.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Waterskin
Kyrin Niteshade.description: A leather hide sewn into an enclosed skin which can contain up to 4 pints of liquid. It weighs 5 pounds when full; a pint of water is approximately 1 pound.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Mess Kit
Kyrin Niteshade.description: This tin box contains a cup and simple cutlery. The box clamps together, and one side can be used as a cooking pan and the other as a plate or shallow bowl.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Rations
Kyrin Niteshade.description: Rations consist of dry foods suitable for extended travel, including jerky, dried fruit, hardtack, and nuts.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Waterskin
Kyrin Niteshade.description: A leather hide sewn into an enclosed skin which can contain up to 4 pints of liquid. It weighs 5 pounds when full; a pint of water is approximately 1 pound.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Ladder (10-foot)
Kyrin Niteshade.description: A ladder 10-foot long, as sturdy or rickety as the hand that crafted or bodged it together.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Oil Flask
Kyrin Niteshade.description:
Oil usually comes in a clay flask that holds 1 pint. As an action, you can splash the oil in this flask onto a creature within 5 feet of you or throw it up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. Make a ranged attack against a target creature or object, treating the oil as an improvised weapon.

On a hit, the target is covered in oil. If the target takes any fire damage before the oil dries (after 1 minute), the target takes an additional 5 fire damage from the burning oil. You can also pour a flask of oil on the ground to cover a 5-foot-square area, provided that the surface is level.

If lit, the oil burns for 2 rounds and deals 5 fire damage to any creature that enters the area or ends its turn in the area. A creature can take this damage only once per turn.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Lamp
Kyrin Niteshade.description: A lamp casts bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. Once lit, it burns for 6 hours on a flask (1 pint) of oil

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Forgery Kit
Kyrin Niteshade.description: This small box contains a variety of papers and parchments, pens and inks, seals and sealing wax, gold and silver leaf, and other supplies necessary to create convincing forgeries of physical documents. Proficiency with this kit lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to create a physical forgery of a document.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Caltrops (Bag of 20)
Kyrin Niteshade.description: As an action, you can spread a single bag of caltrops to cover a 5-foot-square area. Any creature that enters the area must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or stop moving and take 1 piercing damage. Until the creature regains at least 1 hit point, its walking speed is reduced by 10 feet. A creature moving through the area at half speed doesn't need to make the saving throw.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Ball Bearings (bag of 1000)
Kyrin Niteshade.description: As an action, you can spill these tiny metal balls from their pouch to cover a level area 10 feet square. A creature moving across the covered area must succeed on a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw or fall &Reference[prone]. A creature moving through the area at half speed doesn't need to make the saving throw.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Basket
Kyrin Niteshade.description: A basket holds 2 cubic feet or 40 pounds of gear.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Blanket
Kyrin Niteshade.description: A blanket to keep you warm at night.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Bedroll
Kyrin Niteshade.description: Roll of cloth used by traveller to sleep in.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Two-Person Tent
Kyrin Niteshade.description: A simple and portable canvas shelter, a tent sleeps two.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Pristine White Dress from an Angel
Kyrin Niteshade.description:
Bought for 200g from a Devil in Hell, as you do.
This flowing garment leaves much to the imagination, as the revealing clothes are very similar looking to some familiar looking clothes.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Spidersilk Bandage
Kyrin Niteshade.description: As a bonus action, you can wrap this sheet of sticky silk around the appendate of a willing creature. Once applied, the bandage accelerates the creature's natural healing but it's sticky and constricting nature hinders the creature's movement for 10 minutes. For the duration, the targets speed is reduced by 15 feet and it has a -3 penalty to all Strength and Dexterity checks and saving throws. When the duration ends, the bandage dissolves and the creature regains [[/healing 8d8 + 8]]{8d8 + 8} hit points.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Spidersilk Rope (50 ft.)
Kyrin Niteshade.description:
This rope is woven from countless strands of fine, silvery silk. It is eerily light and almost translucent, making it difficult to see. A creature must succeed on a [[/skill prc dc=16]] check to notice the rope.

The rope has 6 hit points, is resistant to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage but vulnerable to fire damage. It can be burst with a successful [[/check str dc=21]] check.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Tanglefoot Arrow
Kyrin Niteshade.description:
Stuck onto the head of this arrow is a tightly-wound ball of sticky silk. When you hit a creature with a ranged attack using this ammunition, the target's speed is reduced by 15 feet until the end of your next turn.

If you hit a target that is already slowed by a Tanglefoot Arrow, the target must succeed on a [[/save str dc=17]] saving throw or become &Reference[restrained] for 1 minute. As an action, the &Reference[restrained] target can make a [[/check str dc=17]] check, bursting the bonds on a success.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Bugman’s Ale
Kyrin Niteshade.description:
This special brew was originally created by the legendary dwarven brewmaster Joseph Bugman, and he shared its recipe only with his most trusted apprentices.

When you drink this ale, you need to make a DC 30 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, you become immune to the &Reference[Frightened] condition for 8 hours.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Heels
Kyrin Niteshade.description: Set of clothes designed specifically to be expensive and show it.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Telekinetic Movement
Kyrin Niteshade.description:
You can move an object or a creature with your mind. As an action, you target one loose object that is Large or smaller or one willing creature, other than yourself.

If you can see the target and it is within 30 feet of you, you can move it up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. Alternatively, if it is a Tiny object, you can move it to or from your hand. Either way, you can move the target horizontally, vertically, or both.

Once you take this action, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest, unless you expend a Psionic Energy die to take it again.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Blindsense
Kyrin Niteshade.description: Starting at 14th level, if you are able to hear, you are aware of the location of any hidden or invisible creature within 10 feet of you.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Dodge
Kyrin Niteshade.description: When you take the Dodge action, you focus entirely on avoiding attacks. Until the start of your next turn, any attack roll made against you has disadvantage if you can see the attacker, and you make Dexterity saving throws with advantage. You lose this benefit if you are incapacitated (as explained in the appendix) or if your speed drops to 0.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Grapple
Kyrin Niteshade.description:
When you want to grab a creature or wrestle with it, you can use the Attack action to make a special melee attack, a grapple. If you're able to make multiple attacks with the Attack action, this attack replaces one of them. The target of your grapple must be no more than one size larger than you, and it must be within your reach.

Using at least one free hand, you try to seize the target by making a grapple check, a [[/skill ath format=long]] contested by the target's [[/skill ath format=long]] or [[/skill acr format=long]] (the target chooses the ability to use). You succeed automatically if the target is incapacitated. If you succeed, you subject the target to the &Reference[grappled] effect. The condition specifies the things that end it, and you can release the target whenever you like (no action required).

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Jump
Kyrin Niteshade.description: Using your bonus action, you can jump up to [[/r @talia.jumpDistance]] ft.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Shove
Kyrin Niteshade.description:
Using a bonus action, you can shove a creature to push it away from you.

The target of your shove must be no more than one size larger than you, and it must be within your reach. You make a Strength (Athletics) check contested by the target's Strength (Athletics) or Dexterity (Acrobatics) check (the target chooses the ability to use). You succeed automatically if the target is incapacitated.

If you succeed, you push the target 5 feet backwards, away from you. For each size category you are larger than the target, this distance increases by an additional 5 feet.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Tinkertop Boltblaster 1000
Kyrin Niteshade.description:
This strange contraption of gears, wires, and lacquered wood has a handle with a metal grip and crank. Its stock bears a flamboyant maker's mark that reads: "Made by Arondriemus Hupperdook Tinkertop". You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

When you land a critical hit on an attack roll made with this weapon, you can immediately make another attack with this weapon after resolving the critical hit. When you roll a 1 on an attack roll made with this weapon, you must succeed on a [[/save 20 dexterity]] saving throw or take [[/damage 2d6 piercing]] damage as some of its gears and wires spring loose.

Magazine. This crossbow holds up to 10 bolts of the same time, which you can expend before needing to reload the weapon. Reloading the magazine with ammunition takes 1 minute.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Martyr's Locket
Kyrin Niteshade.description:
A Martyr's Locket is an unassuming and unadorned gold pendant, deliberately plain and with a blank canvas inside. Blessed by the divine light of Mount Celestia, they are offered by the angelic hosts of Heaven to those seeking to perform acts of true empathy - often given freely to poor sinners looking for penance.

The belief that the truest measure of a soul is not in avoiding hardship, but in the willingness to bear the burdens of others, is a belief not just common amongst the denizens of Heaven but also shared by their mortal followers. As such, many monasteries across the realms which are dedicated to lawful good deities or principles, welcome donations of used lockets and display them in quiet galleries where each captured portrait of a moment of sacrifice serves as a silent lesson in courage and compassion for all to witness. Novitiates spend hours in silent contemplation before them, learning not only from dusty tomes, but from the faces of ordinary people captured in their single greatest moment.

Moment of Martyrdom. When another creature you can see becomes affected by a curse (or an effect that can be ended or removed via the Remove Curse spell), you can activate the locket (no action required) to take the curse upon yourself instead. This ability cannot be used if the other creature isn't willing or if you are immune to any the curse's effects.

When the item is activated this way, the locket becomes a nonmagical @UUID[Compendium.talia-custom.customItems.Item.dQQKUD2XEIMNbGXl]{gold locket with a painted portrait inside} (DMG, p134), depicting you in the moment you took the curse upon yourself.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Silver Tears
Kyrin Niteshade.description:
In the depths of Mestopheles' dungeons on Cania, the 8th layer of Hell, pain devils extract this silvery powder through the torture of captured celestials. Devils bound for the warfronts of Avernus take flasks and snuff boxes of the stuff to fortify themselves against exposure to the raw chaos of demons.

When you consume this substance as an action, you have advantage on saving throws against any effect from a demonic source for 8 hours.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Sheeshah of Revelations
Kyrin Niteshade.description: This finely crafted water pipe is made from silver and glass. Its vase is etched with arcane symbols. When you spend 1 minute using the sheeshah to smoke normal or flavored tobacco, you enter a dreamlike state and are granted a cryptic or surreal vision giving you insight into your current quest or a significant event in your near future. This effect works like the Divination spell. Once used, you can't use the sheeshah in this way again you finish a long rest or until the events hinted at in your vision have come to pass, whichever happens first.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Blue-White Diamond
Kyrin Niteshade.description: The most notable gem from the Diamond variations is usually the colorless one which does have a blue-white tint. The use of diamonds is mainly in the jewelry market. Due to its brilliance, hardness, and rarity, it is the most famous of all gemstones.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Vanishing Velvet
Kyrin Niteshade.description:
Upon coming into contact with water, this moss turns itself and any creature it's covering mostly invisible for 10 minutes.

During combat, an affected creature rolls a 1d10 at the start of every combatant's turn, loosing it's invisibility on a 1 and regaining or maintaining it on a roll of 2 or higher.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Chocolate
Kyrin Niteshade.description: Chocolate comes in many shapes, sizes, and tastes. It is a staple sweet primarily made from cocoa beans, sugar, and milk. A major ingredient used in many desserts such as pudding, cakes, and candy. It can be in a solid form like a candy bar or in a liquid form like hot chocolate, to fit various needs and tastes.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Book: Slaves and Kings
Kyrin Niteshade.description:
A book describing the steamy and forbidden romance between a rich multi-goldillionaire and the down-on-her-luck cleaner maid.

Threehundred pages of best-selling material made for fourtyfive year old women.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Shortsword of Infernal Silence
Kyrin Niteshade.description:
This thin, irregularly shaped blade of charred, abyssal steel gets agitated when Infernal is spoken nearby, as if begging to be drawn. You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. When you attack a creature that understands Infernal with this weapon, you have advantage on the attack roll and the target takes an extra [[/damage 1d8 force]] damage on a hit.

Infernal Silence. When you hit a creature that understands Infernal with this weapon, you can silence the creature until the start of your next turn. A creature silenced this way cannot speak or cast spells with verbal components. You can use this property a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses daily at dawn.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Wyvern Poison
Kyrin Niteshade.description: A creature subjected to this poison must make a [[/save con 15 format=long]], taking [[/damage 7d6 poison]] on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Potion of Psychic Resistance
Kyrin Niteshade.description:
The potion is a plain indescriminate color and smells slightly foul.

When you drink this potion, you gain resistance to Psychic type damage for 1 hour.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Potion of Superior Healing
Kyrin Niteshade.description:
The potion's red liquid glimmers when agitated.

You regain 8d4 + 8 hit points when you drink this potion.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Potion of Force Resistance
Kyrin Niteshade.description:
The potion is a plain indescriminate color and smells slightly foul.

When you drink this potion, you gain resistance to Force type damage for 1 hour.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Gold locket with a painted portrait inside
Kyrin Niteshade.description: Kyrin reaching up with the locket to block and take on the wild magic curse for Shalkoc.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Oil of Immovability
Kyrin Niteshade.description: A vial of this usually contains 4 doses. As an action, a dose can be applied to the hinges of a door or chest lid, the gears of a machine, the axel of a wagon, or to the moving parts of another object. For the next 8 hours, those moving parts are locked in place. It requires a [[/check str dc=25 format=long]] to move the parts, but that usually causes the object to break first, unless it is a very sturdy object.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Oathgold Coin
Kyrin Niteshade.description:
This brilliant, lusterous metal is sacred to the dwarves, said to be the very blood of Smednir, god of gold and gems, who was the first to forge enchanted relics. When he sought to share his love of gold and jewels with the dwarves, Torag forbade it, warning that such gifts would only sow greed and strife among them. But Smednir pleaded, swearing a solemn oath that he alone would bear the burden of greed, so that his kin might cherish wealth without being consumed by it.

Yet as the dwarves flourished, so too did their desires, and Smednir’s burden grew heavier with each passing age. In time, the weight proved too great, and inevitably, he faltered. For this failure, Torag beheaded him, and the blood that flowed from his severed neck sunk deep into the earth, forming veins of Oathgold.

To the dwarves, Smednir’s fall is no tale of treachery, but of tragedy. His story serves as both a warning against making promises one cannot keep and a solemn reminder that no oath, once sworn, is without consequence. Even the smallest broken word carries weight, and so it is said that consuming an Oathgold Coin may absolve a minor lapse, easing the burden of guilt in the eyes of the gods.

Oathbound Exchange. A creature holding an Oathgold Coin can consume it as a bonus action to immediately end attunement to one magical item and immediately attune to another magical item in its possession. This new attunement does not require a short rest.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Dragon Compass
Kyrin Niteshade.description: This brass compass has been calibrated not to point north, but to point toward the spiritual essence of true dragons. While holding the compass, you can use an action to speak the command word, causing the needle to point in the direction of the nearest adult or ancient Dragon on the same plane as you. If you are a Dragon, the compass doesn't point toward you while you hold it.

Kyrin Niteshade.name: Elemental Gem, Red Corundum
Kyrin Niteshade.description:
This gem contains a mote of elemental energy. When you use an action to break the gem, a fire elemental is summoned as if you had cast the conjure elemental spell, and the gem's magic is lost.

The elemental disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends. The elemental is friendly to you and your companions for the duration. Roll initiative for the elemental, which has its own turns. It obeys any verbal commands that you issue to it (no action required by you). If you don't issue any commands to the elemental, it defends itself from hostile creatures but otherwise takes no actions.

If your concentration is broken, the elemental doesn't disappear. Instead, you lose control of the elemental, it becomes hostile toward you and your companions, and it might attack. An uncontrolled elemental can't be dismissed by you, and it disappears 1 hour after you summoned it.

Naami Jamas.name: Halfling Nimbleness
Naami Jamas.description: You can move through the space of any creature that is of a size larger than yours.

Naami Jamas.name: Piercing the Veil
Naami Jamas.description:
As an action, you can enhance your vision for 1 minute. During this time, you can see normally in darkness, both magical and nonmagical, to a distance of 120 feet but you are sensitive to sunlight.
You have disadvantage on attack rolls and on Widom (Perception) checks that rely on sight when you, the target of your attack, or whatever you’re trying to perceive is in direct sunlight.
You can use your this ability a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Naami Jamas.name: Shadowslip
Naami Jamas.description:
As an action, you meld into darkness for up to 10 minutes or until your concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell), leaving only your shadow behind. Your body disappears, and your consciousness resides within your shadow.

While in this form you have 20 AC, advantage on Dexterity saving throws, and a +10 bonus to [[/skill ste]] checks. You have a climbing speed equal to your walking speed but must remain in contact with a surface at all times. You can slip through small holes, narrow openings, and cracks, and you treat liquids as solid surfaces. However, you cannot attack, cast spells, speak aloud, or interact with objects in any way.

Taking damage immediately ends this effect.

When this effect ends, you instantly reappear in your shadow’s location. If there isn’t enough space for you to appear, you are shunted to the nearest unoccupied space, taking [[/damage 1d10 type=force]] damage for every 5 feet moved. Once this effect ends, your shadow disappears, and you cannot use this ability again until you finish a long rest.

Naami Jamas.name: Douse Light
Naami Jamas.description: With a simple gesture, you can put out a single small source of light within range. This spell extinguishes a torch, a candle, a lantern, or a light or dancing lights cantrip.

Naami Jamas.name: Spellcasting
Naami Jamas.description:
An event in your past, or in the life of a parent or ancestor, left an indelible mark on you, infusing you with arcane magic. This font of magic, whatever its origin, fuels your spells.

Cantrips

At 1st level, you know four cantrips of your choice from the sorcerer spell list. You learn additional sorcerer cantrips of your choice at higher levels, as shown in the Cantrips Known column of the Sorcerer table.

Spell Slots

The Sorcerer table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your spells of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these sorcerer spells, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.

For example, if you know the 1st-level spell burning hands and have a 1st-level and a 2nd-level spell slot available, you can cast burning hands using either slot.

Spells Known of 1st Level and Higher

You know two 1st-level spells of your choice from the sorcerer spell list.

The Spells Known column of the Sorcerer table shows when you learn more sorcerer spells of your choice. Each of these spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For instance, when you reach 3rd level in this class, you can learn one new spell of 1st or 2nd level.

Additionally, when you gain a level in this class, you can choose one of the sorcerer spells you know and replace it with another spell from the sorcerer spell list, which also must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

Spellcasting Ability

Charisma is your spellcasting ability for your sorcerer spells, since the power of your magic relies on your ability to project your will into the world. You use your Charisma whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Charisma modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a sorcerer spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

Spell save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier

Spell attack modifier = your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier

Spellcasting Focus

You can use an arcane focus as a spellcasting focus for your sorcerer spells.

Naami Jamas.name: Prestidigitation
Naami Jamas.description:
This spell is a minor magical trick that novice spellcasters use for practice. You create one of the following magical effects within range:

  • You create an instantaneous, harmless sensory effect, such as a shower of sparks, a puff of wind, faint musical notes, or an odd odor.
  • You instantaneously light or snuff out a candle, a torch, or a small campfire.
  • You instantaneously clean or soil an object no larger than 1 cubic foot.
  • You chill, warm, or flavor up to 1 cubic foot of nonliving material for 1 hour.
  • You make a color, a small mark, or a symbol appear on an object or a surface for 1 hour.
  • You create a nonmagical trinket or an illusory image that can fit in your hand and that lasts until the end of your next turn.

If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its non-instantaneous effects active at a time, and you can dismiss such an effect as an action.

Naami Jamas.name: Guidance
Naami Jamas.description: You touch one willing creature. Once before the spell ends, the target can roll a [[/r d4]] and add the number rolled to one ability check of its choice. It has to roll the die before making the ability check. The spell then ends.

Naami Jamas.name: Sword Burst
Naami Jamas.description:
You create a momentary circle of spectral blades that sweep around you. All other creatures within 5 feet of you must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take [[/damage 1d6 type=force]] damage.

This spell's damage increases by [[/damage 1d6]] when you reach 5th level ([[/damage 2d6]]), 11th level ([[/damage 3d6]]), and 17th level ([[/damage 4d6]]).

Naami Jamas.name: Spare the Dying
Naami Jamas.description: You touch a living creature that has 0 hit points. The creature becomes stable. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

Naami Jamas.name: Dancing Lights
Naami Jamas.description:
You create up to four torch-sized lights within range, making them appear as torches, lanterns, or glowing orbs that hover in the air for the duration. You can also combine the four lights into one glowing vaguely humanoid form of Medium size. Whichever form you choose, each light sheds dim light in a 10-foot radius.

As a bonus action on your turn, you can move the lights up to 60 feet to a new spot within range. A light must be within 20 feet of another light created by this spell, and a light winks out if it exceeds the spell's range.

Naami Jamas.name: Witchcraft
Naami Jamas.description:
When your Spellcasting feature lets you learn or replace a sorcerer cantrip or a sorcerer spell of 1st level or higher, you can choose the new spell from the cleric spell list or the sorcerer spell list. You must otherwise obey all the restrictions for selecting the spell, and it becomes a sorcerer spell for you.

You also gain proficiency in the Arcana, Medicine, and Nature skills, and you can use Wisdom instead of Intelligence when making Arcana and Nature skill checks.

Naami Jamas.name: Witches' Rites
Naami Jamas.description: You can cast a sorcerer spell as a ritual if that spell has the ritual tag.

Naami Jamas.name: Channeled Metamagic
Naami Jamas.description:
Starting at 3rd level, when you use Metamagic to modify a spell, you can choose to either control the magic using your ward or channel it directly through your body.

Channeling a spell this way, reduces your maximum hit points by 2d10 for each sorcery point spent this way (included in the cost). This reduction lasts until you finish a long rest. You cannot channel metamagic if your hit point maximum can't be reduced.

If your hit point maximum is reduced to 0, you die.

Naami Jamas.name: Selfless Healer
Naami Jamas.description: Whenever you use a spell of 1st level or higher to restore hit points to a creature other than yourself, the creature regains additional hit points equal to twice the spell's level.

Naami Jamas.name: Curing Hands
Naami Jamas.description:
Starting at 6th level, whenever you cast a a spell of 1st level or higher to restore hit points to a creature other than yourself, you can end one disease or one condition afflicting it. The condition can be: &Reference[blinded], &Reference[deafened], &Reference[frightened], or &Reference[poisoned].

Additionally, whenever you cast a spell that ends one or more diseases or conditions on a creature other than yourself, that spell can remove one additional disease or condition.

Naami Jamas.name: Candle's Insight
Naami Jamas.description:
This spell is cast on its target as the component candle is lit. The candle burns for up to 10 minutes unless it's extinguished normally or by the spell's effect. While the candle burns, the caster can question the spell's target, and the candle reveals whether the target speaks truthfully.

An intentionally misleading or partial answer causes the flame to flicker and dim. An outright lie causes the flame to flare and then go out, ending the spell. The candle judges honesty, not absolute truth; the flame burns steadily through even an outrageously false statement, as long as the target believes it's true.

Naami Jamas.name: Augury
Naami Jamas.description:
By casting gem-inlaid sticks, rolling dragon bones, laying out ornate cards, or employing some other divining tool, you receive an omen from an otherworldly entity about the results of a specific course of action that you plan to take within the next 30 minutes. The DM chooses from the following possible omens:

  • Weal, for good results

  • Woe, for bad results

  • Weal and woe, for both good and bad results

  • Nothing, for results that aren't especially good or bad

The spell doesn't take into account any possible circumstances that might change the outcome, such as the casting of additional spells or the loss or gain of a companion.

If you cast the spell two or more times before completing your next long rest, there is a cumulative [[/r 1d100]]{25 percent} chance for each casting after the first that you get a random reading. The DM makes this roll in secret.

Naami Jamas.name: Healer
Naami Jamas.description:
You are an able physician, allowing you to mend wounds quickly and get your allies back in the fight. You gain the following benefits:

  • Your Wisdom score is increased by 1.

  • When you use a to stabilize a dying creature, that creature also regains 1 hit point.
  • As an action, you can spend one use of a healer's kit to tend to a creature and restore [[/r 1d6 + 4]] hit points to it, plus additional hit points equal to the creature's maximum number of Hit Dice. The creature can't regain hit points from this feat again until it finishes a short or long rest.

Naami Jamas.name: Traveler's Clothes
Naami Jamas.description: A set of clothes worn by travellers.

Naami Jamas.name: Tinderbox
Naami Jamas.description: This small container holds flint, fire steel, and tinder (usually dry cloth soaked in light oil) used to kindle a fire. Using it to light a torch - or anything else with abundant, exposed fuel - takes an action. Lighting any other fire takes 1 minute.

Naami Jamas.name: Bedroll
Naami Jamas.description: Roll of cloth used by traveller to sleep in.

Naami Jamas.name: Hempen Rope (50 ft.)
Naami Jamas.description: Rope, whether made of hemp or silk, has 2 hit points and can be burst with a DC 17 Strength check.

Naami Jamas.name: Waterskin
Naami Jamas.description: A leather hide sewn into an enclosed skin which can contain up to 4 pints of liquid. It weighs 5 pounds when full; a pint of water is approximately 1 pound.

Naami Jamas.name: Mess Kit
Naami Jamas.description: This tin box contains a cup and simple cutlery. The box clamps together, and one side can be used as a cooking pan and the other as a plate or shallow bowl.

Naami Jamas.name: Soap
Naami Jamas.description: Used to clean and wash.

Naami Jamas.name: Backpack
Naami Jamas.description: A backpack can hold one cubic foot or 30 pounds of gear. You can also strap items, such as a bedroll or a coil of rope, to the outside of a backpack.

Naami Jamas.name: Herbalism Kit
Naami Jamas.description: This kit contains a variety of instruments such as clippers, mortar and pestle, and pouches and vials used by herbalists to create remedies and potions. Proficiency with this kit lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to identify or apply herbs. Also, proficiency with this kit is required to create antitoxin and potions of healing.

Naami Jamas.name: Sling Bullet
Naami Jamas.description: A hardened pebble of stone, bone, or metal which can be flung at high velocity using a sling.

Naami Jamas.name: Blanket
Naami Jamas.description: A blanket to keep you warm at night.

Naami Jamas.name: Glass Bottle
Naami Jamas.description: A bottle holds 1½ pints of liquid.

Naami Jamas.name: Candle
Naami Jamas.description: For 1 hour, a candle sheds bright light in a 5-foot radius and dim light for an additional 5 feet.

Naami Jamas.name: Healer's Kit
Naami Jamas.description: This kit is a leather pouch containing bandages, salves, and splints. The kit has ten uses. As an action, you can expend one use of the kit to stabilize a creature that has 0 hit points, without needing to make a Wisdom (Medicine) check.

Naami Jamas.name: Steel Mirror
Naami Jamas.description: A mirror made of steel.

Naami Jamas.name: Sack
Naami Jamas.description: A sack can hold up to 1 cubic foot or 30 pounds of gear.

Naami Jamas.name: Sack
Naami Jamas.description: A sack can hold up to 1 cubic foot or 30 pounds of gear.

Naami Jamas.name: Whetstone
Naami Jamas.description: Whetstone is a sharpening stone. It is used to sharpen the edges of steel tools and implements through grinding and honing.

Naami Jamas.name: Dagger of Warning
Naami Jamas.description: This magic weapon warns you of danger. While the weapon is on your person, you have advantage on initiative rolls. In addition, you and any of your companions within 30 feet of you can't be surprised, except when &Reference[condition=incapacitated] by something other than nonmagical sleep. The weapon magically awakens you and your companions within range if any of you are sleeping naturally when combat begins.

Naami Jamas.name: Two-Birds Sling
Naami Jamas.description:
You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon.

When you make a ranged attack with this sling and hit a target, you can cause the ammunition to ricochet toward a second target within 10 feet of the first, and then make a ranged attack against the second target.

Naami Jamas.name: Wand of Magic Detection
Naami Jamas.description:
This wand has 3 charges. While holding it, you can expend 1 charge as an action to cast the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ghXTfe7sgCbgf1Q8]{Detect Magic} spell from it. The wand regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn.

An arcane focus is a special item designed to channel the power of arcane spells. A sorcerer, warlock, or wizard can use such an item as a spellcasting focus.

Naami Jamas.name: Detect Magic
Naami Jamas.description:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magic within 30 feet of you. If you sense magic in this way, you can use your action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears magic, and you learn its school of magic, if any.

The spell can penetrate most barriers, but it is blocked by 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt.

Naami Jamas.name: Belt of Dwarvenkind
Naami Jamas.description:
Wondrous item, (requires attunement)

While wearing this belt, you gain the following benefits:

  • Your Constitution score increases by 2.
  • You have advantage on Charisma (Persuasion) checks made to interact with dwarves.

In addition, while attuned to the belt, you have a 50 percent chance each day at dawn of growing a full beard if you're capable of growing one, or a visibly thicker beard if you already have one.
If you aren't a dwarf, you gain the following additional benefits while wearing the belt:

  • You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison damage.
  • You have darkvision out to a range of 60 feet.
  • You can speak, read, and write Dwarvish.

Naami Jamas.name: Keoghtom's Ointment
Naami Jamas.description:
This glass jar, 3 inches in diameter, contains [[/r 1d4 + 1]] doses of a thick mixture that smells faintly of aloe. The jar and its contents weigh ½ pound.

As an action, one dose of the ointment can be swallowed or applied to the skin. The creature that receives it regains [[/r 2d8 + 2]] hit points, ceases to be &Reference[condition=poisoned], and is cured of any disease.

Naami Jamas.name: Figurine of Wondrous Power, Onyx Dog
Naami Jamas.description:
A figurine of wondrous power is a statuette of a beast small enough to fit in a pocket. If you use an action to speak the command word and throw the figurine to a point on the ground within 60 feet of you, the figurine becomes a living creature. If the space where the creature would appear is occupied by other creatures or objects, or if there isn't enough space for the creature, the figurine doesn't become a creature.

The creature is friendly to you and your companions. It understands your languages and obeys your spoken commands. If you issue no commands, the creature defends itself but takes no other actions.

The creature exists for a duration specific to each figurine. At the end of the duration, the creature reverts to its figurine form. It reverts to a figurine early if it drops to 0 hit points or if you use an action to speak the command word again while touching it. When the creature becomes a figurine again, its property can't be used again until a certain amount of time has passed, as specified in the figurine's description.

Onyx Dog.

This onyx statuette of a dog can become a mastiff for up to 6 hours. The mastiff has an Intelligence of 8 and can speak Common. It also has &Reference[rule=darkvision] out to a range of 60 feet and can see &Reference[condition=invisible] creatures and objects within that range. Once it has been used, it can't be used again until 7 days have passed.

Naami Jamas.name: Binding Shadows
Naami Jamas.description:
With a gesture, you animate the shadow of a creature within range, causing it to wrap around the target and all other creatures within the target’s reach. Each affected creature must make a Strength saving throw or become &Reference[condition=restrained] by the shadow until the spell ends.

A creature &Reference[condition=restrained] by the shadow can use its action to make a Strength or Dexterity check (its choice) against your spell save DC. On a success, it frees itself.

The creature who’s shadow is being animated has disadvantage on all checks and saving throws against the effects of this spell.

Naami Jamas.name: Darkness
Naami Jamas.description:
Magical darkness spreads from a point you choose within range to fill a 15-foot-radius sphere for the duration. The darkness spreads around corners. A creature with Darkvision can't see through this darkness, and nonmagical light can't illuminate it.

If the point you choose is on an object you are holding or one that isn't being worn or carried, the darkness emanates from the object and moves with it. Completely covering the source of the darkness with an opaque object, such as a bowl or a helm, blocks the darkness.

If any of this spell's area overlaps with an area of light created by a spell of 2nd level or lower, the spell that created the light is dispelled.

Naami Jamas.name: Summon Umbral Spirit
Naami Jamas.description:
You call forth a shadowy spirit. It manifests in an unoccupied space that you can see within range. This corporeal form uses the @UUID[Compendium.talia-custom.talia-actors.Actor.h93djtBU8XUTeYuH]{umbral spirit} stat block.

Roll initiative for the umbral spirit, which has its own turns. It obeys any verbal commands that you issue to it (no action required by you). If you don’t issue any commands to the creature, it defends itself from hostile creatures but otherwise takes no actions.

The spirit disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends.

At Higher Levels.

When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, use the higher level wherever the spell’s level appears in the stat block.

Naami Jamas.name: Shadow Monsters
Naami Jamas.description:
You choose up to two creatures within range. Each creature must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature perceives its allies as hostile, shadowy monsters, and it must attack its nearest ally. An affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

At Higher Levels.

When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 4th.

Naami Jamas.name: Living Shadows
Naami Jamas.description:
You whisper to the darkness, causing shadows to writhe with life. Choose a point you can see within range. Writhing shadows spread out in a 15-foot-radius sphere centered on that point, grasping at creatures in the area.

A creature that starts its turn in the area or that enters the area for the first time on its turn must make a successful Strength saving throw or be &Reference[condition=restrained] by the shadows. A creature that starts its turn &Reference[condition=restrained] by the shadows must make a successful Constitution saving throw or gain one level of &Reference[condition=exhaustion].

A &Reference[condition=restrained] creature can use its action to make a Strength or Dexterity check (its choice) against your spell save DC. On a success, it frees itself.

Naami Jamas.name: Sorcery Points
Naami Jamas.description: You have 2 sorcery points, and you gain more as you reach higher levels. Your sorcerer level equals the number of sorcery points you have, so a 4th level sorcerer has 4 sorcery points, a 16th level sorcerer has 16. You can never have more sorcery points than your level dictates.  You regain all spent sorcery points when you finish a long rest.

Naami Jamas.name: Flexible Casting
Naami Jamas.description:
Flexible Casting

You can use your sorcery points to regain expeneded spell slots, or sacrifice spell slots to gain additional sorcery points.

Creating Spell Slots. You can spend unexpended sorcery points to regain expended spell slots as a free action on your turn. The Creating Spell Slots table shows the cost of regaining a spell slot of a given level. You can regain spell slots no higher in level than 5th.

Creating Spell Slots
Spell Slot LevelSorcery Point Cost
1st2
2nd3
3rd5
4th6
5th7

Converting a Spell Slot to Sorcery Points. As a free action on your turn, you can expend one spell slot and gain a number of sorcery points equal to the slot's level but no more than your maximum sorcery points.

Naami Jamas.name: Spell Scroll: Sending
Naami Jamas.description:
You send a short message of twenty-five words or less to a creature with which you are familiar. The creature hears the message in its mind, recognizes you as the sender if it knows you, and can answer in a like manner immediately. The spell enables creatures with Intelligence scores of at least 1 to understand the meaning of your message.

You can send the message across any distance and even to other planes of existence, but if the target is on a different plane than you, there is a [[/r 1d20]]{5 percent} chance that the message doesn't arrive.

Naami Jamas.name: Notebook
Naami Jamas.description: A book might contain poetry, historical accounts, information pertaining to a particular field of lore, diagrams and notes on gnomish contraptions, or just about anything else that can be represented using text or pictures. A book of spells is a spellbook.

Naami Jamas.name: Healing Word
Naami Jamas.description:
A creature of your choice that you can see within range regains hit points equal to [[/r 1d4]] + your spellcasting ability modifier. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the healing increases by [[/r 1d4]] for each slot level above 1st.

Naami Jamas.name: Lesser Restoration
Naami Jamas.description: You touch a creature and can end either one disease or one condition afflicting it. The condition can be blinded, deafened, paralyzed, or poisoned.

Naami Jamas.name: Remove Curse
Naami Jamas.description: At your touch, all curses affecting one creature or object end. If the object is a cursed magic item, its curse remains, but the spell breaks its owner's attunement to the object so it can be removed or discarded.

Naami Jamas.name: Death Ward
Naami Jamas.description:
You touch a creature and grant it a measure of protection from death.

The first time the target would drop to 0 hit points as a result of taking damage, the target instead drops to 1 hit point, and the spell ends.

If the spell is still in effect when the target is subjected to an effect that would kill it instantaneously without dealing damage, that effect is instead negated against the target, and the spell ends.

Naami Jamas.name: Mass Cure Wounds
Naami Jamas.description:
A wave of healing energy washes out from a point of your choice within range. Choose up to six creatures in a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on that point. Each target regains hit points equal to [[/r 3d8]] + your spellcasting ability modifier. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

At Higher Levels.

When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the healing increases by [[/r 1d8]] for each slot level above 5th.

Naami Jamas.name: Raise Dead
Naami Jamas.description:
You return a dead creature you touch to life, provided that it has been dead no longer than 10 days. If the creature's soul is both willing and at liberty to rejoin the body, the creature returns to life with 1 hit point.

This spell also neutralizes any poisons and cures nonmagical diseases that affected the creature at the time it died. This spell doesn't, however, remove magical diseases, curses, or similar effects; if these aren't first removed prior to casting the spell, they take effect when the creature returns to life. The spell can't return an undead creature to life.

This spell closes all mortal wounds, but it doesn't restore missing body parts. If the creature is lacking body parts or organs integral for its survival—its head, for instance—the spell automatically fails.

Coming back from the dead is an ordeal. The target takes a −4 penalty to all attack rolls, saving throws, and ability checks. Every time the target finishes a long rest, the penalty is reduced by 1 until it disappears.

Naami Jamas.name: Heal
Naami Jamas.description:
Choose a creature that you can see within range. A surge of positive energy washes through the creature, causing it to regain 70 hit points. This spell also ends &Reference[condition=blinded]{blindness}, &Reference[condition=deafened]{deafness}, and any diseases affecting the target. This spell has no effect on constructs or undead.

At Higher Levels.

When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the amount of healing increases by 10 for each slot level above 6th.

Naami Jamas.name: Regenerate
Naami Jamas.description:
You touch a creature and stimulate its natural healing ability. The target regains [[/r 4d8 + 15]] hit points. For the duration of the spell, the target regains 1 hit point at the start of each of its turns (10 hit points each minute).

The target's severed body members (fingers, legs, tails, and so on), if any, are restored after 2 minutes. If you have the severed part and hold it to the stump, the spell instantaneously causes the limb to knit to the stump.

Naami Jamas.name: Life Transference
Naami Jamas.description:
You sacrifice some of your health to mend another creature's injuries. You lose [[/damage 4d8]] hit points, and one creature of your choice that you can see within range regains [[/damage 8d8 type=healing]] hit points.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the hit points you lose increase by [[/damage 1d8]], and the healing increases by [[/damage 2d8]] for each slot level above 3rd.

Naami Jamas.name: Staff of Power
Naami Jamas.description:
(requires attunement by a sorcerer, warlock, or wizard)

This staff can be wielded as a magic quarterstaff that grants a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. While holding it, you gain a +2 bonus to Armor Class, saving throws, and spell attack rolls.

The staff has 20 charges for the following properties. The staff regains 2d8 + 4 expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll a d20. On a 1, the staff retains its +2 bonus to attack and damage roll but loses all other properties. On a 20, the staff regain 1d8 + 2 charges.

Power Strike.

When you hit with a melee attack using the staff, you can expend 1 charge to deal an extra 1d6 force damage to the target.

Spells.

While holding this staff, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it, using your spell save DC and spell attack bonus: Cone of Cold (5 charges), Fireball (5th-level version, 5 charges), Globe of Invulnerability (6 charges), Hold Monster (5 charges), Levitate (2 charges), Lightning Bolt (5th-level version, 5 charges), Magic Missile (1 charge), Ray of Enfeeblement (1 charge), or Wall of Force (5 charges).

Retributive Strike.

You can use an action to break the staff over your knee or against a solid surface, performing a retributive strike. The staff is destroyed and releases its remaining magic in an explosion that expands to fill a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on it.

You have a 50 percent chance to instantly travel to a random plane of existence, avoiding the explosion. If you fail to avoid the effect, you take force damage equal to 16 × the number of charges in the staff. Every other creature in the area must make a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes an amount of damage based on how far away it is from the point of origin, as shown in the following table. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage.

Distance from Origin

Effect

10 ft. away or closer

8 × the number of charges in the staff

11 to 20 ft. away

6 × the number of charges in the staff

21 to 30 ft. away

4 × the number of charges in the staff

Naami Jamas.name: Magic Missile
Naami Jamas.description:
You create three glowing darts of magical force. Each dart hits a creature of your choice that you can see within range. A dart deals [[/r 1d4 + 1]] force damage to its target. The darts all strike simultaneously, and you can direct them to hit one creature or several.

At Higher Levels.

When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the spell creates one more dart for each slot level above 1st.

Naami Jamas.name: Cone of Cold
Naami Jamas.description:
A blast of cold air erupts from your hands. Each creature in a 60-foot cone must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes [[/damage 8d8 type=cold]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

A creature killed by this spell becomes a frozen statue until it thaws.

At Higher Levels.

When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by [[/damage 1d8]] for each slot level above 5th.

Naami Jamas.name: Fireball (5th)
Naami Jamas.description:
A bright streak flashes from your pointing finger to a point you choose within range and then blossoms with a low roar into an explosion of flame. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a Dexterity saving throw. A target takes 8d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The fire spreads around corners. It ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 3rd.

Naami Jamas.name: Lightning Bolt (5th)
Naami Jamas.description:
A stroke of lightning forming a line 100 feet long and 5 feet wide blasts out from you in a direction you choose. Each creature in the line must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes [[/damage 8d6 type=lightning]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The lightning ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

At Higher Levels.

When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by [[/damage 1d6]] for each slot level above 3rd.

Naami Jamas.name: Globe of Invulnerability
Naami Jamas.description:
An immobile, faintly shimmering barrier springs into existence in a 10-foot radius around you and remains for the duration.

Any spell of 5th level or lower cast from outside the barrier can't affect creatures or objects within it, even if the spell is cast using a higher level spell slot. Such a spell can target creatures and objects within the barrier, but the spell has no effect on them. Similarly, the area within the barrier is excluded from the areas affected by such spells.

At Higher Levels.

When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the barrier blocks spells of one level higher for each slot level above 6th.

Naami Jamas.name: Ray of Enfeeblement
Naami Jamas.description:
A black beam of enervating energy springs from your finger toward a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target deals only half damage with weapon attacks that use Strength until the spell ends.

At the end of each of the target's turns, it can make a Constitution saving throw against the spell. On a success, the spell ends.

Naami Jamas.name: Levitate
Naami Jamas.description:
One creature or loose object of your choice that you can see within range rises vertically, up to 20 feet, and remains suspended there for the duration. The spell can levitate a target that weighs up to 500 pounds. An unwilling creature that succeeds on a Constitution saving throw is unaffected.

The target can move only by pushing or pulling against a fixed object or surface within reach (such as a wall or a ceiling), which allows it to move as if it were climbing. You can change the target's altitude by up to 20 feet in either direction on your turn. If you are the target, you can move up or down as part of your move. Otherwise, you can use your action to move the target, which must remain within the spell's range.

When the spell ends, the target floats gently to the ground if it is still aloft.

Naami Jamas.name: Hold Monster
Naami Jamas.description:
Choose a creature that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be &Reference[Paralyzed] for the Duration. This spell has no effect on Undead. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make another Wisdom saving throw. On a success, the spell ends on the target.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 5th. The creatures must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

Naami Jamas.name: Wall of Force
Naami Jamas.description:
An invisible wall of force springs into existence at a point you choose within range. The wall appears in any orientation you choose, as a horizontal or vertical barrier or at an angle. It can be free floating or resting on a solid surface. You can form it into a hemispherical dome or a sphere with a radius of up to 10 feet, or you can shape a flat surface made up of ten 10-foot-by-10-foot panels. Each panel must be contiguous with another panel. In any form, the wall is 1/4 inch thick. It lasts for the duration. If the wall cuts through a creature's space when it appears, the creature is pushed to one side of the wall (your choice which side).

Nothing can physically pass through the wall. It is immune to all damage and can't be dispelled by @spell[dispel magic]. A @spell[disintegrate] spell destroys the wall instantly, however. The wall also extends into the Ethereal Plane, blocking ethereal travel through the wall.

Naami Jamas.name: Dodge
Naami Jamas.description: When you take the Dodge action, you focus entirely on avoiding attacks. Until the start of your next turn, any attack roll made against you has disadvantage if you can see the attacker, and you make Dexterity saving throws with advantage. You lose this benefit if you are incapacitated (as explained in the appendix) or if your speed drops to 0.

Naami Jamas.name: Grapple
Naami Jamas.description:
When you want to grab a creature or wrestle with it, you can use the Attack action to make a special melee attack, a grapple. If you're able to make multiple attacks with the Attack action, this attack replaces one of them. The target of your grapple must be no more than one size larger than you, and it must be within your reach.

Using at least one free hand, you try to seize the target by making a grapple check, a [[/skill ath format=long]] contested by the target's [[/skill ath format=long]] or [[/skill acr format=long]] (the target chooses the ability to use). You succeed automatically if the target is incapacitated. If you succeed, you subject the target to the &Reference[grappled] effect. The condition specifies the things that end it, and you can release the target whenever you like (no action required).

Naami Jamas.name: Jump
Naami Jamas.description: Using your bonus action, you can jump up to [[/r @talia.jumpDistance]] ft.

Naami Jamas.name: Guiding Bolt
Naami Jamas.description:
A flash of light streaks toward a creature of your choice within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes [[/damage 4d6 type=radiant]] damage, and the next attack roll made against this target before the end of your next turn has advantage, thanks to the mystical dim light glittering on the target until then.

At Higher Levels.

When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by [[/damage 1d6]] for each slot level above 1st.

Naami Jamas.name: Cure Wounds
Naami Jamas.description:
A creature you touch regains a number of hit points equal to [[/r 1d8]] + your spellcasting ability modifier. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

At Higher Levels.

When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the healing increases by [[/r 1d8]] for each slot level above 1st.

Naami Jamas.name: Black Sapphire
Naami Jamas.description: Mainly called Star Sapphire, when cut into shape, the reflection of the gem forms into a distinct, six-rayed star. Its magical proprieties have been almost forgotten these days, but it is assumed that its magic involves the passage of time and the ability to control it.

Naami Jamas.name: Spellward
Naami Jamas.description:
A set of two identical silvery bracelets widely used by the people of Ildilas to ward themselves against their own powerful magic.

Naami's bracelets were made by her father, and she treasures them. One of the bracelets seems to have a darker spot…?

Naami Jamas.name: Dagger +2
Naami Jamas.description:
Whether through demonic blessing, celestial bequeathment, crazed experiment, or skillful craft, this weapon has been enhanced to bring more bloodshed by the bearer.

You have a bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

Naami Jamas.name: Bottle of Bagiennik Snot
Naami Jamas.description:
As repulsive as many might find the snot of the frog-like Bagiennik, they cannot deny it's healing abilities.

You regain 8d4 + 8 hit points when you drink this potion.

Naami Jamas.name: Wine of the Winter Court
Naami Jamas.description:
This wine, so dark red in color it is nearly black, pours from its bottle in a syrupy flow. When you drink it, you taste notes of sour apple, bitter ash, and jealousy, and your thoughts are occupied with vivid memories of heartbreak and loss.

When you drink this wine, you have disadvantage on Charisma ability checks for 1 hour, but you are immune to being &Reference[condition=charmed] and can add your proficiency bonus to Wisdom saving throws for the duration. If you already add your proficiency bonus to Wisdom saving throws, your bonus is instead doubled for the duration.

Naami Jamas.name: Wellspring of Life
Naami Jamas.description:
You sprinkle the holy water in an unoccupied space within range and conjure a well that radiates a dim and soothing blue-green light in a 10-foot-radius sphere. Each creature that starts its turn within this light regains [[/r 4d6]] hit points.

As a bonus action on each of your turns, you can move the well up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the healing is increased by [[/r 1d6]] for each slot level above 4th.

Naami Jamas.name: Dreamfeather
Naami Jamas.description:
A Dreamfeather is an exceedingly rare and delicate token from the plane of Elysium. These iridescent feathers belong to the Aethergale, small and ethereal songbirds whose rainbow-tinted plumage usually vanishes when shed. However, when an Aethergale is moved by a performance of true beauty and passion—be it a bard's heartfelt song or an artist's soul-stirring creation—a feather may fall and remain intact, becoming what is known as a Dreamfeather.

Treasured and used as a currency by the Azata, the celestial beings of Elysium, Dreamfeathers are regarded as symbols artistic spirit. To find such a feather is seen as an acknowledgment of one’s creativity and emotional depth. They emit a faint glow, and their touch brings a gentle feeling of calm, as though carrying the nostalgia-filled songs of the Aethergale itself.

Shared Inspiration. A creature holding a Dreamfeather can use it to transfer one of it's inspirations to another creature it can see. This consumes the magic which resides in the feather and it vanishes into nothingness. A creature which doesn't have any inspirations, cannot use this ability.

Naami Jamas.name: Wand of Catnap
Naami Jamas.description:
This simple wooden wand has a small iron cat sleeping along the shaft at one end.

Power Nap. You can activate the wand as an action by making a calming gesture and speaking the command word. Up to 7 willing creatures of your choice that you can see within 30 feet fall unconscious and asleep for 10 minutes. The effect endson a target early if it takes damage ir someone uses an action to shake or slap it awake. If a target remains unconscious for the full duration, that target gains the benefit of a short rest, and it can't be affected by this effect again until it finishes a long rest.

Once activated, the wand cannot be used again until you finish a long rest.

Naami Jamas.name: Flask of Holy Water
Naami Jamas.description: As an action, you can splash the contents of this flask onto a creature within 5 feet of you or throw it up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. In either case, make a ranged Attack against a target creature, treating the holy water as an Improvised Weapon. If the target is a fiend or Undead, it takes 2d6 radiant damage. A Cleric or Paladin may create holy water by performing a Special ritual. The ritual takes 1 hour to perform, uses 25 gp worth of powdered silver, and requires the caster to expend a 1st-level spell slot.

Naami Jamas.name: Bugman’s Ale
Naami Jamas.description:
This special brew was originally created by the legendary dwarven brewmaster Joseph Bugman, and he shared its recipe only with his most trusted apprentices.

When you drink this ale, you need to make a DC 30 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, you become immune to the &Reference[Frightened] condition for 8 hours.

Naami Jamas.name: Heels
Naami Jamas.description: Set of clothes designed specifically to be expensive and show it.

Naami Jamas.name: Angel's Grace (Dormant)
Naami Jamas.description:
requires attunement by a spellcaster

This elegant robe is made from light, exquisite cloth of white and silver, adorned with golden inlays. This garment never gets dirty.

Dormant. While Angel's Grace is in a dormant state, it has the following properties:

  • You are under the effect of the Shield of Faith spell.

  • This robe has 4 charges and regains 1d4 expended charges daily at dawn.

  • You can expend 1 or more of the robe's charges to cast one of the following spells from it, using your spell save DC and spell attack bonus: Sanctuary (1 charge, self only), Detect Evil and Good (1 charge)

Awakened. When Angel's Grace reaches an awakened state, it gains the following properties:

  • The robe has 8 charges and regains 1d6 + 2 expended charges daily at dawn.

  • You can cast the Blade Ward cantrip from it with a casting time of 1 bonus action instead of 1 action and without expending any charges.

  • You can also spend charges to cast the following spells from the robe: Beacon of the Martyr (3 charges, +1 for each level above 3rd), Aura of Purity (4 charges)

Exalted. When Angel's Grace reaches an exalted state, it gains the following properties:

  • While you have at least half of your maximum hit points remaining, you can use your action and speak the robe's command word to sprout a pair of white feathered wings. While you have these wings, you have a flying speed of 60 feet. This effects lasts for as long as you remain above this hit point threshold, or until you choose to end the effect (no action required).

  • The robe has 12 charges and regains 1d8 + 4 expended charges daily at dawn.

  • You can also spend charges to cast the following spells from the robe: Dispel Evil and Good (5 charges), Crown of Radiance (6 charges)

Essence-Bound. When a creature attunes to this item, the item becomes bound to that creature's essence and remains bound this way until a different creature attunes to it. Whenever a creature attunes to this item for the first time, the item returns to its dormant state.

Vestige of Virtue. This item is imbued with the following virtues. While the creature essence-bound to this item consistently acts in accordance with these virtues, the power of the item slowly grows, reaching first the Awakened state and then the Exalted state (the exact moment the item reaches the next state is at the GM's discretion).

  • Prudence. Tend to your own needs and well-being as diligently as you tend to others', for you cannot pour from an empty vessel.

  • Discernment. Always temper your heart with clarity and wisdom, for even virtues become vice and tragedy when taken to excess.

  • Conviction. Walk your path without hesitation and be the first to act when others falter, for evil thrives in the shadows of indecision.

Naami Jamas.name: Detect Evil and Good
Naami Jamas.description:
For the duration, you know if there is an aberration, celestial, elemental, fey, fiend, or undead within 30 feet of you, as well as where the creature is located. Similarly, you know if there is a place or object within 30 feet of you that has been magically consecrated or desecrated.

The spell can penetrate most barriers, but it is blocked by 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt.

Naami Jamas.name: Sanctuary
Naami Jamas.description:
You ward a creature within range against attack. Until the spell ends, any creature who targets the warded creature with an attack or a harmful spell must first make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature must choose a new target or lose the attack or spell. This spell doesn't protect the warded creature from area effects, such as the explosion of a Fireball.

If the warded creature makes an attack, casts a spell that affects an enemy, or deals damage to another creature, this spell ends.

Naami Jamas.name: Oathgold Coin
Naami Jamas.description:
This brilliant, lusterous metal is sacred to the dwarves, said to be the very blood of Smednir, god of gold and gems, who was the first to forge enchanted relics. When he sought to share his love of gold and jewels with the dwarves, Torag forbade it, warning that such gifts would only sow greed and strife among them. But Smednir pleaded, swearing a solemn oath that he alone would bear the burden of greed, so that his kin might cherish wealth without being consumed by it.

Yet as the dwarves flourished, so too did their desires, and Smednir’s burden grew heavier with each passing age. In time, the weight proved too great, and inevitably, he faltered. For this failure, Torag beheaded him, and the blood that flowed from his severed neck sunk deep into the earth, forming veins of Oathgold.

To the dwarves, Smednir’s fall is no tale of treachery, but of tragedy. His story serves as both a warning against making promises one cannot keep and a solemn reminder that no oath, once sworn, is without consequence. Even the smallest broken word carries weight, and so it is said that consuming an Oathgold Coin may absolve a minor lapse, easing the burden of guilt in the eyes of the gods.

Oathbound Exchange

A creature holding an Oathgold Coin can consume it as a bonus action to immediately end attunement to one magical item and immediately attune to another magical item in its possession. This new attunement does not require a short rest.

Naami Jamas.name: Sorcerous Burst
Naami Jamas.description:
You cast sorcerous energy at one creature or object within range. Make a ranged attack roll against the target. On a hit, the target takes [[/damage 1d8]] damage of a type you choose: Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, Poison, Psychic, or Thunder.

If you roll an 8 on a [[/r d8]] for this spell, you can roll another [[/r d8]], and add it to the damage. When you cast this spell, the maximum number of these d8s you can add to the spell's damage equals your spellcasting ability modifier.

The damage increases by [[/damage 1d8]] when you reach levels 5 ([[/damage 2d8]]), 11 ([[/damage 3d8]]), and 17 ([[/damage 4d8]]).

Naami Jamas.name: Resurrection
Naami Jamas.description:
You touch a dead creature that has been dead for no more than a century, that didn't die of old age, and that isn't undead. If its soul is free and willing, the target returns to life with all its hit points.

This spell neutralizes any poisons and cures normal diseases afflicting the creature when it died. It doesn't, however, remove magical diseases, curses, and the like; if such effects aren't removed prior to casting the spell, they afflict the target on its return to life.

This spell closes all mortal wounds and restores any missing body parts.

Coming back from the dead is an ordeal. The target takes a −4 penalty to all attack rolls, saving throws, and ability checks. Every time the target finishes a long rest, the penalty is reduced by 1 until it disappears.

Casting this spell to restore life to a creature that has been dead for one year or longer taxes you greatly. Until you finish a long rest, you can't cast spells again, and you have disadvantage on all attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws.

Naami Jamas.name: Revivify
Naami Jamas.description: You touch a creature that has died within the last minute. That creature returns to life with 1 hit point. This spell can't return to life a creature that has died of old age, nor can it restore any missing body parts.

Naami Jamas.name: Greater Restoration
Naami Jamas.description:
You imbue a creature you touch with positive energy to undo a debilitating effect. You can reduce the target's exhaustion level by one, or end one of the following effects on the target:

One effect that &Reference[condition=charmed] or &Reference[condition=petrified] the target

One curse, including the target's attunement to a cursed magic item

Any reduction to one of the target's ability scores

One effect reducing the target's hit point maximum

Naami Jamas.name: Metamagic: Quickened Spell
Naami Jamas.description:
Warded. When you cast a spell that has a casting time of 1 action, you can spend 2 sorcery points to change the casting time to 1 bonus action for this casting.

Channelled. When you cast a spell that has a casting time of 1 minute or less, you can change the casting time to 1 reaction for this casting.

Naami Jamas.name: Metamagic: Distant Spell
Naami Jamas.description:
