Plex.name: Angel feather from Ezeriel
Plex.description: A feather Plucked from Ezeriel the Angel

Plex.name: Painter's Supplies
Plex.description:
These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade in painting.

Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

Plex.name: Potion of Heroism
Plex.description:
This elixir looks, smells, and tastes like a @item[potion of heroism|DMG]; however, it is actually a poisonous elixir masked by illusion magic. An identify spell reveals its true nature.

If you drink it, you must succeed on a [[/save ability=constitution dc=15]] saving throw or be corrupted by the diabolical power within the elixir for 1 week. While corrupted, you lose immunity to diseases, poison damage, and the &Reference[condition=poisoned] condition. If you aren't normally immune to poison damage, you instead have vulnerability to poison damage while corrupted. The corruption can be removed with @spell[greater restoration] or similar magic.

Plex.name: Spriggan Staff
Plex.description:
Requires attunement by a fey creature

This gnarled and twisted oak staff has numerous thorns growing from its surface. If you're a spellcaster, you can use this item as a spellcasting focus.

While holding it, you have a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls and spell save DCs and you are under the effect of the Barkskin spell.

Additionally, you grow claws, fangs, spines, horns, or a different natural weapon of your choice which count as simple melee weapons for you. Your strikes with these weapons deal [[/damage 1d6 bludgeoning]]{1d6 bludgeoning}, [[/damage 1d6 piercing]]{piercing}, or [[/damage 1d6 slashing ]]{slashing} damage, as appropriate to the weapon you chose, and you are proficient with these weapons. The weapon is magical and you have a +1 bonus to the attack and damage rolls you make using it. You can change the chosen natural weapon as an action.

The staff has 20 charges for the following properties. It regains [[/r 2d8 + 4]] expended charges when you finish a long rest. If you expend the last charge, roll a [[/r d20]]. On a 1, the staff rots into tiny clumps of slimy, organic matter and is destroyed.

Spells. While holding this staff, you can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it, using your spell save DC and spell attack bonus: Absorb Elements (1 charge), Spike Growth (2 charges), Speak with Plants (3 charges), Grasping Vine (4 charges), Guardian of Nature (4 charges), or Wall of Thorns (6 charges).
Additionally, you can cast the Locate Plants or Animals spell as a ritual without using any charges.

Virulent Wound. When you hit with the weapon attack granted by the staff, you can expend up to 3 of its charges. For each charge you expend, the weapon deals an extra 1d6 poison damage.

Plex.name: Absorb Elements
Plex.description:
The spell captures some of the incoming energy, lessening its effect on you and storing it for your next melee attack. You have resistance to the triggering damage type until the start of your next turn. Also, the first time you hit with a melee attack on your next turn, the target takes an extra [[/damage 1d6]] damage of the triggering type, and the spell ends.

At Higher Levels.

When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the extra damage increases by [[/damage 1d6]] for each slot level above 1st.

Plex.name: Spike Growth
Plex.description:
The ground in a 20-foot radius centered on a point within range twists and sprouts hard spikes and thorns. The area becomes &Reference[difficult terrain] for the duration. When a creature moves into or within the area, it takes [[/damage 2d4 piercing]] damage for every 5 feet it travels.

The transformation of the ground is camouflaged to look natural. Any creature that can't see the area at the time the spell is cast must make a [[/skill prc]] check against your spell save DC to recognize the terrain as hazardous before entering it.

Plex.name: Speak with Plants
Plex.description:
You imbue plants within 30 feet of you with limited sentience and animation, giving them the ability to communicate with you and follow your simple commands. You can question plants about events in the spell's area within the past day, gaining information about creatures that have passed, weather, and other circumstances.

You can also turn &Reference[rule=difficultterrain]{difficult terrain} caused by plant growth (such as thickets and undergrowth) into ordinary terrain that lasts for the duration. Or you can turn ordinary terrain where plants are present into &Reference[rule=difficultterrain]{difficult terrain} that lasts for the duration, causing vines and branches to hinder pursuers, for example.

Plants might be able to perform other tasks on your behalf, at the DM's discretion. The spell doesn't enable plants to uproot themselves and move about, but they can freely move branches, tendrils, and stalks.

If a plant creature is in the area, you can communicate with it as if you shared a common language, but you gain no magical ability to influence it.

This spell can cause the plants created by the Entangle spell to release a &Reference[condition=restrained] creature.

Plex.name: Grasping Vine
Plex.description:
You conjure a vine that sprouts from the ground in an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see within range. When you cast this spell, you can direct the vine to lash out at a creature within 30 feet of it that you can see. That creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or be pulled 20 feet directly toward the vine.

Until the spell ends, you can direct the vine to lash out at the same creature or another one as a bonus action on each of your turns.

Plex.name: Guardian of Nature
Plex.description:
A nature spirit answers your call and transforms you into a powerful guardian. The transformation lasts until the spell ends. You choose one of the following forms to assume: Primal Beast or Great Tree.

Primal Beast

Bestial fur covers your body, your facial features become feral, and you gain the following benefits:

  • Your walking speed increases by 10 feet.
  • You gain &Reference[rule=darkvision] with a range of 120 feet.
  • You make Strength-based attack rolls with advantage.
  • Your melee weapon attacks deal an extra [[/damage 1d6 type=force]] damage on a hit.

Great Tree

Your skin appears barky, leaves sprout from your hair, and you gain the following benefits:

  • You gain 10 temporary hit points.
  • You make Constitution saving throws with advantage.
  • You make Dexterity- and Wisdom-based attack rolls with advantage.
  • While you are on the ground, the ground within 15 feet of you is &Reference[rule=difficultterrain]{difficult terrain} for your enemies.

Plex.name: Wall of Thorns
Plex.description:
You create a wall of tough, pliable, tangled brush bristling with needle-sharp thorns. The wall appears within range on a solid surface and lasts for the duration. You choose to make the wall up to 60 feet long, 10 feet high, and 5 feet thick or a circle that has a 20-foot diameter and is up to 20 feet high and 5 feet thick. The wall blocks line of sight.

When the wall appears, each creature within its area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 7d8 piercing damage, or half as much damage on a successful save.

A creature can move through the wall, albeit slowly and painfully. For every 1 foot a creature moves through the wall, it must spend 4 feet of movement. Furthermore, the first time a creature enters the wall on a turn or ends its turn there, the creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. It takes 7d8 slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, both types of damage increase by 1d8 for each slot level above 6th.

Plex.name: Locate Animals or Plants
Plex.description: Describe or name a specific kind of beast or plant. Concentrating on the voice of nature in your surroundings, you learn the direction and distance to the closest creature or plant of that kind within 5 miles, if any are present.

Plex.name: Troll Musk Concentrate
Plex.description:
When this flask hits a creature or object, it bursts open and covers the target in a green liquid, a potent aphrodisiac for trolls.

Upon coming into contact with a living creature, this fatty substance creates a 10ft sphere of foul odour around that creature which persists for 10 minutes.

When a creature enters the effect’s area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, that creature must make a Constitution saving throw against the contraption’s Save DC or become Poisoned until the start of their next turn.

When a troll fails a saving throw against this effect, it becomes Charmed instead of poisoned.

Plex.name: Bugman’s Ale
Plex.description:
This special brew was originally created by the legendary dwarven brewmaster Joseph Bugman, and he shared its recipe only with his most trusted apprentices.

When you drink this ale, you need to make a DC 30 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, you become immune to the &Reference[Frightened] condition for 8 hours.

Plex.name: Oathgold Coin
Plex.description:
This brilliant, lusterous metal is sacred to the dwarves, said to be the very blood of Smednir, god of gold and gems, who was the first to forge enchanted relics. When he sought to share his love of gold and jewels with the dwarves, Torag forbade it, warning that such gifts would only sow greed and strife among them. But Smednir pleaded, swearing a solemn oath that he alone would bear the burden of greed, so that his kin might cherish wealth without being consumed by it.

Yet as the dwarves flourished, so too did their desires, and Smednir’s burden grew heavier with each passing age. In time, the weight proved too great, and inevitably, he faltered. For this failure, Torag beheaded him, and the blood that flowed from his severed neck sunk deep into the earth, forming veins of Oathgold.

To the dwarves, Smednir’s fall is no tale of treachery, but of tragedy. His story serves as both a warning against making promises one cannot keep and a solemn reminder that no oath, once sworn, is without consequence. Even the smallest broken word carries weight, and so it is said that consuming an Oathgold Coin may absolve a minor lapse, easing the burden of guilt in the eyes of the gods.

Oathbound Exchange

A creature holding an Oathgold Coin can consume it as a bonus action to immediately end attunement to one magical item and immediately attune to another magical item in its possession. This new attunement does not require a short rest.

Plex.name: Event Horizon
Plex.description:
As an action, you can magically emit a powerful field of gravitational energy that tugs at other creatures for up to 1 minute or until your &Reference[concentration] ends (as if you were concentrating on a spell). For the duration, whenever a creature hostile to you starts its turn within 30 feet of you, it must make a Strength saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, it takes [[/damage 2d10 force]] damage, and its speed is reduced to 0 until the start of its next turn. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage, and every foot it moves this turn costs 2 extra feet of movement.

Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest or until you expend a spell slot of 3rd level or higher on it (Expend spell slot to recharge manually.)

Plex.name: Blink
Plex.description:
Roll a [[/r d20]] at the end of each of your turns for the duration of the spell. On a roll of 11 or higher, you vanish from your current plane of existence and appear in the Ethereal Plane (the spell fails and the casting is wasted if you were already on that plane). At the start of your next turn, and when the spell ends if you are on the Ethereal Plane, you return to an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see within 10 feet of the space you vanished from. If no unoccupied space is available within that range, you appear in the nearest unoccupied space (chosen at random if more than one space is equally near). You can dismiss this spell as an action.

While on the Ethereal Plane, you can see and hear the plane you originated from, which is cast in shades of gray, and you can't see anything there more than 60 feet away. You can only affect and be affected by other creatures on the Ethereal Plane. Creatures that aren't there can't perceive you or interact with you, unless they have the ability to do so.

Plex.name: Steel Wind Strike
Plex.description:
You flourish the weapon used in the casting and then vanish to strike like the wind. Choose up to five creatures you can see within range. Make a melee spell attack against each target. On a hit, a target takes [[/damage 6d10 type=force]] damage.

You can then teleport to an unoccupied space you can see within 5 feet of one of the targets you hit or missed.

Plex.name: Clockwork Looking Glass
Plex.description:
This device is a complex marvel of brass and polished glass, a spyglass nested within a dizzying array of vanishingly small and perpetually spinning gears. Constructed by Axiomites in the Citadel of Resplendent Clockwork, the realm of Brigh, these looking glasses are used to understand the underlying mathematical and logical laws of the multiverse. Even though they are constructed to perfect precision and without any tolerances, they break as soon as anyone pears through them. The reason for this phenomenon is thought to be understood only by Brigh herself.

Mechanical Truth. You can use your bonus action to peer through the looking glass into the foundational, mechanical nature of reality, shattering the looking glass in the process. For 10 minutes, you count as a contruct when determining your creature type (such as for spells like Hold Person), are immune to the &Reference[frightened] and &Reference[charmed] conditions, and have advantage on checks and saving throws to reveal or resist illusions.
During this time, you experience reality in a strange and dissociated way. You see the world not through your own eyes but as if you were floating above your own head. When someone, including yourself, speaks, the voice sounds distant and as if it didn't originate from the speaker's mouth but from somewhere far above you. Moving your body feels like controlling a puppet on a string or a pawn on a chess board. After the effect ends, you recall the experience like strangely real dream.

Plex.name: Spell Scroll: Catapult
Plex.description:
Choose one object weighing 1 to 5 pounds within range that isn't being worn or carried. The object flies in a straight line up to 90 feet in a direction you choose before falling to the ground, stopping early if it impacts against a solid surface. If the object would strike a creature, that creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the object strikes the target and stops moving. When the object strikes something, the object and what it strikes each take [[/damage 3d8 type=bludgeoning]] damage.

At Higher Levels.

When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the maximum weight of objects that you can target with this spell increases by 5 pounds, and the damage increases by [[/damage 1d8]], for each slot level above 1st.

Plex.name: Interceptor Rocket Straps
Plex.description:
Invented by the legendary artificer Daretti after he witnessed the rocket-powered mobility of Iron Golem Interceptors. Unfortunately for the goblin, he forgot to adjust the rockets' thrust before his first - and only - test flight.

While wearing these thigh-strapped rockets, the maximum distance you can jump is increased by 10 feet.

Rocket Jump. As a reaction, which you can take when you see a creature within your jumping distance ([[/r @talia.jumpDistance]] ft.) move, you can activate the rockets to intercept the target. You take [[/damage 3d12 force]] damage and jump to the closest unoccupied space adjacent to the target. Immediately upon landing, you can take either the Grapple or the Shove action against the target as part of the same reaction.

Plex.name: Catapult
Plex.description:
Choose one object weighing 1 to 5 pounds within range that isn't being worn or carried. The object flies in a straight line up to 90 feet in a direction you choose before falling to the ground, stopping early if it impacts against a solid surface. If the object would strike a creature, that creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the object strikes the target and stops moving. When the object strikes something, the object and what it strikes each take [[/damage 3d8 type=bludgeoning]] damage.

At Higher Levels.

When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the maximum weight of objects that you can target with this spell increases by 5 pounds, and the damage increases by [[/damage 1d8]], for each slot level above 1st.

Plex.name: Scrying
Plex.description:
You can see and hear a particular creature you choose that is on the same plane of existence as you. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw, which is modified by how well you know the target and the sort of physical connection you have to it. If a target knows you're casting this spell, it can fail the saving throw voluntarily if it wants to be observed.

Knowledge of TargetSave Modifier
Secondhand (you have heard of the target)+5
Firsthand (you have met the target)+0
Familiar (you know the target well)-5
Connection to TargetSave Modifier
Likeness or picture-2
Possession or garment-4
Body part, lock of hair, bit of nail, or the like-10

On a successful save, the target isn't affected, and you can't use this spell against it again for 24 hours.

On a failed save, the spell creates an invisible sensor within 10 feet of the target. You can see and hear through the sensor as if you were there. The sensor moves with the target, remaining within 10 feet of it for the duration. A creature that can see &Reference[condition=invisible] objects sees the sensor as a luminous orb about the size of your fist.

Instead of targeting a creature, you can choose a location you have seen before as the target of this spell. When you do, the sensor appears at that location and doesn't move.

Plex.name: Flawed Design
Plex.description: You identify a flaw in the design or construction of one artificial object or construct of your choice within range. The first attack roll made against the target during the duration of the spell is a critical hit. Then the spell ends.

Plex.name: Fly
Plex.description:
You touch a willing creature. The target gains a flying speed of 60 feet for the duration. When the spell ends, the target falls if it is still aloft, unless it can stop the fall.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 3rd.

Plex.name: Martyr's Locket
Plex.description:
A Martyr's Locket is an unassuming and unadorned gold pendant, deliberately plain and with a blank canvas inside. Blessed by the divine light of Mount Celestia, they are offered by the angelic hosts of Heaven to those seeking to perform acts of true empathy - often given freely to poor sinners looking for penance.

The belief that the truest measure of a soul is not in avoiding hardship, but in the willingness to bear the burdens of others, is a belief not just common amongst the denizens of Heaven but also shared by their mortal followers. As such, many monasteries across the realms which are dedicated to lawful good deities or principles, welcome donations of used lockets and display them in quiet galleries where each captured portrait of a moment of sacrifice serves as a silent lesson in courage and compassion for all to witness. Novitiates spend hours in silent contemplation before them, learning not only from dusty tomes, but from the faces of ordinary people captured in their single greatest moment.

Moment of Martyrdom. When another creature you can see becomes affected by a curse (or an effect that can be ended or removed via the Remove Curse spell), you can activate the locket (no action required) to take the curse upon yourself instead. This ability cannot be used if the other creature isn't willing or if you are immune to any the curse's effects.

When the item is activated this way, the locket becomes a nonmagical @UUID[Compendium.talia-custom.customItems.Item.dQQKUD2XEIMNbGXl]{gold locket with a painted portrait inside} (DMG, p134), depicting you in the moment you took the curse upon yourself.

Plex.name: Pyrope
Plex.description: Pyrope, a type of garnet known for its exquisite beauty, also holds military significance. It is believed that adorning weaponry with this garnet allows it to penetrate the thickest hides or demolish the strongest doors, aided by arcane forces.

Plex.name: Breezeblossom
Plex.description: It’s petals will always be carried away by a gentle breeze, going as far to create one themselves if needed. This breeze disperses any magical cloud or fog effects.

Plex.name: Echoing Crystalbloom
Plex.description:
When this crystalline flower shatters, it covers creatures in a 10ft sphere in it's fine dust unless they succeed on a Dexterity saving throw against the contraption's save DC.

Any creature covered by the dust involuntarily echoes it’s own speech for 10 minutes, making it much more difficult to form the verbal components of spells.

While under this effect, casting a spell with verbal components requires a bonus action and the caster's full movement in addition to the spells normal requirements.

Plex.name: Devils Hat
Plex.description: Devils hat

Plex.name: Door trap #5
Plex.description:
Save DC: 15 | Attack Bonus: 8

Mechanism

A uppdated verson of the trap that is slightly easier to not trigger if you know what you are doing when you try to bypass it, (you will probably fail). Othevice it will trigger when you open the door.

Plex.name: Slice of tent
Plex.description: A sliced bit of a tent roughly the sise of a bedsheet

Plex.name: Hurting Stone
Plex.description: When this stone hits a creature or object after being dropped or thrown, it deals 2d6 magical bludgeoning damage and loudly shouts “Ow!”.

Plex.name: Troll Musk Concentrate
Plex.description:
When this flask hits a creature or object, it bursts open and covers the target in a green liquid, a potent aphrodisiac for trolls.

Upon coming into contact with a living creature, this fatty substance creates a 10ft sphere of foul odour around that creature which persists for 10 minutes.

When a creature enters the effect’s area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, that creature must make a Constitution saving throw against the contraption’s Save DC or become Poisoned until the start of their next turn.

When a troll fails a saving throw against this effect, it becomes Charmed instead of poisoned.

Plex.name: Lost Page of Iggwilv
Plex.description:
This page of blank parchment has been ripped from the Demonomicon of Iggwilv, an expansive treatise documenting the Abyss's infinite layers and inhabitants, and the most thorough and blasphemous tome of demonology in the multiverse.

Containment. While the page is blank and you're holding it, you can use an action to target a demon you can see that is trapped within a magic circle. The demon must make a [[/save cha 20]] saving throw with disadvantage. On a failure, the demon is trapped within the page, which fills with writing detailing the demon's widely known name, its depravities, and other information (determined by the DM). On a successful save, the demon is unaffected and this action can't be used again until the next dawn.

Possession. A trapped demon can attempt to possess you or any other humanoid creature that studied the page's script since the demon was contained. The demon's target must be asleep or otherwise unconscious, and must be on the same plane of existence as the page. The target must make a [[/save cha 20]] saving throw. On a failure, the demon is freed from the page, which turns blank again, and possesses the target. The demon controls the possessed creature like a puppet and can release it as an action, in which case the demon appears in the closest unoccupied space. On a successful save, the demon can't use this feature again for 7 days.

Plex.name: Freedom of the Winds
Plex.description:
Wind wraps around your body, tugging at your hair and clothing as your feet lift off the ground. You gain a flying speed of 60 feet. Additionally, you have advantage on ability checks to avoid being &Reference[condition=grappled], and on saving throws against being &Reference[condition=restrained] or &Reference[condition=paralyzed].

When you are targeted by a spell or attack while this spell is in effect, you can use a reaction to teleport up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. If this movement takes you out of range of the triggering spell or attack, you are unaffected by it. This spell then ends when you reappear.

Plex.name: Planar Ally
Plex.description:
You beseech an otherworldly entity for aid. The being must be known to you: a god, a primordial, a demon prince, or some other being of cosmic power. That entity sends a celestial, an elemental, or a fiend loyal to it to aid you, making the creature appear in an unoccupied space within range. If you know a specific creature's name, you can speak that name when you cast this spell to request that creature, though you might get a different creature anyway (DM's choice).

When the creature appears, it is under no compulsion to behave in any particular way. You can ask the creature to perform a service in exchange for payment, but it isn't obliged to do so. The requested task could range from simple (fly us across the chasm, or help us fight a battle) to complex (spy on our enemies, or protect us during our foray into the dungeon). You must be able to communicate with the creature to bargain for its services.

Payment can take a variety of forms. A celestial might require a sizable donation of gold or magic items to an allied temple, while a fiend might demand a living sacrifice or a gift of treasure. Some creatures might exchange their service for a quest undertaken by you.

As a rule of thumb, a task that can be measured in minutes requires a payment worth 100 gp per minute. A task measured in hours requires 1,000 gp per hour. And a task measured in days (up to 10 days) requires 10,000 gp per day. The DM can adjust these payments based on the circumstances under which you cast the spell. If the task is aligned with the creature's ethos, the payment might be halved or even waived. Nonhazardous tasks typically require only half the suggested payment, while especially dangerous tasks might require a greater gift. Creatures rarely accept tasks that seem suicidal.

After the creature completes the task, or when the agreed-upon duration of service expires, the creature returns to its home plane after reporting back to you, if appropriate to the task and if possible. If you are unable to agree on a price for the creature's service, the creature immediately returns to its home plane.

A creature enlisted to join your group counts as a member of it, receiving a full share of experience points awarded.

Plex.name: Chocolate
Plex.description: Chocolate comes in many shapes, sizes, and tastes. It is a staple sweet primarily made from cocoa beans, sugar, and milk. A major ingredient used in many desserts such as pudding, cakes, and candy. It can be in a solid form like a candy bar or in a liquid form like hot chocolate, to fit various needs and tastes.

Plex.name: Fine Clothes
Plex.description: Set of clothes designed specifically to be expensive and show it.

Plex.name: Small Knife (glowing)
Plex.description: A blunt knife used by the scholarly to open letters and correspondence. *GLowing from Continual Flame*

Plex.name: Potion of Fire Resistance
Plex.description:
The potion is a plain indescriminate color and smells slightly foul.

When you drink this potion, you gain resistance to Fire type damage for 1 hour.

Plex.name: Mage Hand
Plex.description:
A spectral, floating hand appears at a point you choose within range. The hand lasts for the duration or until you dismiss it as an action. The hand vanishes if it is ever more than 30 feet away from you or if you cast this spell again.

You can use your action to control the hand. You can use the hand to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contents out of a vial. You can move the hand up to 30 feet each time you use it.

The hand can't attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

Plex.name: Dimension Door
Plex.description:
You teleport yourself from your current location to any other spot within range. You arrive at exactly the spot desired. It can be a place you can see, one you can visualize, or one you can describe by stating distance and direction, such as "200 feet straight downward" or "upward to the northwest at a 45-degree angle, 300 feet."

You can bring along objects as long as their weight doesn't exceed what you can carry. You can also bring one willing creature of your size or smaller who is carrying gear up to its carrying capacity. The creature must be within 5 feet of you when you cast this spell.

If you would arrive in a place already occupied by an object or a creature, you and any creature traveling with you each take [[/damage 4d6 type=force]] damage, and the spell fails to teleport you.

Plex.name: Makeshifth gasmask
Plex.description:
Save DC: 26 | Attack Bonus: 19

Mechanism

Use to breath in case of Fearghas farting or other Poisionus gases.

Plex.name: Breezeblossom
Plex.description: It’s petals will always be carried away by a gentle breeze, going as far to create one themselves if needed. This breeze disperses any magical cloud or fog effects.

Plex.name: Incense of Recovery (Minor)
Plex.description: This block of perfumed incense appears to be normal, nonmagical incense until lit. The incense burns for 8 hours and gives off a lavender scent, accompanied by pale mauve smoke that lightly obscures the area within 30 feet of it. A creature that falls asleep in the smoke does not wake until the incense is burnt up. Each spellcaster that takes a short rest in the smoke regains one expended spell slot of 4th level or lower at the end of the short rest.

Plex.name: Spell Scroll: Ambling Abode
Plex.description:
Choose a building no larger than 30 feet wide or long and no taller than two stories; then [[/r 1d2]]{flip a coin}. On a heads the building sprouts a pair of bird legs, it becomes awakened and acts with a mind of its own for the duration of the spell. The building acts similar to a domesticated chicken unless controlled by other means. At sundown the building will find a smaller one to nest upon.

On a tails the building grows wings and flies away. At the next sundown the building will find a high place to nest upon.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the maximum size for building increases by 10 feet for the width and length, and an additional story for the height.

Plex.name: Babbling Book of the Befuddled Braniac
Plex.description: A book containing historical accounts, information pertaining to a particular field of lore, myth, or legend.

Plex.name: Cane of Tides
Plex.description:
Requires attunement by a spellcaster.

You gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls and to the saving throw DCs of your spells.

The cane has 8 charges and regains 1d8 expended charges when you finish a long rest. You can use the following abilities by expending charges:

  • Add damage: When you cast a spell that deals bludgeoning or cold damage, you can expend 1 or more charges to add an additional 1d8 damage of the same type for each charge you expend.

  • Create Water: You can expend 1 charge to cast the Create Water effect of the Create or Destroy Water spell at 1st level using a bonus action.

  • Maelstrom: You can expend 5 charges to cast Maelstrom at 5th level.

Plex.name: Create Water - Cane of Tides
Plex.description: You create up to 10 gallons of clean water within range in an open container. Alternatively, the water falls as rain in a 30-foot cube within range, extinguishing exposed flames in the area.

Plex.name: Maelstrom
Plex.description:
A swirling mass of 5-foot-deep water appears in a 30-foot radius centered on a point you can see within range. The point must be on the ground or in a body of water.

Until the spell ends, that area is &Reference[difficult terrain], and any creature that starts its turn there must succeed on a Strength saving throw or take [[/damage 6d6 type=bludgeoning]] damage and be pulled 10 feet toward the center. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and is not pulled towards the center.

Plex.name: Paint Cans
Plex.description: Cans of Paint in various collours

Plex.name: Spell Scroll: Word of Recall
Plex.description:
You and up to five willing creatures within 5 feet of you instantly teleport to a previously designated sanctuary. You and any creatures that teleport with you appear in the nearest unoccupied space to the spot you designated when you prepared your sanctuary (see below). If you cast this spell without first preparing a sanctuary, the spell has no effect.

You must designate a sanctuary by casting this spell within the same location once each day for 7 days in a row. Once placed, the location of your sanctuary can only be changed through the casting of a Wish spell.

Plex.name: Gold locket with a painted portrait inside
Plex.description:
The portrait Depicts a Goblin wearing Two hats and a Tiki-mask upon his head.
His expression is the same that Newton would have had while staring at his legendary Apple.— Meaning: Bored and Confounded with a faint bump on his forehead.
He must be a true genius in the making.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Green Dragon Heritage
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
You can, as a bonus action, consume any kind of poison before making a poison breath to apply it's effects to all targets hit.

Any target that fails the saving throw against your breath also fails the saving throw against the poison. Any that succeeds the saving throw against your breath, also succeeds the saving throw against the poison.

For the purposes of dealing damage you treat immunity to poison as resistance instead.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Dangerous Breath
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
If you have access to a breath weapon attack from a class or subclass, you gain a number of resource-free uses per day equal to your proficiency modifier.

This replaces your Dragonborn's Breath Weapon.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Unarmored Defense (Monk)
Shalkoc Zornax.description: Beginning at 1st level, while you are wearing no armor and not wielding a shield, your AC equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Wisdom modifier.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Martial Arts
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
Your practice of martial arts gives you mastery of combat styles that use unarmed strikes and monk weapons, which are @item[shortsword|phb|shortswords] and any simple melee weapons that don't have the two-handed or heavy property.

You gain the following benefits while you are unarmed or wielding only monk weapons and you aren't wearing armor or wielding a @item[shield|phb].

  • You can use Dexterity instead of Strength for the attack and damage rolls of your unarmed strikes and monk weapons.
  • You can roll a [[/r d4]] in place of the normal damage of your unarmed strike or monk weapon. This die changes as you gain monk levels, as shown in the Martial Arts column of the Monk table.
  • You can make one unarmed strike as a bonus action on each of your turns.

Certain monasteries use specialized forms of the monk weapons. For example, you might use a club that is two lengths of wood connected by a short chain (called a nunchaku) or a sickle with a shorter, straighter blade (called a kama).

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Step of the Wind
Shalkoc Zornax.description: You can spend 1 ki point to both Dash and Dodge as a single bonus action on your turn.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Flurry of Blows
Shalkoc Zornax.description: You can spend 1 ki point to make two quick unarmed strikes as a bonus action.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Unarmored Movement
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
Starting at 2nd level, your speed increases by 10 feet while you are not wearing armor or wielding a shield. This bonus increases when you reach certain monk levels, as shown in the Monk table.

At 9th level, you gain the ability to move along vertical surfaces and across liquids on your turn without falling during the move.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Deflect Missiles
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
Whenever you are attacked by a ranged weapon attack, you can spend 1 Ki point to deflect or catch the missile. When you do so, the damage you take from the attack is [[/roll 1d10+@abilities.dex.mod+@classes.monk.levels # Deflect Missiles damage reduction: ]]{reduced by 1d10 + your Dexterity modifier + your monk level}.

If you have at least one free hand and if the missile is small enough for you to hold in one hand, you catch it and can immediately throw it back at your attacker.

The attack you make to do so is a ranged attack with unlimited range but counts as an unarmed strike for all other purposes.

Starting at 10th level, you can use this feature when you're hit by both ranged spell attacks as well as ranged weapon attacks.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Slow Fall
Shalkoc Zornax.description: Beginning at 4th level, you can use your reaction when you fall to reduce any falling damage you take by an amount equal to five times your monk level: [[@classes.monk.levels*5]]

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Extra Attack
Shalkoc Zornax.description: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Evasion
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
Your instinctive agility lets you dodge out of the way of certain area effects, such as a blue dragon's lightning breath or a fireball spell.
When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Stillness of Mind
Shalkoc Zornax.description: You can use your action to end any effects on yourself that are causing you to be &Reference[condition=charmed] or &Reference[condition=frightened].

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Unarmed Strike (Draconic Strike)
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
Draconic Strike

When you damage a target with an unarmed strike, you can change the damage type to acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Draconic Presence
Shalkoc Zornax.description: If you fail a Charisma (Intimidation) or Charisma (Persuasion) check, you can use your reaction to reroll the check, as you tap into the mighty presence of dragons. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Wings Unfurled
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
As a bonus action, you can unfurl draconic wings from your back for 1 minute, giving yourself a flying speed equal to your walking speed.

You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Poisoner
Shalkoc Zornax.description: When you make a damage roll that deals poison damage, it ignores resistance to poison damage. If you would otherwise treat immunity to poison damage as resistance, you now ignore immunity to poison damage as well.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Cook's Utensils
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade in cookery.

Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Chromatic Hardening
Shalkoc Zornax.description: At the end of your turn, if you've dealt damage of at least 4 different chromatic damage types (acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison) during your turn, you gain temporary hit points equal to your level.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Figurine of a Rat
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
Conjure a rat familiar as if casting the spell "Find Familiar". You can have up to three rats summoned at a time and familiars summoned by this item can telepathically communicate with you and share their visual or auditory senses while they are within 1 mile of you.

You can use this item to conjure a rat familiar 6 times before you have to recharge it by offering up a ratatouille worth 100gp.

If these familiars get within 10ft of a gargantuan sized creature before being noticed by it, they can scare it.
- One rat doing so frightens the creature for one round.
- Two rats doing so stuns the creature for one round.
- Three rats doing so paralyses the creature for one round.
These effects bypass any condition immunities the creature might have.
Once a creature has been affected this way, it becomes immune to being frightened, stunned or paralysed this way again for 24 hours.

Note: Each activation of this item summons one familiar; to recharge it please notify the DM (haven't implemented a way to let you do that yourself yet).

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Breath of the Dragon
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
You can channel destructive waves of energy, like those created by the dragons you emulate. When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can replace one of the attacks with an exhalation of draconic energy in a 20-foot cone or a 30-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Choose a damage type: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw against your Ki save DC, taking damage of the chosen type equal to two rolls of your Martial Arts die on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The damage of this feature increases to three and four rolls of your Martial Arts die at 11th and 17th level respectively.

You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest. Alternatively you can spend 2 Ki points to use this feature.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Potion of Legendary Resistance
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
The way the potion shimmers is not unlike looking through a kaleidoscope.

When you drink this potion, you gain one Legendary Resistance for 8 hours. Spending it allows you to nullify the effect a single attack, spell, or ability would have on you.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Slumbering Dragon Vessel
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
This vessel can be a potion bottle, drinking horn, or other container meant to hold a liquid.

As a bonus action, if the vessel is empty, you can speak the command word to fill the vessel with one of the following (your choice): ale, olive oil, a potion of healing, or a potion of climbing. Once this property is used, it can't be used until you finish a long rest.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: +3 Dragonhide Belt
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
(requires attunement by a monk)

This finely detailed belt is made of dragonhide. While wearing it, you gain a +3 bonus to the saving throw DCs of your ki features. In addition, you can use an action to regain ki points equal to a roll of your Martial Arts die. You can't use this action again until the next dawn.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Continual Flame Gem
Shalkoc Zornax.description: The gem gives the look of a torch that burns providing bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Purity of Body
Shalkoc Zornax.description: Your mastery of the Ki flowing through you makes you immune to disease and allows you to use your Deflect Missiles feature on ranged spell attacks as well as ranged weapon attacks.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Fine Clothes
Shalkoc Zornax.description: Formal outfits for the entire party, except Plex which is too big in size.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Circlet of Wisdom
Shalkoc Zornax.description: This circlet grants a +2 bonus to the wearer’s Wisdom score when attuned.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Shifting Stances
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
For centuries, great warriors have looked to nature to find inspiration in battle. Countless monastic orders have crafted intricate unarmed fighting styles based on the deadliness and grace of natural creatures.

You can spend 1 Ki to enter a stance or shift from one to another, imitating the movements of the creature that inspired the stance's style. This stance lasts until you choose to end it, until you enter a different stance, or until combat ends.

You can enter a stance, change to a different stance, or end a stance only once per turn as a free action.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Mantis Style
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
Based on the hunting techniques of the praying mantis, practitioners of this style fight with their hands turned down to emulate the insect’s sharp grasping forelimbs. Mantis style uses precise, accurate strikes to pinpoint an opponent’s vital areas, such as eyes, throat, and pressure points.

Embodying the style of the mantis, lets you add your proficiency bonus to your regular Ki save DC when you use Stunning Strike but the style also reduces your AC by an amount equal to your proficiency bonus.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Tiger Style
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
This style seeks to emulate the power and fury of the great tiger. Practitioners use their hands like claws, perfecting overpowering double hand strikes and driving attack chains.

The tiger style adds an amount of damage equal to your proficiency bonus to all natural weapon attacks you make but reduces your Ki save DC by the same amount.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Turtle Style
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
Channeling the turtle’s legendary defense, practitioners of this style adopt a low, stable posture. Mobility is reduced, but they become a bastion of defense, capable of withstanding powerful strikes with calm composure.

The turtle style grants you a bonus to your AC equal to your proficiency bonus but the maximum distance you can move during each of your turns is limited to a number of feet equal to 5 times your proficiency bonus.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Drunken Brawler's Dancing Shoes
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
When a creature misses you with a melee attack, you can spend 1 Ki to cause that attack to hit one creature of your choice that you can see within 5ft.

If the attack missed you by 5 or more, you regain 1 Ki.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Handwraps of Swift Strikes
Shalkoc Zornax.description: When you use Flurry of Blows and both attacks hit, you can immediately make one additional unarmed strike as a free action.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Mythic Power
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
The path of the Dragon is reserved for those of draconic bloodline, heirs to the divine legacy of Tiamat and Bahamut. This journey represents a rite of passage, unlocking the raw power and profound wisdom inherent in their heritage. From the awakening of their ancestral essence to a final, awe-inspiring transformation into a dragon, the path embodies the might and majesty of the ancient legends.

Mythic characters can draw upon a wellspring of power to accomplish amazing deeds and cheat fate. This power is used by a number of different abilities.

You can expend an amount of mythic power equal to 2 + twice your mythic rank, and you regain all expended mythic power when you finish an extended rest.

This amount is your maximum amount of mythic power. If an ability allows you to regain uses of your mythic power, you can never have more than this amount.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Legendary Resistance
Shalkoc Zornax.description: You can expend 1 Mythic Power as a free action to immediately gain and use &Reference[legres].

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Rejuvenation
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
Upon your death, if your life essence is not captured, it returns to your hoard, where it coalesces into an egg. Any items you were wearing or carrying at the time of death are also recalled to your hoard. After [[/r 1d10]] days, the egg hatches, and you are reborn as a tiny pseudodragon, retaining all memories from your previous lives.

After an additional [[/r 1d20]] days, your pseudodragon form grows to small size. Another [[/r 1d20]] days later, you are fully restored and can transform back into your dragonborn form, regaining all features and abilities you possessed before your death.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Tiamat's Tear
Shalkoc Zornax.description: Only a dragonborn of royal blood can use this unique gemstone to command the movements of the flying island Nabu-Anshar.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Ki
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
Your training allows you to harness the mystic energy of ki. Your access to this energy is represented by a number of ki points, the maximum number of which is equal to your monk level.

You can spend these points to fuel various ki features.

When you spend a ki point, it is unavailable until you finish a short or long rest, at the end of which you draw all of your expended ki back into yourself. You must spend at least 30 minutes of the rest meditating to regain your ki points.

Some of your ki features require your target to make a saving throw to resist the feature's effects. The saving throw DC is calculated as follows:

Ki save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Aspect of the Wyrm
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
The power of your draconic spirit now radiates from you, warding your allies.

As a bonus action, you create an aura around you that lasts for 1 minute and gives you and your allies within 20 feet of you resistance against all chromatic damage types: acid, cold, fire, lightning, and poison.

Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest, unless you expend 4 Ki points to use it again.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Wyrmreaver Gauntlets
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
Requires attunement by a monk

Originally crafted for ground-bound giant brawlers to fight against dragons and other enormous predators of the sky, these studded gauntlets are engraved with the dragon rune.

While you are wearing these gauntlets, your unarmed strike deals an additional 1d6 force damage on a hit.

Guarding Runes

You have resistance to one of the following damage types of your choice: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison. You can change the chosen type when you finish a long rest.

Invoking the Runes

As a bonus action, you can invoke the gauntlets' runes and summon two enormous spectral fists that envelop the gauntlets and mimic your hand motions. The fists can also launch themselves to strike distant opponents, returning immediately to your space after they hit or miss.

The fists last for 1 minute or until you are Incapacitated. While the spectral fists are active, unarmed strikes you make on your turn have a reach of 30 feet, and when you hit a creature with an opportunity attack made with your unarmed strike, the creature must succeed on a DC 11 Strength saving throw or fall Prone.

Once the runes have been invoked, they can't be invoked again until the next dawn.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Ring of Free Action
Shalkoc Zornax.description: While you wear this ring, &Reference[rule=difficultterrain]{difficult terrain} doesn't cost you extra movement. In addition, magic can neither reduce your speed nor cause you to be &Reference[condition=paralyzed] or &Reference[condition=restrained].

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Activated: Greater Invisibility - 4th
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
4th Level

You or a creature you touch becomes &Reference[condition=invisible] until the spell ends. Anything the target is wearing or carrying is &Reference[condition=invisible] as long as it is on the target's person.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Potion of Cold Resistance
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
The potion is a plain indescriminate color and smells slightly foul.

When you drink this potion, you gain resistance to Cold type damage for 1 hour.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Dragon "Eyelashes"
Shalkoc Zornax.description: Actually are Eyelids.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Snack Pack
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
Wondrous item

This bag can only hold food items, keeping them fresh indefinitely.

This bag has an interior space considerably larger than its outside dimensions, roughly 2 feet in diameter at the mouth and 4 feet deep. The bag can hold up to 500 pounds, not exceeding a volume of 64 cubic feet. The bag weighs 3 pounds, regardless of its contents. Retrieving an item from the bag requires an action.

If the bag is overloaded, pierced, or torn, it ruptures and is destroyed, and its contents spill forth unharmed. If the bag is turned inside out, its contents spill forth, unharmed, but the bag must be put right before it can be used again.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Grilled Ribs
Shalkoc Zornax.description: Fall-off-the-bone ribs, coated in sweet and tangy homemade sauces, are a beloved favorite at most taverns, often served for events or celebrations, and eagerly enjoyed by adventurers returning triumphant from their quests or missions.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Draconic Amulet of Greed
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
The damage you deal with your breath is increased by 1dx where x is your gp/1000.

Curse

This amulet is cursed and equipping it extends the curse to you. As long as you remain cursed, you are unwilling to part with the amulet, keeping it on your person at all times and refusing to take it off for more than a few minutes.

While cursed, you will become increasingly greedy and megalomaniacal, refusing to heed the advice of others, lashing out at the slightest perceived insult, and hording your valuables and refusing to spend any unless absolutely necessary.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Gift of the Metallic Dragon
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
You've manifested some of the power of metallic dragons, granting you the following benefits:

  • Ability Score Increase. Increase your Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma by 1, to a maximum of 20. (WIS)

  • Draconic Healing. You can cast the Cure Wounds spell at 2nd level without expending a spell slot. Once you cast this spell in this way, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest. The spell's spellcasting ability is the ability increased by this feat.

  • Protective Wings. You can manifest protective wings that can shield you or others. When you or another creature you can see within 5 feet of you is hit by an attack roll, you can use your reaction to manifest spectral wings from your back for a moment. You grant a bonus to the target's AC equal to your proficiency bonus ([[lookup @prof]]) against that attack roll, potentially causing it to miss. You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Ioun Stone, Language Knowledge
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
An Ioun stone is named after Ioun, a god of knowledge and prophecy revered on some worlds. Many types of Ioun stone exist, each type a distinct combination of shape and color.

When you use an action to toss one of these stones into the air, the stone orbits your head at a distance of [[/r 1d3]] feet and confers a benefit to you. Thereafter, another creature must use an action to grasp or net the stone to separate it from you, either by making a successful attack roll against AC 24 or a successful DC 24 Dexterity (&Reference[skill=Acrobatics]) check. You can use an action to seize and stow the stone, ending its effect.

A stone has AC 24, 10 hit points, and resistance to all damage. It is considered to be an object that is being worn while it orbits your head.

You are fluent in one additional language while this pulsating bit of red jeweled crystal orbits your head. The DM chooses the language bestowed by the stone.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Chef
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
Time spent mastering the culinary arts has paid off, increasing your Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20, and granting you proficiency with cook's utensils if you didn't already have it.

If you have ingredients and cook's utensils on hand, you can prepare up to 10 meals during one hour of dedicated work or as part of a short or long rest. Each meal requires one food and, optionally, one spice.

When preparing a meal, you can choose to enhance either its restorative or preventative properties, granting it one of the following benefits:

  • Restorative. The creature regains a number of hit points equal to 1d8 * your proficiency bonus.

  • Preventative. The creature gains a number of temporary hit points equal to 2d4 * your proficiency bonus.

Meals retain these enhanced properties only while fresh, meaning they must be consumed within 30 minutes of preparation. A creature that consumes a fresh meal gains the selected benefit as well as the effect of any spice used to flavor the meal.

A creature can benefit from only one enhanced meal per rest period.

@UUID[JournalEntry.oa3Aqf451KYG3m2U.JournalEntryPage.l2POHOPcejMpEIHt]{Spice List}

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Potion of Growth
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
The red in the potion's liquid continuously expands from a tiny bead to color the clear liquid around it and then contracts. Shaking the bottle fails to interrupt this process.

When you drink this potion, you gain the "enlarge" effect of the enlarge/reduce spell for 1d4 hours (no concentration required):

While enlarged, your size is increased by one category and your weight is multiplied by eight.
You have advantage on Strength checks and saving throws and your attacks with weapons deal an additional 1d4 damage.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Instinctive Greed
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
You develop an innate urge to accumulate wealth and amass a hoard of treasure in a single location, jealously guarding it from friend and foe alike.

If the total value of coins (platinum, gold, electrum, silver, and copper) and loot in your hoard exceeds the total value of coins and loot you carry on your person, you gain the following benefits:

  • When you deal poison damage, you deal additional poison damage equal to your mythic rank. This bonus is doubled when you deal poison damage with your breath weapon.

  • Gain a bonus to [[/skill dec]], [[/skill itm]], [[/skill per]], [[/skill ins]], [[/skill prc]], and [[/skill ste]] checks equal to your mythic rank.

If the total value of your hoard exceeds the combined value of coins and loot carried by you and all other party members, all bonuses granted by this feat are doubled.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Mystifying Miasma
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
As an action, you can expend 1 Mythic Power to create a cloud of mind-altering fog in a 1-mile radius that lasts for 1 hour.

The fog lightly obscures the area, and creatures inside it are unaware of their minds and senses being distorted by the miasma unless they are either immune to &Reference[illusion] or &Reference[enchantment] magic, succeed on a [[/check inv dc=30]] or [[/check prc dc=30]] check, or possess &Reference[rule=truesight]. Even if a creature becomes aware of the miasma’s mind-altering properties, they still suffer its effects as long as they remain within the fog.

The miasma distorts the mind and senses of other creatures while enhancing your ability to take advantage of their altered state of mind. While inside the area:

  • You have advantage on saving throws against being &Reference[charmed] or &Reference[frightened] as well as on [[/skill ste]], [[/skill prc]], [[/skill ins]], and [[/skill dec]] checks.

  • Other creatures have disadvantage on saving throws against being &Reference[charmed] or &Reference[frightened] as well as on [[/skill prc]], [[/skill ins]], and [[/skill sur]] checks.

Additionally, when you see a creature within the miasma make an attack, you can use your reaction to manipulate their perception, causing them to mistake another creature of your choice for their intended target, provided the new target is a valid option for the attack (e.g., within range). If the attacker is aware of the miasma's mind altering properties, they can make a [[/save wis format=long]] against your ki save DC to avoid the redirection of that attack.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Jump
Shalkoc Zornax.description: Using your bonus action, you can jump up to [[/r @talia.jumpDistance]] ft.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Grapple
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
When you want to grab a creature or wrestle with it, you can use the Attack action to make a special melee attack, a grapple. If you're able to make multiple attacks with the Attack action, this attack replaces one of them. The target of your grapple must be no more than one size larger than you, and it must be within your reach.

Using at least one free hand, you try to seize the target by making a grapple check, a [[/skill ath format=long]] contested by the target's [[/skill ath format=long]] or [[/skill acr format=long]] (the target chooses the ability to use). You succeed automatically if the target is incapacitated. If you succeed, you subject the target to the &Reference[grappled] effect. The condition specifies the things that end it, and you can release the target whenever you like (no action required).

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Boots of Blinding Speed
Shalkoc Zornax.description: While worn, your walking speed is increased by 30ft and you are &Reference[blinded].

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Dodge
Shalkoc Zornax.description: When you take the Dodge action, you focus entirely on avoiding attacks. Until the start of your next turn, any attack roll made against you has disadvantage if you can see the attacker, and you make Dexterity saving throws with advantage. You lose this benefit if you are incapacitated (as explained in the appendix) or if your speed drops to 0.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Stunning Strike
Shalkoc Zornax.description: You can interfere with the flow of ki in an opponent's body. When you hit another creature with a melee weapon attack, you can spend 1 ki point to attempt a stunning strike. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be &Reference[condition=stunned] until the end of your next turn.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Torpor
Shalkoc Zornax.description: A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a [[/save con 15 format=long]] or become &Reference[poisoned] for 4d6 hours. The &Reference[poisoned] creature is &Reference[incapacitated].

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Bracers of Asmodeus
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
If you do not wear armor or use a shield while wearing these bracers, you have a +2 bonus to AC and your unarmed attacks deal an additional 1d4 fire damage.

Additionally, you activate the bracers to cast the Command spell (save DC 18) at 1st level. A Counterspell attempting to interrupt a Command spell cast this way, treats this spell as if it was cast at 6th level. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until you finish a long rest.

Curse

While attuned to the bracers, you become obsessed with plotting, scheming, and manipulation. You always barter for better deals, often using secrets or leveraging other offers in the process. If you ever decline an opportunity to better yourself financially at another's expense, you immediately take [[/damage 3d10 type=necrotic]] damage. Only the Remove Curse spell allows you to end attunement to this item.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Command
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
You speak a one-word command to a creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or follow the command on its next turn. The spell has no effect if the target is undead, if it doesn't understand your language, or if your command is directly harmful to it.

Some typical commands and their effects follow. You might issue a command other than one described here. If you do so, the DM determines how the target behaves. If the target can't follow your command, the spell ends.

Approach.

The target moves toward you by the shortest and most direct route, ending its turn if it moves within 5 feet of you.

Drop.

The target drops whatever it is holding and then ends its turn.

Flee.

The target spends its turn moving away from you by the fastest available means.

Grovel.

The target falls &Reference[condition=prone] and then ends its turn.

Halt.

The target doesn't move and takes no actions. A flying creature stays aloft, provided that it is able to do so. If it must move to stay aloft, it flies the minimum distance needed to remain in the air.

At Higher Levels.

When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can affect one additional creature for each slot level above 1st. The creatures must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Activated: Sending - 3rd
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
You send a short message of twenty-five words or less to a creature with which you are familiar. The creature hears the message in its mind, recognizes you as the sender if it knows you, and can answer in a like manner immediately. The spell enables creatures with Intelligence scores of at least 1 to understand the meaning of your message.

You can send the message across any distance and even to other planes of existence, but if the target is on a different plane than you, there is a [[/r 1d20]]{5 percent} chance that the message doesn't arrive.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Leaden Fist
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
Requires attunement by a monk

These heavy handwraps are adorned with large granite prayer beads, each engraved with writing in ancient Terran.

You can use your action and bonus action on your turn and expend 2 ki points to make a single, powerful unarmed strike that always deals bludgeoning damage. When calculating damage for this attack, instead of rolling a single Martial Arts die, roll a number of Martial Arts dice equal to your monk level.

If this attack reduces a creature to 0 hit points, you regain 1 ki point.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Activated: Shield - 1st
Shalkoc Zornax.description: An invisible barrier of magical force appears and protects you. Until the start of your next turn, you have a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and you take no damage from magic missile.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Activated: Borrowed Knowledge - 2nd
Shalkoc Zornax.description: You draw on knowledge from spirits of the past. Choose one skill in which you lack proficiency. For the spell's duration, you have proficiency in the chosen skill. The spell ends early if you cast it again.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Purple Worm Poison
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
The name of this poison has been made up by alchemists to make it seem like it's more difficult to obtain than it really is.

A creature subjected to this poison must make a [[/save con 19 format=long]], taking [[/damage 12d6 poison]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Broth of Needful Fortitude
Shalkoc Zornax.description: Favored by intelligent undead, this rich stock is brewed from the flesh and bones of humanoids and typically kept sealed in an earthenware jar. When you consume this broth, you can reduce your &Reference[condition=exhaustion] level by up to 2, and you have advantage on Constitution saving throws against disease, poison, and environmental effects for 8 hours. If you are undead, you also regain [[/r 3d6]] hit points.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Hand of Healing
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
As an action, you can spend 2 ki points to touch a willing creature and roll two Martial Arts die. The target creature regains a number of hit points equal to the number rolled plus your proficiency bonus plus your Wisdom modifier.

When you do so, you can also end one &Reference[disease]{disease} or one of the following conditions affecting the creature: &Reference[blinded], &Reference[deafened], &Reference[paralyzed], &Reference[poisoned], or &Reference[stunned].

This replaces your Quickened Healing feature.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Activated: Greater Restoration - 9th
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
You imbue a creature you touch with positive energy to undo a debilitating effect. You can reduce the target's exhaustion level by one, or end one of the following effects on the target:

One effect that &Reference[condition=charmed] or &Reference[condition=petrified] the target

One curse, including the target's attunement to a cursed magic item

Any reduction to one of the target's ability scores

One effect reducing the target's hit point maximum

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Little Finger of Dam'ghur
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
As an action, you can point the wand at any number of undead creatures of your choice within 30 feet., commanding them to return to death. Each targeted creature of Challenge Rating 1 or less must succed [[/save cha 15]] saving throw or be reduced to 0 hit points.

The wand has 10 charges. It regains [[/r 1d6]] expended charges when you finish a long rest. While holding the wand, you can use an action to expend some of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it: False Life (2 charges per spell level), Gentle Repose (2 charges), Speak with Dead (3 charges).

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Speak with Dead
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
You grant the semblance of life and intelligence to a corpse of your choice within range, allowing it to answer the questions you pose. The corpse must still have a mouth and can't be undead. The spell fails if the corpse was the target of this spell within the last 10 days.

Until the spell ends, you can ask the corpse up to five questions. The corpse knows only what it knew in life, including the languages it knew. Answers are usually brief, cryptic, or repetitive, and the corpse is under no compulsion to offer a truthful answer if you are hostile to it or it recognizes you as an enemy. This spell doesn't return the creature's soul to its body, only its animating spirit. Thus, the corpse can't learn new information, doesn't comprehend anything that has happened since it died, and can't speculate about future events.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: False Life
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
Bolstering yourself with a necromantic facsimile of life, you gain [[/r 1d4 + 4]] temporary hit points.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you gain 5 additional temporary hit points for each slot level above 1st.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Gentle Repose
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
You touch a corpse or other remains. For the duration, the target is protected from decay and can't become undead.

The spell also effectively extends the time limit on raising the target from the dead, since days spent under the influence of this spell don't count against the time limit of spells such as raise dead.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Cure Wounds (2nd Level)
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
A creature you touch regains a number of hit points equal to [[/r 2d8]] + your spellcasting ability modifier. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

At Higher Levels.

When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the healing increases by [[/r 1d8]] for each slot level above 1st.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Potion of Water Breathing
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
Its cloudy green fluid smells of the sea and has a jellyfish-like bubble floating in it.

You can breathe underwater for 1 hour after drinking this potion.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Bottle of Bagiennik Snot
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
As repulsive as many might find the snot of the frog-like Bagiennik, they cannot deny it's healing abilities.

You regain 8d4 + 8 hit points when you drink this potion.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Rations
Shalkoc Zornax.description: Rations consist of dry foods suitable for extended travel, including jerky, dried fruit, hardtack, and nuts.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Chocolate
Shalkoc Zornax.description: Chocolate comes in many shapes, sizes, and tastes. It is a staple sweet primarily made from cocoa beans, sugar, and milk. A major ingredient used in many desserts such as pudding, cakes, and candy. It can be in a solid form like a candy bar or in a liquid form like hot chocolate, to fit various needs and tastes.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Bugman’s Ale
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
This special brew was originally created by the legendary dwarven brewmaster Joseph Bugman, and he shared its recipe only with his most trusted apprentices.

When you drink this ale, you need to make a DC 30 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, you become immune to the &Reference[Frightened] condition for 8 hours.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Diamond Soul
Shalkoc Zornax.description: Beginning at 14th level, your mastery of ki grants you proficiency in all saving throws. Additionally, whenever you make a saving throw and fail, you can spend 1 ki point to reroll it and take the second result.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Martyr's Locket
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
A Martyr's Locket is an unassuming and unadorned gold pendant, deliberately plain and with a blank canvas inside. Blessed by the divine light of Mount Celestia, they are offered by the angelic hosts of Heaven to those seeking to perform acts of true empathy - often given freely to poor sinners looking for penance.

The belief that the truest measure of a soul is not in avoiding hardship, but in the willingness to bear the burdens of others, is a belief not just common amongst the denizens of Heaven but also shared by their mortal followers. As such, many monasteries across the realms which are dedicated to lawful good deities or principles, welcome donations of used lockets and display them in quiet galleries where each captured portrait of a moment of sacrifice serves as a silent lesson in courage and compassion for all to witness. Novitiates spend hours in silent contemplation before them, learning not only from dusty tomes, but from the faces of ordinary people captured in their single greatest moment.

Moment of Martyrdom. When another creature you can see becomes affected by a curse (or an effect that can be ended or removed via the Remove Curse spell), you can activate the locket (no action required) to take the curse upon yourself instead. This ability cannot be used if the other creature isn't willing or if you are immune to any the curse's effects.

When the item is activated this way, the locket becomes a nonmagical @UUID[Compendium.talia-custom.customItems.Item.dQQKUD2XEIMNbGXl]{gold locket with a painted portrait inside} (DMG, p134), depicting you in the moment you took the curse upon yourself.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Silver Tears
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
In the depths of Mestopheles' dungeons on Cania, the 8th layer of Hell, pain devils extract this silvery powder through the torture of captured celestials. Devils bound for the warfronts of Avernus take flasks and snuff boxes of the stuff to fortify themselves against exposure to the raw chaos of demons.

When you consume this substance as an action, you have advantage on saving throws against any effect from a demonic source for 8 hours.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Thorn Whip
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
You create a long, vine-like whip covered in thorns that lashes out at your command toward a creature in range. Make a melee spell attack against the target. If the attack hits, the creature takes [[/damage 1d6 type=piercing]] damage, and if the creature is Large or smaller, you pull the creature up to 10 feet closer to you.

This spell's damage increases by [[/r 1d6]] when you reach 5th level ([[/damage 2d6]]), 11th level ([[/damage 3d6]]), and 17th level ([[/damage 4d6]]).

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Guardian of Nature
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
A nature spirit answers your call and transforms you into a powerful guardian. The transformation lasts until the spell ends. You choose one of the following forms to assume: Primal Beast or Great Tree.

Primal Beast

Bestial fur covers your body, your facial features become feral, and you gain the following benefits:

  • Your walking speed increases by 10 feet.
  • You gain &Reference[rule=darkvision] with a range of 120 feet.
  • You make Strength-based attack rolls with advantage.
  • Your melee weapon attacks deal an extra [[/damage 1d6 type=force]] damage on a hit.

Great Tree

Your skin appears barky, leaves sprout from your hair, and you gain the following benefits:

  • You gain 10 temporary hit points.
  • You make Constitution saving throws with advantage.
  • You make Dexterity- and Wisdom-based attack rolls with advantage.
  • While you are on the ground, the ground within 15 feet of you is &Reference[rule=difficultterrain]{difficult terrain} for your enemies.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Chili Pepper
Shalkoc Zornax.description: Harvested usually in most warm climates, it is used mainly as a spice in cuisines to add some "warmth" to the dish.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Ginger
Shalkoc Zornax.description: Ginger, is widely used as a spice and folk medicine. It is provided as tea for those who have weak stomachs to combat nausea, among other things.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Waterskin
Shalkoc Zornax.description: A leather hide sewn into an enclosed skin which can contain up to 4 pints of liquid. It weighs 5 pounds when full; a pint of water is approximately 1 pound.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Elixir of Corruption
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
This elixir looks, smells, and tastes like a Potion of Heroism; however, it is actually a poisonous elixir masked by illusion magic. An identify spell reveals its true nature.

If you drink it, you must succeed on a [[/save ability=constitution dc=15]] saving throw or be corrupted by the diabolical power within the elixir for 1 week. While corrupted, you lose immunity to diseases, poison damage, and the &Reference[condition=poisoned] condition. If you aren't normally immune to poison damage, you instead have vulnerability to poison damage while corrupted. The corruption can be removed with Greater Restoration or similar magic.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Pike
Shalkoc Zornax.description: A sturdy blade mounted upon the end of a long metal haft. Designed as a defensive weapon with considerable reach to both fend off and menace foes.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Guardian Scale of Transmutation
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
A creature can only have one Guardian Scale equipped at any given time.

While you have this scale equipped, you can cast @UUID[Compendium.talia-custom.customItems.Item.uA25JwLN2HLmf0zY]{Guardian of Nature} (1/day) and @UUID[Compendium.talia-custom.customItems.Item.TGZYfNKcSo9lL4Hm]{Thorn Whip}.

The ancient magic of this scale alters these spells. They require no concentration or components, can be cast while raging and have a flat spell save DC of [[12 + @prof]] and a flat spell attack bonus of [[4+@prof]].

Additionally, the cantrip this item grants has a casting time of 1 bonus action.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Thorn Whip
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
You create a long, vine-like whip covered in thorns that lashes out at your command toward a creature in range. Make a melee spell attack against the target. If the attack hits, the creature takes [[/damage 1d6 type=piercing]] damage, and if the creature is Large or smaller, you pull the creature up to 10 feet closer to you.

This spell's damage increases by [[/r 1d6]] when you reach 5th level ([[/damage 2d6]]), 11th level ([[/damage 3d6]]), and 17th level ([[/damage 4d6]]).
