Downtime Activities - Gearing Up

The following activities revolve around crafting and improving equipment and making preparations for upcoming adventures.

Buying a Magic Item

Purchasing a magic item requires time and money to seek out and contact people willing to sell items. Even then, there is no guarantee a seller will have the items a character desires.

Resources

Finding magic items to purchase could requires at least 100gp in expenses.

Resolution

To determine the quality of the seller found, the character must make a check, choosing from Intelligence (Investigation), Wisdom (Insight), Charisma (Deception), or Charisma (Persuasion). The character gains a +1 bonus on the check for every week that has been spent seeking a seller over the past year, up to a maximum of +5.

A character can spend additional gold on the search to improve their odds, gaining a +1 bonus for every additional 150gp spent, up to a maximum of +5. This bonus does not carry over into future Buying a Magic Item activities. The monatery cost includes living a wealthy lifestyle to impress potential business partners.

If the roll's total is below a 5, potential business partners are disappointed and all current and previous resources allocated for the search are lost.

Check TotalItems Availabe for Purchase
5+Roll 1d4 times on Magic Item Table A
10+Roll 1d4 times on Magic Item Table B
15+Roll 1d4 times on Magic Item Table C
20+Roll 1d4 times on Magic Item Table D
25+Roll 1d4 times on Magic Item Table E
30+Roll 1d4 times on Magic Item Table F
35+Roll 1d4 times on Magic Item Table G
40+Roll 1d4 times on Magic Item Table H
45+Roll 1d4 times on Magic Item Table I

The actual availability and asking price for a magic item depend on many factors such as supply and demand, luck, or relations with the seller. The provided tables are general guidelines - the GM has the final say in determining which items are for sale and their final price, no matter what the tables say.

RarityAsking Price (Halved for Consumables)
Common(1d6+1) x 10 gp
Uncommon1d6 x 100 gp
Rare2d10 x 1000 gp
Very Rare(1d4 + 1) x 10000 gp
Legendary2d6 x 25000 gp

Brewing Healing Potions

Old granny's bubbling brews might not be made the same way as the distilled herbal extracts of the trained apothecary but there is at least one thing they have in common - when you drink one, you likely have much bigger things to worry about than asking how they're made.

Requirements

Proficiency with Alchemist Supplies or Wisdom (Medicine).

Resolution

A character brewing healing potions must make a Wisdom (Medicine) or Alchemist Supplies (Int/Wis) check. The result of that check determines the total amount of work the character can get done in that week. Each healing potion requires a different amount of work and a character cannot brew potions with a combined work requirement that is higher than the number rolled. Additionally, the character must spend gold to purchase the required ingredients for the potions.

TypeWork RequiredCost/Potion
Potion of Healing120gp
Potion of Greater Healing5100gp
Potion of Superior Healing10300gp
Potion of Supreme Healing153000gp

Carousing

Carousing is a default downtime activity for many characters. Between adventures, who doesn't want to relax with a few drinks and a group of friends at a tavern? The people one comes into contact with can certainly prove useful as well.

Resources

Carousing covers a week of fine food, strong drink, and socializing. A character can attempt to carouse among lower-, middle-, or upper-class folk. A character can carouse with the lower class for 10 gp to cover expenses, or 50 gp for the middle class. Carousing with the upper class requires 250 gp for the week and access to the local nobility.

A character with the noble background can mingle with the upper class, but other characters can do so only if you judge that the character has made sufficient contacts. Alternatively, a character might use a disguise kit and the Deception skill to pass as a noble visiting from a distant city.

Resolution

When choosing this activity, a character must select the social class they want to carouse amongst.

  • Lower-class contacts include criminals, laborers, mercenaries, the town guard, and any other folk who normally frequent the cheapest taverns in town.
  • Middle-class contacts include guild members, spellcasters, town officials, and other folk who frequent well-kept establishments.
  • Upper-class contacts are nobles and their personal servants. Carousing with such folk covers formal banquets, state dinners, and the like.

Specific Targets. Additionally, a character may wish to come into contact with a certain group or even a specific individual from among the chosen social class. They might want to make friends with a specific noble that has the king's ear, find a benefactor in a wealthy merchant, get to know the town guards to learn about their patrolling schedules, or make aquiantance with the architect that knows the castle like no other. When choosing a specific target it, it is recommended for a player to also inform the GM about their reason and motives for choosing said target in order to avoid misunderstandings and give the GM more to work with.

After a workweek of carousing, a character stands to make contacts within the selected social class, and potentially with the selected target. The character makes a Charisma (Deception) or Charisma (Persuasion) check using the table below.

Check TotalResult
<10Character has made a hostile contact.
10—19Character has made no new contacts.
20—29Character has made an allied contact.
30—39Character has made two allied contacts.
40+Character has made three allied contacts.

Contacts are specific NPCs who now share a bond with the character. Each one either owes the character a favor or has some reason to bear a grudge. A hostile contact works against the character, placing obstacles but stopping short of committing a crime or a violent act. Allied contacts are friends who will render aid to the character, but not at the risk of their lives.

Once a contact has helped or hindered a character, the character needs to carouse again to get back into the NPC's good graces. A contact provides help once, not help for life. The contact remains friendly, which can influence roleplaying and how the characters interact with them, but doesn't come with a guarantee of help.

Copying Spells into a Spellbook

Resources

One or more spell scrolls to copy into the spellbook and an amount of gold equal to 50 x spell level for each scroll to copy to buy the rare inks required.

Resolution

A character who chooses this activity must make an ability check using their spellcasting ability and add their proficiency bonus to determine the maximum number of spells the character can copy that week. The character can copy a number of spells whose combined spell level is no more than the rolled total. Only spells on spell scrolls can be copied into a spellbook. A character that has the Ritual Caster feature or has the Book of Ancient Secrets invocation can also copy ritual spells into their ritual books, following the same rules.

Copying a spell from a scroll into a spellbook destroys the scroll.

Crafting an Item

A character who has the time, the money, and the needed tools can use downtime to craft armor, weapons, clothing, or other kinds of nonmagical gear.

Resources

A character must have the appropriate tool and be proficient with its use. Additionally, the character needs raw materials worth half the item's selling cost.

Resolution

A character crafting an item must make check with the appropriate Artisan Tools (Str/Dex/Int/Wis) check. The result of that check determines the total amount of work the character can get done in that week. A character can craft a number of items with a combined work requirement that is equal to or lower than the number rolled. To determine how much work an item takes to be crafted, divide its gold piece cost by 50.

If an item would take more work than a character can do in a single week, the character can choose to spend the week working on that item alone, leaving it unfinished. When the character chooses the Crafting an Item activity in the future, they can choose to continue work on the unfinished item. This process can be repeated any number of times until the item is finished. A character cannot have more than one unfinished item at any given time.

Relaxation

Sometimes the best thing to do between adventures is relax. Whether a character wants a hard-earned vacation or needs to recover from injuries, relaxation is the ideal option for adventurers who need a break. This option is also ideal for players who don't want to make use of the downtime system.

Resources

A character needs to maintain at least a modest lifestyle while relaxing to gain the benefit of the activity.

Resolution

Characters who maintain at least a modest lifestyle while relaxing gain several benefits. While relaxing, a character gains advantage on saving throws to recover from long-acting diseases and poisons. In addition, at the end of the week, a character gains the following benefits:

  • End one effect that keeps the character from regaining hit points or restore one ability score that has been reduced to less than its normal value. This benefit cannot be used if the harmful effect was caused by a spell or some other magical effect with an ongoing duration.
  • Remove up to 3 levels of exhaustion.
  • Gain temporary hit points equal to twice the character's level.

Religious Service

Characters with a religious bent might want to spend downtime in service to a temple, either by attending rites or by proselytizing in the community. Someone who undertakes this activity has a chance of winning the favor of the temple's leaders.

Resources

Performing religious service requires access to, and often attendance at, a temple whose beliefs and ethos align with the character's. If such a place is available, the activity takes one week of time but involves no gold piece expenditure.

Resolution

At the end of the required time, the character chooses to make either an Intelligence (Religion) check or a Charisma (Persuasion) check. The total of the check determines the benefits of service, as shown on the Religious Service table.

Check TotalResult
<10You gain one disfavor.
10—19No effect. Your efforts fail to make a lasting impression.
20—29You earn one favor.
30+You two favors.

You can never have a favor and a disfavor a the same time - if you would gain a disfavor while you have a favor, you lose the favor instead. The same holds true vice-versa.

Favor. A favor, in broad terms, is a promise of future assistance from a representative of the temple. It can be expended to ask the temple for help in dealing with a specific problem, for general political or social support, or to reduce the cost of cleric spellcasting by 50 percent. A favor could also take the form of a deity's intervention, such as an omen, a vision, or a minor miracle provided at a key moment. This latter sort of favor is expended by the DM, who also determines its nature.

Favors earned need not be expended immediately, but only a certain number can be stored up. A character can have a maximum number of unused favors equal to 1 + the character's Charisma modifier (minimum of one unused favor).

Disfavor. A disfavor works in the contrary to a favor and it is up to the DM to expend it at an appropriate moment and determine its nature. You can choose to make a donation to the temple to rid yourself of any disfavors you have. This donation must have a value in gold pieces equal to 100 x your level x your disfavors.

Research

Forewarned is forearmed. The research downtime activity allows a character to delve into lore concerning a monster, a location, a magic item, or some other particular topic.

Resources

Typically, a character needs access to a library or a sage to conduct research. Assuming such access is available, conducting research requires at least 100 gp spent on materials, bribes, gifts, and other expenses.

Resolution

The character declares the focus of the research—a specific person, place, or thing. After one week, the character makes an Intelligence (Arcana), Intelligence (History), Intelligence (Religion), or Intelligence (Nature) check as chosen by the GM depending on the focus of the research. This check gains a +1 bonus per 100 gp spent beyond the initial 100 gp, to a maximum of +5. In addition, a character who has access to a particularly well-stocked library or knowledgeable sages gains advantage on this check.

Check TotalOutcome
<10You learn two pieces of lore, at least one of which is untrue or misleading.
10—19No effect.
20—29You learn one piece of lore.
30—39You learn two pieces of lore.
40+You learn three pieces of lore.

Each piece of lore is the equivalent of one true statement about a person, place, or thing. Examples include knowledge of a creature's resistances, the password needed to enter a sealed dungeon level, the spells commonly prepared by an order of wizards, and so on.

Selling a Magic Item

Selling a magic item is by no means an easy task. Con artists and thieves are always looking out for an easy score, and there's no guarantee that a character will receive a good offer even if a legitimate buyer is found.

Resources

A character can find a buyer for one magic item by spending 25 gp to spread word of the desired sale. A character must pick one item at a time to sell.

Resolution

A character who wants to sell an item must make a Charisma (Persuasion) check against a DC that depends on the item's rarity to determine what kind of offer comes in. The character can always opt not to sell, instead forfeiting the effort and trying again later.

RarityDCBase Price (Halved for Consumables)
Common10(1d6 + 1) x 10 gp
Uncommon151d6 x 100 gp
Rare202d10 x 1000 gp
Very Rare25(1d4 + 1) x 10000 gp
Legendary302d6 x 25000 gp
Check TotalOffer
<DC50% of base price
DC—(DC+9)100% of base price
(DC + 10)+150% of base price

Training

Given enough free time and the services of an instructor, a character can learn a language or pick up proficiency with a tool, vehicle, or a single type of weapon.

Resources & Resolution

Receiving training in a language, tool, vehicle, or weapon typically takes at least six weeks, but this time is reduced by a number of weeks equal to the character's Intelligence modifier (an Intelligence penalty doesn't increase the time needed). Training costs 25 gp per workweek. Individual weeks of training don't need to be consecutive, but a character cannot receive training in more than one field at a time.

Downtime Activities - Special

Learn a Spell

Certain beings have the unique ability to teach certain spells to others - with great effort even to those without the Spellcasting or Pact Magic features.

Requirements

A character can only choose this activity if they know a suitable and willing teacher. Such teachers usually don't come cheap and often expect to be paid not in favors instead of gold.

Resolution

The character must choose one of the spells the teacher is willing and able to teach them. A character can learn spells of a spell level up to one third of their character level, rounded down. The process of learning and then casting the spell differs between casters - characters with the Spellcasting or Pact Magic features - and those without.

Spellcasters. Learning a spell this way takes a character with the Spellcasting or Pact Magic features two weeks per level of the spell. Once learned, the spell counts as part of the character's class' spell list and can be cast using the character's spell slots like any other spell. If they are a prepared caster, they must prepare the spell as normal to cast it. If the spell is a ritual, the character can cast it as such.

Non-Casters. Those without the Spellcasting or Pact Magic features take three times as long to learn the spell - six weeks per level of the spell. Once learned, the spell counts as an innate spell which they can cast once per day. If the spell is a ritual, the spell doesn't have a daily limit but it can only be cast as a ritual. If a non-caster character later becomes a spellcaster, the rules for spellcasters apply instead.

pages.name: Armor Check Penalty
pages.content: Certain kinds of armor and shields place a heavy burden on the wearer. While wearing an armor or using a shield that has an Armor Check Penalty specified in its description, you suffer a penalty to all Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution ability check equal to the amount specified. If both your armor and your shield impose an Armor Check Penalty, the penalty you suffer is equal to the sum of both items' Armor Check Penalty.

pages.name: Conditions
pages.content:
Distracted

A distracted creature cannot take reactions.

Dazed

A dazed creature can only do one of the following things on their turn: move, use an action, or use a bonus action. If a creature becomes dazed during their turn, their turn ends. The cure ailment power, lesser restoration spell, and greater restoration spell remove the dazed condition. At the GM's discretion, other powers, spells, or effects might also remove the dazed condition.

When a dazed creature is affected by a spell or effect that gives them an extra action on their turn (like the haste spell or the fighter's Action Surge feature), they can still take this extra action, in addition to the movement, action, or bonus action allowed by the dazed condition.

Some creatures in this book have immunity to the dazed condition. At the GM's discretion, a creature published in the core rules or another supplement who has immunity to the paralyzed or stunned condition also has immunity to the dazed condition.

pages.name: Visions of an Eagle
pages.content:
You find yourself enveloped in darkness, the weight of a deep silence pressing against your senses. As you focus, the shadows begin to dissolve, revealing a dimly lit dungeon. The air is cold and thick with the scent of damp stone.

In the center of the room, you see a cage, its bars twisted and rusted, standing stark against the gloom. Inside, a magnificent white eagle is trapped, its pristine feathers dulled by the shadows. Its sharp eyes search for something—someone—through the haze of its confinement, and when they lock onto yours, a shiver runs down your spine.

Then, behind the cage, an imposing figure emerges from the darkness: a frost giant, towering and fearsome. Clad in heavy, jagged armor that glimmers like ice under the flickering light, it looms over the eagle, on its head sits a wide-brimmed wizard’s hat.

You can only watch in horror as the giant raises a massive hand, fingers like icicles curling around the eagle's feathers. One by one, he rips them out with a slow, deliberate cruelty. Each tug is a reminder of pain, and the eagle’s cries pierce your soul—a desperate plea for freedom, a haunting call for mercy that echoes within you.

As its gaze remains locked onto yours, you see the anguish in its eyes, seeking deliverance from the grip of its captor. You want to scream, to rush forward and shatter the bars that confine it, but your body feels heavy and immobile. As the weight of your helplessness presses down on you, you wake from your dream, drenched in cold sweat.

pages.name: Tales of the Black Vents
pages.content:
The Black Vents is an area about a week's march from the Bronze Citadel, where the ground is riddled with holes—ranging from barely a finger’s width to dozens of feet across—that continuously spew thick, black, toxic smoke.

You hear a tale of an enormous demon of fire and flame that came to Avernus eons ago, when the Blood War was still young. It wrought havoc amongst the devils' ranks but eventually - through their trickery and cunning - it fell into a deep ravine and was never seen again. Over time, the land shifted, and as the ravine closed, holes began to appear in the ground spewing forth black smoke. The devils, curious as to where these vents led, explored them. Only the ones that stayed near the surface returned.

But when the remains and personal belongings of the others began to fall from the sky in Dis, it became clear that the vents formed a connection between the two planes - and that something lived inside of them.

In another tale you hear of ten Pit Fiends sent to slay the creature dwelling within the vents. When none returned, Zariel herself took on the task. She did return - bloodied and bruised - and immediately decapitated the first devil who dared ask if she had succeeded. Afterward, she decreed that no devil shall set foot there again, and the entire area has remained off-limits ever since.

pages.name: A Story about Goats
pages.content:
Just as Aviana's hand closed around Plex's neck, the goblin's curse took hold once more and transported him into the Feywild - only for Aviana's curse to take hold as well and bring her along.

The two appeared in the middle of a clearing in a vibrant forest, and surrounded by a few dozen Satyrs who're dancing, drinking, playing music, and partying. Their music suddenly stopped however once they got interrupted by Plex's choking gasps for air and Aviana's "Listen here you little shit...".

The satyrs clearly weren't amused and what followed was an honest effort of diplomacy from Aviana. Which was interrupted only briefly when she noticed that she was still holding Plex aloft by his throat, and that this particular image probably wasn't helping her diplomatic efforts. So she let the goblin go, who immediately teleported away from Aviana. Or rather tried to, as his first attempt resulted in him just teleporting from Aviana's left to her right. The 2nd attempt that followed was successful however and Aviana lost sight of the goblin.

She continued her efforts to make peace with the satyrs but was having a tough time as she made one social faux pas (in the satyr's eyes that is) after another. When Aviana saw the rainbow-colored glow and heard the bleats coming from the forest's edge, she immediately knew what was to come and instantly regretted ever letting go of Plex's neck. The Lantern Goat stormed onto the clearing with Plex on it's back holding onto its horns for dear life. Now that was the kind of diplomacy the satyrs could get behind, and soon the music, dancing, and drinking started again, with Aviana, Plex, and the Lantern Goat as guests of honour.

All were having a good time until Aviana couldn't restrain herself any longer. The large boulder at the edge of the clearing was the first thing she noticed when she arrived here and she instantly knew that not lifting it would be something she'd regret for the rest of her life. The boulder's bizarre shape just made it even more intriguing, as it reminded her a lot of a giant goat's head. So she went over, grabbed it, and - didn't lift it. "Strange", she thought to herself and tried again, putting all of her strength into the lift. Much to her satisfaction, the boulder moved.

Much to her, and everyone else's, dissatisfaction however, it wasn't just the boulder that moved. The earth beneath the clearing shook and rose, higher and higher, until all could see the tops of the trees beneath them. Off in the distance, Aviana even saw a large patch of forest was completely grey. She didn't have much opportunity to ponder that however, as the head-like boulder she tried to lift turned out to be an actual head after all. Namely the head of a mythical Mountain Goat, who had been slumbering for eons. Who was very displeased with Aviana's attempts to tear its head off.

A fight for survival ensued as the Mountain Goat bucked and shook. The satyrs tried to hold on but one by one they fell off the Mountain Goat's back, disappearing into the treetops below with a scream. Plex wasn't having any issues himself as he had correctly figured that a goat wouldn't have any issues standing on another goat, and so he had once again climbed onto the Lantern Goat's back. Due to his growing experience with using unwilling Lantern Goats as mounts, he was finding it easier and easier to hold on. This even allowed him to save several of the satyrs from certain death, as he teleported them safely to the ground.

Aviana, unwilling - and unable - to let go of ~~her boulder~~ the Mountain Goat's head, looked for a way to resolve this situation and the first solution that came to her mind was, unsurprisingly, the broken Iron Flask. She grabbed it from her pockets and threw it at the Mountain Goat - and missed. Plex, witnessing Aviana's valiant attempt from the relative safety of the Lantern Goat's back, couldn't help but be impressed by Aviana's ability to miss a creature the size of a small mountain as he saw the small bottle plummet into the forest below - only to be followed by Aviana, who had no intentions of losing her precious Iron Flask.

Figuring it was a good time for him to leave as well, he teleported himself and the Lantern Goat down to the ground where Aviana was frantically searching for her Iron Flask. After a few minutes of searching - while fighting off the Mountain Goat's attempts to trample her - she eventually found her Iron Flask and noticed that the brass stopper was firmly closed. Before she had time to wonder what was now inside the flask, the Mountain Goat's hoof stomped down and Aviana barely managed to turn around and catch it. The weight of the colossal creature made her sink into the ground but she didn't budge. Getting stomped to death by a giant goat was not how she planned to die!

The Lantern Goat Plex was riding - or rather was trying to ride as he had no way of controlling it - was about to run past Aviana and the Goblin figured this was a good an opportunity to leave as they were gonna get. He just needed a moment to cast a spell - and for that his mount would have to be still for even a second. He shouted at Aviana and the conversation that followed went something like this:

Plex: "Hold the goat!"

Aviana: "I AM! CAN'T YOU SEE THAT?"

Lantern Goat: "Bleeee!"

Mountain Goat ( *very annoyed*): "**BLEEEEEEE**"

Plex: "Nooo, the other goat!"

Aviana ( *also very annoyed*): "LISTEN HERE YOU LITTLE SHIT..."

Lantern Goat: "Bleeee???"

And so Aviana grabbed the Lantern Goat's horn as it ran past, now holding up the Mountain Goat's weight with just one hand. Plex used this moment to open a teleportation gate in the ground beneath them and he, Aviana, and the Lanter Goat all fell through. A few hundred feet away, at the other end of the gate, Aviana got launched several hundred feet into the air as the force of the Mountain Goat's hoof pushed her through. Her fall back down was slowed by several tree branches so she was barely falling anymore when she landed on the ground. Plex, pleased with his efforts to save himself, Aviana and, most importantly, the Lantern Goat, realised that the Mountain Goat was still coming for them. And that he would very much like Fearghas to see it...

When Plex felt Aviana's hand tighten around his neck like a vice once more, he felt the weave around him snap as her action caused a wild magic surge. The world around Plex twisted and he felt like his stomach was pulled through his nose - the oh so familiar feeling of unwilling planar teleportation.

pages.name: Excerpts from Nethys' Book of Magic
pages.content:
Unholy Ritual of Blood

Casting time: 8 hours

Components: V, S M (three conscious and healthy humanoid creatures, the blood of which the spell consumes)

Slowly draw out the blood of your material components and infuse the grimoire with it's essence. It is recommended to restrain your material components before beginning the casting.

Acquiring a form of ear protection or something to muffle their screams with is also recommended as to not disrupt your concentration.

Be careful not to rush! To successfully complete the ritual you need to make sure to draw out their last remaining drop of blood right when the 8th hour strikes.

(Note: the shrivelled remains of your material components make for slightly more durable zombies)

pages.name: Torag's Prophecy
pages.content:
When madness grips the noble heart,
the flame of hope shall soon depart.

Into the east, where mountains mourn,
where past in mist and shadow lorn.

Beneath the earth, in death it rests,
in ruined halls, on shattered crests.

Dear child of stone, to claim the hold,
though must wield wisdom, cursed and old.

Take heed and ward thy golden soul,
lest thy dark might consume thee whole.

pages.name: 78. Kali Conversation
pages.content:
Kyrin's Questions

main questions would be about what happened to her that made her change stop. if she knows much about the shadowfel. I would talk to her baout my psionic blades and see if she knows anything else about that. if she has ever heard of the living shadows attached to people. Basically pick her brain. see if there is something we could look in to and maybe help her as well to get back to normal one day. see if she would be willing to talk about vandree. or if she knows anything about how to find them.

Kali's Answers

what happened to her that made her change stop

"I assume you're asking about my appearance? A wild magic surge happened, just as I was shapeshifting into the form of a spider and I've been stuck like this ever since. Not much more I can say about it. I think I just got unlucky. Or maybe I got lucky, seeing how much worse it could have gone. I'm sure my mother would have blamed Lolth for it. She always believed that anything bad happening to us was Lolth's doing. As some kind of punishment for her fleeing Ul'ath'tallar."

if she knows much about the shadowfel

"Awful place. Been there for a job once, only very briefly however. I was after the head of a Sil'lael noble who thought fleeing there was a good idea. Of course I followed him but by the time if found him, he was already clawing out his own eyes. Made it easy for me but I couldn't even be happy about that. Damn mist felt like it was draining my soul and sanity. After I cut off his head, I noped the fuck out of there as quickly as I could. Didn't want to push my luck and further."

I would talk to her baout my psionic blades and see if she knows anything else about that.

"They're certainly useful, too bad you said you can't teach me how to use them myself. Have I seen them before? No but I know an assassin, a Shadar'kai, whose targets would apparently just drop dead. No wounds, no poisons, nothing. He also never carried any weapons. You kinda remind me of him actually. If we're ever in Al-Qasir, I'll see if I can find him."

if she has ever heard of the living shadows attached to people

"While I was in the Shadowfell, I had to fight off some shadows that were moving around on their own like yours but at least those weren't attached to someone. Not much, but that's all I know, sorry."

see if there is something we could look in to and maybe help her as well to get back to normal one day.

"To be honest, I'm not sure if I wanted to. I've been like this for many years and it's become pretty normal to me. People were scared of me before too so not much changed for me. Other than not being able to shapeshift anymore but I think I'd avoid that even if I could. Bad memories, you know."

see if she would be willing to talk about vandree. or if she knows anything about how to find them.

"As I said, I'd rather not get involved with them. They're one of the mightiest houses in Ul'ath'tallar and in the past, back when the twin matrons still ruled together, I've worked both with and against them. The latter was a mistake I do not wish to repeat. If you're really set on finding Filrae, why don't you ask her sister?"

Rest of Convo

(sorry I couldn't be bothered to rewrite and reformat this properly)

Kyrin "I would talk to her baout my psionic blades and see if she knows anything else about that."

Kali "They're certainly useful, too bad you said you can't teach me how to use them myself. Have I seen them before? No but I know an assassin, a Shadar'kai, whose targets would apparently just drop dead. No wounds, no poisons, nothing. He also never carried any weapons. You kinda remind me of him actually. If we're ever in Al-Qasir, I'll see if I can find him."

Kyrin "I would like that very much. Thank you for the offer. I don't really know of anyone like me. I'm sure you can understand that too. I dont know if I could be affected by a magic surge in the same way you are and be stuck between. I suppose i might be able to be forced into just One form, but even that I'm not sure of.."

Kali "No problems, but please remind me should I forget. Regarding wild magic surges, I'd assume you could get stuck halfway between your child and adult forms." Kali shudders at the thought of being stuck as teenager forever. "Let's hope that won't happen."

Kyrin "if she has ever heard of the living shadows attached to people"

Kali "While I was in the Shadowfell, I had to fight off some shadows that were moving around on their own like yours but at least those weren't attached to someone. Not much, but that's all I know, sorry."

Kyrin "when we were studying in the tower library I found some information on shadows. They said that strong emotion or trauma from our plane can cause them to form in the shadowfell and its possible that the same could happen here from something happening there. its the best idea i have to go on so far but that one doesn't speak often. pointing to the shadow I am from Taldor Augusta, if i remember correctly and i may be wrong, i think they said you had haunted the city a bit as well. There is a place there that I have spent some time, its a place i enjoy really for the solitude and shadows. pulls out my notebook I show her the etchings from grey lamp ally as i tell her about the place. Does this mean anything to you? (if the words are sylvan i cant read them if they are deep i can however it might be something she knows way more about than me as she is well traveled)"

Kali "Hm I wonder what could possibly cause that strong of an emotion in the Shadowfell." Kali's eyes drop for a moment when she hears the word 'haunted'. "The city was my home for a few years, yes." "That lamp is very interesting. It reminds me a lot of those Quadiran lamps. You know, the ones you're supposed to rub while wishing for something. The writing is interesting too, what does it say?"

Kyrin "see if there is something we could look in to and maybe help her as well to get back to normal one day."

Kali "To be honest, I'm not sure if I wanted to. I've been like this for many years and it's become pretty normal to me. People were scared of me before too so not much changed for me. Other than not being able to shapeshift anymore but I think I'd avoid that even if I could. Bad memories, you know."

Kyrin "I can understand that. Sometimes its comforting being one familiar shape, even if its less mmmm… useful? i sit in my little web hammock chair swinging my feet like a little kid its really quite peaceful here. I can see why it would be appealing, no one to bother you uninvited I give her a big cheeky smile the thought of the fall and stop is a bit daunting but the view is great. Anyway, we can always keep it a thought though if i ever come across anything that could help I will keep you updated."

Kali "I appreciate it." Kali returns the smile for just a moment before following your gaze and looking down. "The fall itself is great, can't say much about the impact though, I've always prefered to avoid that. And yeah, I enjoy the solitude here. If someone were to bother me here uninvited, at least I know they'd have a very good reason for it." She falls silent for a moment, seemingly deep in thought before turning her head back towards you. "You're always welcome here though."

Kyrin "see if she would be willing to talk about vandree. or if she knows anything about how to find them."

Kali "As I said, I'd rather not get involved with them. They're one of the mightiest houses in Ul'ath'tallar and in the past, back when the twin matrons still ruled together, I've worked both with and against them. The latter was a mistake I do not wish to repeat. If you're really that set on finding Filrae, why don't you ask her sister?"

Kyrin "Filrae? I didnt know there was a sister. To be honest I don't know much about them at all aside from the little interaction i have had with them and their agents, and of course our little gnome friend here. Aside from what the matron did to me she deserves to be punished for what she has done to her and her friend. ( I would ask Nami to tell her about what has been being said to her recently just on the off shoot it softens her stance a little more. ) Do you know where this Filrae can be found or anything about her?"

Kali "Oh, you didn't? I've told the others about the Vandree twins already. After their mother died, the two ruled the house together and it was under their leadership that House Vandree became one of the great houses in Ul'ath'tallar. Then Filrae vanished and her sister Minae has been searching for her ever since. At least that's the official story." When Naami recounts her recent experiences with the matron, Kali listens intently. "I'm not surprised. She has no reason to just silence you so she can take as much time as she wants to make you suffer." "But you're right, she has to be stopped." She closes her eyes for a moment and lets out a long sigh before opening them again. "What I told you earlier - about me having worked with the twins in the past that being the reason I don't want to get involved - that was a lie. I was hoping you wouldn't prod further." Kali pauses for a moment and gathers herself. "I was just a newborn when Filrae vanished so I only know what little my mother told me. We fled the city shortly Filrae's disappearance and my mother was killed by an assassin of the house many years later. Silenced. I guess she knew something she shouldn't have known. Always said that she was just protecting me by not speaking about it - and I was hoping I could do the same for you. I don't know much, but I know someone who might be able to tell us more. Velkyn Arkenaii - a friend of my mother who fled the city with us and helped us escape. Last I've seen him was shortly after my mother's death about 50 years ago. After her funeral he said goodbye and told me not to contact him again. When I asked him where he'd go he just said 'to lands once noble'. Good heart but man was he a strange fellow."

Kyrin "Is there anything you want to know from me or anything I could maybe help you with? You have been so kind in showing us your space and speaking with us. (also depending on if we are faffing around here still while she goes after fergus's family I would offer to help. If we are away doing something then not. not sure if she would politely decline because she works better alone but the offer is out there.)"

Kali "I'll think about it and get back to you if I may? And thanks for the offer to help me with my job but you'd just get in the way. No offense, I prefer working alone."

Activate the artifact named the Beacon of Doom on the 3rd layer of Heaven until Quattrus 1st, 1498. The task is considered as completed if no being other than than the ones present at the time of signing this contract (Naami, Fearghas, Aviana, Shalkoc, Plex, Emilio, Kyrin, Zariel, 4 Pit Fiends) learn about this contract, the artifact, or its purpose, before the time of its activation.

Consequences of Failure

Zariel, Archduchess of Avernus becomes the legal and rightful owner of the signee's soul if the signee fails to complete the contract.

Upon Signing

Should the signee sign this contract, the transgression of the signee's ally named Emilio specifically, as well as open warrants for the other present allies of the signee (Naami, Fearghas, Aviana, Shalkoc, Plex, Emilio) as well as those of the signee are voided immediately.
