Kyrin is happily munching away on more treats, looking like a child with chocolate smudged on her nose.

Aviana wants to open a cookie business because she thinks Kyrin is adorable. I remind her that we are now in legal trouble with the Duergar, and we are summoned to Hell within the week, not to mention we are planning an ambush on Matron Vandree. We also need to retrieve the Eye of Dahak from the Drow to help the king of Lessia before we can go back to fulfilling our contracts with Hell. Kyrin says she knows where the Drow are. Or… were. She's not sure how long she was in the egg. She describes the place where the Drow where, a place I recognise. We both grimace as we speak about Matron Vandree.

Aviana grumbles very much about how Fearghas' manor looks, and that it needs a complete makeover. We argue there are more pressing matters, i.e. resting because we are all beaten up. Fearghas gives me a triggered spellgem of Private Sanctum. To release the spell, I need to say Execute in Dwarven. Kyrin pulls out an ink-black piece of cloth and slaps it down on the floor, then climbs down into it. It's a Portable Hole! She suggests using it to sneak out of the city, which will cause issues with bags of holding, but this is something we are aware of (thankfully).

Kyrin takes the appearance of Aviana, at her urging. Aviana is star-struck and has her try on a silk robe, and a dress. Fearghas sighs and disappears into the cellar with the intention to drink himself silly. The servants bring a comfortable little pad for Emilio and put it in a corner, as if he was a grumpy little cat; surprisingly he is sitting at the table and having cookies with the rest of us. Emolio

I use my last spell slot, and channel to heighten it from level 5 to level 8, and cast Remove Curse on Plex. He can speak again without music playing in the background, and he is again of reasonable size.

We take a long rest. I HAVE HP AGAIN.

(Now the new rest rules come into effect; the next long rest we can take is on Saturday.)

We are having breakfast the next day and discussing our plans when Matron Vandree speaks into my mind:

Naami. My little traitor.

Did you think your disloyalty would go unnoticed?

A little bird, fluttering through King Dimzad’s halls, sang me such a lovely song.

It spoke of a stolen sceptre, a clever little plan... and you. The bait. Squirming so prettily in the jaws of a trap meant for me.

But fret not, little one. That shall not be your fate.

No - yours will be a special one.

For you will soon learn what fate awaits those foolish enough to betray me - and anyone they've ever held dear.

Shaking, I repeat these words to the party. She will hurt Madr. Emilio and Kyrin comfort me, and Fearghas promises we will take care of it. Aviana suggests making Matron Vandree disappears. We say that is the idea, and nothing short of it will free Kyrin and me from her influence.

Shalkoc cooks up a feast for us, in which he eagerly takes part. Plex and Aviana give 1 pyrope and 2 jades to Fearghas. Kyrin gives me a potion of greater healing. Fearghas cooks up some potions, but the alchemy goes awry.

We have to exile Shalkoc to the other end of the manor to drink tea, ale, and potions, as all liquids still turn to lukewarm water when he is within 60 feet.

Plex turns himself and Aviana tiny so they can sneak better. Emilio scoops up Aviana and hides her in his breast pocket. I lift Plex, scold him, and gently place him in my bag with instructions to not disturb my herbs! Fearghas casts Rary's Telepathic Bond, which I am again excluded from, my mind is still blank... We leave the mansion. Fearghas is tracking mud everywhere for a week because of a surge. I offer to cast Remove Curse on him, but he advises me not to spend this many resources.

We head to the market as I need to replenish my healer's supplies. Fearghas buys me 2 healer's kits, and I sneakily hand him the money when we are out of sight. Fearghas then buys alchemical supplies. Aviana bullies him into buying her a new mug, which grants her inspiration as it is useless.

We head to the king's hall to speak to Dimzad. Kyrin, who transformed into a Duergar, so she stays outside to "watch over the slaves", that is the rest of us, while Fearghas goes in to speak with the king. Kyrin grumbles at this, she wanted to investigate the hall for something hidden, or someone disguised. Fearghas solves her concern by using a See Invisibility gem.

One of the seats to the king's right is empty; last time, a priest was sitting there. The king greets him by saying "Out of your portal, are you?". Fearghas says the Matron is aware of the ambush, and that she has a spy in Dimzad's court. He furrows his brows at this, says he suspected something as some scrying sensors were recently found, one of those at the entrance of Fearghas' portal. (I assume he means the door to the manor.) The sensors were destroyed (presumably this is why an armour was at the door?), but Dimzad says the plans have changed, and asks Fearghas what he is planning to do.

Fearghas says he assumes the Matron will come get me, and also he plans to investigate a camping location of the Drows'. Dimzad asks why he should let the Halfling (me) go. Fearghas says that I am in his employ and care. Dimzad asks why he should let either of us go, as us surface-dwellers don't know how to use Null-Steel…

Fearghas warns us telepathically, and the hall's doors begin to close! Fearghas teleports back to us with a Dimension Door cast with a Subtle Mind Crystal to escape being taken prisoner. The plan is now to run. The moment we start running, statues (demon engines) advance towards us, carrying black nets of Null-Steel.

Aviana hops out of Emilio's pocket and chugs a Potion of Giant Size. Plex drops concentration on the spell that made him tiny, and casts Adjust Density on Aviana to halve her density and increase her jump distance. She uses Legendary Vigor to further increase it. Fearghas casts Feather Fall on us so we don't straight up die.

Aviana scoops us all up and jumps 700 meters up and forward, to not bonk her head on the ceiling (close call). Kyrin and me point to the Drows' camping site as we are gliding through the air; the campsite is empty, and we float far past it. We end up about 3km from the city gates. Aviana approaches the ground and we wriggle out of her grasp to avoid being caught in the explosion from the Thunderfeet Footwraps. All of us jump and float down before she lands, but Emilio is too fancy for this and uses his Robe of Stars to disappear from this reality and reappear a short moment later.

Aviana gently floats down, triggering an explosion, but she takes the superhero landing pose. It looks very different when she isn't slamming down into the ground, but she is having a great time. Plex missed the landing a bit, and emerges from underneath a large mushroom cap somehow. Aviana stomps over to us, Fearghas asks if everyone is alive, and Emilio wants to fly again. Adrenalin junkie…

We agree to return to the campsite to look for clues. It's uncomfortably close to Ukgluz, but needs must. Emilio gives a heartfelt compliment to Fearghas on his excellent use of Dimension Door; he feels invigorated. Aviana carries Emilio up on her shoulder to repay the favour of him carrying her in his pocket earlier. He is loving the height.

We get to the campside, and from Ukgluz we see several demon engines coming in our general direction. We decide to hide nearby and wait for the searching to die down. Aviana puts us all in a potato sack and climbs up to a ledge where we hole up in a cavern that is big enough even for her in giant mode. As we arrive in the cavern, a lage lizard slithers away, deciding it isn't messing with something the size of Aviana. Kyrin scouts further into the cavern, finding only large lizard eggs. Shalkoc gets a hungry look in his eyes and sneaks off towards the eggs until we grab him by the scruff of the neck.

We sit down to keep watch; around 30 demon engines are roaming the area, and after around 3 hours they start to head back towards Ukgluz. After 6 hours, they are all gone. In the meantime, Fearghas looks for herbs and finds some Shimmerleaf, which he coaxes to grow with magic from a gem. I help him out with herbs as he starts brewing. Aviana inspires him to do his best by flexing. He brews up 1 Potion of Supreme Healing. Kyrin takes out a notepad and starts sketching the area, adding some notes. Kyrin conjures up a Mage Hand to pick a blue flower she spotted. She picks two, gives me one which I put in my hair, and presses the other into a book, which gives her inspiration!

Plex summons a Mage Hand to… fight Kyrin's Mage Hand? He only gets a moderate surge that restrains him for a day. The Mage Hand backfired and is now holding him very tight. Aviana wants to chain him up to carry him like a bag. Or tie him up with a hempen rope. Or a jungle vine, whatever he prefers. He can't struggle anyway, and is fine being carried around, but he would much prefer if Fearghas carried him around on Tenser's Floating Disk for a day. Fearghas grumbles, but Plex argues he owes him a favour. Fearghas casts Tenser's Floating Disk and Aviana places Plex on it. She spins the disk.

We climb down with Aviana's help and approach the camp; Aviana stays on the ledge as she is too noticeable, and could easily jump to us in an emergency. There isn't much here, and footprints make it clear that this place has been searched by the Duergar. Fearghas casts Detect Magic. I wave my wand to do the same. We see remains of divination magic, and high-level conjuration magic… that's traces of a Plane Shift spell!

"Fearghas, where did you park Plex?" Aerelia.

Plex was parked next to the remains of the campfire; staring into the ashes, he spots bones… weird bones he's never seen before, they're a little transparent with an iridescent shimmer. He picks them up with his Mage Hand. The bones used to belong to a magical creature, it still holds faint conjuration magic. Plex licks the bones, it tastes surprisingly fishy, a lot like his Fishy Magic.

Wait… I've eaten this fish before, on my travels with the Drow. At a time when we were travelling through deeper levels and food was scarce, the Matron left saying she would get food from the castle, Plane Shifted away, and returned with a barrel full of these fish. When I asked which waters she got these from, she chuckled and said "there is no water there, they just float".

I describe the fish I remember, and Fearghas conjures up an illusion, both of us working out an accurate image of the creature. None of us knows what this is. Shalkoc tries to eat the illusion. I mention the Drow having a place in the Shadowfell where they would stay, which makes Plex do a big frown. Kyrin gives the camp a last good look and spots an elusive little emblem of two crossed daggers. It's made of a mate metal that doesn't reflect light; I immediately recognise the crest of House Vandree. Assassins who worked for House Vandree wore this in the centre of their chest. Thin leather straps lie next to it, one of them stained with blood. I suggest a scrying spell.

We return to where Aviana was waiting, but on the way, Fearghas and me are spotted by the lookouts on the walls of Ukgluz… the gates open and 12 demon engines charge towards us! Aviana bids goodbye to the lizard mum who she was having a deep conversation with, and jumps down to help us.

Fearghas shouts "Hop on!" and polymorphs into a giant dinosaur bird! (Quetzalcoatlus) We get on Quetzalcoatlhus MacAllistar, Aviana wonders if her wings would look like this if she didn't have any feathers, what a sad thought. Emilio is happily sitting on the dinosaur, aura farming. We get away, land, and Fearghas drops Polymorph to cast… Plane Shift?! Where are we going?

We appear in a tower in a demiplane. Fearghas says it belonged to another wizard, who seems to have passed on and, in scientific terms, "he called dibs". We climb the stairs to a room which floor tiles are carved with letters and numbers, and the edges of the room are littered with bones. Fearghas warns us to not go into that room alone. We climb up to the library, a room that makes Fearghas very happy. He starts researching the fish. Another room in the library holds an empty altar and glowing runes that look similar to the ones on the Void Explorer's Spellbook that Fearghas pulled out in the Sibriex lair, which caused Emilio to lose control… Fearghas says the room is no longer trapped, and Kyrin walks in there unharmed. Fearghas, Plex, and me research the golden fish. Plex has to cast Comprehend Languages to read any of the books because he does not know how to read.

Aviana and Emilio were left behind on the floor we arrived in. Emilio is anxious, doesn't feel safe. Aviana encourages him to follow the rest of us, but she is too big to fit through the staircase, so he goes alone. Into the room with the letters. The one we should never be alone in. He climbs up the stairs, and ends up… at the bottom of the stairs, unable to leave the room. Fearghas gets a Skype notification in his head that someone intruded into the tower. He goes to get Emilio, getting him unstuck. Emilio joins us in the library… and immediately sees the purplish runes on the floor of the other room. His gauntlets react even at this distance. He asks Fearghas why he has void runes in the tower, he replies they came with the tower when he took over.

Emilio is not feeling good because of the runes, I offer help but he brushes me off roughly. Fearghas hands me the "Note to Future Self" they previously found in the tower. I read it with great fascination, and eventually Fearghas finds information on the fish! It's a space guppy, native to the Astral Plane. Led by Fearghas, we climb up to the Greenhouse. I am fascinated by everything, and lag behind a bit. When I join the rest of the party on the floor above, it's very overgrown and there is a giant dead plant. Fearghas mentions having to fight it.

Another floor up is a room-wide device that can enhance magic items. It's crazy messy in there, so I tease Fearghas about it. Above is the Observatory, a room where the floor looks like a star chart and most of the space is taken up by a massive telescope. Fearghas instructs me on how to use it, and I hop on the chair and look for Ildilas. It doesn't look so different from when I left it… except it waves like a mirage, only Ildilas, like something is distorting the image. The desert in the centre of the island… maybe has expanded? It's hard to tell, the image is so distorted, and I've only seen maps a few times. The coastline is the same, but the sea just off the island seems shallower, lighter in colour, like the sea floor is raised, in a pattern reminiscent of tree roots jutting from a stump. It faintly reminds me of something I read once, or heard from an elderly relative. Ley lines? I can't recall…

We try to search the Astral Plane for a castle but it's a needle in a haystack situation. That being said… we do have time. Fearghas summons an Unseen Servant to clean up the tower so he doesn't have to do it himself. Wizards… I ask Fearghas if we are safe in the tower, if the Matron can come get me here. He's pretty sure she could not, or at least it would be as tough as it's going to get for her!

We suggest spending some time in the tower to research:

  • Matron Vandree, on the off chance we find anything

  • The Astral Plane and a castle with space guppies

  • Dragon aspects, their eyes, effects on mortal races, dragon sickness

  • Ley lines

  • Duergar religion and scepters

I also said I wanted to examine everyone, with their permission, because we sustained severe wounds in the recent fights, and I want to make sure we're all okay before we get into another battle.

pages.name: 77.1 A blue dress
pages.content:
The nightmare was different this time. As Naami slipped into a fitful sleep in one of the tower's cosy guest rooms, she expected to find herself in the cavern again, defenceless before her fear. She stood in darkness but it was the natural gloom of a deep cave instead of the painful magic-wrought darkness. It was similar to one of the caverns she had traversed with Matron Vandree's party; a high roof made a dome above her head, pierced with stalactites like giant teeth ready to bite down. A dark moss carpeted the rock and a wild array of mushrooms grew close to the walls, fed by dripping water. A purple fungus grew halfway to the roof, its stalks tough as wood. To one of these trunks, the dark shape of a male Drow was nailed by his wrists. His body hung limp as he struggled to breathe, growing weaker by the second.

"Madr!" Naami cried and reached out to her friend.

His eyes glittered with hate. Blood trickled from his mouth.

"Traitor," he spat. "Did we not take care of you? Protect you? You had to run to your kin of cowering surface-dwellers!"

"I was all but a slave," she cried. "I said I would free you. I can save you, too!"

She tried to get close to him but chains wrapped around her neck, and around her bare wrists. The sooty links were driven into the ground, anchored as solidly as if they had grown out of the rock. She struggled, but the cold metal only bit into her skin. Above her Madr's body convulsed, blood flowing out of his mouth now. His eyes closed as his face contorted with pain. Against her better judgement, Naami tried to raise her hands, tried to form the pattern in the Weave that would heal him. She could see the magic, although dimly. The chains dragged her down, draining her strength. If she could manage just one spell, she could save him. Screaming in frustration, fighting her shackles, she called the magic with all her might. It had always been here, an unseen force that would crash into her mind if she so much as thought of it. It would not deny her now! The cold radiated up from her wrists to her shoulders; her fingers went numb. The chain strangled her, now she too was fighting for air but Naami was no stranger to battles anymore. She tasted blood but her spell was taking shape, just another thread of magic and she could release it, seek out Madr's wounds and close them. She could save him. She could save everyone.

The Drow cried out as white wings burst from his back, wide and brilliant in the gloom. His face was no longer his, the sharpness of his features smoothed into a celestial's perfect beauty. Eyes of pure light gazed down on her, filled with worry and pain.

"I can help you, little candle," the winged man said in a caressing tone. "I can teach you to become a better healer."

"No!" Naami shrieked.

Her tenuous control over magic slipped and she released her spell. Knowing what would happen did not make it any easier. The celestial had worn Madr's face just a minute ago, but his body flashed into a tortured ruin, a mockery of what an angel had been. The spell closed mortal wounds, only for the skin to burst a moment later, spilling blood, torn entrails, and maggots. Held by her chains, Naami could only scream and writhe as her hands were splashed with blood, as squirming shapes climbed up her legs. Slicing through her screams a voice reached her, cold as a poison-coated blade.

"Traitor," Matron Vandree said, her silhouette looming in the shadows. "You have chosen your fate, and the spider goddess has blessed me with the duty to deliver you onto it."

"I healed your people!" Naami cried. "I offered my blood and my life force to close your wounds!"

"Only to plot to kill us all," she laughed, a joyless sound more akin to that of a blade being drawn. "How pointless. Is it the same with your surface-dweller friends? Do you also heal them, only for them to run back into the fight and get injured again? Why do you try? Why do you pay the cost in blood, time and again, for nothing to change?"

"Because that's who I am." Naami could not blame the chain around her neck for the pain in her throat, the stabbing heat of a lump announcing tears.

"Useless," the Matron sneered. "All you do is undone. Give up. After betraying me, there is nothing left for you anyway."

"You're wrong!"

She smiled; it was a threat. "Why don't you scream how wrong I am? But will anyone hear you?"

Naami's resolve flared; on the edge of delivering a biting response she saw the Matron lift her arm, fingers hooking around threads of magic. She uttered words of such power, Naami's bones hummed with it. Then all went black, vision and hearing swallowed by humid warmth and the overpowering stench of decay. Before she even touched the inner shell of a slimy egg, before her flesh began to spasm and change, she knew where she was; back in the Sibriex' lair, being warped into a monster, and she would not have Kyrin's luck. She screamed then, screamed until her throat was raw and her head spun, screamed until the darkness seized her and she slumped inside the black egg, her skin bulging in agony. She howled, and there was nobody to hear her.

Naami screamed herself awake and twisted out of the sweat-soaked sheets, brutally landing on the rug next to her bed. She lay on her back, eyes darting as she tried to catch her breath. The reek of blood and decay lingered in her nose; her fingertips still felt slimy. She grabbed at her throat, and could not stifle a relieved sob when she found no chain there. Her spellwards were snug on her wrists, a familiar coolness on her clammy skin. She drank in the quiet of the tower. She was safe here, was she not?

A bang at her door made her jump near out of her skin. She lay in the dimness, panting as quietly as she could, unable to move for her life. She listened with all her being but after a short moment, a familiar voice spoke.

"Naami? You're awake?"

It was Aviana's voice. Naami tried to stand twice but her legs would not let her. She had to settle for slumping on the rug, draped in her blanket.

"Yes. Um… Sorry if I woke you?"

"It's alright. Are you okay? I heard a noise."

Naami gathered her courage for a confident reply. She would give a little giggle and dismiss it as a dream and the harpy would laugh, maybe tease her, and be on her way. It would be as if none of this had happened. All she had to do was wave a hand and smile. She would climb back into bed, and go back to sleep.

"I had a nightmare," Naami said in a tiny voice, barely swallowing a sob.

A pause, then: "Can I come in?"

Naami gave a squeak in assent. The door swung open, admitting the harpy. Aviana sat on the rug next to her, her dark wings making the small room feel crowded. Naami reached out to brush the feathers, her hands shaking. In the darkness she could not see where the dark grey feathers turned to deep blue, but it was enough to know they were not white. Her stomach turned at the memory of brilliant white wings. How much longer would she suffer those nightmares? She had overcome her fear! She had defeated the monster in the Sibriex' lair!

With a lot of care, Aviana put one hand on Naami's head, her sharp talons curling away. The Halfling gave a surprised start, but at the first clumsy head pat the tension began to drain from her shoulders. Aviana's careful touch made her skin tingle; the friendly gesture, if awkward, was immensely calming. She realised her jaw ached from grinding her teeth, and made herself stop.

"The bravest of us have nightmares," Aviana said wisely. "Sometimes even when we are awake. Often, they're called Plex."

The Halfling giggled in spite of herself. Oh, she was still shaky, still haunted by the horrifying visions. But Aviana's words… they were real. Her friend was real, and they would protect each other.

"And sometimes, even Plex disappears," the harpy went on. "So nothing is so scary it lasts forever! Until Plex comes back, I suppose… Better to focus on the good things. I've only ever seen you in the green dress, do you have a blue one? Deep blue, like my feathers, that would really compliment your eyes, and it would go well with the bracelets you always wear."

"I do have another travelling dress," Naami said, her voice becoming steadier. "It's more of a light blue, though."

"Well that will hardly do," Aviana sniffed, dead serious. "We do need to go shopping some time. I also need another mug."

"Didn't Fearghas just buy you a mug?"

"Yes," she admitted, patiently drawing out the word, "but he bought it from the Duergar. Who knows how it was made. Probably by slaves. How unethical! It will make my drinks taste of low morality. And then my skin will get all dull. You need to pay attention to these things."

Tears rose to Naami's eyes faster than she could stifle them. She was blubbering before she had a chance to calm herself. Hearing Aviana's usual talk, as if nightmares had no power on her, on the world… the sense of relief was just too powerful for her shredded nerves. She wiped her eyes, only bringing out more tears. She grieved for the celestials, she feared for Madr and for her friends, but above all she relished Aviana's lively presence, she delighted in being alive and well herself. Angels or demons would not break her. She had powerful allies she could rely on, and they were becoming dear friends too. Neither the Drow nor the Duergar would stop her. She would find out what was happening in Ildilas, and she would go home and see her parents. She could introduce them to her friends!

"There, Naamilia. It's okay," Aviana said, her usually flamboyant voice dropped to a soothing whisper.

She draped one wing over Naami's shoulders. Silky feathers brushed the Halfling's skin, a cool caress and an occasional tickle. How had Aviana come up with this nickname? It didn't matter. Naami reached out for a hug, her hands growing steadier. Aviana hugged her back with great care, as if she was made of brittle glass. To the harpy's strength, she probably was even more fragile than glass. Beneath skin unmarred by scars, thanks to potions and magic, Aviana's muscles were steel. Even as she sat with her legs casually crossed, comforting a friend, she had the aura of a force of nature. She was a rock, steadfast and immovable, unlike the boulders she liked to move. There was no place safer than Aviana's arms in this moment.

"Thank you," the healer said.

"For what?"

"Everything. Not abandoning me to the Drow. For keeping me away from Dimzad and his chains. Even though I've only put you all in greater danger now."

"Ah, nonsense. There is always danger for people like us. Where is the fun, without a good arm wrestling session?"

"Speak for yourself," Naami giggled. "You have so much muscle."

"It makes my charm," Aviana said. "And you have… negative muscle, really. You are eating meat? And plenty of soup?"

"Yes mum," Naami teased. "I'm just naturally small."

"Hmmm. Doesn't hurt to make sure. I'll ask Shalkoc to cook a healthy breakfast for you. Dawn shouldn't be too far, now."

In the windowless room, it was impossible to be sure. Naami stood gingerly but her legs were steady enough for a dance now. She could not resist a little hop and a skip out of the room, to prove she could. She was not afraid anymore. In the tower's main hall, a pale light touched the high windows, making the floor tiles gleam. Motes of dust glittered in the air, reminding Naami to tease Fearghas about cleaning up the place. Soon her friends would wake up, and they would all gather for breakfast. The nightmare would really be gone then, dispelled by daylight and the party's noise, by hot tea and sweet treats. It would come back; Naami was certain of it. Confronting her fear was not the same as healing from it. When the nightmare returned she would be ready to face it again, as many times as it took. Aviana took her leave to be about her morning stretches; left to herself, Naami gave her face a thorough wash, and changed into her blue dress.

pages.name: 78 - Further threats and goblin traps
pages.content:
Wednesday 29th of Nonus, 1497

01:23

Ley lines are rivers of mana left over by the mixing of positive and negative energy. The high elves of Aethel'eren (an island far east of Quadira) use ley lines in their magic.

A temple to Nethys, goddess of magic, buried under the Redwind Sands, could contain information about lichdom.

Shadows are reflections of strong emotions or events in the Material Plane that leave echoes in the Shadowfell. This can also happen the other way around, though it is a lot rarer.

Fearghas reads us the Duergar Creation Myth, as told by the Dwarves. In the tower, we find another version, as told by the Duergar. It is quite different… The Duergar claim they disobeyed their god Torag out of curiosity and yearning for understanding, and were burnt by Azgal, the Ebon Fire. The Duergar look down on the other Dwarves for their blind obedience to Torag. In Ukgluz, there was a temple to Azgal, and the stolen scepter was the Scepter of Azgal.

Fearghas, Plex, Kyrin, and myself have been doing research in the library. Aviana has been playing chess with Emilio and bugging Fearghas for a gravity-enhanced gym room. Aviana won every chess game by virtue of neither her, nor Emilio knowing the rules. They gambled, and somehow Emilio won 800 gold?! I learn that last time Plex' curse tried to teleport him away from the tower, he got stuck in a teleportation loop between the curse pulling him away, and the tower pulling him back, for hours. Which made him very nauseous.

After reading Draconic Aspects and their Kin, we theorise that the eye of Dahak held by the king of Lessia contains half the dragon's soul. We suspect it's the left eye, that of evil. How frightening… where would the right eye have gone? Does Vrazzak the Lich have it? We attempt to figure out whether Plex is left-handed or right-handed to judge if he is evil. Aviana chucks a ball at him to see which hand he catches it with. He catches it with telekinesis. All our plans are in tatters.

We wonder if Dahak's right eye might cure the king of Lessia.

Vrazzak supposedly is friends with Dam'ghur (the undead mage whom we beat up after Shalkoc picked up his little finger that he is now waving around as a wand). Their friendship consists of trying to kill each other. If we want to find out more (read: when we have time to find out more), we could start in the Redwind Sands!

Kyrin's shadow wiggles of its own volition. She does not know why. We talk about how both the Shadowfell and the Feywild are very susceptible to emotion and intent. Plex says the Shadowfell is… taking over the Feywild? That's terrifying! Shalkoc says we should go to Hell to meet Zariel, as she wants to meet "the angel slayer" (that's me). Emilio suggests he can claim to be the angel slayer, to protect me. Shalkoc says I can just pretend I am a regular angel slayer. What in the world. Kyrin gives me a cookie.

We shuffle to bed at 2am.

Plex is dragged to bed while still restrained on his floating disc.

WE SLIP ON THE STAIRS BECAUSE PLEX TRAPPED THEM WITH SOAP.

Ouchie.

Fearghas wants to kill Plex. He cleans up the stairs with Prestidigitation. I help Plex back to his disc, as he was knocked off by most of us tumbling down the stairs. We end up in the kitchen for a 2am snack before going to bed. Totally did not go to the wrong floor of the tower, we would never. I call dibs on the tiny room with the plants. Fearghas finds a hidden door behind the wall of one of the toilets. the diarrhea room Shalkoc tests every bed to find the most comfortable one. Fearghas finds a Dispelling Stone, and deposits Plex into a hammock. Fearghas wanders to a room adjacent to the plant room I picked, and he drops into a spike pit?! I rush to help him, and he only mutters "ow". I throw him a rope and he climbs out, muttering.

The room seems full of stolen stuff, and it contains a wand that makes Fearghas feel so tired… it's a Wand of Catnap! Actually quite a powerful item. Plex rolls around his hammock with great satisfaction, until he falls out. Fearghas pauses his bedtime reading to say "I'm not getting him". Plex tries to get back to the hammock. We have pleasant quiet for the rest of the night.

Wednesday 29th of Nonus, 1497

10:22

Short rest

On our way to get breakfast, we descend to the ouija room letter room. Plex is there, and he made a lineart of his face with the bones littering the room. What. We need to:

  • figure out where the Drow are

  • deal with Shalkoc's and Fearghas' contracts

  • figure out what is happening with the Shadowfell

  • track down the Lich

I ask whether we want this done before or after lunch. We agree that dealing with Matron Vandree is the most urgent, as she will come for Kyrin and me as soon as she can. Plex can move freely again, and Aviana wants her chain back. Plex has the zoomies; he is stress-testing the pathfinding algorhythm, running laps around the tower. That's a lot of magic words! Fearghas shuffles back to the library for more research on the Astral Sea and the castle mentioned by Lady Vandree. No luck, so we discuss how to find the Matron. Kyrin pulls out the House Vandree crest she found at the campsite; it has blood on it, so it would be useful in divination magic to locate its owner.

The crest is a cloak pin in the shape of crossed daggers. It is not magical. We have no idea how to make use of it.

We consider going to Heaven, and waiting and seeing whether Matron Vandree comes to get me. Plex suggests going to the Feywild, to Mennon. I ask who Mennon is; Plex casually responds Mennon is an archfey. I squeak at this. Aerelia gets carrot up his nose again. Must be a surge, a major one.

I get a Sending from Matron Vandree and repeat it to the party:

Little traitor, remember your friend Madr? He had some words for you. "Did we not take care of you? Protect you? You had to run to your kin of cowering surface-dwellers!" I might have misheard some parts, his words were difficult to make out between his screams. I'll let you know if he has more to say.

I panic and tell the party that the Matron is torturing my friend, and I will surrender myself to her so I can help Madr. They suggest I send a message to Madr first to try and ascertain the Drows' whereabouts, and if this fails, I will surrender myself. I use one of my scrolls of Sending and message Madr:

Madr, this is Naami. Where are you? Are you okay? I will come free you, whether you want it or not.

He responds:

Naami? Are you ok? The Lady told of your treachery so I'm surprised you're still alive! Stay out of this! Don't come for me!

Fearghas and me discuss whether Matron Vandree could have intercepted my Sending and tampered with it somehow. He doesn't know of any way, and enquires about the nature of Lady Vandree's magic. Shalkoc suggests I message Lady Vandree and claim I've captured a dragon. Somehow the discussion ends up in whether to tie up Shalkoc, which makes Fearghas very frustrated. We discuss where to go and draw the Matron to (or more likely, her minions), and settle on someplace near Lessia.

Shalkoc whips up some food for us; spicy poultry for Fearghas, spicy chocolate biscuits for me (delicious!), a stack full of meat burger for Kyrin (Fearghas asks where he got the meat from), a herby donut for Emilio (he is very happy), then after Aviana grumbles about Emilio getting a donut, Shalkoc whips up another donut for her. It's covered in dark sauce… it's chocolate sauce, right? Lastly, Shalkoc grills up a fish for himself. Then he realises he forgot to make a snack for Plex, and cooks a green salad with some weird stuff on it. Supposedly it tastes like meat, but it isn't meat? How does he do that…

Fearghas teleports us to Promise around noon. For Emilio and Kyrin, it's the first time they see the floating island! Fearghas gives them a warm welcome to the island. Kyrin asks how it stays up, and Fearghas explains that the wind crystals are degrading and need research and repairs. Aviana says they are enslaving air elementals. What??

I use another scroll of Sending to contact Matron Vandree:

Matron, please do not hurt Madr. I will surrender myself. I am on the floating island above Lessia.

(By the way I get a surge and I am unable to read for a week. Very tempted to burn a spell slot to remove that.)

She responds immediately:

Oh such innocence. During all of your time with us, you still haven't understood, have you? I don't care about where you are and I don't need to. To punish you for your disgression, all I need to know is where those you care about are.

Kyrin and Fearghas guess that Matron Vandree is making me suffer for fun, and eventually she will come to see it with her own eyes. Therefore our best bet is to wait for her cruelty to get the better of her. Oh, joy.

Plex placed traps around the doors in the cabin while nobody was looking. Oh, further joy.

Shalkoc's cat-sized dragon Ivernia perches on his shoulder, and Aviana's frost wolf Kaar is hanging around the chicken coop. Aviana asks for food for the dog. That wolf is very hungry, and so is the dragon, and we will need to resupply food soon. Kyrin feeds the dragon some dried meat; somehow she doesn't like it, and spit on Kyrin's face. She's devoured similar food before…

Kyrin feeds Kaar, and he gives her a thorough lick, drenching her in drool. How friendly!

We go upstairs so Kyrin and Emilio can pick a room. Plex doesn't remember which doors he has trapped, so he uses a magical key to make more doors. Shalkoc triggers one of the goblin's traps, and he jumps out of the way. Plex says to tell him before opening doors. Fearghas does not tell Plex, opens the door to his room, and triggers a trap. A stone hurtles towards him, whacking him in the head. The stone shouts "Ow!" and a light powder explodes in the air, making Fearghas sneeze violently. He also explodes at Plex, telling him to remember where he puts his traps!

Emilio gives up on this whole bullshit and snuggles up in a bed.

"Are you gonna use Plex as a hammer?" - Aerelia

Fearghas uses a spellgem of Sending to ask Kali to come to the cabin.

I ask if I can examine everyone and check for lingering injuries, to make sure we are all in fighting shape. I knock on Emilio's door and he is… not… here? He's woven a cocoon of purple light around him and is just floating in there, eyes glowing. Since when can he do that? I guess I'll ask again later…

Plex plants magic mushrooms from the Feywild, what could go wrong? I check everyone for injuries but they are all doing fine, it's a relief. Aviana is thankful for my care and I get inspiration!

Kali arrives and Fearghas casts Comprehend Languages so he can understand her Druidic language. She looks at us with all her 6 red eyes, Kyrin is taken aback. Fearghas asks Kali to go to Lessia and rescue his parents. She is a little doubtful on how to carry out the task. Fearghas asks Kali how much she was paid to kill Aviana. To… KILL… Aviana? So Kali is an assassin, and also a bachelorette apparently.

Kyrin shapeshifts into her child form, which intrigues Kali (don't blame her). Kali says she was paid 8000 gold to assassinate Aviana, and she only took the contract as a side job. Aviana is offended by the low price on her head, and argues she should be worth at least 10 000 gold. Fearghas grumbles, and offers Kali 5000 gold to rescue his parents. She asks for double. Fearghas barters and rolls a natural 20! Kali says she just wanted to test him, and agrees to the 5000 gold.

Kali says we can contact her by speaking to any of the spiders here. Spiders understand common? the Drow says they don't understand in the way we can have a conversation, but they will go to her if anything is up. I ask Kali if she would plant the Springseeds for me, and care for them. I show her one of the seeds, she is very intrigued. She says the seeds must have come from a beautiful place. My mind flashes back to the celestial warped into a fiend, and the fight for our lives in the Sibriex lair; I get choked up, unable to get a word out. Kali assumes the place I got the seeds was so beautiful I am at a loss for words. I let her believe that.

Kali enquires about Kyrin's shapeshifting ability. Kyrin explains it's part of who she is, not something learnt. Kali seems sad about this, and says a lot of people would pay good money to hire her. Kyrin says yes, she was working for the Drow, it did not go well. Kali is very confused at the talk of the egg and the Sibriex lair. I kindly ask that we don't speak of this further. Sarenrae knows, I have plenty of nightmares as it is.

Kyrin starts chatting with Kali telepathically using Psychic Whispers. Kali also says she can teach us certain spells, given time. She can teach me to speak with the spiders! I definitely want to spend some time with her, not only for the spells, I want to plant my trees! Kali casually mentions that the two easternmost doors are trapped, so Kyrin decides to sleep on the couch, it's safer than trying to open doors.

Kali invites Kyrin and me to join her on the other side of the island, where it is much quieter (glares at Plex). Aviana wants Kali to teach her many knots, so she can tie up Plex. Kali demonstrates the restraining of short people by spitting spiderweb on Kyrin in child form, and wraps her up in a spider cocoon so she cannot move at all. Aviana is interested, spits on the ground, doesn't seem to work. Kali slices Kyrin free with exceptional dagger skills. We imagine if Kali wanted to hurt Kyrin, Kyrin would have been dead last week.

Kali can use ZA WARUDO with needles and a Time Stop spell. Aviana knows this, and confidently says Kali would not hurt a fly. I think Kali EATS flies. No offense.

pages.name: 79 - A divine dog, and priorities
pages.content:
Wednesday 29th Nonus, 1497

18:55

Kyrin and me return to the cabin after spending time conversing with Kali. I tried to communicate with spiders, no luck yet. Emilio hatches wakes up from his power nap. Fearghas is enjoying some rare chilling time, reading. Shalkoc is teaching tricks to Ivernia and trying to teach her to speak. It's working about as well as my spider-speaking endeavours; she is not really getting the memo that her mouth can be opened for purposes other than eating or breathing ice. She picks the second one to use on Shalkoc, giving him a frosty mug. Which only inspires Shalkoc to use assistance from Ivernia to make frozen treats. The creativity!

Kyrin asks where Kaar is. We hear him trampling around on the floor above. I wonder whether Aviana is teaching Kaar to speak too, but we hear growling and a harpy screech. "Clean your paws before you step on my clothes!" Fearghas' temple vein starts to pulse as he conspicuously looks away from the ceiling. He is still under the effect of a surge that causes him to track dirt everywhere he goes.

Some random older woman from Promise comes by, walking a rat-sized dog. Shalkoc, thanks to an earlier surge, gets on his knees, eyes wide, saying he has never seen anything as holy as this dog. Shalkoc tries to prompt a religious conversation about the dog being the saviour of all, while the old lady stammers the dog Hufflepuff is her little darling. Shalkoc wants to steal the lady's dog, but the sweet lady gets terrified by Ivernia who is casually flying in. The dragon makes a beeline for the dog, looking forward to a bite-sized snack. Shalkoc steps in and picks up the dog; she shivers in his hands like she's about to straight up die from fear. The old lady passes out from sheer terror.

I try to convince Shalkoc to let the dog live its life. He locks Ivernia out and begins feeding and worshipping his new god. Fearghas tiredly asks me where Shalkoc got the dog. Kaar is barking, Aviana is shouting, and Ivernia flies up and makes another dive for the dog. Fearghas tries to get Shalkoc to give up the dog. He is unwilling. I rush to the aid of the dog's owner who is still lying in a heap close to the cabin. Emilio tries to bait Ivernia with treats to get her away from Shalkoc's newfound deity. He fails to get Ivernia's attention, but by god did he get the dog's attention, and she is going for Emilio with all her tiny might. Kyrin is giggling her bum off, I don't blame her, I'd do the same if I wasn't trying to revive the poor lady.

With a heavy sigh, Fearghas casts Remove Curse at 6th level on Shalkoc.

  • he no longer sees the doggie as a god

  • he loses his 3rd-level spell slot

  • he loses his -1 to constitution

  • he loses his +1 to intelligence

All liquids within 60 feet of him still transform into lukewarm water, the next pig he sees is still a god, and he is still black. He now sees the dog as food instead of god, and tries to feed her to Ivernia, who is making puppy eyes so she can eat the pup. Fearghas and Emilio do their best to protect the dog. Emilio begins to wrestle with the dragon, surprisingly successfully, as Fearghas grabs the dog and immediately gets bitten. Shalkoc coaxes Ivernia away with the promise of treats. Fearghas grumbles at Kyrin because she could have helped instead of giggling herself half to death.

I manage to wake the old lady up, explain what is going on, and apologise for Shalkoc's behaviour. Fearghas shows up with the dog dangling from his finger. The old lady yanks the dog from Fearghas' finger and invites us over for cake. Her name is Rose. Very sweet. She returns to Promise, insisting we come over for cake. Fearghas sees he cannot keep me away from cake, but I suggest we go without Shalkoc.

Fearghas and me return to the cabin where Shalkoc is feeding treats to Ivernia. She is behaving, likely due to being very hungry. Emilio is flabbergasted. I ask him, first time? This amuses Fearghas. We sit down like civilised people, and Kyrin talks about our conversation with Kali. We get a lot of extra information on the Drow sisters Filrae (my boss who was exiled) and Minae (the sister who is now at the head of House Vandree).

Kali mentioned one Velkyn Arkenaii, a friend of her mother's who fled the city Ul'ath'tallar, where House Vandree has great influence. Kali hasn't seen Velkyn in over 50 years, but supposes he might be in Aethel'eren (which means "noble lands" in Elvish). Or more likely on one of the surrounding isles, which we know next to nothing about. That's far away, not that it matters a lot to us, I'm sure it's beautiful country, we'll add this to the long, long list of our quests. Nagaaaaaaaaaaai.

We do need to report to Zariel first, or we might be toast. Literally.

We discuss what to do with Promise, whether it will crash into mountains (not unless Shalkoc wants it), how to develop it (we need craftsmen), how to have people travel to and from it, what is the most urgent (building the Academy to keep Promise aloft).

The problem is, Fearghas can't teleport us to Hell until Saturday. We could ask Zariel to teleport us there, but since we don't really have much to report, she probably won't take kindly to it. I am not an angel slayer, dang it Shalkoc! We consider casually flying Promise all the way to Aethel'eren but it will take a while. Fearghas wants to wait for Kali to rescue his parents. Kali mentioned she had connections in Taldor; we might be able to employ scouts from there to go to Ildilas and investigate the situation!

Kali goes off to Lessia to scout. Kyrin goes to bother Aviana and Kaar because FLUFFY. Kali returns around midnight, alone. She left a letter for Fearghas' parents so they know they are being rescued. Kyrin asks about her connections in Taldor; I mention the need for scouts to Ildilas. Fearghas brews up Potions of Supreme Healing. He advises Shalkoc to ask around in Promise for craftsmen.

Fearghas blows up at Plex about the mushroom pit in front of the door. I offer to help him relocate the mushroom pit so it's not in the way, while Fearghas stomps off. Kyrin considers cleaning her Sunblade just to mess up the Light-Shy mushrooms… While us small people are gardening, the grown-ups, plus Kyrin, are having serious talk with Kali about adventurers to hire. I join and outline three profiles of people I want as scouts:

  • a sailor with knowledge about the weather

  • a scribe who will be taking detailed notes

  • a scout who is particularly perceptive and notices details to report to the scribe

It would be great to have a person capable of flight, but I'm not counting on it. At first I add I don't want the scouts to endanger themselves, but Kali, Fearghas, and Emilio talk me down. If the adventurers take the job, they are aware of the risks and know they may die. I can't consider myself responsible for protecting them. I can only promise to try… Fearghas growls about messing up his alchemy. We discuss hiring someone to gather herbs for him to screw up brew more potions. Aviana flexes to inspire Fearghas to roll better. It does not work out.

Most of us go to bed. Kyrin wants to stay up and wait for Kali, as she isn't tired. Plex goes to the kitchen, curls up in a big pot, and goes to sleep. Fearghas is rage-sleeping.

Thursday 30th Nonus, 1497

06:00

Kali returns early in the morning, floating in through the window in cloud form. She is accompanied by two other clouds, who turn into Fearghas' parents! Kali is not too happy, she says she's been seen by guards. Fearghas happily reunites with his parents, how sweet! His dad did not enjoy being a cloud, but his mum had a blast and a half. He promises to take her flying again some day.

Fearghas gives his parents his room in the cabin. Shalkoc goes to cook up a big breakfast, finds Plex sleeping in the cauldron which is humming with the goblin's snoring. Fearghas introduces the party to his parents, throwing in a warning about Plex. He bargains with Shalkoc to pay Kali in coin, not in diamonds.

Fearghas' dad is called Dulum, and his mum is called Ysolde.

Aviana takes out the Null-steel chain, wraps Plex up in it and lifts him out of the cooking pot. She unchains him and lets him run free, ranting to Shalkoc about "not eating food cooked on Plex". The goblin makes a shopping list to go to the market. Ysolde scowls at Plex, don't blame her.

After breakfast, we all head to the settlement for various errands. On his quest for spices, Shalkoc sees on the market a wonderful, divine-looking pig. He is enlightened and kneels, worshipping the pig. Fearghas and me discuss casting Remove Curse, but it will take a spell slot of 7th-level at least. I could cast at 9th but that would cost me a lot, so Fearghas tries to persuade Shalkoc to purchase the pig and put it in a pen at the cabin so it can live its happiest pig life. Shalkoc is unwilling to be separated from his lord and saviour, Mr Oinkers. Fearghas argues that we can't take the pig to Hell, and it will be very well protected at the cabin, what with all the traps Plex put around it.

Shalkoc buys the pig for an obscene amount of money (10 gold). I distract Aviana by shopping for clothes, we have a nice time shopping for dresses and shoes; she also searches for various supplies, most of which I grow very concerned about. An extra-long, teleportation resistant dog-leash? She's putting that on Plex, isn't she. What does she want herring, potato, and carrots for? Taking advantage of the diversion, Fearghas walks away with his parents, explaining he will be away with the party for a while, showing them around. They ask for a shop where they could work as alchemists.

Plex gives a ridiculous amount of gold to 2 children for them to gather sticks and bring them to the cabin. He looks for paint, there is no paint, so he goes to the bar, making the DM cry because he does not know the price of drinks. Plex wants to do the equivalent of buying a round, but for the whole city, for 2 or 3 days. Aerelia begins to calculate. Plex is aghast at the amount of people living in Promise, all without paint.

5000 gold per day to buy a drink to everyone in Promise. Plex decides to throw a secret party, and pays the barkeep 300 gold. Nobody knows there is a secret party going on at 8:00 am. Plex goes to buy a pig. Aviana grumbles about her Kaar. Plex drinks on his own, in this fine morning. Throwing a secret party gets him inspiration. What even is going on. Thankfully, the morning drink distracts Plex from sneaking into a pasture and stealing the bells from the cows.

Aviana is looking for sunflowers and shampoo. Nobody knows what those are. She speaks to Shalkoc about the party's food stores, then buys 2 handmirrors. Why? As my mum would say, "only god and the little piggies know", and according to Shalkoc those two are one and the same. Aviana buys cobbler's tools, leatherworker's tools, and a lot of rope to craft an anti-magic leash for Plex.

Shalkoc happily goes to Glim's Emporium of Exotic Flavours buy spices, but the spice trade is not going well. On the account of there being no trade to speak of, since the common folk can't get off the island. Glim heartily recommends Quadiran cuisine, which causes Shalkoc to drool and possibly yank the island in the general direction of Quadira for a moment. Fearghas hears of Shalkoc's burning desire to go to Al-Qasir, and vetoes it on the account that Quadira is fiercely anti-magic.

Fearghas asks Shalkoc to fly the island to Taldor so people can trade. We make a stop at the cabin on the way to drop off our pigs. As we walk, Kyrin mentions her foster mother, a herbalist and healer who is also a tailor. She sounds like a wonderful person! Aviana wants to meet her immediately for duck-sized clothes, which severely confuses Kyrin.

Shalkoc wants to build a temple for his pig-god. Kyrin pleads that we don't have time for this! Fearghas casts Minor Illusion to make a pig-temple. Shalkoc is delighted.

We finally head to the Locus. Emilio is very worried about going to Hell, he's sweating bullets anticipating it might be like the Void. Plex admits he stole something last time he was in Hell. Aviana says it was her sanity. She had one before? Plex confesses he stole a bunch of Silver Tears, and he also freed Glim the spice trader, who was enslaved to a devil. Oh dear.

Plex teleports us to the Bronze Citadel in Avernus. Fearghas hands a spellgem of Sending to Shalkoc so he can contact Zariel. Emilio remarks that it's pretty hot in here. You don't say? Fireballs are raining from the sky, and the air stinks of sulphur and soot. Kyrin asks about Hell so we don't get ourselves fried on the spot. Fearghas explains about the paramount importance of the letter of the law, that there is NO tourist tax, don't believe that. Plex and Aviana want their money back. She says she bought NFTs in Hell, oh no.

Four pit fiends arrive to escort us. They're massive winged devils taller than Aviana. She claims they love music. I'm sure they're very polite, but I'd really rather not piss them off. We get asked to show our papers, but Emilio, Kyrin, and myself don't have any… The devil behind the counter calls his manager. A well-dressed, very impressive devil jurist shows up with arrest warrants for Fearghas, Aviana, Shalkoc, and Plex. They are to go to jail and wait for their case to be handled. Fearghas asks on what charges? The devil says, public indecency and theft. Indecency? In Hell?!

Getting our papers done would take… 6 months?! Kyrin says Zariel wants to see me, then tries to charm the devil, arguing the pit fiends were sent by Zariel to escort us to her. Fearghas says Zariel wanted to meet us before the end of the week. The devil jurist is covertly asking for a bribe. Kyrin speaks to the jurist about "greasing the wheel". She's still in her child form, and the devil looks on her with pride. A child who is trying to bribe him? That child will grow into a fine adult, for sure. The jurist lowers the price to 26 soul coins. Fearghas hands them over. The bag of scolding roasts him, which amuses the devils.

We have papers now! We enter the city, still surrounded by our pit fiends guards. They lead us to the courtyard in front of Zariel's tower. Plex hangs out at the back of the group, uncommonly quiet. Fearghas asks if we should go in by ourselves, as our guards aren't moving further. They give noncommittal answers… Kyrin simply walks into the tower. One does not simply walk into Zariel's tower! But Fearghas follows, then Emilio, then me. Aviana is busy drafting a legal complaint and wants to sit somewhere to finish writing it, but there is nowhere to sit, because this is Hell. Shalkoc follows me, and Plex trails after him as Aviana closes the march.

Shalkoc, Plex, and Aviana see the pit fiends grinning knowingly, like we've walked into their trap. Plex says "stooooooop I don't want to go into the building anymore", Aviana asks for the Glasses of True Seeing, wink wink nudge nudge? Fearghas puts them on, spots a scrying sensor above the door, but that's it. Aviana asks the pit fiends what is going on. They grin and say we don't know the rules of this place. We ask, and they say entering the tower is forbidden "since last time", and being ignorant of the rules does not protect us.

After a frustrating exchange with the pit fiends, we go back out into the courtyard and wait. The ground is dirty and hot, there is nowhere to sit, and the heat is extreme. After FIVE excruciating hours, Zariel glides down from the sky and lands behind us. She praises Shalkoc as a "good little pet" and asks him to introduce the angel slayer. He pushes me forward. I am frozen in fear. Emilio throws up his hands because Shalkoc just ruined the plan.

Zariel walks up to me uncomfortably close, looks down, and stares into my SOUL. She raises my chin up with the stump of her hand, and interrogates me. I'm shaking in my boots, saying I only accidentally killed an angel. I try to explain, but only squeak. Kyrin offers moral support. Appreciated. She also offers Psychic Whispers to establish a makeshift telepathic bond! Even more appreciated. Fearghas frantically thinks to Shalkoc to NOT say anything stupid.

I answer Zariel's questions, though vaguely, with the strict truth; that I killed an angel under very specific circumstances that are not in my power to re-create. She is amused by the irony of making everything worse by trying to help. Turning to Shalkoc, she says she expected something different when he spoke of an angel slayer. She forces me to look up and says that I don't have the strength to slay an angel, seeing how I'm trembling. I do not protest or deny. She asks me very clearly if I am capable to go to Heaven to sow discord and do murder. I say I am not capable of that.

Emilio opens his mouth to speak, but before he can get three words out, Zariel grabs him by the throat and lifts him to his tiptoes, inflicting heavy damage, poisoning him, blinding him, and deafening him. Plex shimmies away from Zariel as she tells Shalkoc he has no excuse for disrespecting her. He tries to apologise, and ask her to not kill Emilio. To which she responds by squeezing Emilio's neck tighter. He uses his cat-eared Hoodie of Stars to dip into the Astral Plane. Zariel rounds on Shalkoc, demanding what excuse he has for this.

Shalkoc tries to explain.

It does not go well.

It really does not go well, please let us leave.

Zariel explains life and death to us. Mostly death. All to say that Shalkoc has no way out of his contract because as a dragon, he does not really die when his body perishes, he just comes back to his hoard. His soul doesn't get stripped of individuality and judged by Pharasma, which constitutes death. Zariel wants to bully Shalkoc into paying reparations because his "pet" (Emilio) disrespected her (by trying to speak without being spoken to) and therefore she wants another contract. She will wait out Emilio's return so she can trade his life for something we offer her.

Shalkoc asks Zariel what she wants. She says Kyrin and me look "innocent enough". She wants us to enter the 3rd layer of Heaven and place a portal there. Kyrin says she'll do it. I'm thinking to Shalkoc to NOT ACCEPT THIS. Zariel conjures up a contract, an inkwell that looks filled with fire, and a pitch-black quill.

Aerelia steps away for a bit to write the contract. We collectively sweat through our pants. My cheeks are a rainpipe. He returns with a contract, even worse than I thought as it has a deadline AND a clause to not breathe a word of the contract or the artifact to anyone else.

Kyrin signs the contract. Zariel smiles. We are free to leave, Emilio included. Fearghas casts Sending to Emilio on the Astral Plane to tell him it's safe to return.

Aviana mutters about how this is unlawful. Zariel grabs her by the throat. Domi rolls a natural one on the CON save, pops inspiration, still fails it. Aviana uses Legendary Vigor to resist the damage and resumes babbling. Fearghas is definitely having an aneurysm, considers using magic to shut her up, realises she will equally resist it, and gives up.

This did not happen, thank the Heavens. Not that they could help us now. Not that we would wish them to, considering recent events.

Zariel makes it clear that we are not only free to leave, but also and mainly expected to leave. We proceed to exit as fast as we possibly can. Plex goes to teleport us out, gets a surge that makes the weather within 1 mile of him be the opposite of what it naturally is, so it starts snowing and freezing in Hell.

We return to Promise and Emilio deeply apologises for creating this situation. Nobody is mad at him, he didn't know. None of us knew. We return to the cabin defeated. Fearghas establishes a telepathic bond and makes it very clear that NOBODY must learn of that contract until Kyrin has opened the portal in Heaven, or our souls are forfeit. Well, her soul is forfeit. But we're in this together now, as we are all complicit.

We discuss Zariel's priorities. The Locus, our Locus, was created by Heaven and Hell working together. Now that Aviana broke it, and the planes are converging again, demons can go and fight anything they want (not JUST Hell). Which messed up the Blood War, and put the devils at liberty to go fck up the angels.

We discuss how to wriggle out of our contracts. Fearghas' death would release him from his, we are pretty much certain. We theorise it might also work for Shalkoc, but we are less sure. We decide that we should go to Heaven next, and we look for ANY loopholes in the contract, with limited success.

pages.name: 80 - Where is the beer?
pages.content:
Thursday 30th Nonus, 1497

17:55

Fearghas entrusts the Wand of Catnap to me. It can make up to 7 creatures take a short rest in only 10 minutes, basically. Kyrin shows us the Beacon of Doom that Zariel has given her. We decide, reluctantly, to go to Heaven to fulfill her contract. We must wait for Saturday because we first need a long rest to recover high-level spell slots. Fearghas and me know that while anyone is allowed to enter Threshold, the first layer of Heaven, we can only reach higher levels with an invitation. There is a single, winding path up Mount Celestia, from which we must never stray. That is the only way to ascend between levels. We immediately start discussing ways to bypass the invitation (sneaking, forging). I don't think that's a good idea…

Fearghas casts Legend Lore as a ritual, because he can apparently? He investigates the 3rd level of Heaven, Venya. It's colder than the other levels, snowy mountains. There are cities in valleys connected by roads and bridges. This layer focuses on craftsmanship and community. Torag's realm is located there. It's much less defended than the 1st and 2nd level… logically. Any dangers there are mainly natural, like avalanches. Nobody expects the Spanish Inquisition an attack on this level.

Aviana decides to buy a lot of chocolate/confectionaries, sneak it into Shalkoc's Snack Pack (Bag of Holding but for food), and bring it to the angels as a show of kindness. Shalkoc considers eating up all the treats, then offering himself to the celestials. We go talk to the Elder of Promise, a priest of Sarenrae called Gavel. He gives us a very exact definition of Lawful Good. We discuss whether a Divination spell like Augury would fail Kyrin's contract. Depending on the wording, it very much could.

Friday, 1st of Decimus, 1497

19:05

After a day of resting, talking, and spellscribing, we are all in the cabin when we see a longship on the lake, being dragged ashore. Aviana and Fearghas go to meet the sailors. They have mentioned being on good terms with the Frost Giants, and expecting a visit. Plex starts to scramble, searching the cabin for all manners of alcohol in case a party happens. We meet up with General Ragvond; the ground shakes beneath his feet. He could accidentally step on me… or on Plex… or on Kyrin in child form. Plex is hiding under a bush, potentially hiding several bottles of booze. Aviana welcomes the giant and Shalkoc offers food.

Ragvond says he was sent by Utgard-Loki to establish a trading post. There is also a personal request for us to help in the war against the Fire Giants, as there have been "complications". Aviana asks whether it is related to "that giant ball of fire". Ragvond is impressed; that's a close assumption. He likes Aviana, and he doesn't like a lot of people. The Fire Giants are using chains to enslave Magma Elementals, which are causing big disturbances for the Frost Giants. Loki would be in our debt if we travelled to the volcano of Surtur's Jaws in the fortress called Obsidian's Cradle, and retrieve Rovagug's Chains.

Kyrin uses Psychic Whispers so we can discuss this without risk of being overheard and breaking the contract. There is a little joking around with Ragvond, then Kyrin steps out of the shadows (nobody was seeing her, not even Plex who was hiding under a bush right next to her). Ragvond gives a start like an elephant being startled by a mouse, saying he nearly stepped on her. Size isn't everything!! Them lumbering people, really…

Ragvond invites us aboard the ship, where a 10-feet-high anchor which apparently is for us? It is a Transdimensional Anchor. With it, we are given a chain that gradually becomes translucent, until the links disappear. He challenges Aviana to carry the chain, and drops it into her hands. It is a Transdimensional Anchorchain, metaphysically bound to the anchor. The chain can transport us to the anchor by opening a portal, even across planes. We just need someone really REALLY strong to drag the chain!

Aviana grabs the anchor, pops a deadlift, and jumps to the middle of the island. Kyrin sneaks underdeck. The ship rocks brutally and Emilio, Plex, and myself drop down into the hold. Plex immediately pops Feather Fall. Ragvond is laughing his bum off, and asks where the beer is (as this is what Promise is trading with the Frost Giants).

Aviana deletes herself accidentally.

Fearghas warns the brewer that Frost Giants are on the way, very eager to try some good ale. Having plonked the anchor down close to the town, Aviana returns and we party with the giants.

Sunday 3rd of Decimus, 1497

08:45

Long rest

Fearghas does some very risky alchemy, which fails despite Aviana's inspiring abs. I yell at Shalkoc for a solid 5 minutes, he offers me a big serving of Lovely Honey Cookies, shaped like a bee and with a flavour of spicy honey. They're good. They're really good. I realise I've drawn my dagger during my rant, sheathe it, and stomp off to brew a pot of tea to go with the cookies. There are more bee cookies for Fearghas and Plex, while Emilio snacks on a comforting jacket potato and Kyrin tucks into a big fish steak. Aviana gets a plate of "jumping dumplings", rhubarb-filled treats that are supposed to prevent falling damage. Great for climbers. We hope it works. Attention chute de pierres. Shalkoc cooks some strange mushrooms with lavender for himself. Are those safe to eat? Anything is safe to eat for him but those fungi look suspiciously like something that would give you hallucinations for hours…

We head to the Locus to teleport to Heaven. Fearghas opens a portal and whisks us away to Heaven's Shore. We arrive in the middle of a fierce battle between angels and devils. A host of angels tries to get to us as we materialise, but they are cut down. One lone angel survives, severely wounded and unable to fly. He welcomes us, introduces himself as Ezeriel, and immediately offers protection to Heaven's Gate. There are far too many devils for us to fight, and all we can hope to do is get to the walls to take shelter.

Kyrin hides so well that nobody can see her, again. I summon Dwen and hop on his back, we are ready to make haste. Kyrin shoots the Arrow of Destiny (tm) at a Bone Devil, who is shooketh that one arrow deals so much damage. The devil flies towards her and brings a friend. When Kyrin shoots the devil, a glowing rolled newspaper appears above her head and whacks her for radiant damage. She's still in child form, maybe that is why.

Fearghas tells Ezeriel that we can help in the fight! The angel says we just have to get to the gates, 1000 feet away behind a host of devils. Fearghas casts a juicy Lightning Bolt, catching 4 Merregons in it. A big slipper appears behind him, glowing radiant like the morning sun, and slaps him hard over the ear. The Merregons shoot Ezeriel, he's barely standing anymore! Emilio shoots 3 Eldritch Blasts at the Bone Devil that still has Kyrin's arrow stuck in him, 1 blast misses but the others connect, and very briefly catch Ezeriel's attention. A golden hand appears and flicks Emilio's ear.

Aviana gives Ezeriel a bottle of Murgaxor's Elixir of Life, and plays the damsel in distress. Plex wants to be thrown 500 feet. The Horned Devil at the back attacks Ezeriel, and tells the 2 Bone Devils to charge forward and attack the angel. He is not asking, so the bony boys whack him.

Plex is the voice of reason.

Plex is the voice of REASON.

PLEX IS THE VOICE OF REASON.

Plex says we need to save the angel. He casts Temporal Shunt, says "trust me" and shunts both a Bone Devil and the angel through TIME ITSELF. The other Bone Devil is hella confused. Another Horned Devil hurls flames at Fearghas, and suddenly the weather turns cloudy and rain begins to pour down. Wild magic surge, eh. One Narzugon riding a Nightmare rushes towards us and uses Terrifying Command and tries to frighten us. I roll a natural 1 on the save, pop inspiration, natural 20. Sunglasses descend on my eyes. Plex, Fearghas, and Shalkoc are frightened. Aviana pretends to be frightened with such conviction that she very nearly scares HERSELF. Emilio scowls at the devil, shrugs, and says "I've seen worse."

One Bone Devil tries to spear Fearghas like a tasty snack on his polearm. He casts Shield, so the devil lashes at Kyrin with its stinger-tail, and slashes with his claws. Kyrin takes the first hit, and dodges the second one like a champ. Ezeriel comes back from the Temporal Shunt, immediately eats a magic surge that permanently lowers his Wisdom, and he has no clue what happened to him. He grumbles about "vile Infernal magic" and Plex just stands here like a guilty lime. In the middle of battle, Shalkoc asks about Shaik, whether anybody knows them. We yell at Shalkoc, what else is new?

Ezeriel tells us to follow him, tries to fly away, but his wings are too damaged. Shalkoc gets in a critical punch on one of the bony boys and stuns him. He advances on the bridge and shifts to Turtle Style, taunting the devils to shoot him. As if on cue, devil artillery slides into the chat. Arcane bombs fall, thankfully none of us gets hit. Emilio stares at the explosions, wondering at the flavour of them.

Kyrin shoots the stunned bony boy, he looks really beaten up at this point. I cast Mass Cure Wounds, healing Fearghas and Ezeriel's wounds, and removing Fearghas' and Plex' fear. Still riding Dwen, I run past the Bone Devil by the bridge, dodging his opportunity attack. Plex starts his turn with technical questions on which actions EXACTLY will trigger damage from the Realm Effect Forced Peace. If he shoves someone off a ledge, does he take damage? Then he uses Versatility through Unpredictability because as it turns out, after a 10-minute discussion on how/where to use Arcane Gate, it turns out he does not have Arcane Gate prepared. Just Plex things. Plex is trying to be a good green boy and generate some positive karma by slaughtering devils, and obeying angels. See earlier notes. Plex considers using his pride and joy, Jim's Lance of Compensation.

The Bone Devil grapples and stabs Ezeriel, somehow triggers a wild magic surge that blasts necrotic damage on anyone within 60ft, then heals him. Dwen dies on impact. Legitimately every time I summon my doggie, Aerelia murders him. My poor Dwen, next time we have a rest I'm just gonna sit and cradle the figurine and whisper happy things to him.

Well the surge causes the very damaged Bone Devil to heal up back to full, and then a JIRRU BIIIIIMU BEAM of light descends upon him and smites the shit out of him for being the first to damage most of the combatants present. What a rollercoaster. We just get to beat him up all over again. As an additional side effect, the wave of necrotic damage breaks the protection of Aviana's Amulet of Fragile Tranquility and she enters rage. Fearghas casts a Magic Missile, then throws in a Vicious Mockery. "I've seen better skeletal structures on a diced chicken!" But the Bone Devil does not know what a chicken is, and the insult falls flat. Chickens would probably insta-roast in Hell. Eggs would insta-boil. No wonder they don't know about the tasty birds.

Emilio grabs a cute little star from his cat-eared hoodie and throws it like a dart and OH GOD IT'S MAGIC MISSILES AND HE ROLLED MAX ON DAMAGE. He goes into Void Form and crunches (?) on an Essence Shard to activate Netherwalk. Imagine walking faster after eating, could not be me. I only get sleepy, more like Nethernap I guess.

"Just leave the little child alone with the Bone Devil." - Aerelia, 2025.

Aviana leaves the little child alone with the Bone Devil. She jumps next to the Narzugon on his Nightmare, zapping him with the Cursed Thunderfeet (and getting divinely slapped for it), then continues down the bridge at a run, complaining "you're ruining my damsel in distress moment!". As a true damsel in distress, she uses her Battering Ram, crashing the Narzugon into Ezeriel and the Bone Devil. The Bone Devil turns into a Done Devil, and Ezeriel and the Narzugon are paralysed. Welp. Another charge yeets the devil into the water where he proceeds to sink.

The devils descend on the paralysed Ezeriel and knock him out. Well more like stab the light out of him. The Horned Devil then turns to Emilio and strangles him with his tail, grappling him. "Devils really like strangling me!" Wiesel says. And with 0 hesitation Domi replies "They read your backstory." The devil nonchalantly makes a stab at Emilio, who swings himself like a pendulum to dodge the hit.

"Shalkoc, you are good at two things. Healing is not one of them." - Aerelia and Karnack in perfect sync, like you'd think they must have rehearsed that.

So Shalkoc punches the Bone Devil in the rear end Thousand Years of Pain, cracking most of the remaining bones and moving right back to where he was. A perfect drive-by! The devils assume Ezeriel is dead so they try to whack Emilio. Another arcane bombardment misses all of us. Kyrin casually pulls out the Sun Blade and slaps a crit on the Bone Devil, jumping down from the tree and lopping its head off. In its last moments, the Bone Devil hears the trees speaking Changeling, he is scarred for life.

I pick up Dwen, back in his rock form, and kneel by Ezeriel to cast a 4th-level Cure Wounds on him, Heightened to 7th-level. He is thankful but says we really need to move, the next wave of devils is already coming! I hurry onto the next bridge. Plex is going through his spellbook backwards to find Arcane Gate and cast it. It does not work out. Fearghas burns a Dreamfeather to give him another chance, but Plex still cannot find the all-important spell. that's a 50% chance and we are on… 4 failures?

Fearghas grills 2 Merregons with a Lightning Bolt, and spits at the Horned Devil that he smells of elderberries or something (Vicious Mockery). "Pleeeeeex?" The goblin is working on it. He's never looked for a spell so hard in his life. A Narzugon appears NEXT TO ME. Nightmares do be fast. Emilio eats 3 shards for a Bloodrazor. So anyway, he started slashing. He lands a crit with Reaping Claws, earning inspiration for it! He rolls close to maximum damage, but in reaction the devil stings him and poisons him with his tail.

Some people work well under stress. Plex is not one of them. It might be easier if he could read? Aviana grapples the Narzugon and jumps halfway to Quadira with him, frying him on landing. A Horned Devil eats a surge and drops to 20% HP, yippeeeeee! Ezeriel eats a lot of fire damage, and goes down again. Emilio is getting forked. Shalkoc uses his Hand of Healing to get Ezeriel back on his feet.

"Poor angel's gone down more than a Titanic hooker." - Kyrin, 2025

"Technically, you could all get into my hole!" - also Kyrin

We get hit by an Arcane Bombardment. I'm out of range; everyone saves except Fearghas who takes full damage. Ezeriel faints again. Kyrin whips out the Portable Hole with the intent to shove Ezeriel in. I'm getting frustrated with this angel; I take off my ward and channel Heal, heightened to 9th-level. He gets up from death's door with a few bruises and he can fly again as his wings are healed. Kyrin gives me a flat look. Fearghas is shouting to just GET IN THE HOLE. Emilio is still dangling 70 feet in the air, choked by the Horned Devil.

I should have jumped into the hole. I was too worried I'd need to heal someone, and would not be able to reach them from inside the hole! Plex fails the coinflip a 5th time. It takes Shalkoc's inspiration and a 6th coinflip for Plex to FINALLY have Arcane Gate prepared. Turns out Emilio can easily escape the Horned Devil whenever he wants, but he stayed grappled because he wanted to fight it.

Fearghas casts Dimension Door, Plex casts Arcane Gate and duplicates it with Fishy Magic. Passing through the string of portals, Fearghas arrives before Heaven's Gate and bangs on the door screaming LET US IIIIIN. A Narzugon crits Aviana, very bad idea that. She is also fighting with 2 Bone Devils. A third one joins the party! Emilio lands another crit with Reaping Claws, only to eat another Punishing Sting. Emilio pops 3 shards on Accrued Vitality, gaining 20 temp HP. For 2 more shards he uses Phase Shift and teleports right into the portal. He does fall 40 feet but his temp HP absorbs the damage.

Aviana stares down the devils, says "Alright it's time for me to goooooo!" and feeds a rage to her Royal Commander's Cloak to escape from the grapple. She walks away dragging the Narzugon, but gets an opportunity attack from a Bone Devil and immediately gets grappled again. She feeds the cloak another rage. This whole thing happens one more time. Aviana jumps into the hole, bringing the Narzugon, but she is wearing the Transdimensional Chain around her wrist, and it can't be contained in an extradimensional space right, so she gets stuck with her face in the hole and her bum sticking out.

Fearghas is having a fit yelling at Aviana to GET INTO THE PORTAL!! She does so, STILL bringing the devil and his burning horse. I get burned by a Horned Devil. Ezeriel stands up and tells us to go through the portal, that he will hold them back. We yell at him to go through, and open those gates for us! He goes through the portals, shouts to let us in, his friends recognise him and agree. Ezeriel runs the FCK back through the portals. We shout at him again, and ask him to protect the goblin who is holding the portaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaals!! Thankfully, he does that. Surprisingly, Shalkoc did a good amount of the yelling and he even sounded reasonable!
