I get hit full force by the next Arcane Bombardment, while Kyrin dodges it perfectly. It burns, I'm fine, trust me, I'm okay, I promise. Kyrin picks up her hole and hurries through the portal. I follow right behind her. Plex and Ezeriel follow from the middle, and we all gather in front of Heaven's Gate. Behind us is a whole ARMY of devils. Planetars descend from the walls and pick us up, accompanied by DUMBO THE FLYING ELEPHANT who gives us an Aura of Invincibility, protecting us from a massive Fireball.

Aviana is still lugging the Narzugon, and the Planetars tear him apart. Guess Aviana will bother Fearghas for a goat plushie to hug now? She tries to grab a handful of the Nightmare's mane "to add to the fashion" but to her disappointment, the horse disappears when its summoner is slain. We are put down safely and approached by an Archon guard carrying a big tome. He says he needs to register us before sending us to the healers' ward. Ezeriel thanks us for saving him, and that seeing us alive is the only reward he wants for doing his duty.

The Archon reads us seven commandments:

Thou shalt not speak a lie.

Thou shalt not harm the innocent.

Thou shalt not desecrate that which is holy.

Thou shalt not place thyself above the greater good.

Thou shalt not abandon thy lawful duty.

Thou shalt not deny aid to those in need.

Thou shalt not deny a righteous plea for mercy.

Thankfully we still have the telepathic connection so we can discretely get our stories straight. White Tower bullshit. On the way to registration, Fearghas tells us why again they have got involved with Hell in the first place. This story told at the speed of thought is a real treat.

pages.name: 80 - summary
pages.content:
Where is the beer?

I have received the Wand of Catnap.

We decide it's most urgent to go to Heaven and fulfil Kyrin's contract, the risk of failure is too great. So naturally Fearghas googles the 3rd level of Heaven; we learn it's called Venya, a layer of snowy mountains and cities snug in valleys. It can only be reached by a path we must never stray from, and it's very lacking in defences. Nobody expects the Spanish Inquisition an attack on this level...

Aviana buys chocolate for the angels and we speak to the Elder of Promise.

The next evening, Frost Giants appear! Plex scrambles looking for alcohol, in case a party were to happen. We meet with General Ragvond who is sent by Utgard-Loki to establish trade with Promise. He also asks us, mainly Aviana really, for help in the war against Fire Giants. They are enslaving elementals which is very bad, such reprehensible behaviour, who would do such a thing. We agree we will help when we can, not right now.

Aviana receives the most massive anchor and chain known to the Multiverse, and plants the anchor down near the town. The chain, if dragged by someone of superhuman strength, will tear through reality to reunite with the anchor. If only we had a very strong harpy... oh but wait!

After some falling on our bums, some spooking Ragvond, and a healthy amount of joking around, Ragvond asks where the beer is, as this is Promise's trade good with the giants. We drink and party with the giants, who complain about being scammed and served water when Shalkoc is nearby.

Our Sunday morning begins with Fearghas grumbling at alchemy, and me yelling my lungs out at Shalkoc, who defuses the situation with cookies. I'll get him next time! We teleport to Heaven's Shore and arrive in the middle of a huge battle, a devil army is invading and a host of angels hurries to protect us. Only one survives, a gentleman called Ezeriel. We proceed to fight with him, and sometimes for him as he is knocked unconscious by the devils a significant amount. Some notable events in the battle:

  • I grow tired of Ezeriel passing out and cast Heal at 9th levelTM

  • Kyrin shoots the Arrow of Destiny on a Bone Devil, even he is surprised that one arrow can hurt this bad

  • Fearghas fries Merregons like it's BBQ day

  • Aviana is the damsel in distress, still charges like a moose forward and back, and then forward and back

  • Time magic, and confusion

  • It starts to bucket down, wild magic eh

  • Shalkoc casually asks if anybody knows Shaik, we yell at Shalkoc

  • We all worry when Emilio is grappled by a Horned Devil and dangled 70 feet in the air, but he says he can teleport out at any time and just wants to aura farm fight him

  • Plex is the voice of reason

  • Plex is the voice of REASON

  • PLEX IS THE VOICE OF REASON

Divine light smites us when we attack unprovoked, which is funny when one devil gets a surge that blasts necrotic damage on everyone nearby. He heals the damage inflicted, then a beam of light descends on him and deal pretty much the damage he just healed. Aerelia kills my dog, again. Fearghas insults devils so bad they cry. Emilio throws the cute little stars on his cat-eared hoodie and OH GOD IT'S MAGIC MISSILES AND HE ROLLED MAX ON DAMAGE. Aviana leaves the little child (Kyrin in disguise) alone with the Bone Devil, then goes away to tank 3-4 devils like she fears we will steal them.

"Shalkoc, you are good at two things. Healing is not one of them."

Shalkoc then proceeds to execute a shinobi technique of fingers up the arse on a Bone Devil. Kyrin casually pulls out the Sun Blade and slaps a crit on the Bone Devil, jumping down from the tree and lopping its head off. In its last moments, the Bone Devil hears the trees speaking Changeling, he is scarred for life. All this time Plex is frantically searching his spell book for the ONE SPELL that will save us from certain death. He loses the 50/50 FIVE times in a row, please don't ever play gacha games.

Kyrin wants everyone to get in her hole so she can pick it up and carry us to safety. We are shit at following simple instructions, and Plex finds his spell, so we instead make a daisy chain of portals and teleport to Heaven's Gate, where Fearghas bangs at the door screaming LET US IIIIIIN!! Emilio and Aviana escape their devil pursuers by fluttering a cloak, and doing a shady teleport. Not in that order. Shalkoc yelled at Ezeriel, very convincing, he must have learnt from the best.

At last the angels rescue us and fly us over the wall, where we are given 7 commandments which leave a decent amount of wriggle room, and we are told to go register ourselves. They are not super impressed by Aviana's chocolate. Fearghas tells us a very good story.

pages.name: 81 - The angelic tribunal of meet & greet
pages.content:
Sunday 3rd Decimus, 1497

10:30

We are taken to the registration hall by an angel called Verita. Close to the gates, an enormous white building with blue roofs is called the Administratorum. Ezeriel tells Verita of our heroic gates, and me saving his life! Verita says she will inform the Witnesses; citizens of Heaven randomly chosen for jury duty. We enter a large square room furnished with benches, and a small fountain in the middle of the room. We are instructed to wait, and we will be called individually through the ebony doors at one end of the room.

As we wait, another angel comes to offer water and fresh fruit and asks if we need immediate medical attention. We say we can wait, and we are left to our own devices. Fearghas prestidigidates water into blackcurrant and banana water for him and Plex, respectively. Aviana desires water with the flavour of "whipped cream, strawberry and banana, with a tint of coffee and crushed pistage nuts". Plex tries to hide. We tell him off. I tell Aviana we are not here to fight; it seems it was necessary.

After a short wait, I am called in first. The door shuts off telepathy spells; at the centre of the room, a pedestal magicked with Comprehend Languages bears the Seven Commandments. On each side of the room, three blindfolded Witnesses, citizens of Heaven, stand to aid Verita in her judgement. Depending on the entrant's answers to the mandatory and optional questions, they are to be provided with one of 5 levels of guidance to ensure everyone's safety; the first being complete trust, the last constant surveillance by several archons.

I answer the questions to the best of my ability. There is kind of a lie already, not outright, but far from the full truth. It'll be fine I'm sure but I'm sweating through my dress. The Witnesses seem convinced by my answers? It's difficult to tell on smooth-faced blindfolded angels… They deem I don't need guidance and can find my own path. Phew. I have level 1 guidance.

Fearghas goes after me. One of the Witnesses asks him why he seeks Torag. Our dwarf says "reassurance", as he followed Torag's teachings his whole life. He is also asked whether he has made bargains with the Void, Fearghas says no. Upon being asked, he says he seeks to help others. The players take turns playing the Witnesses, and Domi is incredible as a pompous angel. Fearghas is deemed to need level 2 guidance.

Kyrin is called in. She immediately gives a false name, but without lying. ("My current name is Miri Flick.") Verita can see Kyrin's real shape, and asks for her true name. Kyrin gives it, and explains she is a shapeshifter. I ask if she intends to use her abilities for deception. She says she has in the past, as needed for her jobs, but she is not planning to deceive anyone here. Verita chimes in, asking if she wants to revise this statement. She says no, it was honest. Domi's Witness asks if Kyrin is acting as a proxy for evil itself. Kyrin dodges the question. The Witness asks, "did you ever find justification for cruelty?" Kyrin says she doesn't want to harm others if she can help it. Kyrin ends up with level 3 guidance, calls us racists out of character.

Emilio sees an exasperated Kyrin come out, and he goes in. He says he hopes to gain better understanding of good and evil, and that he hasn't betrayed anyone. Verita asks him if he wishes to seek healing for the "disfigurement" he carries. He says he would rather not, as it is useful for now, but the offer is tempting. Karnack's Witness asks for clarification. Emilio is asked how he spent his earlier years, and he answers truthfully, though not mentioning the Void by name. I ask Emilio if, should the greater good require it, he would sacrifice his personal interests, he says yes. He gets level 2 guidance.

Kyrin gives him The LookTM of "did they grill you as much as they grilled me?". Shalkoc goes in next. Oh, lord. When being asked why he seeks to enter Heaven's Shore, he hesitates and says "I think I am going with a friend, I forgot why we're here, by the way the food here is amazing!". Verita warns him to follow the commandments or suffer the consequences. Shalkoc reiterates he comes here with a friend to visit Heaven. He asks how to get an invitation to higher layers, gets told off. I ask if we can be certain he will remember the rules. He claims he is great at remembering rules because… aaaaah… he forgot. He is asked which other places he visited. "The cold place, the cold place, the dark place… the city where one of my friends grew up…" He gets asked to elaborate. "The place where the frost giants and the fire giants are." Aight. Upon being asked whether he acts as a proxy for evil itself, he says "I think I have my own will!" Then, he says no. I ask if he requires "healing for his mind". He claims his friends guide him. We ask what if he is without his friends. He asks for a copy of the rules to take with him.

Shalkoc asks a question to himself. The table loses it. "Snar for president!" - Kyrin

"Does that mean you do not remember whether you have done evil before?" All the Witnesses are losing brain cells listening to Shalkoc. Verita says Shalkoc has told a minor lie; claiming he forgot why he sought entrance to Heaven's Shore. He justifies himself saying he was distracted and stressed out.

Shalkoc votes for himself. We lose our shit. Again.

Shalkoc gets a guidance of level 5. He asks if that is a good score. Verita explains he will have several angels accompanying him. Our dragonborn says that's great and asks if Ezeriel can accompany him. Shalkoc PROUDLY walks out of the room saying he got the highest score. Fearghas facepalms with the sound of falling pipes and prays to Torag. He receives a divine Bless.

Aviana goes in. She flexes as she says her full name. She says she wants to enter Heaven's Shore because she believes this is where true good resides. Also we were chased by an army of devils. She flexes, says she is doing this for a dwarf friend who keeps asking, but she doesn't mind because it makes her stronger. That is the full truth. Aviana says she didn't come for personal gain, but to help her friends and improve the circumstances of her tribe. Then she starts rambling about Promise. She admits she does not deeply understand the rules, but she is willing to learn, and will do her utmost to not forget them. That's better than the dragonborn… "I will always attempt to grab onto the closest people who are in need of mercy, and hopefully I can deliver them graceful embrace in their time of need." She says evil must be defeated; but faced with the choice of smiting evil or helping the innocent, she would choose the latter. Aviana says by helping herself, she will also help others, because just look at these muscles. We're blindfolded. She says her mind is her greatest weakness, and she is trying to improve her problem with economics. Aviana gets level 2 guidance, and flexes her way out.

Aviana is disappointed she didn't get as high a score as Shalkoc. I whisper to her it works the other way. Last but not least, Plex goes in. He claims he is cursed to tag along with the party, and since he is forced to follow them, he decides to help them. Karnack's Witness asks about the nature of Plex' curse, and whether it poses a danger to anyone else. Plex says it might have been a Hag, and affected the other goblins of his tribe, who are probably in great danger. He seeks nothing from Heaven itself, but enjoys the protection from the party. He would accept help with his curse. He offers to help the denizens of Heaven in exchange for help with his curse. Upon being asked, he says if one of his companions were to do an evil deed, that person should be punished. Domi's Witness asks if Plex has hurt people before, and if yes, has he enjoyed it (not in these terms). Plex says self-defence is not evil. I ask Plex why he is not helping his tribe. He says he is trying to find a way to suppress the curse, but it's a long process. Plex asks for clarification on the rules, and explanation of certain words.

Karnack's Witness asks "Do you wash your rice before you cook it?" Plex answers "You're supposed to cook it?" Plex gets level 3 guidance.

Eventually the party is reunited. We discuss our results, and give Shalkoc shit. Fearghas casts Rary's Telepathic Bond, and then Plex runs back into the interrogation room, cutting himself off from the telepathic link. He asks if anyone is listening in on us. Verita asks him if he has anything to hide. Now she is more suspicious of Plex. Moments later, Verita leads us to another room where Ezeriel is waiting for us. He is glad to see us again. We are to go to the infirmary with him, and then we will meet Shalkoc's bodyguards guides.

Aerelia chokes on carrots again, despite his efforts to break this particular curse.

Aviana asks Ezeriel where the angels get their clothes. He is confused; he just buys them in the city. There is trade between Heaven's Shore and other planes, using gold as currency. Shalkoc asks if there is any place to buy herbs. Ezeriel grows sad, one of his companions, Solara, went to the herb store a lot. We cross a bridge lined by giant statues and get to the infirmary. It's more like a massive hospital, shining white walls and tall windows. A lot of people fly in and out of the place. We discuss the healing arts, and Ezeriel is disappointed by Aviana's comments. Fearghas warns him that he will have to revise his judgement of her many times.

Over the course of 3 hours, we get treated and healed to full! My max HP is still reduced, though. A messenger comes in and asks to speak to Ezeriel in private. One of the angels asks Fearghas what troubles him. He replies "How long you got?". The angel says "As long as it takes." With a glare towards Plex, Fearghas begins to unload all his frustration with Aviana and Plex. And goats. He rants about Shalkoc. He rants about the king of Lessia. He vents about his parents being imprisoned. He rages about the Drow and the Duergar. "Thanks," Fearghas says, "I think I needed that." The angel, Valeriel, says it's all good, it's a difficult burden to bear. + inspirational quote.

Plex walks around and explores, but gets told off when he is nosy. A celestial named Caelus asks Emilio to remove his bandages. Emilio hesitates, but does it. Caelus seems sad, but tries to comfort Emilio about scars being a source of pride, and part of who he is. Someone tries to heal my channelling fatigue, it does not work. The head of this wing, Clementiel, comes in to have a look. He seems young, but I sense he is wise and tired. He recognises my fatigue for what it is, burning my life force to heal others, and he scolds me. I thank him… He then says he recognises my staff, and says… "Thank you."

Natural 20 on emotional damage. The FEELS. My little heart. Yeah I sat here with my hands at my heart, eyes misty, for a moment Naami and Pebble were the same person.

Aviana is advised to take better care of her feathers, or she will lose the ability to fly. She says she can't fly, and it's not a bug, it's a feature. The angel says, normally harpies can fly? "These wings aren't for flight, they are made to solidify my charismatic appearance," Aviana says. She asks to learn more about her race, where harpies come from, and how to make her wings harder and bigger like her BICEPS. Because "everybody knows size matters," she says as she looks at Fearghas.

Plex and Ezeriel return as we are chilling by a fountain. The angel looks really disheartened; he says he is not allowed to return to the front lines for 2 months, so he may take time to grieve for his squad. He wants to go back and fight, but accepts his fate and quotes words the Marshal Shaik said to him when he first arrived in Heaven. Plex asks if we can honour the dead with Ezeriel; they sacrificed themselves to save us. Fearghas agrees with Plex, which deeply annoys him. We get invited to the funeral for Ezeriel's squad on the second layer, but we need to ask the Marshal Shaik first (the very angel Shalkoc is contracted to kill).

3 Devas arrive and introduce themselves as Huey, Dewey, and Louie. They're not their real names, but they chose these nicknames to help Shalkoc remember them. Shalkoc says 6 is the double of 5 and we all have to roll an INT save. We get a splitting headache and Plex, who rolled a natural 1, gets a bout of madness that manifests in the overwhelming urge to eat something strange such as dirt. He takes out a piece of jade from his pack and starts nibbling on it. I try to get him to spit it out, but he swallows the stone and proudly shows his empty mouth. Aviana wants to go to the library and have someone read her bedtime stories about "the glorious harpy race". Huey, Dewey, and Louie cannot help with that, they have to watch Shalkoc at all times. The moment a library is mentioned, we lose Fearghas, as expected. Aviana claims to be an intellectual. Kyrin says we're not supposed to lie. The harpy defends herself. Nobody believes her.

Plex tries to make sense of Fearghas' magic, shows a beautiful picture in his spellbook. Fearghas cannot make heads nor tails of it. Plex learns the spell Planetrotting! The material component is hilarious, it's like he tried to figure out Plane Shift, got most of the way there, and got there by Plex means. We head to the armoury to take Shalkoc's toys away. He has to surrender all his magic items, but is allowed to keep his Snack Pack. Kyrin pats him on the shoulder. Shalkoc is told to put all his magic items and weapons into a chest, but there is a tiny problem; he has 2 cursed items (the Draconic Amulet of Greed and the Bracers of Asmodeus) he refuses to take off. We tell him to be reasonable, but he protests. Fearghas smells the bullshit by virtue of a natural 20 on Insight. "Right folks, hold 'im down, dogpile!" Kyrin goes to sneak the Amulet off of him, but one of the guards notices and tells her off for stealing.

I sigh and cast Remove Curse on Shalkoc. Both his curses are broken, he feels a lot less greedy. He hands over his magic items and poisons with no further fuss, keeping basically only his Snack Pack. Aviana wants to trade feathers with the Devas. They are confused but see no harm in it. Ezeriel gives her a feather, and Aviana returns the favour.

With our obligations taken care of, and three days until the funeral, we decide to go shopping. Plex wants to jump on clouds, is disappointed. He wants to eat a cloud instead. The madness has passed, this is just Plex. Aviana says he needs to learn the spell Eat Cloud. Fearghas has no idea what she is going on about.

Before the all-important shopping, we decide to go see Shaik to ask for passage to the 2nd layer. Telepathically, Fearghas confirms we should speak to Shaik about the contract, since we are not sworn to silence on this one. As we walk, Kyrin asks the Deva guards if they have ever fought a Sibriex; she mentions the Perfected Deva I released from its agony. They know what it is, and upon hearing that story, they kneel down and pray in sorrow. I join them, hoping I have the right. They wish he hadn't had to suffer through this, but they're glad we could put an end to that madness. They ask Shalkoc if he remembers this fight.

Snar: Which fight?

Aerelia, quietly: My man…

Shalkoc remembers, thankfully. The Devas send a message asking for more assistance because they did not realise how strong a warrior Shalkoc is. It's in case he needs more "physical guidance". 2 Planetars arrive; Laurel and Hardy. We reach Shaik's office palace and are greeted by more Planetar guards. After a short wait, Shaik comes out to meet us. She is a dark-skinned, curly-haired woman with amber eyes and golden wings. She dismisses the guards and welcomes us. Ezeriel explains we wish for permission to attend the burial ceremony for his squad. "So you're the people Solara and the others sacrificed themselves for. I'm glad to see you alive." She asks what brought us here. Aviana urges Shalkoc to give Shaik chocolate. She accepts it and says it's very kind, but it would be a greater present to someone who might be hungry, or might never had chocolate before.

Fearghas asks Emilio if he ever had chocolate before. He has, but only likes the sweeter varieties.

Fearghas explains to Shaik about Shalkoc's contract to kill her. As soon as he drops Zariel's name, Shaik looks sad… "Another poor soul," she says. Fearghas says we only took the contract to save Plex' life. She says she is proud of us for speaking out, and standing against evil. We chose good despite there being no reward for it, and we should be proud of ourselves. Kyrin asks if there is a way out of Shalkoc's contract. Shaik says no, it's a lawful contract and it will not be broken. She tells of being in denial after Zariel's fall; she went to Asmodeus to bargain for Zariel's soul back. Asmodeus told her that Zariel had chosen her path. If a devil can own your soul, they can also sell it. It requires a legal contract, but that is the only way to get a soul back from a devil. We wonder what Zariel would want so much that she would trade Shalkoc's dragon soul for it… Fearghas suggests, very carefully, the threat of an invasion from Heaven. Preferrably on Dis, so Zariel gets shit from Dispater AND Asmodeus!

We consider killing Zariel somehow, and discuss the consequences for our souls. Technically, Zariel originates from Heaven, not Hell, so the only way to destroy her is to kill her in Heaven…

We conclude that we need to coerce Zariel to sell Shalkoc's soul back to him, and Kyrin's soul back to her. We ask Shaik for advice on how to get to the 3rd layer. She muses that an act of great craftsmanship could get us invited to Torag's realm, or maybe big dwarven heroics! Shalkoc asks Shaik "Where do angels cry?" Because angel tears can help people? He asks if people are going to cry at the funeral. Shaik's face goes to stone and she says you will not find angel tears in Heaven. You will have to go to the depths of Hell, where celestials are endlessly tortured in Mephistopheles' dungeons. That is what Silver Tears are.

I did not know… I did not know what Silver Tears were. Light forgive me. I did not know… The floor seems to shift under my feet, I clench my fists. My head burns. Do not fall and cry. There is nothing I can do now. But I know the truth.

Fearghas' idea:

  • Get to Dis (either through the Bronze Citadel, the Black Vents, or the River Styx).

  • Threaten Zariel to use the Beacon of Doom in Dis and let Heaven invade.

It's a dangerous plan relying on Zariel being complacent, Kyrin having been in Hell as her innocent-looking child form Miri.

Emilio wants to take part in threatening Zariel, so Fearghas asks if he has any means of coming back from the dead, just as a precaution. He does not, and can't carry Aviana's Hearthstone (too heavy). We plan on going to the Black Vents to at least figure out what is going on there. Whatever is there scares (?) Zariel, so we are interested.

pages.name: 81 - summary
pages.content:
The angelic tribunal of meet & greet

Fearghas makes water taste better. We are called one by one to stand before Verita and six Witnesses who determine how much helicopter parenting guidance we need to not burn down the place. When one of us is called in, the others play as the angelic Witnesses, friendliest PvP I have ever seen.

I am called in first, squeak a bit and sweat a lot, get the lowest level of guidance. Fearghas goes next and speaks about Torag, he is asked about the Void for some reason. He makes it out with level 2 guidance, basically just needs to catch up with an archon every few days, hopefully over tea and crumpets. Kyrin follows, she speaks honestly but the angels aren't fond of a roguish background. She gets out with level 3 guidance muttering about racist, what does racing have to do with all this…?

We all sweat when Emilio goes in. Verita asks if he wants his hands healed. Emilio says they're pretty useful. Upon being asked he speaks about his childhood but never mentions the Void by name. Technically not lying. He shows his best side and gets level 2 guidance, we all exhale. None of us are prepared for what follows.

Shalkoc goes in, says he forgot why he came here and talks about the food. Verita says that's a lie; not the food part, the forgetting part. He is great at remembering rules! Why? He forgot. Shalkoc visited many places: the cold place, the hot place, the dark place, the city where a friend grew up. The angels are bamboozled and gently ask if he is delayed in French and needs his mind healed. He declines, then asks a question to himself. The Witnesses are losing brain cells. Sheer chaos at the table. Shalkoc votes for himself. "Snar for president!" - Kyrin

Shalkoc is very proud of his level 5 guidance. Highest score. Fearghas facepalms so hard, Torag hears his desperate prayers. Aviana tries to emulate Shalkoc's high score, thankfully fails. She rambles a bit and flexes, sadly no effect on the blindfolded Witnesses. She gets level 2. We nearly forget about Plex, he was trying to be forgotten. He speaks about his curse, and says evildoers should be punished. Our good goblin asks clarification on the rules. Then Witness F asks the all-important question, "Do you wash your rice before you cook it?" and Plex replies "You're supposed to cook it?" That alone earns him level 3 guidance. We discuss our results, Plex nearly screws us over, and we head to the infirmary.

Aerelia chokes on carrots again, despite his efforts to break this particular curse. He was so close, only one carrot remained, but no, he was defeated by the penultimate orange root.

We chat with Ezeriel on the way, then spend 3 hours at the hospital having our wounds treated. Fearghas has a therapy session with nurse Valeriel. Plex gets told off for being nosy. Nurse Caelus looks at Emilio's hands and gives him a comforting talk. The head doctor Clementiel scolds me for channelling, advises me to heal more sustainably. As he turns to leave, he says "I recognise that staff you are carrying… Thank you."

Natural 20 on emotional damage.

Aviana is told to take better care of her wings, and has a conversation about the glorious harpy race. We meet Shalkoc's bodyguards Huey, Dewey, and Louie (nicknames Shalkoc can remember). Shalkoc says 6 is the double of 5, which causes psychic damage and Plex eats a rock out of sheer madness. Plex learns the spell Planetrotting, by doodling and thinking hard about Plane Shift. We go to the armoury to take away Shalkoc's toys, I cast a Remove Curse on him so he can unequip his cursed items without us all dogpiling on him. The angels realise Shalkoc is a lot stronger than they thought, so they call in 2 more powerful bodyguards, Laurel and Hardy.

We go see Shaik to request permission to attend the funeral for Ezeriel's squad, they all died to protect us after all. We tell her about the contract to kill her. She is saddened, we talk about Zariel and hatch a crazy plan…

Instead of using the strawberry field Beacon of Doom in Heaven, we go to Dis and threaten to use it there so the angels can invade. This will be our bargaining chip to buy back Shalkoc and Kyrin's souls from Zariel. Emilio loves the plan and wants to screw over Zariel personally. Do not see how any of this could possibly go wrong.

pages.name: 82 - Ideas are cheap, Plex' paint is expensive
pages.content:
Sunday, 3rd Decimus 1497

23:45

Shaik encourages us to talk about anything burdening our hearts. Fearghas explains his cunning plan to threaten to invade Hell, and asks for Shaik's support. We discuss what we do if Zariel doesn't agree to sell the souls back, so Fearghas mentions a possible Wish spell. Wish can go terribly wrong, and Fearghas mentions an Aeon that could undo a Wish. I have no idea what he is talking about, but Shaik grows very stern and asks how much he really knows about those creatures. Fearghas admits, not much. Shaik says, it would be better to keep it that way. Well that's ominous.

Shaik is unwilling to commit time and troops to threatening Zariel, especially since the plan could fail. Kyrin's contract is already failed, as she telepathically told Shaik about it. Shaik warns us to be VERY careful that Dispater does not learn of our plan. He is very paranoid, and any form of magical spying will be considerably more difficult. Shaik says that getting into Dis by sailing the River of Souls is not just a bad idea, it's a lot worse. Not to mention we'd have to be dead. We mention the Black Vents; Shaik questions the reliability of our intel. Don't blame her, this idea comes from Aviana overhearing devils chat about it… She also urges us to be super careful about it, research and scout.

Kyrin asks Shaik for help drafting another contract to reclaim her soul and Shalkoc's. She suggests we go to Mechanus to ask help from the Modrons, or any servant of Abadar. Plex casually says Mennon can probably write a good contract. Yes, the Archfey, the Unseelie Fey Lord. He can find all the loopholes, right? Fearghas vetoes, then drags his feet in telling Shaik about Mennon but eventually explains. Mennon is Plex' lord, and he was on a hunt for dragons and placed a mark on Shalkoc's soul.

Shaik says the Bronze Lady could help us; Brigh, goddess of clockword, invention, and timekeeping. Another reason to go to Mechanus? Her realm alone could inspire us. We should talk to Claude in the Library first, get papers in order, then go to Axis. Talking to Abadar's servants would also provide more information.

Do we have any more questions? I have so many questions. Can I do an internship here? Shaik speaks to me about life and death, and that my soul might belong on this plane? I prefer to live in the here and now. Shaik gives us permission to walk the Pilgrim's Path so we may attend the memorial for Ezeriel's squad. She also asks that we keep her updated. With final advice on being patient, and taking time to prepare, she lets us be on our way. In Heaven, we are as safe as we can be.

On our way back to the City, Ezeriel asks for a token from each of us (feather, scale, lock of hair…). Fearghas asks why, Ezeriel sort of dodges the question and only says it's important to him, and to history. "You'll see," he says. Plex asks for a token back, and Ezeriel offers a feather. Plex gives a piece of toenail. Emilio breaks a chip off his hand, it grows back, not creepy at all. Kyrin and me give a lock of hair. Fearghas gives a piece of beard. Shalkoc gives a scale and Aviana gives a feather, making a fuss.

Fearghas asks for hot springs nearby; Ezeriel says of course, there are the baths close to the infirmary. Baths! I'd love a good soak… Kyrin wants to go to an armourer for shopping. She is hoping to find armour for Aviana's wings that would allow her to fly. Jewelry would also be good! I mention it's the middle of the night, though the realm is bathed in twilight, and that maybe we should find a place to sleep. Fearghas asks for a place that sells spell scrolls, of course he does. Emilio seconds this? Ezeriel is confused; the spells aren't really for sale, more for teaching.

Aviana wants to buy a dress, and Plex wants holy robes. Ezeriel leaves, with the promise to see us on Wednesday for the memorial. Plex wants to hit the markets now in the middle of the night, grumbling about how on Promise, shops are closed at night. Aviana buys her dress for 15 gold. To learn a spell, you'd have to become an acolyte and commit to the angels' teachings. Fearghas is not willing to commit.

Kyrin spots a celestial from Nirvana who is painting his wings, with magic paint to not interfere with his ability to fly. Shalkoc struggles with himself, eyeing the paint like he wonders what it tastes like. Under Fearghas' withering glare, he keeps it together. The artistic angel, Ventriel, is a follower of Shaelyn, goddess of beauty and art. Plex introduces himself as Plex, follower of friends. The goblin is interested in the paint… Ventriel says he is an artist as well! Everybody is! Most people just don't know it yet! "Don't encourage him," I squeak. Fearghas glares. The angel and the goblin engage in active artistic talk while Kyrin giggles.

"Are you just trying to summon Smiler again?" Fearghas asks, menacingly. Plex dodges the question and says he will be painting on buildings. Ventriel prompts Plex on what kind of art he is planning on, exactly. Plex is not planning on anything, he just wants paint. Twelve pans of caint. He happily pays 120 gold for it, struggles counting his coins, upsets the cosmic order in the process, just Plex things. Kyrin looks for something that would allow Aviana to change the colour of her wings, which Ventriel considers to be perfectly reasonable. You gotta match those outfits after all. He could make it, but it will take some time, so he offers to contact Kyrin when it is done. It would cost the pretty sum of 5000 gold, half upfront. Kyrin agrees immediately.

Emilio buys a black pearl for 500 gold. Not a pirate ship. Shalkoc is cartoon-floating, nose following the smell of sweets baking. Kyrin buys Olykoeks (donuts) for everyone, including Shalkoc's bodyguards. Plex gives her a Potion of Heroism in return, which reminds Fearghas to look for alchemy supplies, but he has negative luck.

After the delicious sweet snack, we go to the Library where we meet Claude, a mechanical cube with spindly arms and legs, and a pair of wings that are definitely too small to lift him off the ground? He wears a monocle, very distinguished. He takes simple requests. VERY simple requests. He has way too much information on Avernus, and nothing on the Black Vents. Fearghas intellectually wrestles with the robot, gets an estimated wait time of 12 hours. Grumble.

We go to an inn and pay 15 gold per person, per night. The food is amazing though. We lose Shalkoc for a couple hours, he's just sitting there unresponsive, then he begins to talk our ears off. By that time it's 2 in the morning and no one is listening.

Monday, 4th Decimus, 1497

10:00

Short rest

When we arrive at the Library and check on Claude, he is struggling with the progress bar at 15%. Poor little guy, he just needs more time. Shalkoc and Aviana are dying to go to the baths and eat some tasty food. Plex tags along, then watches the sunset and sniffs his paint. Fearghas, Kyrin, and Emilio spend the whole day in the library, researching the old way. I accompany them at first but grow tired eventually, and head to the infirmary where I watch the nurses heal with innate magic, fascinated.

Tuesday, 5th Decimus, 1497

10:00

Short rest

Plex wakes us in the mid-morning, saying he has something to show us. He hurries to the kitchen, where they kindly shoo him out. We gather in a private dining room and have a good breakfast, where Plex shows us a black lantern, glowing with a blue light. Shalkoc and Aviana, not fully awake, leave the room to get more food. Plex swings the lantern excitedly. Fearghas reaches for it, screaming NOOOOOOO! Just then, the world blurs and I feel the typical sensation of teleportation, like having my stomach pulled through my nose.

We find ourselves standing on a large circular stone in an eerie swamp. A blood-red moon hangs in the sky, glaring at us with cold spite. (Realm effect: Blood Moon's Spite)

"Pleeeeeeeeeeex…" Fearghas says ominously.

"… oops?" the goblin replies.

Emilio shudders. Fearghas scolds Plex, and says we must stick together. He says we are somewhere between the Feywild and the Shadowfell?! And that last time they were here, things started attacking them. Stay in the lantern's light. The blood moon is new, last time this place was pitch black… I grab Kyrin's hand while she questions Plex on where we are and why. He tells the story of when he first found the lantern. (Read: The Lantern in Plex' Memories)

Plex wants to paint a tree. We look around for blobs of colour, no luck. The moon is either a new moon or a blood moon, it only has 2 phases. This one is the opposite of what the one on the Material Plane is. Holding the lantern, Plex walks up to a tree (so we all follow him to stay in the light) and begins to paint it bright blue. The bark shrivels up violently as if the paint was acid.

We follow a path of sorts through the marsh, and come across two Spriggans, plant creatures that resemble the Leshen, only much smaller (phew). One of them is carrying an unconscious Dryad. He jumps off and walks away as the other Spriggan spots us. It starts shrieking; words that Plex recognises as very distorted Sylvan. He tries to talk to the Spriggan. It does not work out.

Fearghas says if we stray too far from the lantern, we will be teleported back to where we came from. Every plant is diseased and covered in mould. It's as moudly as some places in the Underdark! Except this mould looks more… aggressive, somehow. Fearghas chucks a Fire Bolt on the Spriggan, which is still screaming. I summon Fade and timidly follow after Fearghas. I need a friend. Plex hides so well, I have no idea where he is. Emilio steps in front of me and casts… HELLFIRE?! It's a CANTRIP?! It misses, so he goes into Void Form and activates Netherwalk. Fade walks up behind Emilio, and takes a defensive stance (the Dodge action).

Kyrin walks up to Fade, and shoots the Spriggan with her bow. It does not hit. The Spriggan's bark skin grows darker and sturdier, like oak. It steps into one fallen tree… and out of the one right behind me. It sees Plex, and attacks him. The Spriggan slashes with his claws, and poisons Plex badly, I can't heal him unless I use a Lesser Restoration first to cure the poison… Our goblin is severely injured.

Fearghas launches Scorching Rays at the Spriggan, it doesn't burn as well as it did just a minute ago. Shoot. Fearghas insults him as a bonus action (Vicious Mockery). I reach out to Plex with a Healing Word and… my magic doesn't take hold. His complexion improves, I imagine the poison is gone, but his wounds aren't closing! Panicked, I step forward to cast a spell, but my mind resists it. I'm already concentrating to maintain Fade in this world… I stumble away, reaching out for my staff and lashing out with a Lightning Bolt.

Plex casts Blight on the Spriggan, which immediately kills it. I rush over to Plex and start dressing his wounds but my hands shake and I do a very poor job of it. Emilio pokes the dead Spriggan and Fearghas picks up some Bloodroot at the foot of the tree. Kyrin looks for flowers… everything here is dead or dying and rotting.

According to Plex, Spriggans (and also the Leshen) look like fey creatures, but very twisted. We follow the path the other Spriggan took. Off in the distance, we see a large tree. Red fluid flows into the tree and we hear… singing. Very ominous words:

By the moon's blood light, we stand,

To corrupt this creature of the land.

The heart of the wood, so pure and bright,

Will blacken and break in endless night.

Four red platforms surround the tree. The Dryad's body hangs in mid-air in a bubble of blood and energy, and the creatures that are chanting are Blood Hags. They spot us immediately, except Kyrin who is one with the shadows. One of the Hags has a ladle with a handle so long, it's practically a staff. She grins at us with FAR too many teeth, all the while stirring the cauldron in front of her. The Hags sing the next verse:

With raven's claw and eye of newt,

We nurture now a bitter root.

Her skin of bark will twist and thorn,

A monster in this clearing born.

They taunt us as we approach. We roll initiative. One of the Blood Hags slips on blood, falls into her own cauldron screaming as she is boiled alive, and dies. How unfortunate! Just Plex things.

I trash talk the nearest Hag and get cursed for my trouble. BAD curse, I can't do shit except hope to the goddesses that I pass the save. (Sanguine Curse) She then shoots Blood Bolts at Emilio, who slaps her with Hellish Rebuke, twice.

I PASS THE SAVE ON THE FIRST TRY for the low low price of 8 necrotic damage and a concentration save. Aaaand one level of exhaustion from the Realm Effect. I move closer, thinking only of saving the Dryad… and right into the range of the Hag up north. She casts Spike Growth, catching us all in the area. Difficult terrain, damage on movement. Blehblehbleh. Fade dashes to the nearest Hag, fangs bared. Emilio goes into Void Form, and shoots 3 blasts. Kyrin is sneaky sneaky and only reveals herself to shoot the Hag, and Mark the soul. She chucks a Psychic Blade, sadly misses, moves behind the rock.

Plex casts a Gravity Sinkhole then Fey Steps into a tree. Further Plex things, really. Fearghas drinks a Potion of Maximum Power and casts Scorching Ray at 4th level. Emilio gets cursed, burns an inspiration to pass the save. He cackles at the Hag. Fearghas frowns, Emilio is going off the deep end. The Hag scowls, then sings the third verse of the ritual!

Willow's sap will cease to flow,

Bitter ichor we bestow.

With spider's silk and serpent's skin,

Let all the foulest rot begin.

She tosses the ladle into the stew, and blood surges out and towards the tree. The wood creaks, and one of the four openings in the trunk closes. The unconscious Dryad spasms in agony and it looks a lot like bloodbending?! The Hag comes close, insulting Emilio. He fights back with a spirited "Try me!". He gets hit with a Blood Bolt, is poisoned, and fails the save so he has to hurt a creature before the end of his next turn. He slaps a Hellish Rebuke on the Hag and once more, Aerelia is passing all the saves tonightaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa.

The next Hag sings the fourth verse, then throws in the ladle, closing the south opening in the trunk!

The forest's plea, a mournful sound,

Is lost upon this blighted ground.

With sinner's spleen and powdered bone,

She'll rule a dark and twisted throne.

Fade bites at her and throws her down, but she shrugs it off and goes to taunt and attack Emilio. Plex casts Temporal Shunt in reaction, but the Hag passes the save. We yell at Aerelia a little bit. Emilio is injured pretty bad, and grappled. Then the Hag tries to PEEL OFF Emilio's face! He burns his last inspiration to make the save, grabbing her wrist to keep her hand off him. She lashes at him with her Blood-Drinking Hair but he saves, taking half damage. She heals for half the damage dealt!

Plex knows a thing or two about Hags… in the ritual he was involved in, there were 6 verses. We are running out of time!

Acting on instinct, I walk through the thorns and lay my hand on Emilio's back. "I put my hope in you," I tell him, and summon my strength to cast Regenerate. I add a Healing Word heightened to second level. He grins with an air of madness as he flexes his claws. He does a Phase Shift to the other side of the blood cauldron, then casts Eldritch Blast and pulls the Hag into the cauldron with Grasp of Hadar. She screeches as she dies in the boiling crimson liquid. But Emilio gets a wild magic surge and is incapable to speak any language, making animal noises instead. He barks at her…

Fade dashes to the Hag that ran to the west to take the place of her fallen sister. Kyrin shoots at that Hag and Marks the Soul. She throws a Psychic Blade into the Hag. Plex, this beautiful bastard. Plex, of the deepest of greens. Plex, goblin of many hats. PLEX CASTS SILENCE! I'm going to hug him, but not so tight he loses concentration. Fearghas casts Misty Step then moves to the platform next to Emilio. He casts, at 6th level, Traitorous Blood. And that's the bloodbending. "It's just a little enchantment magic, don't worry about it." - Fearghas

Fearghas makes the Hag dash towards him and Emilio, who takes an attack of opportunity with Reaping Claws against her as she passes. The Hag's mouth is forced shut; her eyes are full of horror at being on the receiving end of unholy-ass magic. I question Fearghas on this magic, but now is not the time nor the place… I cast a Chill Touch the bad touch on the Hag in the area of Silence. She tries to leave it, Fade bites her and trips her. Go Fade! But then the Hag gets to her feet and jumps out of the Silence spell. We almost had her. She casts a Sanguine Curse on Fearghas, but he saves. Seeing Plex' lantern, she shoots him with Blood Bolts but he Temporal Shunts her all the way into her next turn.

Fade tiptoes to the spot where the Hag will soon reappear, goes invisible, and readies to bite. Emilio realises he can't speak human languages anymore; his face goes blank, he ignores Fearghas' warning and goes to slice the Hag he is controlling, then uses Bloodrazor and walks up to Fade, ready for the other Hag to reappear. Kyrin sneaks up to the same spot, then unsheathes her Sun Blade, so we all know where she is.

Plex does "the obvious thing in this situation", and builds a wall of dirt with Mold Earth. Fearghas readies Ray of Frost, and makes his Hag ready Blood Bolt. The Hag appears. Fade bites her, drops her prone. Kyrin stabs her, shiningly! Except she rolls a 1 and she rolls a 2, and even with advantage none of this hits, blinded by her own sword… Fearghas releases his Ray of Frost and his Hag casts Blood Bolt. I release my Guiding Bolt.

The Hag is extremely confused by all that just happened. She snarls, "if we can't have her, you can't have her either!" and runs into the tree cackling and casting three Blood Bolts. Fade rushes in and bites the Hag. Emilio runs right after Fade and casts Steel Wind Strike on the Hag who is lying prone, so he gets advantage. With the ROAR of a T-rex, Emilio teleports behind the Hag and slashes her, tendrils bursting from his claws. His gauntlets devour the body until only a puddle of blood is left. I feel Fade's unease… what in the world makes an undead panther feel uneasy…

Combat ends, so I can go and verify for myself, unfortunately. I run to the Dryad, ignoring all else. She has been torn to pieces and is beyond saving. I fall to my knees screaming in frustration and pain. More corruption I could not stop. More twisted, sick magic I was powerless against! Fearghas asks me, if the corpse was whole, could you do anything? I'm not even sure. Fearghas casts Grave Craft nine times to get the body back together; it moves unnaturally and it takes most of my remaining strength of mind to watch. I make myself watch. I owe it to her.

Fearghas crushes a spellgem of Revivify and brings the Dryad back to life. She's unconscious, but breathing. The ritual was almost complete… the Dryad is warped, proportions off, skin hardened to bark, any gentleness gone from her features, her teeth are pointed and sharp.

Emilio's Void Form ends and he collapses, groaning and muttering weakly. I drop to my knees next to him, twisting the spellwards off my wrists. I cast at 8th level, Remove Curse. Emilio weakly kicks me away and huddles in a corner whispering "I'm sorry, it won't happen again, I promise, I didn't want to, I'm sorry, I did it again, never again, you mustn't know, I'm so sorry…" Kyrin and Fearghas try to comfort him, and he only pulls away in fear.

Plex painted the Hag blue while nobody was looking; even Emilio chuckles at this. Fearghas interrogates her, with Plex casting Detect Thoughts on her. Her thoughts are of spite and glee… and a complete absence of fear. She asks Fearghas which crone taught him the bloodbending. "That's none of yer business," he says. The Hag says, this is the art of "the mother". Fearghas asks who that is. "The one-eyed, the queen of us, the goddess of fallen and destitute women. The goddess of spite, the angry hag. You come here, to her realm, and you don't even know the mother's name? You use her arts, and you don't even honour the mother's name?" And then insults follow, I ain't writing that.

Fearghas makes her eat one of her own fingers. Emilio shakily gets up and attemps Intimidation. He rolls a 29. He squeezes her shoulder and threatens to show her "true madness and fear", worse than anything he has been through in 15 years. The Hag lashes out (verbally); "what do YOU know of suffering", no man shall show her suffering, it would all be child's play. What she experienced would break any man. "It did break me, but I grew from it. I became the very monsters who broke me." Plex, reading the Hag's thoughts, sees irrational hatred and spite.

Fearghas asks the name of the one-eyed, what she is doing to the Feywild, and why. The Hag says she cannot say that to us, and grins. She says she can introduce Kyrin and us to her, we assume because we're women. Emilio lashes out in defence of us. The Hag taunts. Kyrin casts Psychic Whispers so the Hag can speak to her without any man hearing.

Things the Hag says to Kyrin in her mind:

  • If Kyrin mentions Gyronna's name in the hearing of a man, her gaze will be upon her, and she will take vengeance.

  • The Hags were turning the Dryad into something "more useful" (a Spriggan). So all Spriggans are females, woops I called them "he"…

  • Plex has stolen the lantern from "her first daughter" (Elsa??)

  • Plex kept secrets from us… what else is he keeping?

  • The lantern steals joy and colour; they pass through here, but don't stay

Out loud, Fearghas asks why the Feywild is being targeted. "The Feywild is everything that we should have. It doesn't deserve what it is, what it has, what it ever has been," the Hag says. The realm we are in now is called Muravelara. She talks shit that we don't know which plane we are in.

What plane are we in…?

We're in the Abyss.

WE'RE IN THE ABYSS.

Fearghas makes the Hag disembowel herself. I dodge the guts and blood. Emilio slumps down and takes a deep breath. The others loot the place. I find I am clutching my dagger in a white-knuckled grip, barely in control of myself. Staring at the Hag's corpse I feel vague… disappointment. Her last taunt to me rings in my ears, "You'll feel right at home here…"

Loot:

  • Potions of Heroism 2

  • Mage Wine 4

  • Abyssal Nail Polish 5

We investigate the area, which means several skill checks and consequences for failure.

Plex, Emilio, Fearghas, and Kyrin stand in a circle and all punch the person to their left after all failed a Nature check. I see my friends brutally descend into madness and hit one another with irrational spite. I scream at them to stop but they can't.

I pass the check, so I find a Staff of Placeholder because the DM hasn't made it yet.

We roll investigation, with further anger and slaps from the ones who fail. We find the Hags' full chant. The two last verses, which we managed to stop, are:

The ancient evils stir and creep,

While the unwary woods now sleep.

This sacred form, we shall defile,

With poisoned thought and hateful guile.

The charm is cast, the soup is brewed,

Her gentle soul is now subdued.

From slumber deep, she will arise,

With burning rage within her eyes!

DM asks me to roll Arcana with advantage. I roll a 22. The corruption here is different from the magic of the Sibriex but… the corruption on that Dryad is much like what I saw on the monster I killed in its lair… My staff feels so much heavier as we shuffle away from this place to use the lantern again, and return to Heaven.

pages.name: 82.1 - Empty history
pages.content:
Freedom was a fight to the death. Unfettered, Emilio's claws slashed air and flesh, spilling dark blood and tearing life essence. It was sweet, not of taste but of feeling. It felt like life, stealing it from a threat and pulling it into himself. All life had to eat, eat or die. Now Emilio was eating, and the Hag was his prey.

"What a pretty boy," the crone sneered. "I wonder how you will taste?"

"Try me!" The words were a growl.

Her magic hit him, twisted power ripping at his flesh. Diseased blood infected him, sapping his strength. He fought it, snarling. The Void in his flesh swirled, fuelling his strength. Magic did his bidding even in this form, magic as ravenous as his mind. Fire formed in his mind; he hurled it from the distant stars. Flames fell from another sky, purple flames that devoured. The Hag screeched, her magic rising to shield her. Too late; the wrinkled skin was marred with burns. Blood for blood. If he was slow, if he stumbled, if his strength failed him, Emilio would die.

He loved every second of it. Cosmic energy blazed in his veins. No cowering in the shadows, no looking over his shoulder. His own blood on his tongue invigorated him. The Hag reached out with crooked fingers, claws. They could not be as sharp as his. Brittle bones and thin skin! Fingers like steel wrapped around his throat; the other hand rushed towards his face. No claws sharper than his! He had been broken and remade in a primal vortex. No crone, no matter how magical, would undo him!

Emilio's claws shot up, scoring the Hag's wrist as he grabbed her arm. Something flashed in her eyes — not fear, but spite. He grinned. Two could play this game. He squeezed the fragile wrist; the muscles under his fingers tensed, the creature's breath grew shallow. Pain. She was hurting. Emilio's own wounds seemed distant. His grin widened as she struggled. Before he could snap her bones, she wrenched her arm free. Disappointing, but there would be other chances. Emilio crouched to lunge at her throat. He had not thought her hair would be a weapon.

Tangled greasy locks whipped at him, latching onto his skin. Pain seared through him, his strength leeching from his limbs. For a second his vision blurred; he forced his eyes to focus. Control — he'd had to seize control, a lifetime ago. He held control. His body, his hands, they answered his command, they were in his grasp. He would not let his knees bend. He would not fall. With a roar, he turned his will to physical strength and slashed through the disgusting hair. Separated from the Hag's body the ends that touched him fell dead, leaving angry marks on his skin, oozing blood. He would heal, later. Once he'd killed her, he would eat. Emilio would feel better then. He moved to attack, limbs heavy. His blood was sluggish. He would not get dizzy. Win first. Live, then sleep. Fight on. Fight on!

A light touch on his back. Emilio would have spun around and gutted whatever approached him, but he sensed no threat behind him. A killer, he would have felt coming; bloodlust was impossible to hide from him. The Void pulsed with bloodlust; he knew it as well as his heartbeat. On the small of his back was Naami's hand.

Why was she here? Up close? Was she mad?

"I put my hope in you," she whispered.

Overwhelming magic blossomed, power capable of tearing through reality. Naami's magic was gentle, washing over him like deep silence. Darkness without a sound, dreamless sleep. For a moment out of time, his mind bathed in blessed quiet. Emotion floated away. The struggle for survival, his eternal fight, was distant and muted. He took a deep breath, drinking in the regenerative calm. The spell sank into his body, mending cuts and bruises, lending him strength. Another healing spell filled him with bursting energy. As his body was restored, his mind returned. In the next heartbeat, he was fighting again.

Claws flexing, he bared his teeth. His own energy surged from deep within. Emilio glimpsed the fabric of the world, saw himself placed on it. Through that weave, he shifted. He appeared a short distance away, his understanding of reality fading. More importantly, he stood on the other side of the boiling pool, the crimson cauldron the Hag had been stirring. It roiled by his feet, noxious fumes drifting up. With a laugh, Emilio raised his hand towards the Hag. Eldritch energy burst from his claws, hitting the crone's body. She spat at him, shrugging off the attack. Exultant, Emilio commanded the magic as a part of himself. Grasp, pull. The Hag's face dropped in surprise as Emilio's spell yanked her towards him.

Her feet caught on gnarled roots; with a screech she tipped forward and plunged into the boiling cauldron. Blood hissed, erupting, dragging the foul creature under. Boiled by her own magic. Emilio's blood sang in triumph, his mind rejoicing in the kill. Sated? Never. But for a short while he felt joy, an all-consuming golden fire within.

His own magic flared around him. Emilio spun, sensing energy wrap around his head, around his throat. Panicked, he raised his claws and the magic fled, having wrought its change. A wild magic surge! The insides of his skull twisted in agony. No! He had won! He was alive! He opened his mouth to shout an insult at the dying Hag, to assert his victory and defy the unpredictable magic. "I am no one's prey!" The words formed within, and refused to come out. A dog's deep bark broke out of him. Confusion. Words? They were inside, barely. He grasped at meanings, catching nothing but smoke.

It was the wild magic. His words… His humanity… He fought to hold them close. He fought as if drowning; magic was stronger than him, all around his mind, submerging his thoughts. Verbs warped into images, sentences became smells. Close by, Fearghas shouted. Emilio smelled another Hag and threw himself at her. Control slipped his grasp. He fumbled for it, for what made him human and not voidborn. Both hunted. Both ate. Both killed. Which was he?

Lyrielle…

He tore blood from that other Hag; his mind sharpened to a razor blade, Emilio wrapped a mist of blood around his claws. He would kill that Hag too, and the last one behind the tree. He would kill, then he would eat. He would live. His past was only a history of killing and eating. Even after he escaped the Void… his mind recoiled at the memory. Head spinning, his world narrowed to a point, the tip of a claw. Survival instinct needed no language. He needed no words.

The last Hag appeared, from being shunted through time by Plex' magic; the party's attacks converged on her. Emilio tried to reach her, tried to attack. His body would not move, his mind at war with itself.

"If I can't have her," the Hag shrieked, "you can't have her either!"

Running from magical attacks, dodging weapon strikes, the Hag rushed into the tree. Her shadowy form a blur, Fade followed. Emilio found he could run after her. Feline limbs would move. An animal would chase after its prey. A voidborn would kill and eat. Emilio moved as both. A spell that required no words… he knew one. Claws catching the blood moon's light, he draped magic over them and over himself. One with his claws, one with his spell, one with his killing instinct. A hollow wind carried him to his prey, who had fallen to Fade's jaws. A roar burst from his chest, louder than human lungs could produce. It was the roar of a mighty beast. Emilio was a beast again. Before language, there had been roars. Before eating, there had been devouring. Before humanity, there had been the voidborn.

And a voidborn was hungry. A voidborn was tortured by hunger, starving, always ravenous. Emilio… was voidborn. His claws tore into the Hag's body, sinking into the flesh. He cackled and exulted, delighting in tearing his prey to shreds. But there could be no waste, not in a place as hostile as the Far Realms. Food was so scarce. Tendrils slithered from his claws, plunging into his prey's body. Prey was food. Food was life. The tendrils tore chunks from the Hag, absorbing them. The claws snapped bones, drinking in their dust. The still-warm corpse was reduced to essence, feeding Emilio's gauntlets, feeding the void inside. He tried to fill his past with the life force of the creature. He absorbed it to sate a void. He was instinct. He would survive.

Emilio stood in the ecstasy of having consumed a threat to his life. He barely saw Naami run past him, past the puddle of blood in front of him. Nothing else remained from the Hag. Through a red haze, Emilio saw the Dryad's body, torn apart in the Hag's last act of defiance. How the crone had paid for that! Death sought life, vengeance sought injury. He wanted to laugh. Somehow, Naami's scream stopped him. Why would a voidborn pause for a Halfling's voice…?

The healer knelt by the Dryad's ruined body, screaming and sobbing. Her small form shook as she clenched her fists. Frustration… rage… pain… Emilio could nearly taste them. Fearghas stepped to Naami. They spoke. Words were no use to a beast. The Dwarf's magic forced the Fey's body back together, torn limbs knitting to chest and hips. Naami watched, eyes wide, her cheeks glistening. Why cry? Why hurt? Another creature was dead. That was cause for joy. Joy, and feasting. Emilio's hands burnt, his claws twitching. A Fey would taste better than that Hag, despite the corruption marring her body. He lifted his hand.

Fearghas crushed a gem, releasing the spell within. The Dryad's chest stirred, breath returning. Disappointment, swept away by anger. That he would dare steal prey! Emilio's breathing quickened, the blood roaring through his veins. He would not allow that. Could not allow that. How… dare…

With a sound like star shards shattering, the power left Emilio. It was always abrupt, going from the absolute freedom of his Void Form, back to a stealthy disguise. Usually, he tracked time and was prepared for it. This time, something cracked like a whip in his mind. The world tilted nauseatingly around him; pain flared in his side. He had collapsed on the rough bark.

Emilio was human. Humans did not devour other creatures without leaving so much as a bone behind. Pain wracked him, body in mind, memories flooding his brain. He tried to let them out, tried to speak, but there were no words to be made. There was no humanity in him to form sentences. He sobbed; he heard himself whimper like a wounded dog.

Naami knelt beside him. Her magic… different. Powerful as earlier, even more powerful. A spell was laid atop him, not a spell to repair and heal but a spell to undo and purify. The quiet enveloped his mind again. He nearly gave in to it, nearly let it cradle his aching soul — then he felt the positive energy reach his hands, and panic took over. How would the gauntlets react? If they attacked her… if they tried to devour her just like he had devoured the Hag…

Emilio had no strength left, but he had to protect her. With a gasp of pain, he kicked Naami away. She gave a surprised squeak; he saw exhaustion on her face. He saw her wrists bare, the safety of her spellwards discarded for a moment. He felt the magic that lingered on him; it pulsed with power, with Naami's life force. She had overexerted herself to cast that spell. Idiot. She had been warned about that.

"I'm sorry," Emilio said.

Searing pain cut through his brain and was gone in an instant. His thoughts were back to normal, back to what they had been after learning to speak. His words… he really was human. And with language returning, guilt crushed him. He could not keep it quiet; it cut him inside.

"I'm so sorry. It won't happen again, I promise. I didn't want to! I'm sorry. I did it again, never again, you mustn't know, I'm so sorry…"

The words spilled from him, just as sharp on their way out. He could not stop them. Kyrin and Fearghas crouched by his side, offering comforting words. But… he could not receive them. He had no right, not after what he had done. Not after today. Not… not ever. Never! He could not be trusted around people! He would… again…

"Leave him," Kyrin said. Sadness in her voice? "We can't help him now. We need to be asking some questions first."

"You've got this, son," Fearghas said. Kindness. Emilio sobbed. "Plex? What did you do to the Hag?"

"That's rich coming from you, Fearghas," Naami muttered. "Are you controlling her body? What kind of magic is that, blood magic?"

"Just a little enchantment. Don't worry about it." The dwarf shrugged.

Emilio raised his head just a little. If there was danger… if they had to fight… he would protect. The small green wizard stood proudly next to the crone, brush in hand, admiring his work. The Hag was painted from head to toe in vivid blue. Behind him, Naami snorted. Surprising himself, Emilio chuckled.

"Well," the dwarf said, "artistic inclinations notwithstanding… Plex, your assistance?"

The goblin nodded enthusiastically, casting a spell of his own. Emilio recognised the pattern; a spell to search someone's mind. It was to be an interrogation. Predictably, the Hag refused to cooperate. Fearghas' frustration rose despite Plex' effort to read the creature's thoughts. Twisting his fingers in unsettling patterns, Fearghas forced the creature to eat one of her own fingers. Naami pressed her hands to her stomach, face drained of colour. They… needed him. Shaking, wrestling with his own body, Emilio stood. Weariness held him in a death grip, but his heart still beat. He approached the Hag, glaring.

"Answer the questions. Now. Or I will show you true madness and fear. I will show you worse than what I've been through the last fifteen years."

"What do you know of suffering," she spat. "No man shall show me suffering. It would be child's play! What I have lived through would break any man."

Emilio smiled, though there was no joy in it. That was almost reassuring. He shuddered at the memory of the exhilaration that came with killing. It would return. He did not fear it, as long as he too would return from it. Despite the gravity of the situation, he delighted in every word he managed to speak.

"It did break me," he said softly, "but I grew from it. I became the very monsters that broke me."

On the last sentence, his voice became steel. Plex shook his head.

"More spite," the goblin said. "Hatred. So much hatred."

"What are you doing to the Feywild, and why?" Fearghas snapped. "Who is the one-eyed?"

"I cannot tell you that," the crone said with an ominous sneer. "I could introduce them to her."

She nodded to Naami and Kyrin. "You're not doing a thing to them!" Emilio said.

"Because we're women, I assume." Kyrin stepped forward, wisps of magic curling like smoke around her. "Fine. Say it to me, then. The men won't hear."

Faint whispers just on the edge of hearing told Emilio that Kyrin was using telepathy. She would give them a report later. Silence stretched uncomfortably before the changeling signalled she was done.

"Why is the Feywild being targeted?" Fearghas asked aloud.

"The Feywild is everything that we should have," the hateful creature grated. "It doesn't deserve what it is, what it has, what it ever has been! This place… Muravelara… is what we get."

"That's… not a place I've heard of," the dwarf grumbled.

The Hag's eyes widened in outrage. "You come here, using the mother's arts, refusing to honour her name, and you don't even know where you are? What plane you are in?"

"I can guess," Fearghas said sombrely. "The Abyss."

"The Abyss!" She cackled. "You're in the Abyss! I'll kill you and corrupt your corpses!"

Naami was in front of the Hag, dagger drawn and glowing in the sickly light. "You're not doing any more of that, you fiend," the little healer spat.

The monster only cackled louder. "The Abyss! You'll feel right at home here, little one…"

Naami's knuckles on her weapon went bone white.

"Enough!" Fearghas said and gestured sharply.

Still laughing madly, the Hag plunged her fingernails into her stomach, pulling and dragging, collapsing as her guts spilled out. Naami leapt back, swaying on her feet. She sheathed her dagger with jerky motions, her entire body stiff. Emilio had a good idea of what she was feeling. From her stance, her shifting glance, the set of her jaw… disappointment. A shiver raced down his spine; before he knew it, his back slammed into the giant tree's bark. He slumped to the ground, breathing, just breathing. He could not bring himself to do much else. It was a victory. He was alive. He was Emilio.

pages.name: 82 - summary
pages.content:
Ideas are cheap, Plex' paint is expensive

Kyrin fails her contract by speaking to Shaik about it. We have a long talk with the marshal, explain our plan to get into Dis and threaten Zariel. She advises us to research and scout the Black Vents before rushing in, not that we would EVER rush in with 0 prep, haha. We could go to Mechanus for inspiration from Brigh, goddess of clockwork. We get permission to walk the Pilgrim's Path to the second layer to attend the memorial for Ezeriel's squad.

To Plex' great delight, we go shopping in the middle of the night. We find an angel by the name of Ventriel painting his wings. Kyrin commissions an item that will change the colour of our harpy's wings so she can match her outfits. Plex talks art for hours before buying several pans of caint cans of paint and breaking the universe with math. Emilio buys a spell component and we all talk about pirates for some reason? Then Kyrin treats us all to unpronounceable donuts, yippee!

We go to the Library and meet Claude, a Quadron. Communication is difficult, we leave him searching for information on a way down to Dis. It will take a long time so we go back to the inn where we eat amazing food.

We spend the next day chilling, as Claude is still looking for the information we requested. Shalkoc, Aviana, and Plex go to the baths and eat delicious food. Fearghas, Kyrin, and Emilio hit the books. I tag along with them for a while, then my neck gets all achy so I go to the infirmary and watch the angels work their healing. I receive 2 flasks of holy water during that time, for reasons best left unsaid. Imagine reading your spells properly.

Our Tuesday begins with Plex banging on our doors because his lantern is glowing. We go eat breakfast; as Shalkoc and Aviana leave the room for more food, Plex activates his lantern and teleports us into an eerie swamp bathed in the light of a blood moon. We don't know where we are. Plex doesn't know where we are. Stay close to the lantern. aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa

This realm has two moon phases, blood moon and new moon, opposite of the moon in the Material Plane. Plants are dead or dying of rot and mould. We trudge through the marsh and find 2 Spriggans, fight and kill one of them (not before he slaps Plex real hard). The other runs away carrying an unconscious Dryad. We give chase, and run into a ritual held by 4 Blood Hags.

We roll initiative, one of them falls into her own cauldron and dies, thank you Plex! Terrifying battle ensues, we try to stop the ritual to save the Dryad. Predictably, it does not go well. We do stop the ritual, Fearghas uses bloodbending on a Hag and now controls her, I give him the side eye, we will have WORDS about this later. The Dryad died, torn apart by the last Hag before we could kill her. We don't know how Emilio killed that Hag really, we found him next to a puddle of blood, the Hag's body nowhere to be seen. Fade was there and saw it happen, but she can't speak and she's just really uneasy. What spooks an undead shadow panther anyway…?

Fearghas reassembles the Dryad and brings her back to life, but she is mostly corrupted into a Spriggan now. Emilio got a surge that makes him incapable of speaking a language, he just makes animal noises. He reverts to his human form after combat and collapses. I channel an 8th-level Remove Curse on him, he kicks me away. Ability to speak restored, he curls into a ball whimpering "I'm sorry, I did it again, I'm so sorry" over and over. Fearghas and Kyrin try to comfort him, but only Plex can get a chuckle out of him.

How? Plex painted the Hag blue while nobody was looking.

We interrogate the Hag with some old-fashioned torture and intimidation. Kyrin telepathically learns some info about "the mother", a one-eyed goddess who hates men. The Hag talks mad shit and tells us we are in a realm called Muravelara. We realise we don't know what plane we are in.

The Abyss. We're in the Abyss. Of course we're in the Abyss.

I flop on my couch and scream into a pillow, then return to take more notes.

We find loot, investigate for more loot, everyone except me goes mad with spite and hits one another. Eventually we awkwardly leave this place with:

  • a Sickle of Bountiful Harvest and a Spriggan Staff
  • 2 Potions of Heroism and 4 Mage Wines
  • 5 Abyssal Nail Polish bottles
  • and the full song the Hags were singing as part of their ritual

We return to Heaven feeling defeated, carrying the corrupted Dryad in the hope the angels can do something for her.

pages.name: 83 - Tangled roots
pages.content:
Tuesday, 5th Decimus, 1497

13:22

Plex picks up all the loot while Fearghas is distracted. He finds some Troll Musk Concentrate (1), Sneezing Powder (1), Vanishing Velvet (4), and Wandering Wart (1).

Back in Heaven, Shalkoc and Aviana are absolutely not worried about us and are happily eating sandwiches and swiping food from the buffet for when we return. The angels tell them off, predictably. They try to sneak off as much food as they can. Ah yes, the Barbarian Path of the Primal Squirrel. They investigate the lantern but roll like concentrated essence of ass, grab the lantern, and go to the baths. At one point the lantern's faint glow disappears and we all pop up… outside Heaven's Gates. A very confused Pit Fiend and 2 Merregons look at us. The celestials atop the wall are equally confused. The corrupted Dryad appears next to us, still unconscious.

Well, shit.

Kyrin slaps down her Snortable Portable Hole to push the Dryad in. Plex casts Darkness. One of the Merregons attacks me but gets a surge and starts drowning in air, he can breathe water though! He also gets slapped by the realm effect Forced Peace. Emilio Eldritch Blasts it and kills it, then jumps into Kyrin's hole. I scream at the angels to let us in, looks like they are planning to do just that! Then I grab the Dryad and drag her into the hole with me. Now there is one sentient (debatable) root, one potato, and one traumatised boy in the hole, in addition to the vegetables stored in there.

The Pit Fiend casts Fireball. Fearghas dodges for half, Kyrin has the sickest dodges and takes no damage. Plex ran away so he doesn't get hit. Then the Pit Fiend uses Terminal Command to order his friend to walk up to us and explode. Nani?! Fearghas runs behind Plex towards the gates. Kyrin picks up the hole with all of us in it and teleports, then dashes right up to the gates. Plex does a Fey Step closer to the gates, and grabs Fearghas with a Vortex Warp.

The Pit Fiend moves up to Plex, close enough to count his hats. Fearghas grabs him into a Dimension Door and the celestials swoop down to pick us up. We get told that we have to go through registration again, no exceptions. Kyrin is treated with less suspicion this time, and our guidance levels are lower than last time. The Dryad is taken to the hospital in the meantime. We return to the inn where we find Shalkoc with his guards, who are flabbergasted to see Shalkoc is STILL eating.

Huey, Dewey, Louie, Laurel, and Hardy ask if we are fine. Fearghas lightly says we are fine. I glare at him. Shalkoc asks if we found some food. Fearghas says no, Emilio looks very green in the face. Plex casually says "I guess we'll have to find another way to the Abyss next time."

Silence. You can hear a pin drop in the room. The five angels says "the WHAT?!" in perfect unison. Plex backpedals and lies. The angels question him. Fearghas masterfully saves the situation, by just telling the truth. That easy, huh. Shalkoc's bodyguards are horrified by Fearghas' story, and one of them immediately informed one of his superior. We might have to answer a few more questions. The celestials suggest we go join Aviana at the baths to relax, as we all look pretty roughed up.

Shalkoc wants to find a big tree to meditate under, after eating all this food. He gets inspiration twice, from eating a pickle and looking at Emilio's cloak. Jackpot! We start talking about burgers. Emilio really does not look well. We go to the baths and find Aviana, wearing only a towel, who thought we were stuck inside the lantern and poured some bathwater into it so we'd have something to drink. Plex teleports himself into the water fully clothed. The floors are dented as if she had been banging the lantern onto the marble.

Emilio has never been to a bathhouse. He hesitantly dips a finger in. Fearghas explains, then disrobes and jumps in. I follow suit; Emilio is more hesitant but reluctantly takes off his cat-eared hoodie and the rest of his gear, and gets in. Fearghas is embarrassed that I'm so close and looks away, I'm not paying attention, just making bubbles. Aviana demands an orange from Plex in exchange for the lantern, then chases him around whipping a towel. Kyrin is washing the soot from her clothes. Emilio is floating and relaxing a little bit, his gauntlets cleaner than I've ever seen them. Fearghas begins the five-stage process of cleaning a dwarven beard.

Fearghas stays about half an hour, then heads to the library. Emilio follows after a while. The others begin to leave one by one. I stay for a good three hours, just enjoying the water. Aviana is the only one still soaking when I go looking for the others. And Plex, who is sitting in the cleavage of the water-pouring statue. Aviana tells him to get down because "Thou shalt not defile that which is sacred" and boobs are sacred. Aerelia inspiredly says "Yeah!". It's canon. Female clerics can use their boobs as holy symbols. Plex jumps down as Fearghas yells "Do a flip!" We find Shalkoc banging his head on a tree, trying to trigger a surge.
