We head to the library, and as we open the door we start to cough in a wave of grey smoke. Claude the librarian is smoking next to a pile of tomes, the research we requested from him. The Quadron's eyes are rolling in their sockets, gone blue, his mouth is smoking. He is stuck in an error and reboot loop from researching the Void… Fearghas, Emilio, and myself realise trying to help might be dangerous because of Void corruption. Plex tries to fix him, passes an INT save… Aviana knows how to fix him, and casts Concussive Maintenance Mending.

"Sometimes it's a stroke of genius, sometimes it's just a stroke." - Kyrin, casually throwing the table into chaos.

Aviana knocked Claude on the head so hard he forgot the last backup, and restored data from before he was researching the Void. Shalkoc wants to take Claude home. His bodyguards are not pleased with him. Aviana nearly breaks Claude all over again; I kindly ask the Quadron to cancel the request for information about the Void.

I ask Claude about his research about Ley Lines. They criss-cross the land, often following its contours, carrying magic. People often recognise the signs of Ley Lines without realising what they are. They often follow waterways, as they also take the path of lesser resistance. People have tried to use them, but it's dangerous. They vary in intensity, and can be harnessed. Fey Roads or Shadow Roads are tied to Ley Lines. Harnessing Ley Lines is taxing and dangerous. On one, you can tap into its power to regain spell slots, or recharge a magic item (conditions apply).

Ley magic: special spells that can only be cast with the help of a Ley Line. Practicing Ley magic without being properly trained will result in channelling fatigue.

Kyrin gets some good hints about Changelings; the Mistborn isles, where a Shadow Road is said to exist, suggesting a connection between Kyrin's race and the Shadowfell. Psionics are said to be connected to the Maelstrom and Gem Dragons.

Shalkoc: Am I a gem dragon??

Laurel: You may not be a gem dragon, but you certainly are a gem.

Aviana: A secondhand gem maybe.

Fearghas tells Plex, again, that the Void Dragon is not his friend and wants to kill him. Aviana asks Emilio about "friendship in the Void". Emilio says that in the Void, there is no friendship, only "feast or be fed on". He concludes the Void Dragon is out to dine on Plex, who has shown himself as weaker and thereby, a tasty morsel. Emilio theorises that Plex made a pact, not with the dragon but with a higher entity, and maybe that higher entity sent the Void Dragon as food FOR PLEX. The dragon is either Plex' death or his dinner, depending on Plex' strength.

I suggest Plex start lifting weights with Aviana then. She is thrilled. Emilio is getting frustrated trying to explain the Void to Plex and Shalkoc, but a binary concept is proving too difficult for them. Plex wants the dragon as a pet. That is not in the list of options. The list has only two items; eat it, or be eaten by it.

Kyrin is bamboozled and asks why the Void Dragon is hunting Plex, so Fearghas explains. Painfully, but mainly hilariously. Emilio loses his shit when he learns about the Demilich Plex chucked into the Void. Fearghas grabs his book on Avernus and starts to read, grinding his teeth noisily. Something about a planar wound (the planes had fused because of a Wish spell, the devils tore it open, Asmodeus just left it open, that's what the Black Vents are) and the Demon Lord of Monsters and multitude, Echidna Lamashtu.

How to remove a permanent curse on an object: either through a Wish spell, or maybe by transferring the curse to a living creature. Some ancient priests in the Redwind Sands did such a thing. Well, before they were the Redwind Sands, of course. Mukashi, mukashi.

There is a note on a Guardian Golem waiting for us on Friday 8th Decimus between 4:30am and 4:35am at gate C3H8 in Mechanus for us to visit. We'll head there after our next long rest. We plan to head to Avernus after visiting Mechanus, if possible.

Research done (for now), we go to the infirmary to check on the Dryad. Caelus asks what happened to us?! I say a goblin with a lantern happened, it's best not to pry too much. We enquire about the Dryad, Caelus asks us to wait a while. Fearghas explains to Aviana what happened to the Dryad. After a few moments, Master Clementiel appears and asks if we saved the Dryad's life. He can't let us see her… her wounds have been healed but she reacted to healing magic by growing bark. She became very aggressive when someone tried to water the plants, and the healers had to detain her. She's presumably already killed someone and is raging that no one will defile her forest. The same thing the Spriggan said before attacking us…

Aviana suggests a Love Potion. Fearghas shoots her down, verbally. The Dryad has been locked in an atrium with plants around her. The angels tried to heal her mind, but there was nothing to "fix". We visit the Dryad, bearing Clementiel's warnings in mind. She is pacing, her face haunted, looking for intruders. Clementiel casts Tongues on us all so we can speak to the Dryad.

She's disturbed and angry. Everybody wants to hurt her forest. This is not her forest. I ask where she is from, but she doesn't know. "Moonlit Grove" is the only name she knows. (Plex knows about 15 Moonlit Groves…) Kyrin asks for her name ("Ah goddammit!" - the DM), and what is the last thing she remembers from her grove? Her name is Joline, and the last she remembers is cold despair overcoming her, all the joy drained from her. She remembers crying, her tears were strange colours. Kyrin explains to her all that happened, about the Hags, and what is happening to the Feywild. The lanterns draining the Feywild belong to Elsa, first daughter of the goddess of Hags.

Aviana draws a circle, sits cross-legged in it and tries to meditate, to commune with spirits.

When Joline hears Kyrin's story, the trees around her start to tremble, leaves falling like it's suddenly winter. The roots pierce the ground and grow spikes that surround the Dryad, weaving a protective shell around her, Fearghas thinks. Plex corrects him; the trees are protecting her, the Dryad isn't doing anything. Embers appear in the trees' bark, as if after a wildfire, after we say we are going after the one who is doing this to the Feywild. Charred branches fall, and the Dryad looks charred as well, anger in her eyes. It's not the confused madness from before. She asks who did this.

Plex says it's Elsa. Kyrin asks if Joline saw any lantern, but she doesn't know what a lantern is, so Plex shows his lantern. The moment Joline sees the lantern, a wall of thorns pops up, hitting the barrier the celestials put up. Kyrin enquires further about lanterns but Joline is back to mad rage, accusing us of defiling her forest, threatening to make us pay, and trying to escape her prison.

Kyrin uses Psychic Whispers to speak to Joline in her mind, saying we aren't responsible and to please stop attacking. She responds out loud, "Why should I believe you? Everyone is after my forest. Everyone who says they want to help are lying!" Emilio says he has no reason to lie; the Hag tried to hurt him, and he will find it and kill it.

Aviana tries to calm Joline with a ritual, kind of like Beast Sense, that's why she was sitting in a circle. She is trying to improwise a new spell. We all roll a WIS save, miraculously all pass because Aviana has no idea what she is doing. She is just trying to "send good vibes". It backfires, Aviana feels Joline's rage aaaaaaand she goes into Barbarian Rage. She knows how to harness it, and does not lose her mind. She shares with Joline her focused rage; the tangled roots begin to loosen and open up. They're still charred and thorny, and the Dryad steps forward. She says:

"Let me out of here. I will not hurt anybody here. You've done nothing to my forest, but I will hunt the one that hurt my forest, until the end of the world if I have to."

She asks where Elsa is, if we can find her. Joline decides she will look for her with us. She is not asking. I ask her if she would be okay leading the efforts to find Elsa. The DM forgets to answer this, don't blame ya Aerelia, there is a lot going on. After discussing among ourselves, we give Joline a choice: send her back to the Feywild, or come to Promise and look over my trees (I disagree).

She is confused that nobody is looking after our forest. We say there is a spider looking after it (Kali). She wants to come to Promise and take care of the forest, as mortals are no good with that. She demands to be let out of her prison in Heaven.

Plex says cutting trees is like leather clothes. Only Aviana understands this, and explains. Shalkoc gets it. The rest of us are confused.

Fearghas pops a spellgem of Sending to contact Kali and explain the situation, warn her to not let anyone near Joline's grove. We warn Joline about Kali's appearance. Another Sending to Gavel to tell him what's going on. Then, we speak with the angels to ask Joline be released. And finally, Aviana yanks the Transdimensional Anchorchain to open the portal to Promise, with the wizards' help so she can make the superhigh DC. She fails twice, blames Plex, tries again. With a roar for effect, she takes the tug-of-war stance. Plex helps, by jumping up and grabbing the chain, hanging from it.

The portal opens! We see Kali through it but she doesn't seem to see us? It's a one-way portal because we're in Heaven. Fearghas wants to launch me like a pebble. We let Joline go through, and the portal closes. Aviana says this is all thanks to Plex.

We go to the markets again for spell components, and a towel for Aviana (among others). Afterwards, we return to the inn. Fearghas checks on Kyrin, and rages about the Lawful Stupid alignment (Plex'). I go check on Emilio because he was looking mighty green earlier.

Wednesday, 6th Decimus, 1497

7:47

Short rest

We head to the Pilgrim's Path. There are small shrines on the way with lit candles and offerings. The cliff face is very steep; lichen grows in places, sometimes sprinkled with flowers. Kyrin asks if she may pick a few. Huey, Dewey, and Louie say yes. One of the Planetars (Laurel) is going ahead… and disappears. We catch up, don't see him. Then Hardy disappears from behind us. One after the other, we appear in Mercuria. The time it takes for each of us is different, we all wander at our own pace. In total it's a good 7-hour walk. I pass through first, and Fearghas is last (after grumbling to Shalkoc who was second-to-last). He mutters very heartily, and louder by the second! Until it reaches the ears of Torag, who says, if you're having trouble with anger management, try journalling! Write it in a book! Fearghas yells about his Hall of Grudges, and passes through! He suddenly pops up ahead of us, screaming and raging. Laurel asks if he is okay. I offer him a cookie. He lifts his magical tankard, fills it with ale, and downs it in one go.

We round a corner and come to a lush valley, spreading out before us. This is Iomedae's realm, the Halls of Valor. I have words with Fearghas about his blood magic. The others thought I'd yell at him but… to be honest I'm mostly worried about him. About what the darkness of these spells would do to him, to his soul. He waves my concerns away, says he's fine. I'm not entirely convinced… I admit I'm also really unsettled by that magic. When Fearghas asks why, I say "because those spells hurt everyone". He argues it doesn't, really, and those spells are a last resort. We grumble back and forth about magic and evil.

pages.name: 83.1 - A sweet tea
pages.content:
There was no night in Heaven. For someone who had lived most of his life in darkness, it was more than a little unsettling. Not really a matter of sleep — Emilio could sleep when he wanted to. He'd had to learn this. And he loved sunlight. But this constant glow, even during the nightly hours, felt wrong. It reminded him all too keenly that, once more, he was not in the Material Plane. He was in another world, one he understood so much less than home.

Emilio's room was comfortable, with a lot of space even for a single person. He imagined it had been designed by and for winged people. The wood panelling was simple but elegant, the bed was soft and comfortable. There was no fireplace like those Emilio was used to; instead, one of the walls had a niche holding a large, milky orange crystal. If he touched the surface, he could adjust the temperature it radiated into the room. He needed one of those in his room on Promise. A washstand was topped by a gleaming silvery tap. A small table bore a lamp filled with scented oil, and had two cushioned chairs on either side. At the foot of the bed stood a chest without a lock.

A timid knock at the door. Emilio jumped, though he had known it would come.

He made his voice steady. "Enter."

The panelled door swung without a sound as Naami stepped in, carrying a tray. The Halfling looked a lot better than she had; her scrapes and burns had been healed, but she still looked weary. Some of that fatigue… Emilio looked away. He sat cross-legged on his bed, in full view from the door. Clearly, angels had no need for privacy screens.

"I brought you something to eat," Naami said, setting her tray on the small table. "It should help you feel better."

"I'm not hungry." Emilio's voice came out rougher than he intended. Control. Never let them smell your fear.

He'd anticipated she would notice. There had been chaos at dinner, with Kyrin shifting her appearance to Shalkoc's while the real Shalkoc sipped soup, talking herbs with Naami. Fearghas had had to stop Aviana from putting a collar and leash on Plex while he obliviously changed the colours of his mushroom dish, trying to make every fungus its own vibrant shade. His task accomplished, the goblin had promptly forgotten the grilled mushrooms and become fascinated with his fork, of all things. Fearghas' Mage Hand was holding a vial filled with a bright pink liquid out of Aviana's reach. Fake Shalkoc and real Shalkoc were duelling with chicken drumsticks. Shalkoc's five bodyguards watched with faces carefully blank. Emilio had endured as long as he could before muttering an excuse and slipping out.

"You didn't touch your food," Naami said. "You'll need your strength tomorrow."

"I'm fine, really."

He still dodged her eyes. She would look at him with worry and some confusion. He was sure of it. The concern… he could not face it. Would not face it. Not after kicking her away. Not after what he'd done. He had not even lied; he didn't feel hungry. Well, his stomach growled occasionally. But he felt… fed. That sensation was familiar, to an extent. He had been hunted by voidborn. He had fought them and killed them, so of course he had eaten them. Well, the gauntlets had. That was natural. Voidborn ate other voidborn, and Emilio was part voidborn. What he had tried, unsuccessfully, to explain to Plex was the simple logic of the Void; you fight, or you flee. If you fight and win, you eat, and you live. Outside the Void, it was a lot more complicated. People didn't eat people. Even something as twisted and disgusting as a Blood Hag… was not voidborn. He had done it again.

He was nauseous, not from hunger. Against his better judgement, he glanced at the tray Naami had brought. It held a bowl, blessedly covered, a small teapot, and two mugs. Smells wafted into the room despite the lid. It smelled… good. Vegetables, grain, and broth. Probably a nutritious meal to help a sick person recover. But Emilio wasn't sick. He had… he was…

A monster. The smells of food were too much. Emilio's head spun, his stomach clenched painfully. Sweating with the effort of fighting the nausea, he gritted his teeth. Bile burnt his throat. He could not have stood even had he tried to. Don't let it show. Never show weakness. If he looked like prey for just a second, he would become prey. His hands trembled. He could not assume his Void Form now; the earlier fight had drained him. Magic…? He could summon a minor spell. Enough to repel an attack. It would buy him time. He could escape into the Astral Plane, just long enough to recover.

"You don't look fine at all."

Naami's voice. She had taken a step closer. There was no threat coming from her, but Emilio fought down panic. She must not know. None of them must know. If they learnt what he had done, they would execute him like a rabid animal. Was that not what he had shown himself to be? A beast.

"I… I'm tired from the fight," he forced out. "I'll eat later."

She reached a hand towards him, hesitated. "May I take a look at you? If you're ill, I can help."

He nearly laughed. "I'm not ill."

Uneasy silence. Then, she sighed and drew a chair.

"I'm not good with combat," she said, as if to herself. "I loose my cool. I panic. I use magic impulsively, and tax myself. But I am good at treating injuries and diseases. I see things others don't notice. I know you're not feeling well, and you don't want me to know. I won't pry any more. You probably have a good reason. I'm not here to force you."

He looked up, then. She was tiny, sitting with her eyes down, her hands clasped above the table. She looked weak. She wouldn't survive a minute in the Void.

"How did you survive this long?" He had not meant to ask, really.

"By not being alone. The times when I had nobody… that's when it got bad. That's when I thought I would die. You're not alone now."

There was warmth in Emilio's chest. Confused, he felt at his heart. Much like in the baths earlier, his shoulders relaxed. It reminded him of Lyrielle. The feeling nearly drove the nausea away for a moment. It was frightening… it was good.

"Thank you," Emilio said.

Naami nodded. "Do you feel up to some tea?"

He grimaced. "Can try…?"

She poured two cups, and handed one to him. Light green, the warm liquid had a delicate herbal scent. It seemed mixed with some kind of milk. Emilio just held the cup, feeling the warmth. Naami took a sip and grinned.

"No pressure to try it," she said, "but I think it's lovely. A sweet tea does wonders for bitter memories."

It certainly smelled lovely. Emilio's stomach rumbled and twisted. He hoped Naami had not heard it. He thought she had.

"Your hands," she said. Emilio tensed. "The angels called it a "disfigurement". Scars. I thought so too, at first, though more along the lines of a curse. The more I see you fight, the less convinced I am. They don't feel like a wound that can be healed. They're not… damage. They're a part of you, just as Aviana's wings are part of her. Aren't they?"

He nodded. Relief warred with fear. She knew about him. She… knew about him? Having this secret found out… was also a weight lifted from his shoulders. He had been so worried she would try to heal his hands, to undo… whatever magic had brought him and the gauntlets together. Would they have lashed out? Would they have hurt her? Or worse… Out of that fear, he had kicked her away. Protected her from what he was. Emilio did not think he could stomach any of the tea. At least the liquid wasn't red. With trembling hands, he set the cup on the nightstand. Naami gave him a sad look.

"I don't know much about the Void," she said, conspicuously looking away. "As much as I'd like to keep it that way, I don't think any of us will have the luxury. When we fight more of the creatures from there, I'm counting on you. I'll take the liberty to assume, from experience… not every battle takes a toll on you. In fact I've never seen you this drained after a fight. No, you don't need to confirm or deny. I'm not here to press you on it. I'm just… speaking my theories out loud. Honestly, I blame Fearghas. That magic of his! Would mess up anyone's stomach, and then some."

He let her speak. It was oddly comfortable, especially as he had expected to be pushed for answers. This party… they didn't need to focus on survival. They had enough power to not be threatened by most situations. His body and mind railed against the emerging sense of comfort. Never relax. Never let your guard down. One moment of relief, of thinking he was home and safe… Memories of his village. Naami's voice faded to a murmur as Emilio's hearing was overcome with a rushing sound like a waterfall. Cold sweat. He had to fight for breath. Never again. The portal… His head spun.

"Emilio?"

Gasping, he snapped out of it. He sensed magic, Naami's. A spell, not yet released. He had both hands pressed to his stomach.

"Never again," he whispered. He clung to the very words, unwilling to let their echo fade.

Warm cloth on his forehead, wiping away the sweat. Naami was right in front of him. So small. Anyone else, he might have attacked. She probably could not save herself. Even exhausted as he was, he could — Her magic washed over him, weak yet soothing. Emilio's body softened, his mind began to slow. Reluctantly, the nausea retreated.

"Then we'll do our best so it doesn't happen again. All of us. Together."

Emilio's breath caught, his throat aching. She couldn't know. She must not. For the first time in three years, he wanted to cry. It's too late. It has already happened. I tried to prove I'm human. Will I become a beast again?

"We can't ask Claude for research," he heard himself say. "Too dangerous. And Plex still thinks the Void Dragon is his friend!"

She shook her head. "Don't remind me."

And that portal is still open. Has the village changed at all?

Another silence, less awkward this time. He sensed… resolve from her. She sat on the bed in front of him, looking at her hands. No, she was staring at her spellwards. One of the silvery bracelets had a sooty stain on it. She rubbed at the stain. It showed no sign of fading.

"Before we entered the Sibriex lair," she began, her voice trembling, "I showed my memories. Remember? Images through the telepathic bond. I could not put them into words. Even now, I would be hard-pressed to do so. Then, it was impossible, the words would just not come out. I know I've gained some manner of forgiveness, attained some form of redemption. It helps. But I don't know if I can ever forgive myself. Being here surrounded by angels… they are lovely people, so kind and sweet. But I close my eyes, and I see the one I killed. You know? Wounds may heal, but they leave scars. Some memories lose their edge, but they never fade."

She closed her eyes. She carried her staff lashed to her back, as usual. She rarely even let it out of her sight. Emilio assumed it was because the staff was her weapon, her means of defending herself.

"I don't think the others told you," she continued. "The first time I came to Promise, we talked about Matron Vandree. We asked Kali if she knew anything. She suggested… oh, she was very direct about how much trouble I was in. She said we should h-hire a… a demon… for help. Everyone just treated it as a rational argument. Well, Fearghas wasn't too thrilled. But Aviana seemed to think it was a good idea. She pulled an angel's dress from her pack, I'm not sure how she got her hands on it. And all I could see were memories of the Sibriex lair and the tortured angel. Their words… they brought up memories to beat at my mind. Look, I've been a healer my whole life. I've seen bad wounds, and people who were really sick. I have a strong stomach. That day, I threw up all over the floor. I was so ashamed. I'm not, now. I'm not sure why I'm telling you this. I just want you to know… there is no shame in having horrors in your past. There is no shame in losing to them, even a hundred times. No shame in being unable to get a word out. We keep fighting. If one day the words come to you, and you want to speak them? You know where to find me."

Emilio was shivering, his back pressed against the wall. The exhaustion from the battle, the strain of fighting the nausea, the fear of confessing his real nature… his body was so heavy. Breathing was a struggle. He was just so drained. He wanted to be rid of his burdens but he could not set them down, not yet.

"I've seen you angry," Naami said, looking past him. "I've seen you exhausted, and overwhelmed. Mostly I've seen you cold and controlled. I think after today's battle, it was the first time I saw you afraid."

Never show fear. Never let others see your weaknesses. The weak were devoured. The strong feasted. Naami was weak, and strong. Yet somehow, Emilio did not fear her. Yes, I was afraid. He would never admit it, never be made to admit it. Hollow shadows swirled around his heart, keeping it shrouded, keeping him safe. He was not sure when the darkness had come. He knew it was here. It had not stopped light from coming into his life. Doing the right thing. He understood that now.

"I'm sorry for kicking you," he said.

"Ah, you're fine. I don't hold it against you. I think I startled you? It was a powerful spell I cast on you without warning. You just looked like you… needed it. Urgently."

The memories from the surge flooded back. With considerable effort, Emilio suppressed a shudder. "You were right," he said. "Why did you not strike me back?"

"For kicking me?"

He nodded. She thought for a moment.

"Because it's not what I do. I make people better. And, maybe that's selfish? I refuse to let the Hag be right about me, when she said I would be right at home in the Abyss. I'm not a demon; I'm a healer. If that means I will take hits, fine. I'll be who I am. Forgive violence. Heal fear. I'll make the choice to be kind, as many times as it takes."

A choice. Emilio could also make a choice; he would not hurt her. He held control. If he lost it, he would seize it again. He took a deep breath to steady himself, and reached for the cup of tea. It was wonderfully sweet.

pages.name: 83 - summary
pages.content:
Tangled roots

Plex picks up all the loot while Fearghas is distracted.

In Heaven, Shalkoc and Aviana are stuffing their faces with sandwiches, not worried about us at all. Aviana goes to the baths, taking the lantern.

We teleport back to Heaven but appear outside the gates, where a bunch of confused devils attempt to grill us, literally. We get into Kyrin's hole as planned, and are picked up by the angels. We have to go through registration again, then meet up with Shalkoc. His bodyguards are flabbergasted by the sheer quantity of food he's eaten, showing no sign of stopping. Fearghas says he will get very fat. Shalkoc asks if we found any food in the Lantern Realm. Emilio goes green. Plex, noting the absence of his lantern, casually says "we'll have to find another way to the Abyss next time". Predictably, the angels are not fans of the Abyss.

We go meet up with Aviana, who is pouring her bathwater into the lantern, so we can have something to drink in there. We have ourselves a nice soak, even Emilio relaxes. Fearghas goes through the five-step process of cleaning a dwarven beard. Plex climbs into the cleavage of the marble statue pouring water into the pools. Kyrin does her laundry. I make bubbles in the water. Meanwhile Shalkoc finds a tree to meditate under, gets bored of meditating, bangs his head against the tree to trigger a surge.

We go to the library, where Claude the Quadron nearly set himself on fire by getting stuck in a boot loop. Aviana has a stroke of genius and performs concussive maintenance, saving his life. Then tries to break him all over again. Turns out researching the Void is not too healthy. We learn really cool bits and pieces about Ley Lines and Changelings.

We have a long, frustrating discussion about the Void Dragon. Emilio tries to explain there are no friends in the Void, it's "feast or be fed on". Plex refuses to understand the dragon wants to snack on him. Our warlock nearly has a fit when he learns of the Demilich Plex chucked into the portal. Kyrin is bamboozled, so Fearghas tells her the whole story.

Fearghas rage-reads about the Black Vents being a planar wound that Asmodeus decided to not do anything about. The Demon Lord of Monsters and multitude, Lamashtu, is involved. Not demon shullbit again… We also find clues on how to remove curses from objects, might find further clues in the Redwind Sands?

A Guardian Golem will wait for us at gate C3H8 in Mechanus on Friday 8th Decimus between 4:30am and 4:35am. This shit gonna be fire yo.

We go check on the Dryad in the infirmary. It is not going well. It is going the opposite of well. They had to lock her up because she went on a murderous rampage when plants were watered. We have a long and tense discussion with her. Aviana does a meditative pose, gets very angry. Joline the Dryad now understands the Barbarian rage and wants to hunt some Hags. We eventually send her to Promise to take care of the Nirvana trees, what could possibly go wrong?

Aviana tugs Promise to her with the anchor chain, all thanks to Plex. We go shop for spell components, then have some character moments at the inn.

The next day, we climb the Pilgrim's Path to Mercuria. Fearghas has some trouble with the contemplative walk, shouts so loud Torag can hear him. As we enter the Halls of Valor, I have an uncomfortable conversation with Fearghas about his blood magic. They seem evil to me, I worry they will harm him somehow. He says he is fine (tm) and evil magic can be used for good! I'm not super convinced, but can't find really good arguments.

pages.name: 84 - I am a healer, but...
pages.content:
Wednesday, 6th of Decimus, 1497

18:00

We walk through rolling plains and past giant statues. After 2 hours, we reach a new statue surrounded by a gathering of angels in a somber mood. Some are in full armour, carrying weapons. Ezeriel is here, his armour heavily damaged. He welcomes us, and begins the ceremony. Everyone sits down in the grass, us included. Celestials step forth, telling stories of the fallen and their heroic sacrifices. We are encouraged to speak as well, but no pressure. Emilio says a few words of thanks and bows, leaving Ezeriel weeping. I speak as well, thanking the angels for saving us, and promising they will live on in our hearts. Aviana says "good job!", which gives Ezeriel a chuckle. Shalkoc places dried meat on the statue as an offering, which confuses most of the people present.

Ezeriel closes the ceremony by placing seven crystals containing the tokens we gave him. The angels get up, adjusting armour like they're going into battle. Ezeriel explains that as a tribute to the fallen, there will be a friendly martial competition. There is protective magic that will keep us safe, and we are welcome to join. The game is called Champion of the Hill, he explains the rules to us. Essentially the team with the most members left on the hill when time runs out, wins.

Kyrin and myself are elected as team captains. Kyrin picks Emilio, Plex, and Shalkoc. I pick Aviana and Fearghas, and Ezeriel joins my team to make up the numbers. We get a full refresh before starting. We put our heads together and discuss strategy. Plex wants to immediately concede. Emilio and Fearghas look a little too happy about this whole thing.

We roll initiative, Aviana says "Let's do this!", stomps down, and her skin turns yellow. Super Chicken. She rages and runs into the circle. She earns the Bear's Blessing. I step forward and cast Living Shadows, but Plex responds with Temporal Shunt. All our plans are in tatters. Ezeriel flies into the circle and casts Sacred Flame on Emilio, dealing minor damage, and probably just stoking his fighting spirit. Shalkoc steps into the circle with Step of the Wind, then punches Aviana but she dodges. They end up happily bumping first, with no damage occurring. Shalkoc shifts to Turtle Stance.

Kyrin teleports into the circle and slashes at Aviana with the Sun Blade. It's a crit on Aviana! Oh… ooooh no. Her Unflinching feature triggers! She heals for most of the damage, but Kyrin still slaps Mark Soul on her. Aviana reflects all 90 damage on Kyrin. For the Yu-gi-oh players, this is during the damage step. Welp, no response. Emilio casts Dissonant Whispers on Aviana, who rolls a dirty 0 on the WIS save. Ouchie. He goes into Void Form and uses Phase Shift to teleport into the circle next to Kyrin. Plex puts Fearghas into a box with Wall of Stone. He casts Dimension Door and appears in the circle, close to Plex. Then he summons a Spiritual Weapon and whacks the hell out of Plex.

Round change! Kyrin - 4 / Naami - 3

Aviana pops a mythic power, Legendary Vigor and proceeds to punt Shalkoc 200 feet backwards, at the speed of light itself. For the low, low price of a bonus action. She grabs Kyrin and squeezes the life out of her, literally, she passes out just dangling in the harpy's claws. The arena's magic takes hold and teleports Kyrin outside of it, restoring her to full health. Aviana is not done grappling, and grabs Emilio.

I appear from the Temporal Shunt, very confused. Walking into the circle, I slam down the Staff of Power and surround myself with Wall of Force. No one is getting me out of that circle. NO ONE. Ezeriel swoops down and bonks Emilio, who tries to slice in response but the angel dodges. Shalkoc is chilling over in Africa, in Turtle Stance too… He ends the stance, toggles Step of the Wind, and dashes back into the arena some 100 feet. Kyrin teleports right back into the circle, close enough to touch Aviana's feathers. She tries to whack her with the Sun Blade, but Aviana dodges.

Emilio gives Aviana a smug grin, then Phase Shifts away… into my Wall of Force. Aviana follows. It sure is crowded under this glass now… Emilio is slicing away at Aviana, but she reflects even more than she took. He slices at her again, and that's a crit! What could possibly go wrong? She uses Stone's Endurance as a reaction, reducing the damage. She also heals back more than she took, and inflicts Frightened on Emilio, Shalkoc, Kyrin, and Plex! The entire enemy team wants to run away! Go Aviana! But her skin changes colour again, she is now half-yellow, half-grey, like a very old chicken.

Plex dashes behind the nearest rock to break line of sight. This pleases Fearghas greatly. He chases Plex with the Spiritual Weapon, tries to chuck his axe at him, it does not go well. Not only does he miss but Plex tries a Temporal Shunt on him. Fearghas responds with a Magic Mirror, bouncing the spell back on Shalkoc. Chain 3! Shalkoc fails the save and is shunted through time. Fearghas fires a 7th-level Magic Missile on Plex, who becomes the first goblin in history to look down the barrel of a minigun. He drops and reappears outside the arena as Fearghas is BEAMING. He does not care about winning.

Round change! Kyrin - 2 / Naami - 7

Aviana feels kinda stuck in the Wall of Force. She offers a Bugman's Ale to Emilio so he can be immune to fear and they can have their 1v1. She asks that I drop the Wall of Force. I ask if she has a good plan. She says no, but she has a plan. I drop the Wall of Force. She bear-hugs Emilio, then drop-kicks Kyrin, punting her all the way to Antartica.

Emilio insulted my damage. So I take off my spellwards and pull radiant power into myself. "I am a healer, but…" and I fire a 9th-level Guiding Bolt. Emilio moves his head to the side, dodging at the cost of a strand of hair. Tee-hee, that was intentional of course, I didn't really want to hurt you. My spell shoots into the sky like a second sun, woops? Ezeriel bonks Emilio, and he reappears outside the arena.

Shalkoc reappears, confused. Me too, buddy, me too. He goes to Turtle Stance, and fails the save against Aviana's fear. Kyrin also fails her save, but she is a Rogue so she screws the rules and shoots at Fearghas. Emilio runs towards us and casts Void Torrent on all of us inside the circle. Everyone but me passes the save, owwie. He teleports into the circle.

Plex casts Jim's Magic Missile, creating TWENTY twisting, whistling, hypoallergenic, gluten-free darts of magical force to pepper us all. Alas, he gets greedy and the missiles explode in his face. But Emilio uses a Dreamfeather, allowing him to reroll! And it's not a nat 1! Thanks to Plex' Gravity Well, he pushes Fearghas, Aviana, Ezeriel, and myself out of the circle! And a free Crushing Impact on Fearghas to slap him down because he can. He Fey Steps to the East… just short of the circle. The missiles are too much for Fearghas, who reappears outside the arena.

Fearghas faces a dilemma. Teleport into the circle and win the game? Or blast the ever-living hell out of Plex? Fearghas chooses violence in the form of a 5th-level Scorching Ray on Plex, who responds with Temporal Shunt.

"Why is Shalkoc 200 feet in the air?!" - Karnack

"Oh sorry I forgot to put him down." - Aerelia

Anyways, that's a Magic Mirror from Fearghas, and 5 of his Scorching Rays hit, 2 of them crits. He burns Plex to a crisp, causing him to reappear outside the arena. Emilio is alone in the circle, and the game ends in a tie. Fearghas has earned the biggest victory of his life.

"Best funeral ever!" - Plex, who was killed twice in the scuffle.

Ezeriel commends us on not holding back, even against our own friends. Oh, if he knew the thoughts that went through Fearghas' head. Aviana distributes Bugman's Ale. Shalkoc's bodyguards gently say we should return to Treshhold, now that we have done what we were allowed here to do. We get back there in the middle of the night, about 3am. We return to the inn and shuffle to bed.

Thursday, 7th Decimus, 1497

Long rest

Kyrin goes to the markets to buy a very specific item, the Painter's Plume. Emilio casually buys diamond dust. I (re)stock on spell components. We spend a day relaxing before our appointment in Axis in the early hours of Friday.

At dinner, Kyrin gives the Painter's Plume to Aviana. She immediately puts on the jewelry and turns her wings brilliant white like a angel's, with golden feathertips. She gives Kyrin a pair of heeled shoes in return. We turn in early, but as I am about to go to bed, Master Clementiel comes to ask me for a conversation. He looks unwell, we walk for a while and he asks me to tell him about Lioriel… the angel I found in the Sibriex lair before I met the party. I struggle to get the words out, but I tell him. He leads me to a statue that was built as a memorial to Lioriel, whom Clementiel reveals was his brother. The Staff of Power I carry… it was Lioriel's. He was a healer with a burning heart, blinding him to the risks. Much like me, he wasn't a combatant… When he heard the desperate prayers of mortals trapped in the lair, he flied to their aid.

Clementiel sees the same traits in me as he saw in his brother, and he wishes to guide me as he failed to guide Lioriel. Not by restraining and forbidding, but by guiding and steadying. He asks me to accept this guidance, in the form of the Angel's Grace, a robe of white and silver with immense power, most of it still dormant. If I accept the guidance and act accordingly, the robe's power will awaken. I am honoured to accept this gift… as Clementiel leaves, I remain by the statue for a little while, praying and meditating, feeling the shadows around my heart dissipating.

Shalkoc wakes us in the middle of the night, like 2:30am. Fearghas is not impressed by my resplendent white dress, but Aviana does draw attention to it, and shifts the colour of her wings to match my robe. I don't feel quite worthy, yet… I'm a little embarrassed. But… I had not realised how cold I had been inside, since Lioriel's death. There is such warmth, now.

We go to the armoury to get Shalkoc's magic items back. He gets a little pat on the head for behaving so well. Laurel says Shalkoc VASTLY exceeded his expectations. By doing nothing. Their expectations must have been somewhere in the Lower Planes at this point… Shalkoc is very pleased. The bodyguards collectively sigh.

We gather around and Fearghas casts Plane Shift. Our stomachs are pulled through our noses again! We arrive on the single layer of Mechanus, Axis. The realm effect, Clockwork Precision, will remove advantage/disadvantage and force our rolls to be as close to 10 as possible, before modifiers. Nice and smooth. Flatten curves. Nothing is random. It sure is interesting here though, endless cities within giant gears, everything moving in perfect sync. "Don't even think about it, Plex," says the DM. (Well that's goblinist profiling now.) Each giant gear has its own gravity.

"They probably have very advanced technology here," Aviana says, "maybe we can use some of that for Promise!"

"Yeah we just need to kidnap the right people," Shalkoc says.

Just then, the ground quakes. I fall down, and find Plex, Shalkoc, and Emilio prone next to me. A titan topped by a castle took one step, tripping half of us. We finally look around, and find we are standing in a long hallway, right in front of gate C3H8. A Guardian Golem, its body inscribed with glowing blue runes, comes over to us, its movement unexpectedly dextrous. It greets us, and Fearghas gives our invitation from Claude. We state our full names, under threat of being kicked out. We also have to state our intent. Fearghas glares at us, especially at Shalkoc. "Behave yourselves, and be careful what you say."

We walk along a bronze wall. It looks smooth from afar, but… it's engraved with tiny letters in every known language. It states all the laws of Mechanus… That wall is extremely long. There are very long guidelines on the topic of changing the colour of structures. That means no painting, Plex. Aviana, we know you are dense, but you are not a building. Shalkoc what do you mean there is no gravity, we've just been over that!

We enter a giant engine room. Out-of-character, for a locomotive. It starts moving! Like a wagon or cart, without any horses! And there are no mages around… But gods, it's loud. So much steam is coming from the exhaust pipes. Smooth ride, if loud. Fearghas casts Detect Magic, but there is barely any around… just for lighting lanterns. The engines aren't magical… how mysterious.

After a 10-mn ride, we ride across a gap between gears. I look down… factories and cities. A clockwork dragon! There are airships. Beaming with pride, Plex says it can only be the work of Flax. We arrive in a city of towering buildings… is this how a spiderling feels? Tiny and easily crushed… The Golem guides us through metal hallways. This is Brigh's realm, the Citadel of Resplendent Clockwork. He leads us to a clockmaker, a servant of Brigh.

The light in the corridor suddenly goes red, sirens blare "Attention. Anomaly detected. Containment procedure started." Emilio… senses other Voidborn. As we round a corner into an open courtyard, we spot FIVE void portals, much bigger than the one we closed in the Underdark. Out of all five at the same time, a single creature slithers out, all tentacles and glowing red eyes and maws.

"It's basically the size of a gundam." - Emilio

Modrons flock to the portals to close them. Emilio looks delighted! And hungry…

pages.name: 84 - summary
pages.content:
I am a healer, but…

We have a long walk through the plains to a new monument commemorating Ezeriel's squad. There is a short and very emotional ceremony, other angels share their memories of the departed. We are invited to speak as well. Emilio expresses heartfelt thanks, and I promise Ezeriel's squad will live on in our hearts. Aviana goes "good job!". Shalkoc offers dried meat, confusing the angels.

Well, food is sacred to Shalkoc, it makes sense. Kinda.

Ezeriel places seven crystals on the statue, containing the tokens we gave him. The locks of hair are well and good but the goblin toenail nearly breaks the DM. As part of honouring the departed, we are invited to take part in a battle game, Champion of the Hill. A spell protects us from death, so we can go all out. Oh dear.

We make 2 teams: Kyrin, Emilio, Plex, and Shalkoc on one side; Aviana, Fearghas, Ezeriel, and myself on the other side. We discuss strategy for a little bit, a bit disturbed by Emilio and Fearghas looking way too eager to fight.

Aviana turns yellow first thing in the fight. Super Chicken. Plex shunts me through time. Ezeriel hits Emilio but only pisses him off, presumably. Shalkoc and Aviana have a friendly fist bump. Kyrin slaps a juicy crit on Aviana, bad idea that, hell breaks lose. (For the Yu-gi-oh players, Aviana reflecting 90 damage on Kyrin happens during the damage step, no response possible.) Plex puts Fearghas into a box, he teleports out with a shrug. Then he summons his spiritual axe and begins to whack the hell out of Plex.

Aviana cheats pops a mythic power! That alone nearly wins us the game, as she punts Shalkoc out of the battlemap. I happily put myself under a glass made of Wall of Force. No one is getting me off that hill. Emilio teleports under my glass, taking Aviana with him. It sure is crowded in here. Aviana's skin goes grey as well and she is now a very angry, very large cockatiel.

Aviana: "Naami can you drop that Wall of Force?"

Me: "Why, you have a good plan?"

Aviana: "No, but I have a plan."

Me: "Ah okay then."

I drop the Wall of Force. The harpy gives Emilio a bear hug, then punts Kyrin halfway to the Howling Wastes. I decide to use a gasp DAMAGE SPELL. 9th-level Guiding Bolt makes like a second little sun in the sky, how happy! I totally miss my target though.

Plex casts Jim's Magic Missile, and it would have blown up in his face if not for Emilio's Dreamfeather! Plex is really not very lucky in gambling but keeps trying, good job Plex!

Fearghas has to choose between getting on the hill and winning us the game, or throwing the game to kill Plex. He makes the choice of the great personal victory and burns the goblin to a crisp.

"Why is Shalkoc 200 feet in the air?!" - Karnack

"Oh sorry I forgot to put him down." - Aerelia

"Best funeral ever!" - Plex, who was killed twice.

We return to Threshold, crash into bed, and take a long rest over the next day.

During downtime:

  • Aviana receives FASHION, gives fashion back
  • Emilio casually buys diamond dust
  • Clementiel comes to see me for a very emotional conversation about his brother Lioriel, the angel I found in the first Sibriex lair I was in
  • I receive Angel's Grace, a robe of great power and Clementiel's guidance to me
  • Shalkoc proudly wakes us at 2:30 am and we get his magic items back
  • Shalkoc VASTLY exceeded his bodyguards' expectations, by doing nothing. He is so very proud of himself

We go to Mechanus, which is very impressive, very orderly. Aviana and Shalkoc discuss kidnapping people. After some goblinist profiling, we follow the Guardian Golem along an unending wall covered in the laws of Mechanus. There is a long section about regulations on painting buildings, to Plex' dismay.

We get on a train, though none of us knows what a train is. There's a clockwork dragon! As we are walking to meet up with a clockmaker, sirens start blaring about containing an anomaly. We all turn to Emilio. He's doing that pose hounds do when they smell the rabbit. We round a corner into a nice open courtyard and see FIVE void portals spewing out an abomination the size of a Gundam.

pages.name: 85 - But it doesn't have any nose-holes!
pages.content:
Friday, 8th of Decimus, 1497

04:30

We are following the Guardian Golem, Warden XM-7, in a very orderly manner. On the roof to our right, something is swirling, twisting inward… then, we hear the shrieking. We spot 4 more portals, 2 straight ahead and 2 to our left. Tentacles with eyes exit the portal on the right…?! Emilio warns us, things are about to get really bad.

We roll initiative, with unusual results due to the realm effect. XM-7 requires assistance closing the portals, we all agree to protect him. Emilio says the big tentacly monster is a Mindwitness, and the best strategy for hunting them is… not being seen. Cool. It begins with eye rays; I resist the Fear Ray, Emilio resists the Stunning Ray, and Fearghas resists the Psychic Ray. Phew.

I cast a Twinned Death Ward on myself and XM-7. He appreciates the assistance, what a good bot. Then I use the Angel's Grace's power to cast Sanctuary on myself, and retreat to the back lines. Emilio says he's going to turn off the lights, and 1.2 second later he casts Dying of the Light. T-thanks for the heads up, but next time, a little sooner?! As mentioned, everything goes pitch black. I hear XM-7 say Target acquired, and adds details on the closest voidgate, then takes off towards it. Emilio follows the flying robot, he is the only one who can see in the darkness.

Fearghas is grumbling at Emilio that he "cannae bloody see". He casts Fireball blindly, protecting XM-7 from the blast. There is some mad sizzling. "Sounds like unhappy shadow calamari" - Kyrin. Fearghas goes off muttering about humans seeing in the dark, and how he can see through darkness but not magical darkness grrrmmmmmbl.

We hear the scuttling of tiny feet coming our way. A lot of tiny feet… Kyrin fires an arrow; from the thud, she hits something. She hides, but that's okay we couldn't see her anyway. Emilio says the Mindwitness is hovering right above him, which causes the aberration to spot him and attack! Emilio's magic snipes it with necrotic damage and exhaustion. This also slaps a second Mindwitness! I quietly use Piercing the Veil, and tiptoe away from the closest monster, trying to get in a good position to keep an eye on everyone.

THERE ARE NO WILD MAGIC SURGES IN MECHANUS!!

Fearghas wants to move in.

Emilio casts Howling Horrors, producing an ear-splitting screech and dealing some juicy psychic damage. There is a revolting sound of something rotting bursting, as one of the Mindwitnesses dies and falls from the height it was hovering at. XM-7 reaches the portal on the roof and casually closes it. He used his left arm which rotated quickly and produced a beam of bluish light that shot into the portal and shrunk it until it winked out. Yeah… I have no idea how to do that myself. But Emilio seems inspired?

Emilio senses a shuddering of pain as XM-7 fires into the portal. He thinks it's just like a caster dropping concentration on a spell. These small portals, unlike the one we saw in the Underdark, are not stabilised and held open; they're being kept open by, Emilio assumes, a creature on the other side. So some voidborn can just open portals to other planes and let bullshit through. Lovely.

Fearghas fires (hehe) a Ray of Frost on a Minion and obliterates it. He shouts there are more enemies this way. He then gets "tentacled". Why'd you have to use this word, I've seen enough… hens wearing ties to know where this is going. Emilio's spell slaps the minions all the way into next week as they instantly die to the necrotic energy. He guides Kyrin to the closest monster, and she shoots at it.

We hear sloppy sloshing noises as more things spill out of the portals. We need to get XM-7 to close them asap! Another sickening sound as a second Mindwitness succumbs to Emilio's magic. I follow after XM-7, looking for the closest portal, and summon Fade in the idea to have her flank enemies so Kyrin can shoot them better. Emilio casts a Blade Ward on himself, and yells to XM-7 to head north, he was a lost bot. XM-7 locates one of the portals, on the roof of the building in front of us! Fade feels her way up the stairs and hunts by sound, camping next to one of the portals. She goes invisible, hoping to bite anything that comes her way. She might let Emilio pat her head, since they both want to nibble on voidborn?

Fearghas is DONE with the darkness and puts on his Glasses of True Seeing. He goes northwest to the left of the building, looking for a portal to point XM-7 to. Kyrin moves her "happy butt" close to Emilio, as he is, in her words, her "seeing dog". He points an enemy to her, far to the east. She takes the shot, but narrowly misses.

As round 4 begins, Emilio feels the air ripple and the portals… stabilising. He warns us about this, adding he has a bad feeling about this and we need to close the portals like now. I dash up the stairs and spot three of the portals! I do my best to aim XM-7 to the nearest portal. Kyrin tugs Emilio's robe to wish him luck; he apologises about leaving her as he dashes up the stairs, and says he sees a lot more Mindwitnesses and minions… and a Warped Seer. Ah shit, here we go again.

Our brobot XM-7 closes the portal by the roof with his beam! Emilio recognises the entity beyond the portal as he feels its pain from this portal in front of him… and the portal behind him, too. It is one single big voidborn holding all the portals open, that is TROUBLE.

Fade leaps off the roof, taking minor fall damage despite landing on her shadowy paws. She prowls at the edge of Emilio's spell and takes the Dodge action, hoping for minions to come within attack-of-opportunity range. Fearghas looks into the western void portal… Immediately, he knows he should not keep looking. He only glimpses a mass of teeth, tentacles, and eyes. "We all know the old wall of flesh!" Karnack says happily. Eek. Fearghas shouts IMMA FIRIN' MAH SPHERRRRRE and casts Otiluke's Freezing Sphere. The voidborn freeze with a sound of tinkling glass, crystallised with frost. This draws the minions of course, who scuttle towards him.

The Seer all the way to the northeast starts blasting. Fearghas is saved by the realm effect, which causes the first two Psychic Orbs to miss. He casts Shield to block the third one. Emilio's magic casually murders 4 other minions. Kyrin says "Come and get me!" which confuses XM-7 for a moment, until Emilio directs him to the western portal Fearghas is standing close to. She cunningly dashes up to between Emilio and me. He points out the nearest enemies to her, allowing her to plant an arrow in a Mindwitness.

Round 5 starts. All eyes are on Fearghas, and believe me, there are a LOT of those. He saves against a Psychic Ray, a Fear Ray, and a Stunning Ray — barely. All the eyes narrow, and their owner skedaddles. The exact same thing happens a second time with another Mindwitness. Oh they're mad. I aim at the Seer with Lioriel's Staff, and blast off a Magic Missile… at 1st level. Woops… It tickles the Seer. I hear it giggle in my mind. Uuuuuuurrrrrgh.

Fearghas is hit by a Slowing Ray and a Telekinetic Ray. He is restrained and dragged towards a pit by a Mindwitness. Emilio goes into Void Form and becomes unable to concentrate on Dying of the Light. He teleports with Phase Shift, and starts blasting.

"Are we seriously trying to figure out the air speed velocity of a dwarf?" - Kyrin

Fearghas falls into the pit, Wile E. Coyote style. Oh no! Anyway. The Mindwitnesses are looking very smug, so Emilio assures them, and Fearghas, that the aberrations will be next. He gets blasted with eye rays for his trouble, and gets stunned. Because of this he cannot save on the Telekinetic Ray and gets restrained too, allowing the Mindwitness to drag him to the edge of the pit.

XM-7 closes the western portal. The voidborn on the other side gets angry, Emilio says… It wants to come here. Oh my. Fade runs up to a Mindwitness and has herself a little crunch, then a big crunch, killing the thing.

Fearghas: "Ooooooooaaaaaahaohohohohooooo… bloody humans. Dimension Door!"

He's fine, just grumpy. He asks XM-7 how to close the portals. The Golem starts rattling out some kind of equation. "In Common!" Fearghas requests, to no avail. Emilio is getting his nice bottom handed to him. That's a shame. The Seer joins in and blasts him while he is struggling. That's a lot of damage! It scuttles towards Fearghas.

Suddenly, Antagonize. The DM does not know how it got here. We struggle for a minute; it was on the Rogue's Mantle all this time. Well that was weird. Kyrin then decides to shoot "this little shit over there".

Round 6 starts and… no new enemies appear. That's actually somehow more frightening…

I chuck a Fireball towards the Seer, detonating it in the air to 1) catch the Mindwitness and 2) spare Fearghas. He is very proud. The dead Mindwitness crashes splashingly to the floor and the Seer is not happy with me. I recast Sanctuary on myself, just in time, as a Mindwitness is giving me the evil eyes, a lot of them. Emilio is incapacitated.

I save against a Fear Ray, but Fearghas fails against the Telekinetic Ray and chucked into the pit. Again. Fade gives the Seer the good old crunch. As a reaction, it uses Bend Space and swaps places with a Mindwitness, so Fade crunches on that. SQUISH. It's disgusting and she bites very gingerly, inflicting minor damage. She uses Shadow Blend to become a very grumpy invisible shadow cat.

Fearghas Misty Steps out of the pit, then casts Disintegrate on the Seer. It saves and takes no damage! The Seer casts Collapse Distance on Emilio, teleporting him… INTO THE PIT. Toodaloo! Fearghas casts Feather Fall on him! The Seer looks back at the portal behind him… and jumps into the pit after Emilio. What?! He falls past Emilio who is falling in slow motion. Yoink! Attack of opportunity!

Kyrin aims at the Mindwitness, right into the teeth-holes left by Fade. Oh that is a lot of damage for an arrow.

Three new portals open. Out of FIVE portals flows a single creature… The portals all close after it. A towering creature stands before us, made of tentacles and parts of beasts, too many eyes, too many fangs. The body parts are all jumbled and howling. As that Greater Star Spawn Emissary comes out of the portal, it blasts an EMP wave that incapacitates XM-7. It spews out a wave of Unearthly Bile, which only Fade manages to dodge, sort of, she still takes half damage. For each failed save, a Choker spawns… cool, cool.

Now, the Emissary takes its turn. All the bullshit before was just reaction! It decides Fearghas is the biggest threat, and one of its maws rushes towards him. Fearghas dodges, so the Emissary shoots 2 Psychic Orbs at him. It slaps an Eyeless Void on Kyrin's position, an area of magical darkness…

I keep it together, and whisper to the darkness, making shadows converge on the Emissary. I have to recast Sanctuary after that, running out of charges but it might save my life! Emilio bursts out of the pit with Void Torrent. He walks up to me, and crunches on his shards to apply Accrued Vitality. Very prudent, approved.

The Emissary uses 2 legendary actions on Warp Space, making the ground below Emilio and me a mass of teeth and maws! Aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa. Fade tries to opportunistically crunch at a Mindwitness, but remembering how slimy and disgusting they are, she hesitates and the attack misses. Don't blame ya, kitty. The Mindwitness takes a look at Fearghas, a lot of looks really… He takes a Fear Ray and is now quaking in his boots.

Fade gives the Emissary the good crunch, presumably it tastes better, then she slips into the shadows. The Emissary is immune to prone, of course… Fearghas casts another Otiluke's Freezing Sphere, ignoring all allies. The foul-tasting Mindwitness dies, and the little minions are wiped out as well. Then he summons his axe with Spiritual Weapon. And the big pile of void bullshit is resistant to Force damage, welp. Sad Warlock noises.

Kyrin does a Psychic Teleportation out of the magical darkness and drops down on the Emissary, slashing with the Sun Blade. Fade's flanking grants her Sneak Attack priviledges! She marks the soul in the bargain.

The Emissary saves on my Living Shadows, and casually walks out of the aoe… Come on. It casts Eyeless Void to slap more magical darkness on Kyrin, Fearghas, and Fade. From inside the darkness, it chucks three Psychic Orbs at Emilio, inflicting heavy damage. He's standing right next to me, so I remove my spellwards and channel Cure Wounds, heightened to 8th-level, on Emilio. The maws below our feet disappeared, phew.

The Emissary unleashes a Mind Cloud, inflicting spicy psychic damage on Fearghas, Kyrin, and Fade. Emilio speaks the command word of his cloak, and casts Blight on the big guy, but it resists necrotic damage! The Emissary burns another legendary action to attack Fade, and kills her. Fearghas casts the bad touch Withering Touch and tries to inflict Curse of Fragility, but the Emissary burns a legendary resistance.

"It's a shame the Curse of Impotence doesn't make all his tentacles go limp…" Kyrin

Fearghas chugs a Potion of Supreme Healing and shimmies around so he is perfectly flanking the Emissary. Kyrin slashes with the Sun Blade. Unsurprisingly, the Emissary is resistant to psychic damage as well. It lets out a very angry… squelch. (Karnack makes murlock noises) She slaps a Psychic Blade into it for good measure.

The Emissary uses its 4th legendary action to recharge its Unearthly Bile… and it immediately starts it turn afterwards, so it pukes out the bile. Kyrin dodges and takes zero. Emilio is immune thanks to his cloak! The Emissary is, of course, immune to acid. Hey, you never know. It then shoots Emilio with the Psychic Orbs, and all three hit! He is still standing, but barely…

I upcast Wellspring of Life to 7th-level and slap it down at my feet and Emilio's. The Emissary teleports INTO IT and attacks Emilio… Vittuperkelesaatanaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa. The Wellspring heals Emilio a little bit although I roll like concentrated essence of ASS. It's enough for Emilio, who walks up to the Emissary and starts slicing. He pops an essence shard on Accrued Vitality… and for a second his claws resist his will. Surprise quickly fades as his face takes on a look of "Oh… it's like that." He consumes 5 essence shards for a free Eldritch Blast, and finishes off the Emissary!

Emilio's gauntlets turn pitch black, absorbing light. His shadow extends, dragging the Emissary back to where it came from, leaving not even a corpse or a drop of blood. He stands with a look of immense satisfaction on his face, then lays down with a wide happy grin on his face.

We level up to 14!! UNLIMITED POWAAAAAAAAAAAH

I question Emilio on what he did with the body. He very naturally replies "I ate it. We hunt, we eat, we get stronger. That's how it goes, no?" Fearghas grumbles because he wanted to harvest the body for alchemical components, presumably. The dwarf asks… "Is this what happened to the Hag? Is that why you freaked out when Naami touched you?" Emilio goes quiet, and nods. Then he explains it's different, because she wasn't voidborn. I sit down in shock. An entire conversation suddenly makes a LOT of sense…

XM-7 gets back up and says "Threat can no longer be detected. Expecting report." And then he arrests Fearghas for "tampering with evidence". Fearghas protests… XM-7 has no sense of self, it seems. We very frustratingly try to explain we did nothing wrong, and we saved the place from a void incursion, but XM-7 cannot compute and repeats we violated a law. The fine for tampering with evidence… is three days of community service polishing clockwork wheels.

I ask XM-7 if he is okay. He says yes, in robot speak, and that my care is appreciated. Some more stomping occurs as robots from the forensics team show up. They ask us a lot of questions about what happened exactly. We spent FIVE HOURS reporting, omitting only the Emissary… At least we did it while standing in the Wellspring of Life and we get healed to full. Fearghas gets to harvest his alchemical components, but since he still broke a law, the robots insist on him doing the 36 hours community service polishing brass cogs within the next 7 days, which prompts a healthy amount of grumbling.

"Please follow for audience with Master Artificer Kazzim-Aleph-1" XM-7 says, and stomps away. He leads us to a workshop, from which comes an irritated (?) beeping, and then unsteady steps, like a drunk man walking with a cane. The figure which opens the door is a good bit taller than Shalkoc, cloaked in red, and wears a clockwork mask that reveals an organic, humanoid eye. Mechanical appendages poke out from under the cloak. (Imagine a steampunk tech priest, Aerelia says.) It asks with a high-pitched, squeaky voice, whether we are the mortals he was told to expect.

He is one of the Master Artificers in service of Brigh. We are… expected to enter, not welcome, and we are not to touch anything inside. He makes it clear that he'd rather spend his time with anything else than "fleshlings". I say that's rude. He says we just haven't been blessed with the resplendence of clockwork. We enter, sit down, and the Artificer says "You are about to lose my interest, try to spark it." Sigh.

Fearghas brings up the Beacon of Doom, and Kyrin pulls it out and explains its function. She also explains wearily that we helped defend this place, but got community service for it… Kazzim-Aleph says that if we don't break any laws, we don't get punished. I say it's impossible for mortals like us to know all the laws of Mechanus… "Have you considered replacing your body with resplendent clockwork?" Eeeeeegh…

He picks up the Beacon of Doom and his cogs start turning real fast. He wants to study it. He will look at it in his workshop for a bit, while his apprentice entertains us. We say we need to leave with the artifact in a couple days. "That is tragic," he says and scampers away with the Beacon, shouting for his apprentice Kess Al'dín. A female voice replies; Kazzim-Aleph dismissively tells her to have "meaningless conversations" with us.

We see a… devil's wing pop up, immediately followed by the rest of a winged Tiefling in a steampunk outfit, with the marks of goggles around her eyes. She is very curious about the artifact, so Kyrin gives a short explanation. Emilio chimes in, explaining how he pissed off Zariel. I say it's a long story, and may we please have some tea? She conjures up a flame with her finger, looking very proud of herself, then sheepishly says her master doesn't approve of that since she burnt down the library, once.

Kess says she applied for an apprenticeship, and she has been here for 6 years. She doesn't get to talk to people often, and those aren't really fulfilling conversations. I sort of challenge Kess to think about how to get Zariel to sell us back our friends' souls. She tries but quickly gets stumped, and we end up talking about people, logic, numbers, structure… and Fearghas' community service.

Kess asks why we are so pressed by time. We've got things to do, places to be… we're involved in wars, the time schedule is tight, and more voidborn are appearing. She is confused but no less curious. She shows us a piece of clockwork on her thigh… I ask her to explain. She talks about… not having time for things like dying. Kyrin asks about the mind, and the soul, and identity. Kess hasn't figured out how to convert the mind and soul to clockwork.

I ask Kess if her body doesn't reject the clockwork. She says of course it does, she just numbs it. She shows us a needle in her leg, dosing her with painkillers… It makes me so sad… Emilio discusses the similarities with his half-voidborn body. Kess is really intrigued, so Emilio tells her about the Void. Kess sees logic in the Void, a law in "eat or be eaten". She wants to go there. Emilio is trying to explain she will die… at best.

Kess is a little confused about why we are here, if we are so bad with law. We explain we need help with law. She explains to Fearghas that he is lucky; the law he broke here, Lady Brigh is very lenient with it. On other gears, he would have been killed outright. Apparently, there is a lot of "chaos" on this gear. Oooooooooh dear. One of Lady Brigh's teachings is chaos is necessary for innovation. Kyrin pulls out her Echo Stone, which says "Oh, I have this echo rock" after Kyrin said it. Kess is FASCINATED. She wants to build something similar out of clockwork, so she can record her ideas and she doesn't have to remember them!

Fearghas is eager to get done with his community service, and goes out. "Aight, XM-7, take me to the cogs." Before he leaves, he casts Rary's Telepathic Bond to stay in touch with us. Kess offers us to look through the catalogue of "things Master can craft". The moment she mentions a "Tome of Clear Thought", we hear from outside the door… tap tap tap… taptaptapTAPTAPTAPTAPTAPTAPTAPTAP and Fearghas appears asking about the tome. He is told off by XM-7 because he has to go polish cogs instead of running off… There is also talk of an Ioun Stone of Mastery (increases Proficiency Bonus by 1) and a legendary +2 dagger that poisons its target, Asp's Kiss.

Specific ingredients are needed to craft these items… a petrified Pit Fiend's eye for the stone (it must be petrified before it dies), a poisoned poison gland of a Yuan-Ti Anathema (they are immune to poison) for the dagger, and the still-dreaming brain of an Aboleth for the tome. For this we need to extract the brain without waking or killing the big fish. All of the brain. We hyperfocus on the brain and lack of nose-holes, and discuss theories. Kess interjects those ingredients have been on the list for a very long time and nobody has managed to provide them. Yeah, I wonder why.

We speak to Kazzim about the contract with Zariel. He suggests to have the signing of the new contract happen on neutral ground, i.e. Mechanus. Essentially we sneak the Beacon into Dis, then go to Mechanus, and blackmail Zariel to come to Mechanus and sign, or we activate the Beacon in Dis and she gets big shit from Dispater. We also need to have the person who carries the Beacon under constant live surveilance from Mechanus until they bring the Beacon back there to trade it back to Zariel. Phew, my shift key worked overtime on this paragraph.

We discuss the cost of descending to Dis through the Bronze Citadel in Avernus… Probably a very steep cost, like 5000 gold per person, one way, from Avernus into Dis. Well, back to the idea of the Black Vents. We'll also need to reveal it to Dispater so he knows to blame Zariel. A time constraint on Zariel would help us.

Plan of attack:

We go to Avernus, descend into Dis through the Black Vents, set up camp in Dis with the Beacon. We send a message to Zariel telling her to get thine arse get her fiery bum to Mechanus or we blow up the thing and she gets mad shit from Dispater.

Kazzim suggests to have Mechanus officials contact Zariel, because they don't lie. Fearghas asks who we need to talk to for this kind of support. Control Court MH4; we can get an appointment with them through XM-7, probably. The Modrons will help us with the details, i.e. facilitate the contract. Our job is to get the Beacon to Dis for blackmailing purposes, and then take it back to Mechanus to exchange it for our friends' souls. Fearghas asks about the location of a teleportation circle in Mechanus where we can meet up.

pages.name: 85 - summary
pages.content:
But it doesn't have any nose holes!

We follow Warden XM-7, but as we enter a courtyard — gasp! — a void portal! Another! Yet another! Five in total! Brobot politely requests assistance to close the portals. Emilio kindly informs us that the big monster, all tentacles and eyes, is called a Mindwitness and the best strategy to hunt it is… not being seen. It blasts us with eye rays, so there goes the plan.

Emilio says he's going to turn off the lights, but we're in initiative and 1.2 second later he casts Dying of the Light, plunging us all into magical darkness. Fearghas grumbles he "cannae bloody see" and mutters heartily about humans. We fight blindly and make an enlightening discovery!

THERE ARE NO WILD MAGIC SURGES IN MECHANUS!!

Fearghas wants to move in.

XM-7 closes a portal by shooting it. Emilio senses something from beyond the portal, a lot like losing concentration on a spell. We theorise the portals are unstable and held open by a void mage, so we better hurry! Aerelia uses the phrase "get tentacled" and my mind is filled with images of female chickens wearing neckties. Is this psychic damage? Both Fearghas and me find ways to see through the darkness, but poor Kyrin needs to be guided by her seeing dog Emilio, who points her at enemies like a gun.

We can't be too mad because Emilio's spell easily drops the small minions. The fight is a breeze, until he feels the portals stabilising and a Warped Seer gets through. Fearghas is hearing the trees speak Deep Speech. We point XM-7 at the portals because we have no idea how to close them ourselves. Emilio senses there is only one entity holding all those portals open. Fearghas takes a peep into a void portal, decides it's a bad idea as the old Wall of Flesh peeps back.

"IMMA FIRIN' MAH SPHERRRRRRRRE" - Fearghas casting Otiluke's Freezing Sphere

I somewhat accidentally chuck a 1st-level Magic Missile at the Seer. Max damage but a d4 being a d4, it barely tickles. That thing giggles IN MY MIND. Uuuuurrrrrrgh. Fearghas is grappled and chucked into the pit, Wile E. Coyote style.

"Are we seriously trying to figure out the air speed velocity of a dwarf?" - Kyrin

I make Fearghas very proud with the simple use of Fireball. Fearghas is chucked into the pit again, may or may not have been Emilio's fault. Then Emilio is chucked into the pit, and the Seer jumps in after him. But Emilio got a Feather Fall courtesy of Fearghas, so not only does the Seer zoom past him, Emilio gets an attack of opportunity.

Three new portals open to let through a generous serving of nightmare fuel, teeth and eyes and tentacles aplenty. The Greater Star Spawn Emissary blasts an EMP wave that knocks out Brobot! Then it vomits on us a lot.

Magical darkness is slapped on Kyrin but she teleports out, slashing with the Sun Blade! My shadow cat gives her Sneak Attack privileges by flanking the big thing. Fearghas gives the boss the bad touch, which is Withering Touch.

"It's a shame the Curse of Impotence doesn't make all his tentacles go limp." - Kyrin

Karnack makes excellent murloc noises. We get puked on again, and the Emissary gives Emilio a lot of side eyes because he is immune to acid. Kyrin is not immune, but she does the sick dodges. Emilio is next to me, getting focused and taking a beating, so I cast Wellspring of Life at our feet. The Emissary teleports INTO IT and attacks Emilio… Vittuperkelesaatanaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa. I roll on healing like concentrated essence of ASS. Emilio looks at the Emissary, looks at his claws, smirks. "Oh… it's like that." And he finishes off the boss with an Eldritch Blast as a BONUS ACTION?!

Emilio eats the boss. He is now very happy and ready to take a nap.

We level up to 14!

Fearghas and Emilio have words. I hug the Staff of Power for emotional support because my cat got murdered. Fearghas harvests alchemical components and gets arrested for tampering with evidence, sentenced to 3 days polishing gears.

Five hours later we get to leave the crime scene. XM-7 has rebooted and he leads us to a workshop where we meet Master Artificer, Kazzim-Aleph-1. He is a very impatient person whose body seems mostly mechanical, he calls us "fleshlings". We show him the Beacon of Doom, he loves it and wants it for study. Fine then, just for a few days. He grabs it and disappears downstairs with it, leaving us to talk with his apprentice, Kess.

A winged Tiefling, Kess is very happy to be talking to people for once. She's started to turn her body into clockwork, using lots of painkillers in the process. We talk about a lot of things, Kess wants to visit the Void, we try to explain it's not exactly good for tourism this season. Fearghas leaves to start polishing cogs. Kess mentions items her master can craft; an Ioun Stone of Mastery, the poison dagger Asp's Kiss, and a Tome of Clear Thought.

The last one has Fearghas rushing back in. These items need very specific materials; a petrified Pit Fiend's eye, a poisoned poison gland of a Yuan-Ti Anathema, and the still-dreaming brain of an Aboleth. We have a deep conversation about how to procure the brain. Kyrin happily suggests we extract it through the nose-holes. We do a quick research and realise… Aboleths don't have any nose-holes!

We are stumped. Fearghas takes it personally.

Kazzim gives very good advice about our predicament with Zariel, and with the help of Mechanus we now have a solid plan of attack!

  1. Sneak the Beacon into Dis.
  2. Tell Mechanus to contact Zariel.
  3. Get the Beacon back to Mechanus and exchange it to Zariel for our friends' souls!
  4. ???
  5. Profit!

pages.name: 86 - Goblin rockets and vending machines vending vending machines
pages.content:
Friday, 8th of Decimus, 1497

13:10

We speak with Kess about how to keep a brain alive. We have 3 days on our hands while Fearghas is polishing gears and Master Kazzim is studying the Beacon. I argue with Aviana; we should study air travel to keep Promise aloft, instead of working enslaved air elementals to death! Fearghas feels a disturbance in the Force. He wants to build a life support machine for just the brain, as Master Kazzim would be very upset if we brought the entire fish. Kess says this kind of machine would be really difficult to make, even for master artificers, and the apparatus would have to be tuned to the Aboleth specifically.

Looks like trading here is mostly done in Clockwork Looking Glasses, a currency of which 1 is equal to… 1618.03gp. How golden-ly specific. We can trade gold for them. The looking glasses are also a one-use item with really interesting effects! Truly a metaphysical experience.

We find a workshop painted in odd colours, which seems about to close. It was the workshop of the recently deceased master Artificer Daretti, a goblin who had Brigh's favour. He passed away after… testing one of his invention. It is heavily implied the goblin blew himself up all the way into the neighbouring gear by way of a rocket. Plex is impressed and needs one of those.

We discuss air travel in Hell, prompting a lot of chaos. Fearghas is getting a weird headache while polishing gears. Aviana is talking Plex into tying rockets to his legs, and suggests trading Shalkoc for the rockets, until she realises when kinda need Shalkoc for the whole poisoning thing. He casually suggests kidnapping people, which has every construct in the immediate vicinity creak as their heads ominously turn towards us. Ha ha no we were not being serious, of course. You see we were just in Heaven and we were not allowed to lie, so we thought we should tell a silly lie just to be funny.

The robots are very amused with us. Shalkoc and Plex want to open up a shop in Axis, and I cannot understand why. Aviana does the math on how much the Rocketbelt would cost in gold (3237). We could rent out a vending machine, slap it down in Promise, and use it to trade with Mechanus. Honestly, that would be fire, let's go! Turns out to get a vending machine, we need to go to a vending machine that vends vending machines. Plex is already calculating how to scam the vending machine. I fear we may be polishing gears for a while…

We can get 7 vending machines for 1 looking glass. We do some math, which ends in Shalkoc saying to Plex "Anyway, are you taking the gold or not?". Plex tries to negotiate, borrows money from Shalkoc for his Rocketboots, and we decide to rent the 7 vending machines and decide later what to do about all these vending machines. Aviana suggests using the anchor chain to go get some money from Promise, which according to Kess, is legal as long as we do it in the designated teleport area.

Fearghas takes a break from polishing gears to go tell us all off. Turns out Emilio has big monies! Plex buys 2 looking glasses and trades them for "a chance to soar in the sky with a rocket strapped to his side". In these terms. Aviana buys a looking glass and is now absolutely broke, the entirety of her monetary wealth reduced to 2 silver pieces.

We find a shop selling "height compensation devices", that is very thin stilts, as demonstrated by a gnome now taller than Shalkoc. He pulls out a long trumpet and says "Welcome to my shop!
