I am Arondriemus Hupperdook Tinkertop." He also sells guns hand crossbows with a 10-bolt magazine; the Tinkertop Boltblaster 1000.

Another shop sells spell scrolls, so we of course lose Fearghas. He is frantically looking for potions to sell so he can buy scrolls, but there is very little interest in potions on this plane of existence, most inhabitants are machines… He sells unneeded scrolls to purchase other scrolls and copy the spells into his spellbook. Fearghas also buys the Tinkertop Boltblaster 1000 for Kyrin.

We finish shopping! Fearghas furiously polishes gears for 3 more days. Kess kindly lets us sleep in her room.

Monday, 11th of Decimus, 1497

14:45

Short rest

We make ready to return to Avernus and scout out the Black Vents. Combat mode on. We go over the hearsay and legends we have on the area… it is not reassuring at all. Master Kazzim returns the Beacon of Doom and says it has been made with the influence of Nethys, the god of magic. He believes it comes from, or was stolen, from Nethys' realm in Limbo, Ahkanefti. However, this realm has been sealed for a very long time! 1500 years or so? He isn't sure. He also doesn't think the Beacon is that old, it seems it was made using recent technology.

He mentions temples to Nethys underneath the Redwind Sands desert, massive structures built with magic. Maybe that civilisation isn't as dead as we thought… Aviana, Shalkoc, and Fearghas talk about Plex eating memories among giant trees in Jotunheim; one of these memories related to Ahkanefti.

Kazzim asks if he could keep the Beacon for just a few more days possibly…? Plex narrows his eyes at him, supposing he'd keep the Beacon forever if we let him. Plex and Aviana mutter back and forth in the butt language Sylvan. We firmly tell Kazzim he cannot keep the Beacon, so he asks if we have anything else like it. Fearghas pulls out a tiki mask, which sets Kazzim's remaining eye rolling so far it comes back a different colour. Plex pulls out a coconut, I mean a smoke grenade. Fearghas tries to retrieve the artifact. Kazzim is unwilling to let go. Plex is digging through his pack, pulling out traps of his own design. Surprisingly, though maybe not so much, Kazzim likes Plex and his ingenuity. He warns him to adjust experiments to his size. Guess he sees a bit of the late Daretti in Plex… shudder.

Emilio gives a long stare at a strange square of some kind of stone, muttering about his Book of Shadows. The stone is his book? I am very confused. The confusion spreads as we start talking about warlocks.

Plex wants to trade a trinket with Kazzim. He wants some time to think it through, while Plex is just winging it.

We discuss the logistics of plane travel, and Fearghas suggests a long rest before we go down to Hell.

"We should build a brothel." - Aviana

Aerelia rolls a bunch of hidden dice which makes us all plenty nervous, so we call him out on it.

Before taking a rest, Fearghas does some spellscribing and alchemy while inspired by Aviana's glorious flexing. I cast a 9th-level Remove Curse on myself to undo 2 major surges. Fearghas and Plex copy into their spellbooks: Catapult, Flawed Design, Fly, and Scrying. Aviana wants to tinker with Kyrin's shoes or my shoes, to try and hide a small blade in them. Because she loves our feet. Uh, that sounds wrong but okay.

Aviana gives me a shoe with a secret blade. I give her a cookie for it. Then Shalkoc says he still has chocolate. I happily suggest we kindly ask to borrow a kitchen somewhere, and use the chocolate… to make better cookies! We are both thrilled.

Tuesday, 12th of Decimus, 1497

15:45

Long rest (next long rest on Saturday, 16th Decimus)

Kyrin writes and sketches in her journal about our recent adventures.

The gear we are on, Brigh's domain, has 2 sides. She believes that order and chaos are needed for innovation, and therefore is very tolerant of planar travellers (called "variables"). They live on the downside of the gear, and have created imitations of natural landscapes. On the upside of the gear, dedicated to absolute order, constructs live and calculate every little thing.

There are no clouds nor rain in Axis, and the temperature is always exactly 23.1406°C. This is also oddly specific, more secrets of math. Air currents remain very localised.

I research the painkillers living creatures use here, hoping for useful substances, and I am horrified… their painkillers are so strong, they just cause necrosis and nobody cares, because they just replace the fleshy parts with clockwork. To take my mind off this horrible discovery, I go bake cookies with Shalkoc. We save them for desserts as he cooks meals for all of us. Rhubard pie for Fearghas (yes rhubard with a d, I don't think that was intentional but I love it, the rhubarb of bards), Stir-fried rice with chicken for Aviana, Eggs and sausage for me, Grilled ribs for Emilio, Meat sandwich for Plex, Fried fish for himself, and a luxurious Chai Latte for Kyrin.

Then, Plex casts his new spell Planetrotting to take us all to Avernus. It does not go well. IT DOES NOT GO WELL!! Everything smells of swamp-rot. We all get irrationally angry with Plex. Oh… oh no. We are in Muravelara. We hear a weird howling in the distance! Aviana cries, why are we in a SWAAAAAMP?! and shoves Plex. Fearghas casts Guidance on Plex, and starts the ritual casting of Leomund's Tiny Hut. This is gonna be 10 long minutes.

Kyrin, Shalkoc, Aviana, and Emilio are looking out for threats. Plex is getting started on another Planetrotting. I try to stay calm and begin ritually casting Augury, ready to interrupt it if anything threatens the two wizards. Naturally, our friends are rolling Perception checks… under the Blood Moon's Spite realm effect… Shalkoc fails the check.

Kyrin figures out a pattern to the very creepy footsteps in the mud, which always sound like they are right behind us until we turn around, and there is nothing. She pretends to turn around… ha, gotcha! One of the trees has moved… and we roll initiative.

Kyrin moves away, and shoots… something with her bow, marking the soul (it's a Spriggan). Emilio says… "I'm so sorry, Kyrin". And casts Dying of the Light, and immediately after he grants us Gift of Eyes. Eek… but at least we can all see! Except Kyrin, she is out of range. Oh dear. The Spriggan swipes at Kyrin, poisoning her. She can't regain any HP, and must hurt another creature. She dodges a second sweep of its claws, but the third one hits. Then it casts Insect Plague as a bonus action. EMILIO COUNTERSPELLS aaaaa you absolute treasure. As the Spriggan ends its turn, it gets slapped by Dying of the Light.

Shalkoc is angry and must punch something. I yell at him to protect the wizards, but he rushes the Spriggan and whacks it with a Leaden Fist, killing it on the spot. Emilio drops concentration. Kyrin is mad that Shalkoc stole her kill. She slashes at him with a Psychic Blade, misses on account of being blind, and gets even angrier! I cast a Healing Word on her, curing her poison, but she only tries to stab Shalkoc again! He casually dodges and walks away. SHE SHOOTS HIM. SHE SHOOTS HIM WITH THE +2 BOW.

Fearghas is entirely unbothered and finishes his spell, but does try to teach Emilio about "measured response". He does not see the problem in blasting a 7th-level spell on one supposed threat. Plex interrupts the eating of his shoe, pulls a bent fork out of it, and begins casting Planetrotting again. And it's another mishap. We teleport to Heaven, fortunately without any devils in sight. We are spotted by Dewey atop the wall, waving at us and telling us to come in. We go in, go through registration, Fearghas has a stern talking-to with Shalkoc, and the angels ask him about the Commandments. Shalkoc starts rattling them off, very inefficiently. E for effort, and he still gets level 5 guidance. We kindly request Huey, Dewey, and Louie again.

We have to go to the market to get Plex some forks, as Planetrotting consumes them and he is all out of forks. The whole ordeal takes a good 5 hours, and it is about 21:30 now. We catch up with Shalkoc's dedicated bodyguards. Plex is eyeing a pet turtle like he's going to steal it. In my mind I am already making the hand signs for Binding Shadows.

The good angels refuse to rip off Plex by accepting 250 gold for a fork. They do sell forks to Aviana for a reasonable price, who then sells them to Plex for 250 gold apiece. I am screaming IRL. Huey, Dewey, and Louie give us presents! In total 19 Martyr's Lockets. They allow the wearer to deliver a willing creature from a curse, by taking the curse upon themselves instead. (conditions apply) I respectfully receive one of the gold pendants and put it on.

Plex casts Planetrotting. Ah shit, here we go again. THANKFULLY, no mishap this time but we do appear 20 miles off, honestly no big deal, it's nothing next to being transported to THE ABYSS. The barren landscape and blazing heat of Avernus greets us, along with raining hellfire and stench of sulfur. In the distance, against the dark sky, rises a thick column of black smoke. We spread out to not all be blasted simultaneously by the fireballs falling from the sky. We do, of course, still get blasted by a few Fireballs, except Fearghas who knows how to walk without rhythm, and Kyrin who somehow dodges them all.

I get 2 DEX saves, pass one, fumble the other. Sigh. Plex sort of goes around the problem by casting Absorb Elements. It's a sweaty, gruelling 6-hour walk. We reach the edge of a giant crater, we can't even see the other side, and look down but there is too much smoke and soot to see anything. We do spot some holes inside the crater, all of them spewing thick black smoke. The moment the smoke blows into our faces, we all erupt in fits of coughing and crying. Plex casts a Gust of Wind, at Aviana's request, and aims it into the crater. The wind draws in air from the sides, and some of the smoke moves… weirdly. Not like smoke should. More along the lines of Smoke Mephits, but they don't seem to have noticed us.

Fearghas goes to test how unhealthy the smoke is. He passes the save, but that smoke is draining… We'll get exhausted staying in this smoke for long. We start discussing workarounds. Wind Walk… summoning an Air Elemental… Plex' Breezeblossoms… Find the Path? I could Shadowslip down. We settle on Find the Path, which points the way straight down. In the meantime I take out my cards and ritually cast Augury. I sort of expected that, but I read the result "weal and woe".

Plex is muttering about buying more coconuts, and he fashions a "gas mask" for himself. Sadly it does not count as a hat. He offers to sell another one. We decide Emilio should get it. Plex asks for his chicken back. "Do you want the one with the bowl or the one with the coconut?" Emilio picks the bowl, which apparently was very important to a dead man a long time ago, and pays with Plex' last Wooden chicken statue with knife beak.

Ah, the beauty. Truly a story arc ending. Threads are tied, plot points are resolved. I watch in awe.

Aviana casts Resistance on herself. Multiple times. Risking a surge every time. What could possibly go wrong.

We descend into the crater, visibility reduced to 60 feet, the smoke stinging our eyes and irritating our skin. Fearghas' armour starts squeaking as the heavy smoke and ash creep into the joints, he prestidigitates it away when it gets bad. It gets hotter the lower we go; we walk down a winding tunnel and Fearghas trips on something hard. Doesn't look like a stone? It's blackened steel… a merregon's breastplate…? Farther ahead, the horn of a horned devil. Next to it, a satchel. Inside, 8 vials of Silver Tears! I really don't want any of that… but I reluctantly take one. Just to protect everyone. I hope with all my heart I won't have to use it.

About an hour in, with Aviana casting Resistance every single minute, she somehow DOES NOT GET A SINGLE SURGE. This right here is the real magic. As we continue walking we realise this place is a maze… but Fearghas' spell guides us. The tunnel opens up, and the ground is pierced by more and more shafts straight down, some wide, other very narrow.

Fearghas, Shalkoc, and myself get this feeling of being watched… and it's coming from everywhere around us except the ground beneath our feet. It even comes from the walls themselves… As we walk on, it only gets more intense. The air is also getting hotter; even for me the temperature is really uncomfortable. We… aren't supposed to be here. Something really doesn't want us here. The environment starts to express this; the ground crumbles right in front of our feet into a deep chasm.

Fearghas snorts his Silver Tears… but it doesn't help at all. We step into a giant cavern. A chasm yawns in front of us, crossed by a stone bridge. Find the Path points straight ahead… We start on the bridge, and a powerful gust of wind roars upward, knocking Emilio, Fearghas, and Plex 30 feet back and prone. The bridge was blasted away, and the updraft continues to blow. Aviana is squealing and holding her dress down, although no one is looking.

Aviana suggests linking us all with a chain, and jumping across. Kyrin suggests as many of us as possible get into her hole. Plex considers Adjust Density. When Kyrin brings up the Portable Hole, the two wizards frown. Getting into the hole should be fine, but exiting it probably will see us back in Avernus, as it is an extradimensional space.

Kyrin casually teleports across with Psychic Teleportation; she throws her dagger and first it goes up, then plummets as the air current switches directions and is now rushing down. That's… not how air behaves? "It is if something is breathing in and out," Fearghas says. Why… why did you have to say this… the nightmare fuel… Shalkoc flies across. Aviana throws a chain across to help the rest of us cross, and holds it steady. Kyrin secures the other end of the chain to rocks. Thankfully, as Shalkoc was about to wrap the chain around a cracked rock!

Plex halves his density, takes off his shoes to better balance on the chain, and walks across. He makes it but loses his balance at the end, and Shalkoc rescues him in the nick of time. I crawl across but as I reach the exact middle of the chain, out of reach from etiher side, my sweaty hands slip and I lose my grip. I dangle by a leg, the air current pulling me down… Panicked, I meld into darkness with Shadowslip and slide across the chain, weightless. On the other side, I remain a tiny pool of darkness, as flat as possible as if hugging the ground. Shadows make no sound but this shadow is whimpering. Kyrin's shadow somehow… stretches and scoots towards mine, as if curious.

Emilio balances his way across… halfway through, the air current reverses again to upward. It throws off his balance and he is launched upwards, narrowly missing rocks that would kill him on impact. Fearghas manages a Feather Fall just in time, but he zooms 200 feet above. Shalkoc flies up after him, and the air pushes him up at superior speed. Emilio slips into Void Form and uses Phase Shift to teleport to Shalkoc. He grumbles he should have just teleported from the start. Shalkoc exclaims "Woooo! You can fly as well!" Thankfully our dragonborn still grabs the warlock and flies them both safely to the ground.

Right after they land, the air current shifts to downwards again. Fearghas crosses by sheer cool factor, whatever that means. We all retreat from the edge to give Aviana space to land… Fearghas goes first and grumbles… "We are not alone." Emilio looks a little too happy about that. Hey we're not in Muravelara anymore you can chill out. Ahead of us, strands of smoke form into a vaguely humanoid shape, a Soot Elemental. It stares at Fearghas, who stares back, and rushes at him. Fearghas raises his hand to fire off a spell.

Everything around us vibrates and resonates as a growl comes from everywhere at once; from down below, bouncing off every stone.

pages.name: 87 - Growth spurt, evil smoke, and many stubbed toes
pages.content:
Tuesday, 12th of Decimus, 1497

22:55

We begin by rolling initiative, and Plex feels an extra angry stone appear. Shalkoc sprouts dragon wings and buggers off to the west, flying into a cloud that chokes and silences him, uh-oh. Thankfully, he is capable of punching without shit-talking or even breathing! The banter is entirely optional! He hits something in there and stuns whatever it is. He then stuns it again, for reasons, and punches ever onwards. The DM ominously appeals to our greed, and Shalkoc backs out of the choking cloud and immediately begins yapping again, it's nice to have him back! I was worried for a second there.

There is snacking and then Emilio does some Eldritch blasting. He hits with all three beams but Plex is locked out of the server by Aerelia's ISP. We all get shunted into the aether for few minutes, then Emilio gets a surge and grows to Large size! Aviana is delighted and Fearghas freaks out, half the table descends into absolute chaos, excellent.

Fearghas shoots a Fire Bolt and we find out the Living Soot is immune to fire, then he stubs his toe on an inconveniently placed tiny rock, which proceeds to get up and hurl itself at the wizard. Oh dear… It misses, and falls prone. I scout out the battlefield in shadow form and take the Dodge action. Plex uses Mold Earth to fuse the chain with the rock, then hides behind the big rock. Another rock launches itself at Emilio and hits his ankle, dealing minor damage then falling prone.

Aviana RAAAAAAAAAGES and crosses the chasm, asks Fearghas if the pebble is killing him. He says no, so she concludes the pebble is killing him and uses her Battering Ram on it, crashing into Kyrin who was hiding nearby. Woops! She charges again, straight into Plex who was also hiding, and everyone but Aviana could see him. He rolls a dirty 0 on the save and is punted into the pebble behind him. Both are distracted. Emilio talks shit at Fearghas: "And you complain when I turn off the lights??"

The Living Soot floats over to Aviana, does a little spin on itself and creates a poisonous tornado of Engulfing Sootstorm. Fearghas, Plex, and Emilio all fall prone and take damage. A rock flings itself at my shadow, but misses and falls prone because I have sick dodges. A light begins to shine out of nowhere! We have the sneaking suspicion a rogue just equipped a sword. Aviana wants to feed a Potion of Growth to Emilio. If he activates Void Form does he then turn into a kaiju? Hmmm…

Kyrin starts slicing at the second Soot that showed up, with limited success. Shalkoc casually punches a puff of smoke to death, and flies over to find a giant Emilio lying on the ground, the rest of us choking, and I'm not even here. Emilio gets up and disregards the need to breathe in favour of slicing at the Living Soot, but he gets ANOTHER surge and explodes, catching us all in the blast. It's a massive explosion and we all take heavy force damage! Fearghas is panicking thinking Emilio lost control of his powers and the Emissary he ate is corrupting him. I get pushed out of Shadowslip, Kyrin perfectly dodges and takes no damage, and Plex falls unconscious. His Vortex Warp contigency activates!

Fearghas stands up, reluctantly, and eats an opportunity attack by walking away, thankfully it misses. He casts Magic Missile at 1st level, hoping it will be the final straw. He gets a surge that protects him from devils, sort of. One Living Soot dies! I slap down a Wellspring of Life, then step around the big rock following Fearghas' directions. I spot Plex and yell at him to STOP DYING, casting a Healing Word. Then I hide behind the big rock as I don't have enough movement to return to the Wellspring and dip my toes in, sad times.

Plex agrees to stop dying and Fey Steps across the chasm, goes straight back to hugging the Living Soot and choking. Sigh. He bonks a puff of evil smoke with the Spriggan Staff, dealing all of 2 damage. Aviana somehow applies Death Ward on Plex. She says to Fearghas, "Plex is in safe hands!" and just then, the goblin is grappled and restrained by the remaining Soot, who proceeds to slap him until the ward triggers and leaves him at 1 HP. The Soot then flies away still carrying Plex. Get back here with our goblin! Shalkoc, get him!

Kyrin attempts to, I quote, "snatch his little goblin ass back" but Plex is already too far. She then shoots the Soot, which dies, and Plex is shot 200 feet up by the wind draft. He's still distracted from the soot and unable to take reactions, and so is Fearghas, so what even is Feather Fall? Just then the draft switches back to downwards, sucking Plex in. The winged rescuer Shalkoc flies to Plex using Step of the Wind and readies to catch the goblin on his way down. He catches Plex gently like a chicken that escaped the coop. "I can't let you go," he says to Plex, "you still owe me 7000 gold… with 20% interest."

Hanging over the abyss, Shalkoc and Plex argue over debt and potential goblinicide, Plex magicked himself out of Shalkoc's grasp to avoid paying up, but the Dragonborn is a good friend and catches him. We all stack up in the Wellspring and clean off the soot. The spell easily closes all our wounds! As we are healing up and I'm checking Emilio to try to figure out if his void powers are getting out of control, and he is still in Void Form… more Living Soots attack us! Yeah that's on us, lingering in a highly hostile area…

Shalkoc breathes on it, Fearghas chucks a Ray of Frost and tells us to get the hell out of here. Ironic, considering… Following his directions, we all start running north, the last location indicated by Find the Path before he dropped concentration. Kyrin shoots it, then runs and hides. I try to restrain the Soot with Binding Shadows, but it is immune. Well, worth a try. I run up to Fearghas, but the elemental follows right behind me, putting both wizards and myself in a cloud of poisonous smoke… We all pass the DEX save and take no damage!

Emilio casts Steel Wind Strike and teleports to the Soot to slice it up. Aviana tries to catch it in the Iron Flask but it resists it, good attempt. Shalkoc runs up to the Soot and punches it, gets a surge that reverses his damage and healing, misses, punches again, and heals the enemy. We are all waving at him to STOP PUNCHING but we can't speak on account of choking on soot. Shalkoc proceeds to practice social distancing, eats an attack of opportunity for his trouble, and protects himself with his wings.

Fearghas runs away and stubs his toe, again. He blasts a Ray of Frost on the Soot for FIFTY-SIX DAMAGE?! It's vulnerable to cold damage! The smoke from the elemental's body starts freezing, sadly the cloud choking us is not affected. Plex stubs his toe and casts Sapping Sting on the Soot, who saves and takes no damage. Plex teleports… but Fey Step takes him to the west and he plummets into the abyss as he is sucked in by the downward draft. Fearghas snaps a Feather Fall on him just in time.

Kyrin swoops from the shadows and slaps a critical hit on the Soot with the Sun Blade, smiting the daylight out of it. Plex is still falling to his death, albeit slowly. The down draft increases, as if something massive was taking a really deep breath. I walk up to Fearghas up to the next chasm, but I have no way of getting Plex so I hold myself ready to dodge attacks. Emilio follows suit, also using Dodge. Aviana jumps over the chasm and readies the Iron Flask… to catch Plex in it when he inevitably zooms back up.

Shalkoc slams his fist down, hitting one of the Slingrock Blocklets, the pebbles that have been stubbing our collective toes all this while. Instead of getting crushed, it gets shot 20 feet away thanks to its feature Skipping Tumble. Just kicking rocks over here. Fearghas Misty Steps across the gap and stubs his toe, prompting healthy dwarven grumbling.

Plex is plummeting towards a pool of lava, though none of us knows this. He uses his Mage Hand to loot gemstones, priorities?? Up here, the smoke and fog are getting sucked down into the chasm… Kyrin teleports across. I cast Levitate through Lioriel's staff and push myself across. Shalkoc flies down to grab Plex.

The downward draft becomes so strong, it tears off boulders bigger than me from the walls. I hurriedly drop Levitate before getting crushed to death, and follow everyone down with Feather Fall. We have no way back up but we have bigger problems right now. And we are right back in initiative order as a thunderous grumbling shakes the walls. Fearghas GLARES at Plex in an attempt at nonverbal communication, but the goblin is confused.

The ceilings are lower here so Shalkoc needs to land. We sneak through narrow passages, dodging lava pools and giant inhaling currents. Plex uses Minor Illusion to make a bunny. Fearghas jumps to grab shiny pyropes. Shalkoc smells money and… steps into the wind currents. He is immediately knocked on his bum. Plex uses Fey Step, teleports himself into the wall and is shunted out. There is a really creepy feeling to this place… like something is following right behind us, getting closer by the second.

Kyrin tries to grab a toe-stubbing rock, misses, trips and falls prone. Emilio and me fall behind… the soot seeping from the walls seems to solidify, and I make out the outline of something huge to the north-west! We need to run for our lives!! Fearghas steps back to catch a glimpse, then runs back saying it's big and we all need to book it. I've been saying the exact same thing! But he doesn't believe me because I'm always squeaking gnegnegne…

Shalkoc tries to go pick up diamonds glittering in the soot, but steps into the wind again and gets dragged backwards and knocked on his bum. Again. The déjà-vu is overwhelming… Plex places a Wall of Stone in the path of the inhale, causing the air current to bounce off and shove Fearghas. Emilio dashes behind me, using his last essence shard on Netherwalk to increase his speed.

The gargantuan creature… GLIDES RIGHT BEHIND US!! It lashes out at me and grapples me, picks me up, and flings me at Emilio. I crash into him, knocking us both prone. The monster attacks Kyrin, everyone is shouting, Aviana shoves me into the wind which pushes me next to Fearghas. Kyrin goes invisible with Psychic Veil. Fearghas pops a spellgem to inflict Slow on the monster, which does not seem bothered in the slightest.

Plex is grappled, then flung at Fearghas, causing the goblin to lose concentration on the Wall of Stone that was protecting us from the inhale. Shalkoc casts Guardian of Nature, then sneezes on the big thing. He proceeds to run off TOWARDS the Giru to pick up loot. He is shouting about money with the monster breathing down his neck… I get to my feet and quicken a 3rd-level Cure Wounds on Plex, who immediately creates an Instant Door into the wall and steps through it. Emilio is struggling to get through the air current and join us but he is cursed with ever-failing strength saves.

Shalkoc narrowly deflects an attack with his Protective Wings, but the Giru just catches him and flings him instead, over the pile of gold. He smacks against the wall and slides down into the lava. Aviana picks up a boulder and plonks it into the hole from where the wind is blowing, temporarily stopping the current… but the pressure is already building, it won't hold for long!

Fearghas Polymorphs himself into a Stone Whale. execute plan whaleghas He grabs me in his mouth, then similarly eats up Plex who was hiding in a closet of his own making like some green ostrich. He swims through the stone, and gobbles up Shalkoc. Inside Whaleghas, we go on an adventure as he flies all across the cavern to pick up loot. He is picked up and flung into the lava by the Giru… which breaks his concentration on Polymorph!! And uses inspiration to reroll and pass, phew. Shalkoc wants out to loot the place, but we are in lava… Kyrin suggests he goes through the blowhole, "like a snot rocket", but even that is too dangerous.

I sense a request for love and support for Whaleghas, so following Shalkoc's example I cast a warded heightened Cure Wounds on him, closing all his wounds. The Giru floats over to us… Whaleghas tries to communicate with Plex, who casts Tidal Wave, dousing the lava. Right after, Fearghas uses a Dreamfeather, which causes a surge… TRANSFORMING ALL LIQUIDS WITHIN 5FT INTO LUKEWARM WATER WHEN DRUNK. It only lasts a minute so quick drink up the lava!!

The Giru whacks Whaleghas until he is no longer a whale and we all land into the lava. Aviana wraps Emilio in chains to drag him through the air currents, and they dash into the cavern. Well Aviana dashes, Emilio just follows somewhat unwillingly. Kyrin is looting the place and picks up, in addition to a lot of gold, a Sheeshah of Revelations, a pipe allowing the user to have prophetic visions.

The smoke lifts, and we see diamonds glittering in the distance! Fearghas chugs a Potion of Flying and Polymorphs right back into Whaleghas, and scoops the three of us back up into the whale dimension. He Disengages, gets pushed by an air current on his way, and floats across the cavern towards the exit. I give Shalkoc a good bit of healing, and Plex halves Whaleghas' weight.

Emilio really wants a snack in the form of essence shards so he starts slicing at the Giru. Good start, but then he rolls a natural 1 and a Living Soot pops up. Aviana charges just for the sake of a little HP, dragging our poor warlock along. She then rushes into a narrow passage, still dragging a Large-size Emilio who will not fit in the tunnel… some train memes and mental images later, he gets dragged through, taking only minor damage from the sharp rocks. She shatters the chain, freeing Emilio. She couldn't do this any sooner?

Kyrin happily picks up more diamonds. Emilio then gets flung into the lava.

"MacWhale?" - "That's Whaleghas MacWhale to ya, son."

A diamond tumbles into Whaleghas' mouth along with some lukewarm water, and I catch it. A big slab of granite comes in…? Along with some half-chewed rocks which whack both Shalkoc and me in the face. Plex somehow triumphantly dodges all the rocks, standing on the stone slab. It's a hover board! I mean, Earthboard. Shalkoc is buried under a big slab of rock, in Whaleghas' mouth. He struggles but he is flat as a pancake with all the strength of boiled lettuce. I'm also squished under stone, but I manage to get my hands free and Levitate the rocks off of Shalkoc and me.

Emilio is getting grabbed out of the lava, and flung back into it. Plex wants to… ahem… explore Whaleghas' body?! "What's the safe word for this campaign?" Karnack asks. We dissuade Plex, who exits the whale instead. Emilio gets fried by lava, he is alive but barely. He burns his last pact slot on Void Torrent to get close to Whaleghas, stubs his toe, and struggles towards me. He pops a shard on Accrued Vitality, not only rolls like shit but also gets a major surge which makes a 50% chance to fill unattended containers with spiders. "Yay snacks!" Plex exclaims. Screw this I'm casting Remove Curse asap.

Aviana drops to 0 HP, but she is raging so Relentless Rage activates and she drops to 1 HP instead! She uses Battering Ram for temp HP and runs straight south. Coming to a hole in the ground, she sees a city far below… only a city, as far as she can see. It's Dis! She tries to shout to us to guide us, but we're too far to hear. Not sure whether to jump, she charges at the wall and leaves a dent. Good job! She drinks up a Potion of Legendary Resistance and waits for us to catch up.

Kyrin teleports closer to Aviana, unfortunately so does the Giru. Whaleghas whales to Aviana, and spits Shalkoc and me out. Hey we're right by the exit! He swims through the wall again and grabs Emilio to bring him to us. Whaleghas floats down through the hole, still carrying Emilio. Shalkoc grabs me and unfolds his wings, carrying me down to Whaleghas' back. Plex gets grabbed and flung against Kyrin. The Living Soot grapples and restrains him within the silencing cloud of choking, but Plex burns a Mythic Power on Convincing Arguments, persuading himself he is not silenced at all. He casts Thunder Step and lands on Whaleghas' back.

Only Aviana and the Giru are left in Avernus and she is at 1 HP with a little temp HP! She uses a Mythic Power on Legendary Vigor, granting her success on Relentless Rage. She shoves the Giru away, and jumps into the hole. Kyrin catches her with telekinesis to avoid the damage from her Thunderfeet. The Giru tries to chase, but cannot seem to pass through the hole!

We all enter Dis and feel the realm effect Dispater's Iron Wards, making Divination, Illusion, and Enchantment spells really difficult if not straight up impossible.

pages.name: 88 - Sightseeing and shopping in Dis
pages.content:
Tuesday, Decimus 12th, 1497

23:00

Whaleghas flies lower, looking for a quiet spot to land but… this place is a giant anthill, without the ants, as far as I can see that is. There are devils flying around, yikes. We fly through a sickly yellow, acrid smoke that is still so much more breathable than what passes for air in the Black Vents! The urban landscape is dominated by the Iron Tower in the distance.

Emilio comes in clutch as Aviana, Shalkoc, and Plex weren't paying attention. Whaleghas is a whale. Apparently being choked by Zariel was educational? He says Dispater is extremely paranoid and the entire city is under constant surveilance. Yeah and a flying whale isn't drawing any attention… Whaleghas is offended by the voice of god calling him fat. Aviana flexes with an inspiring quote to help Whaleghas hide in the smog, and I give him a headpat for Guidance.

We land in an alley just wide enough for Whaleghas to get through; a river of molten slag flows nearby, and the heat near grills us where we stand. Most buildings are metal, and most glow as if just taken from the forge… Let's try not to touch anything shall we? Whaleghas spits out Bigmilio who is covered in slobber and grumbles "Never again!", to which Whaleghas replies by giving him a big lick and one of the cat ears on his starry hoodie sticks right up. I give Kyrin the very heavy Earthboard to put inside her Portable Hole. With the sound of a deflating balloon, Whaleghas reverts to Fearghas!

Of course all this attracted attention and a Horn Devil flies down to us asking to see our flying permit, and our landing permit. Kyrin smells an amount of bullshit and asks the devil where his own flying permit is. He is confused and says he doesn't need one on account of being from here. Plex says "How do you know we're not from here?" The devil loses brain cells. Kyrin calls him out on trying to shake us down for money. He denies, but just then Fearghas' Bag of Scolding begins to abundantly insult him.

Just our luck, the devil thinks we insulted him. We try to explain, he does not believe us. He tells an outright lie, which deeply disappoints me, where is my White Tower bullshit!! Fearghas tries to be friendly so the devil asks why we're here. Sightseeing and shopping for clothes and spices. He mentions an incident in Avernus with a spice trader… ahahah… We start talking about Zacharias, the viceroy of the viceroy of Dispater! In between Zacharias and Dispater is Titivilus, we learn.

We ask our "friend" if he can recommend us a good inn. He points us to a "cozy" establishment called Out of Thyme. Fearghas gives the devil 3 Soul Coins and he lets us be on our way. We immediately go in the opposite direction. I'm suddenly covered in spiders!! Emilio is acting far too innocent about it. We start walking down the bone-paved street as I slap creepy crawlies away and try to not let Plex or Shalkoc catch a snack off my back. Plex is looking at these spiders with far too much interest while Aviana is turning her wings red.

Plex identifies the spiders, their entire lineage, their history and even the name of their little cousins. And they're edible, he's had similar ones before. I grill Emilio until he admits having a spider-spawning surge, and I flick him on the ankle with a Remove Curse at 9th level, then I heal us all with a Wellspring of Life. Fearghas casts a Sending to notify our allies in Mechanus.

We spot a Pit Fiend intimidating a small person, a Halfling or a Gnome. The small person shakes his head impatiently and ROASTS the Pit Fiend and threatens to turn him into an imp?! All quasits are now French. The Pit Fiend lets out an ear-shattering roar and takes flight, chucking Fireballs into the sky.. Kyrin, Emilio, and Plex didn't slot Earplugs on their armour… The Gnome turns around whistling, but stops the moment he sees Fearghas, who recognises him as Jubilost Narthropple the jewel-crafter. Who was killed by Kali over 6 months ago!

He is… very happy in Hell. Business is booming. What brings you down here, he asks. Sightseeing. Shopping. He invites us to his workshop for a catch-up session. He says the people of Hell recognise and encourage his genius, and provide him with materials. Jubilost takes us to his jewelcutter's workshop; tools are strewn around but everything seems covered in a fine layer of white dust, and in the middle of the room is a third of a 3m in diameter crystalline sphere with a ladder to the side, being built from the bottom up.

Fearghas puts on his Glasses of True Seeing. Every 30 feet in the street is a Scrying sensor. As we sit down, a crate in the corner bursts into flame. Jubilost sighs, douses the crate, and sits back down. I ask if this is a regular occurrence. The jewel-crafter says "oh no it's just not very happy here". He retrieves a piece of coal from the crate. Confused, we enquire about it. The gnome lights the coal on fire and drops it into a bowl. A tiny blue flame sparks up; a shard of a spirit, he says. Jubilost asks us to take the spirit with us, and we hurriedly agree. Emilio reaches his hand out towards the flame. Fearghas frowns, but Jubilost seems genuinely sad about the spirit.

Emilio picks up the coal; Hearthkeeper's Spark, basically a pet fire! Shalkoc is excited to have the Spark help him cook. Plex feeds a spider to the Spark, making a stink in the workshop. Shalkoc feeds a piece of chocolate to the Spark. Emilio lights matches and happily feeds them to the Spark. Jubilost is not happy with our bullshit, understandably… He explains he got the Spark when his workshop burnt to the ground.

Aviana wants to do some post-workout workout and is looking for something to lift. Fearghas finally asks about the crystal elephant in the room, I mean the sphere. Jubilost is making a giant crystal ball out of angel's tears… He tried with angel's eyes, but it didn't work as well. I feel sick and look away, but everywhere I lay eyes is more of the white dust, angel's tears… Fearghas cools down Aviana with a Prestidigitation on her clothes. Shalkoc basks in the coolness. Jubilost does not want magic in his workshop, for obvious reasons.

Kyrin is snooping, she is invisible but still leaving footprints in the dust. Just then her invisibility runs out! But Jubilost had his back to her so he doesn't see her pop into existence. Plex offers to trade gems and Jubilost offers old underwear for them. Hole-y underwear, not in the heavenly sense. Jubilost reveals he owns none of his workshop as he is owned by Titivilus. We need, of course, permits for everything; owning money, trading money, being in any 30-foot area… Nobody waits for the permits, you're supposed to pay for them.

Fearghas and Jubilost have a chat, and halfway through the gnome interrupts our friend and asks someone else to talk because he is bored listening to ONLY Fearghas. We ask where we can lay low for a bit; Jubilost talks about a mansion not far from here, which has been empty for as long as he's been here. Supposedly there is no surveilance in there, and the owner isn't coming back… The manor's owner is Zacharias! Nobody knows what happened to him, and he isn't dead. Fearghas asks if it's legal to go to the mansion. Jubilost says getting caught for trespassing is a crime… aight message received.

Kyrin asks questions about gems and Jubilost begins info-dumping on her. Aerelia is choking on watermelon, what a surprising change of pace from carrots! We talk about diamonds and the cost of spells, and Kyrin is surprised to learn I can bypass material components on spells. Heheh, sorcerers can ignore certain rules. Aviana asks for EYEglasses made of diamonds. Kyrin tells her off for wasting diamonds I could use to bring people back to life!

Furious shouting and cursing interrupts our friendly conversation, drawing nearer as it announces the arrival of the Pit Fiend. Jubilost strongly advises us to "get the fuck out of here" as we are not under anyone's protection. We walk down a road lined with caverns and eventually make it to the manor. A bridge that ends in a drawbridge, pulled up, spans a river of lava. Plex pesters Fearghas to write him permits for walking, and for talking, and for his staff, and for his hats… We lose sight of Kyrin, again, and assume she is sneaking too well for any of us to spot her. Again. Aviana don't step on her again.

In the lava river, two statues crouch on rocks on either side of the bridge. We are super suspicious of the statues. Fearghas casts Detect Magic ritually, which is now a 1st-level spell that would consume a 6th-level spell slot, ouch. But ritual casting bypasses spell slots. Plex is now pestering Aviana for permits, who is being surprisingly patient. On either side of the drawbridge, battlements jut out of a stone wall which the manor is built into. Shalkoc picks up two pebbles and throws them at the statues, but nothing happens.

The bridge is really low over the lava, so since Kyrin can't find any traps we cross rather quickly before the heat can fry us. Kyrin teleports to the battlements, and Shalkoc flies after her. She finds the mechanism to let down the drawbridge, and in we go! We close the drawbridge again behind us. Shalkoc somehow breaks the battlemap, confusing the hell out of the DM. Fearghas cautions against scattering… so naturally Shalkoc gives everyone chocolate. Plex pulls out the Instant Door but it's not working on these walls! Plex finds out the hard way the walls are magical. Emilio tries to pick the lock by the mundane use of Thieves' Tools, but nope. His lockpick gets jammed in the lock…

There is a fancy, colourful design engraved in the floor… there is dried blood over it, urgh. Plex of course Fey Steps himself into a cell on the other side of the door Emilio tried to pick. PLEX GETS INSPIRATION FOR THIS. A squeaky voice speaks to him in a language he doesn't understand. Fearghas wants the door ripped off because the goblin ran off again. Plex successfully makes an Instant Door and sneaks around very poorly. "Hello there," says Plex to a tiny green thing staring at him. The green thing tries to hide but its horns and ears stick out of the hay. It's a croissant quasit! That's… a demon. What is it doing in Hell?!

Aviana shoulders the door into next week, then goes back to writing permits for Plex. There is a small office beyond, and another locked door between Plex and us. We kindly ask Kyrin to pick the lock and it clicks open with ease. Fearghas tells off Plex and… sees the tiny demon thing, to which Plex is offering some briar as a snack. The quasit tries to bite off Plex' hand, but he withdraws it real quick. Fearghas casts Comprehend Languages to communicate with the demon… Turns out the quasit is insulting the ever-living daylights out of Fearghas and also asking how to get out of here, as an afterthought. Plex also casts Comprehend Languages, both wizards have to cast it ritually as it is Divination and the realm effect makes it troublesome.

The quasit is not forthcoming with information nor polite. At all. Then it turns invisible. Fearghas advises to leave it alone for now. We search the office and find reports from 6 months ago, most of them about punishing servants. The last page is ripped out. We find a permit that allows the bearer to carry a permit to imprison people. We're in German gun laws bureaucracy, then… We discuss Zacharias and Fearghas and Aviana describe a dashing Tiefling in a suit, wearing a top hat and doing card tricks. Plex chimes in he was dealing with demons.

On the other side of the hall, we find a forge full of weapons. Shalkoc sneakily bites his finger to drip blood onto the intricate design in the floor in the entrance hall. The engraving soaks up the blood with supernatural speed… but nothing else happens. The ledgers in the forge have 7 or 8 pages ripped out. In the coals of the forge, now cold, a page has not quite burnt up… Fearghas can just make out the name U'usholgas. He finds some cold iron, a metal used to fight demons.

I'm trying very hard to dissuade Plex from teleporting on the other side of the door. Fearghas and Kyrin go question the invisible quasit about U'usholgas, with very little results. Plex starts painting the Knock spell on the door. Fearghas pokes Plex with the cold iron, who is very uncomfortable as fey creatures also react to that metal. "We have a demon in the prison! That was unnecessary", Plex grumbles.

We gather around the symbol carved into the floor and talk about blood. Aviana suggests bleeding Shalkoc above the sigil in the flor and it makes me very sad. Fearghas casts Detect Magic and sees several types of magic. The door is a big slab of carved stone with no handle or hinges, clearly magical. Kyrin sneaks back into the prison to try to catch the quasit so we place our bets. The little demon turns into a bat and camps by the ceiling. Oh it is on. Kyrin uses her shadow to extend her reach and swat him down with Shadow Strike. She catches him like a terrible little pidgeon!

The quasit makes a scary grimace at Kyrin but she gives him a little squeeze right around the throat. He tries to bite, a lot, but Kyrin carries him back to the rest of us. Fearghas grumbles and pays his wager to Aviana. The wizards understand what the quasit is screeching, and it is insulting us of course gorilla warfare. Fearghas translates, it's not gonna work, there is so much blood out there. We still, in Fearghas' words, "squeeze him like a lemon". No results, none with Fearghas' blood either. Based on the quasit's rambling and our experiments, we theorise we need… devil blood.

Kyrin and me go up the stairs to the battlements. Clearly bodies have been dumped into the lava over the crenellations, and drops of dried blood remain. Aviana bonks her head on the door, with no result. Plex Fey Steps, but appears next to Aviana as he can't control the direction he goes. Fearghas grumbles he can't cast Disintegrate on a magical object. We suggest Kyrin sneaks off, abducts a random imp, and we can squeeze that over the symbol.

She finds 3 imps, one of them digging a hole and 2 others drinking beer and watching. She creates a diversion with a ball bearing and distracts one of them. She grabs an imp, stabs it nonlethally, and happily brings it back. Fearghas slices into it, and the blood isn't absorbed into the floor, it spreads in the intricate pattern. Hmmmm, we need more… Well, off with its head. Plex loots the tiny little workman's hat.

We enter into a hall dominated by a pillar. There is a swirling sound like a… portal opening…? Kyrin casually rolls a 34 on Stealth and possibly dips into the Ethereal plane. Then Fearghas, with a 35 on Arcana, figures out the portal will take exactly 7 minutes to open. Quick, loot every room!! We roll initiative like DEMIGODS, nothing under a 16 and most over 20. We're wasting all our good rolls! Shalkoc tests a bed for comfort. Plex picks up a lot of paper (permits?). Kyrin opens a chest so sneakily that it doesn't remember being opened; it's never been touched like this! She vaccuums up 3000 gold.

Fearghas identifies the portal as a one-way portal to the Abyss, and doesn't think anything can come through. We're not under time pressure, so we start investigating the entire area. To the right of the portal room, we find a comfy study or office, one wall of which holds a door obviously opened with a key in the shape of a stylised wing. In the inkwell is a quill made of a harpy's feather. The inkwell contains a lot of Abyssal Nail Polish! There is another locked door. We guess it leads to a treasure vault, so Fearghas teleports to the other side with a Dimension Door. Just as he starts looting, he gets a Sending back from Mechanus, we must go back as soon as possible!

Fearghas herds us like kittens and casts Plane Shift, but Aviana does need to go grab Plex by the neck before he can cast Gravity Sinkhole and gets us into massive trouble. We hurry through the formalities of entering Axis, and make it to the room where Zariel has been summoned. She is glowering at us. Dis was hot, but the archduchess of Avernus is making the Plane of Fire seem cool now. The Modrons ask Kyrin to hand over the Beacon of Doom. Master Kazzim is also here and he is very sad to see the Beacon go. We all sign the contract devised by the denizens of Mechanus.

"Pleasure doing business with ya," Fearghas says to Zariel. With this we are free from our contracts and we can buy passage into Dis from the Bronze Citadel! (for the low price of 5000 gold per person) Kyrin says to Zariel, "Shaik sends her regards." Zariel is fuming so much, the nearby Modrons are starting to melt. She turns on her heels, and Plane Shifts away.

Plex exchanges trinkets with Master Kazzim; his Fabulous Appearance trap, which goes off, for a model flying balloon.

Aviana pulls out the Transdimensional Anchorchain to take us back to Promise. Plex hangs from the chain as he is helping with Adjust Density. Fearghas' Guidance makes her pass the strength check on the second try; the Material Plane is pulled towards Mechanus and we all jump through. Aviana is last, and she gets LAUNCHED through the portal at mach 7, misses the cabin, gets catapulted up the slope of her roost and soars back to the town, leaving a crater when she falls. "Just gotta work on my landing!"

We check on the people of Promise, and find General Ragvond of the Frost Giants still here. They set up tents in the market square, and their armour is damaged. Ragvond greets us, seeming tired. He says the town was attacked by… undead dragons?! He is very proud of defending the town and most importantly the brewery.

The island is still travelling towards Taldor, where I plan to hire people to investigate Ildilas. We learn the children of Promise apparently like Kali and Joline a lot, and the parents are complaining the two women have been teaching their kids… how to set trap, how to become poisoners, and also archery so some of the kids have returned with arrow wounds. Oops. Kyrin hugs Kali, and the Spidrow freezes, she is not a very affectionate person.

Fearghas asks about the undead dragons, and if Kali has any more information about them. She brings up the undead army in Lessia. Kali warned the Frost Giants so they were ready to face the attack. We tell her about the vending machines from Mechanus and she is confused, don't blame her. We discuss the whole "teaching archery to children by letting them shoot one another". It's really not as bad as it sounds. We discuss, at length, the children of Promise and their education. The Springseed trees are growing nicely, though one of the saplings has a tendency to run off, ah well, even trees can be troublesome.

We retire to the cabin and look through our loot. Fearghas pays Plex 100gp just so he shows off the papers and scrolls he grabbed from Zacharias' manor. Kyrin distributes the gold she looted. Aviana triggers one of Plex' traps, which causes a surge turning her skin grey, and another surge poisoning her. Meanwhile Plex gets a surge that cannot be removed and… he gains proficiency with painter's tools. All his practice on hags paid off.

Aviana shrieks PLEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEX!! and the goblin casually replies "I did nothing, you knew I trapped the house!" and Emilio shrugs and says "I did not eat the Emissary, it just fell through my portal". Right. Then Aviana opens another door, triggering another of Plex' traps… this one had Troll musk concentrate. Now we need to clean the house, Shalkoc says. And another hurting stone shouts OW.

pages.name: 89 - Tripping in the Feywild and back again
pages.content:
Wednesday, 13th of Decimus, 1497

10:00

Plex is doing goblin things like painting a mushroom forest in his (?) room and trying to sell himself on the markets. Fearghas negociates with Plex for spell scrolls. Shalkoc sells chocolate to Plex. The island is still floating towards Taldor but it will take 2.5 months before it arrives.

Fearghas is researching stone whales and looking for dirt on Zacharias but mostly on his boss Toblerone (Titivilus).

Aviana is trying to craft shoes and hats, and taking a walk in Jotunheim. She's also helping Kyrin make protective gear for the children who are training in archery.

Shalkoc wants to acquire (read: enslave and juice) more air elementals.

Kyrin is playing with the children as Miri, and learning from Joline and Kali.

I meet up with Fearghas' mum and we exchange plant secrets. Then I join Kyrin and Shalkoc for spider-speak class with Kali.

Plex is zipping to the Feywild to look for help building the Nexus… and introducing fey creatures and plants to Promise, what could go wrong.

Emilio is scouting around his home village and he wants to research void portals but… how? Claude got fried researching the Void… Fearghas offers assistance with his Void Explorer Spellbook. He also sits cross-legged a bunch doing who knows what.

Kali tells Shalkoc to please feed Ivernia, she is making everyone nervous. The little wyvern wants food, a lot of it, and now please. She'll eat a cow every day. Shalkoc feeds her a few pieces of chocolate. She tries to get into the Snack Pack, misses, and makes puppy eyes at Shalkoc for more chocolate.

Shalkoc suggests to Aviana building a farm just to feed Ivernia and Kaar so they don't start attacking people. Aviana says, let's please everyone, start a goat farm so Plex is happy, kill the goats so Fearghas is happy, and feed the goats to our pets. Back to the spider-speaking class, Kali asks us to share experiences of understanding animals. Shalkoc talks about eating animals, and Kali suggests he maybe tries feeding animals instead. Kyrin talks about feeding rats in the city, who'd then bring shiny trinkets. Kali says rats are very tasty. I talk about the small sand cats in Ildilas getting into food stores.

I grumble about the wasps on Ildilas attacking spiders, and Kali encourages me to go talk to the hornets. WHY. One of them lands on my staff and walks to my hand. I try to not piss it off. It works out somewhat, then the insect gets into my cookie jar. We are finding common ground at last! I put down my cookie jar as a peace offering for the hornets, and over FOUR HUNDRED come to accept the peace offering. That's WAY more than I expected, I lose my cool and leg it as fast as I can, which is not very fast. Kali says when I'm frightened, hornets see me as the cookie as fear smells delicious to them. I am to offer them cookies on the regular and become less scared. Well it gives me a good excuse to pick up on the baking sessions with Shalkoc.

Kyrin says she mostly has experience with small animals, but she doesn't like snakes. Kali agrees they're very sneaky… but they make reeeeeaaaaaally good poison. She tasks Kyrin with helping her milk the snakes for venom. She's not super enthusiastic but I encourage her. Shalkoc wants to eat the animals. Did he show up to the wrong class?? "We said veterinary, he heard culinary." - Kyrin

Kali advises Kyrin to just not let the snakes bite her. Yay. She then asks Shalkoc about what animals would want to eat HIM. He talks about dragons and points at Ivernia, which causes both the spidrow and the wyvern to stare at him. Dragons… aren't animals. They're dragons. Shalkoc does not seem to grasp that, so Kali calls in Aviana's winter wolf Kaar. Shalkoc asks if we are cooking him. Kali says Aviana would really not be happy about this, so Shalkoc says maybe he should consider Kaar as part of his group. Kali asks if this is how he sees the world; "my group, I don't eat, not my group, I eat." She is trying to make him think about animals as anything other than food. Kaar is trying to act all cool and edgy but his tail is wagging, what a good boy. A magical ice wolf the size of a bear, but a good boy nonetheless.

Kali is desperately trying to encourage Shalkoc to be kind to animals. She sends him to clean the stables for the next two months, without showing his intention to kill and eat them. Plex gets chased by a swarm of hornets for eating the cookies, and the hornets. Shalkoc asks if the hornets are tasty. Plex teleports away and Kaar runs off as he spots Kyrin returning with a massive snake trailing behind her. Kali instructs Kyrin in the milking of snakes. Kyrin is very intimidated by the snake, with fangs the length of her shortsword, and asks very politely for venom. The snake does not seem interested in donating venom, but rather in having Kyrin for a snack. Kali is looking at her with this sink-or-swim expression in all six of her eyes.

In this metaphor Kyrin swims like a fish; she swings around and behind the snake before it can bite her, making it dizzy and successfully collecting the venom. For her efforts she gets to keep 1 jar of snake juice. After our lessons, Kali excuses herself as it's time for dinner and she would love to inject her own venom into a slab of raw meat to liquefy it, so much more convenient than cooking it and eating with a fork and knife. We walk back to the occasional screams of Plex taking turns between eating cookies and running from hornets, and eating hornets and running from cookies.

Plex does some thinking and comes to the conclusion that running for cookies is a lot of work and he'd rather have other goblins do it. Naturally he decides to recruit people to build the Nexus to forbid planar travel to and from Promise, which would cancel out the goblins' curse. Plex invites Kyrin and Aviana to go "pick flowers in the Feywild". I go over to Fearghas' mum who is a botanist, and we make plans to build a garden to contain the fey species.

It's Kyrin's first visit to the Feywild, she is amazed to see how vibrant the colours are! The three of them land in a hoofprint left by the mountain goat. Aviana is carrying a haybale, on top of which Plex and Kyrin sit. Thankfully (and to Plex' slight disappointment), the titanous goat is nowhere to be seen. They encounter psychedelic sludge and Aviana breathes in the pheromones and starts dancing and juggling the haybale. Plex and Kyrin fall off. Kyrin is tripping balls hallucinating burgers. Plex goes to chase a rainbow, which turns into a rainbow-snake. He falls off the rainbow and cannot locate the sky anymore, that's because he is hanging upside-down.

They thought it was a swamp. It's a sludge of slugs. Plex pierces it with flying hedgehogs he wanted to make into sandals. The slug reacts like a scared cat, arching its body, and Plex, Aviana, and Kyrin go sliding down the slug. Hedgehogs rain down! Plex and Aviana are catching so many of them but Kyrin is not putting in any effort. Aviana somehow stays aloft with her wings covered in hedgehogs. Plex is flying! Nope, he slams into the ground and sinks in. The ground moves up and Plex gets launched into the air, having landed in a herd of bouncing sponges that were doing their yearly migration.

As they bounce up and down, they spot wide swathes of unsettling grey in the distance… but that's okay they're bouncing in the other direction. Plex plants his pitchfork into a sponge and invents the pogo stick. They eventually roll off the herd of sponges and spot beautiful butterflies coming over. They're flesh-eating butterflies coming for a dead sponge. One butterfly swallows the sponge whole, giving it the look of a pumpkin with two tiny wings, very pleased with itself. Plex collects some butterflies.

They find a river with banks covered in soapy moss, and wash up. Then they are chased by a tree-sized mushroom, and finally stop tripping. Cicadas scream at them, so Plex catches some with the intention of eating them. Tiger poppies are drugs if you smoke them, Plex explains, just watch out for their fangs. Plex hands Kyrin Jim's Lance of Compensation to harvest the flowers from a safe distance. The tiger poppy just laughs as it's really ticklish, and curls up into a ball. Good time to pick it up!

A mountain approaches… Plex leaves the hay as a tribute, but not before signing it by painting his face on it. Plex coaxes a sponge to follow him by bouncing on his "togo-stick". He casts Adjust Density to make Aviana heavy so she can use the Transdimensional Anchorchain and bring them all back to Promise. The portal only stays open that long, so out of the group of sponges Plex wanted to bring back, only nine make it through in time. Aviana reopens the portal, allowing two more sponges through but she wants MORE and holds the portal open, allowing yet two more to pass. The sponges get LAUNCHED through, soaring all the way to the cabin where Fearghas is casually reading.

Aviana slashes one sponge into ribbons, still holding the chain with one hand. The portal snaps shut again but Aviana is angry and yanks it open with the force of a natural 20. Three sponges come through, followed by Kyrin and Plex. Aviana lets the portal close, getting slingshot through. Kyrin lugs a Spidersilk Bomb hoping to catch some sponges. Plex is on his pogo-stick and Aviana is hurtling through the Springseed forest (the trees have wisely learnt to leave a path). The harpy grabs Plex by the neck yelling at him to "cast slow fall". Plex holds on to the pogo-stick for dear life and pulls his hats over his eyes, incapable of casting while he is grappled.

Plex yells at Aviana to let him go so he can cast spells. He decides the best course of action is to cast… Reverse Gravity. With the town just below. People, pigs, Frost Giants, objects are lifted into the air. Kyrin dodges mid-air, while trying to herd the sponges in her silk bombs. General Ragvond is having a blast, waving at Aviana as she tumbles through the air. Plex burns all his spell slots on Feather Fall, Aviana switches to Eagle Spirit, and Kyrin throws her last Spidersilk Bomb to save as many people as they can when Reverse Gravity drops. Plex gets a surge and… for the next month, the next dog he sees is God. He spot Miss Rose's chihuahua flying 100 feet in the air. Plex lets some people fall to their death to cast Vortex Warp and catch the dog, forcing Aviana to pop a spellgem instead.

Fearghas feels a disturbance in the Force and gets up from reading his book, walks to the window and glimpses the chaos.

Half the town has severe trauma, the Frost Giants want to go again. Kyrin is lugging a big net of 18 pumpkin-sized bouncing sponges, stopping every few steps so they don't start bouncing too much. Aviana spots Fearghas and Plex tries to sneak away. I come back from the Springseed forest at this point and meet with Shalkoc who just got done mucking stables. And here is Emilio emerging from a dark corner where he was meditating, drawn by the chaos. Plex tries to pogo away which is not sneaky at all and Fearghas snaps at him to GET BACK HERE. Plex pretends he did not hear and bounces away. Fearghas yanks him back with Telekinesis. Plex plays dumb. Fearghas DEMANDS to know what is going on.

"It all started when we started doing drugs." - Aviana

Kyrin attempts to explain. Plex releases a flying hedgehog, not helping his case. Fearghas is struggling to process it. At my prompting, Plex explains the sponges reproduce asexually; when they grow too big, they split into two. They're edible, as they harden when they die. Actually very tasty, which makes them decent livestock animals. At Plex' urging, we try to use the sponge herd to move the obelisk at Locus. To Fearghas' great shock, Plex' theory works perfectly and we smoothly get the monolith in the middle of town. Kyrin helps position it properly with her telekinesis. Now we just need to build around it to set up the Nexus of Binding!

Fearghas learns stone whales are found in the Mountains of Madness, south of the Redwind Sands. Research into Toblerone Titivilus is relatively easy; he is practically running Dis, as Dispater himself is not very present. Oddly, he seems loyal to Dispater. Zacharias rose through the ranks very quickly, and became viceroy to Titivilus only about 80 years ago, very recent in devil years. Fearghas supposes Zacharias has a connection to the demon lord Pazuzu (harpy feathers, vrocks on the other side of the portal in his manor). Pazuzu would definitely take a stance towards the recently returned dragons, as he aims to claim dominion over all winged creatures.

Plex rolls a 24 with painting supplies. PLEXWHATAREYOUPAINTING. "Nothing," he says. This will come up again.

Emilio is looking to return to his village in the Solemn Watch mountains… that's really far away! (several thousand kilometres in non-retard). Fearghas Teleports him there and the second they come close, Emilio's patron gets agitated. The closer they get, the more Emilio's patron shifts from hunger to survival mode. He's never felt this before. Whatever is there, it makes his patron feel like prey. Emilio advises STEALTH and not staying long; there isn't just one entity here, more a creeping feeling of wrongness and misplacement.

Emilio opens up to Fearghas about the void portal in his village, and how his father threw him in as a sacrifice. Fearghas tries to comfort him, then he casts Wind Walk so they may scout undetected. It's evening and the sun is sliding west, but instead of red sunset light, the air has a purple tint. The mountains look wrong too… some are too jagged, others look like they've been stomped down. There is no wind, no clouds, they can't feel warmth nor chill. The ground is cracked, fog is clinging to the forest down below. The trees look sick or dead… or not like trees anymore, overgrown with mould like cancerous tumours.

They approach the last hillside barring the view to Emilio's village… and something sees them. A large fleshy eye opens in the moutainside. Emilio barely keeps his wits about him as his patron quivers, feeling cornered. Fearghas is overcome with madness, trying to attack his friend (thankfully it doesn't work great in cloud form). Emilio picks up on this and flies away, getting Fearghas to chase him. They streak through the sky until Fearghas manages to snap out of it and Teleports them both back to Promise. They give us the very worrying news that an entire area of the world is being corrupted by the Void.

When they get back, Fearghas is teleported against his will to the mines of Lessia, mid-sentence as he was talking to Emilio. It's the same surge that teleported him to the Plane of Water a month ago… He casts Invisibility and tries to sneak with all the stealth of an elephant dancing in chain mail and is heard by three people; two of the king's honour guard and a Duergar, in full armour and interrupted in the middle of a civil conversation about poison and casualties on their way to Lessia. They start towards him and he dips through a side corridor but his stealth is atrocious and they follow the noise he makes.

Fearghas casts Polymorph and transforms into a rat to escape his pursuers. He is now Ratghas. Once the other dwarves turn back, he /unrat and Teleports back to Promise, getting back eventually to a very confused Emilio. Wind Walk is still active so Fearghas turns into a thundercloud and flies over Emilio's head, grumbling Dwarven curses all the while.

We return to the cabin and find Plex in a room with Rose's chihuahua, covered in blood with 2 clothed chickens sacrificed to the dog, who looks far too pleased with the situation. I firmly decide to not deal with this for a second and take off my spellwards, slap one hand on the dog for effect and the other hand on Plex. I channel a 9th-level Remove Curse, Plex tries to Temporal Shunt me, Fearghas Counterspells, Plex wants to keep the dog. I argue we should get the little thing back to its owner, so Aviana casts Speak with Animals and asks the dog who it wants to live with. She translates "scratch me behind the ears now".

Plex relents that Rose may have the dog back, but she owes him two chickens. The chihuahua demands human blood, despair, suffering, and ear scratches. Fearghas scoops up the abyssal little shit, hands it to Kyrin, and we both go to the town to return the dog to Rose.

As we get to the settlement we hear a booming voice demanding the return of his gold. General Ragvond is squeezing the life (?) out of the vending machine we rented from Axis. We try to de-tangle the situation. Ragvond wants his money back, an apology, and a duel as reparation. Turns out Ragvond was trying to buy… gear. Like armour and weapons. And he bought… gears. Machine parts. Fearghas tries to explain, but Aviana speaks… closer to his language.

It does not go well. Ragvond compliments Fearghas on his width and then tells him to use simpler words. "That's why I said we should stick to raiding. Trading was a mistake." Ragvond mutters. Fearghas puts a lot of effort into explaining to Ragvond how to properly use the vending machine. The Frost Giant is not receptive. No one else in Promise has had problems with the vending machine, Ragvond is just an idiot. A very big, very angry idiot. Aviana offers to give him his money back. He slaps her on the back so hard, she sinks into the ground. The harpy manages to appease the general by paying him half his money back and apologising, and promising a chance to reclaim his honour. We'd help but we have to be uuuuuh where are we going again? Mining scenarium and plotonium, yes. She asks Plex to paint the offending vending machine red to signify his evil deeds, and replace it.

Emilio tells us about the Void shullbit. I squeak. Fearghas describes the eye in the mountain, and admits it messed with his mind. We discuss the reaction of Emilio's patron. Aviana suggests going to the Abyss. I threaten to vomit on her. Fearghas joins in saying we could find good intel in the Abyss. And here is my migraine again, I had not missed it. Fearghas insists we should at least speak with Yuguloths in Hades.

We try to think of how to contain the Void corruption. Fearghas shows us his spellbook again, and says its author ventured into the Void as protected as they could be, and upon returning penned the book… but as the writing progresses, it makes less and less sense, with the last pages completely incomprehensible. With the most powerful protective magic in the world, the Void's madness still caught up to the author… We are absolutely certain the Void will make us mad. Fearghas has copied a spell capable of opening a void portal, but he does not yet understand it enough to cast it. Which is for the best, because he does not know how to close the portal…

We decide to first go back to Dis to hopefully fulfil Fearghas' contract of killing Zacharias, and also to look into saving the Feywild from the abyssal corruption, hopefully that will give us ideas to deal with Void corruption.

As time passes and we mostly stay on Promise, taking care of the settlement and its people, we decide to build the Nexus of Binding, the Goblin Quarters, and the Market Square. This will really tank our economy though so we better be ready for this.

pages.name: 90 - Kyrin explains what money is
pages.content:
Friday, 13th of Undecimus, 1497

15:00

The goblins are tanking the economy.

Kyrin is sick of milking snakes (don't blame her). I am now deliberately baking cookies for the hornets. Better not ask Shalkoc what he's been doing the past few weeks… Fearghas gets a surge that protects him from slaps for an hour, to an extent. Aviana flexes to inspire him, and he restyles her Headband of Intellect into sunglasses, using some alchemy bullshit to make the lenses darken in the sun.

We'd decided to head to Muspelheim to take care of Loki's quest, retrieving Rovagug's Chain from the fortress Obsidian's Cradle in the volcano Surtr's Jaws. We are absolutely not doing this quest so General Ragvond stops draining the beer supply and goes home. Nobody has seen Plex for a few days so we are all concerned and somewhat on edge. So instead of just sitting around waiting for something to explode, we decide to use the Nexus to travel to the Frost Giants' camp a couple miles from Obsidian's Cradle.

Fearghas wants to juice Aviana for monster blood to brew Fire Resistance potions. She runs away. He chases her saying IT'S FOR SCIENCE. Fearghas goes to the vending machine, but no luck. Modrons have very little use for potions after all. We are currently flying over the Green Sea, a vast grassland where Griffons and Ankhegs are known to roam the land as pests. We decide to hop down (literally, using Feather Fall), hunt some giant bugs for blood, anchorchain back to Promise and then go to Muspelheim.

Fearghas starts tying us all together with rope. "Oh, we're tying up people??" Aviana happily pulls out a chain. We try to calculate which of us falls the fastest, but Aviana took off the Sunglasses of Intellect so she has no idea. Oh well. We jump off and hurtle towards our death, wind roaring in our ears, the ground rushing closer… until Fearghas casts Feather Fall and we gently fall down and land in a beautiful emerald expanse, nothing but grass on the horizon except for one keep in the distance, and a small village behind us.

We vote for the village and walk about an hour there. We find… no one there, farming tools abandoned as if people had just dropped them and ran. Emilio is distracted by how peaceful the place is (and maybe still happy about jumping off the island). Kyrin sees a door slightly ajar and casually walks over to check it out while Aviana is dejectedly noting the sheer absence of boulders or rocks of any sort. The house has a barn attached, and she spots an eye glancing through the spaces between the planks. As soon as she spots the spy, she hears a child scuttle off and hide in the hay. In child form, she walks in and calls out a friendly hello in Common.

A male voice questions back where we're coming from, what we're doing here, and what is going on. Kyrin replies in a very straightforward manner, just not saying where we're from. We want to hunt Ankhegs, she says. The man asks where her parents are. She calls Fearghas over for assistance. He asks what is wrong and the man replies terrified, "the sky is falling down". Yeah I suppose Shalkoc drove Promise a little too close to the ground…

We agree to all hide in the barn. All the cows are muzzled… "Flying things can't smell you when you hide in hay," the man says urgently. Aviana takes offense. We all gather in the barn and Fearghas happily introduces us all. The farmers freak the hell out and take out the pitchforks on Aviana of all people. She steps outside to appease the people, which causes the people to spot Shalkoc and panic all over again.

Fearghas tries to explain our friends are people and will not harm them. He gives his word, as people trust a dwarf's word, that none of us means them any harm. He then says we're monster hunters and looking for Ankhegs to murder. The man runs off to find the Elder, Fearghas asks for his name, he shouts he is called Louis and disappears around the next house.

Louis returns with an old man, François, who is very glad to see monster hunters, as they've called for help. He asks if we can do anything about the flying island… Shalkoc asks if he wants it moved to the left, or the right? Fearghas kicks him, and tries to reassure Francois. He is not very trusting, don't blame him, I didn't think Promise was real at first. Shalkoc says they should untie the cows' mouths as this is not very healthy for them. Wow, character development.

François thinks Shalkoc is a paladin and kneels down in reverence, because Kyrin said he's kind of a holy person, as a monk. Louis wants to take care of the paladin's horse. We try to explain our "lord" does not have a horse as he can fly. The rest of us walk. The farmers want to see a pegasus and Kyrin gives Fearghas a pointed look, hoping he can Polymorph into one. He grumbles and tries to clear up the misunderstanding, which really amuses the children hiding in the barn. The adults a bit less, as they stand up disappointed.

Fearghas is losing his mind trying to get the farmers to direct us to monsters. Finally with Kyrin's help they point us towards a 50 feet high plateau maybe a 2-hour walk away, saying Griffons tend to fly from over there. What we know is the people in this land are serfs and don't own anything, getting what they need by bartering with one another. Kyrin trades some coins with Emilio, then gathers up the children and does some sleight of hand to impress them as she gives them each a copper coin. They don't know what money is, so she tries to explain. The children ask if the coin can "bring grandma back". EMOTIONAL DAMAGE.

The children are very confused and talk about a mean thief called Antoine. They don't realise what a thief is, bless their little hearts. Francois and Louis advise Fearghas to go to the manor afterwards and get our reward from the lord. The farmers will continue to hide, and Louis insists on giving us hay to mask our scent. We finally walk away, Fearghas and Kyrin grumbling to each other.

We talk about Griffon eggs, the stealing of them to raise them as mounts. They're friends, not food, we tell Shalkoc. By the cliff, we find the fresh-ish remains of a horse and Aviana spots a Griffon circling high up. There are 3 more, and Fearghas casts Silent Image to make an illusory horse and get them to swoop down. We murder two, and Fearghas juices them for blood while Kyrin looks for eggs, with Shalkoc's assistance.

Kyrin and Shalkoc find eggs, they also find Griffons, knock them out, then Shalkoc tries to get one male and one female but has no idea how to tell them apart. Kyrin feels bad about killing them and stealing their eggs, so she telepathically asks Fearghas if he can shrink them so she can keep them. The problem is getting the tiny Griffons into the spider silk bag, so Emilio tries to intimidate them. Rolls a 4. The Griffons give them a side eye full of pity. We also chuck the dead Griffons into the Portable Hole to later harvest their hides and meat.

Kyrin and Emilio have an excited discussion about traumatising children. I ask Fearghas for something against migraines. Fearghas asks Aviana to yank her chain have a go at the anchorchain, but predictably does not manage to even lift it. I give Aviana emotional support in the form of Guidance and she opens the portal on the first try.

We return to Promise with two live Griffons, shrunk. Two dead Griffons, in the hole. One Griffon egg. With Fearghas' input I identify the live Griffons as a mating pair, and these usually only have 1 egg anyway, they eat up all but the biggest egg. We go talk to Stormwind the military captain, hand her the Griffons, and Fearghas tells her to figure it out. She is confused and says tentatively she'll see what she can do…? The soldiers don't even have horses, none of them is trained with animals.

Fearghas has a stroke of genius and remembers Aviana's tribe of Goliaths lives here. They can handle the Griffons just fine! That leaves the dead Griffons, which Shalkoc is absolutely DYING to cook. Fearghas gets to brewing, with the inspiration of Aviana's fantastic flexing.
