He whips up a large batch of Potions of Fire Resistance, and then some Potions of Psychic Resistance, for reasons (looks at Emilio).

Kyrin does drugs using the Sheeshah of Revelations, which gives her similar effects to a Divination spell. She asks where the chain is being kept inside the fortress. She has a vision of a large, very long chamber with rocky walls, deep underground. It's filled with bubbling magma, and in the middle of the chamber a stone path stretches across the magma. At the end of the path is a hole in the ground, and into the hole hangs a chain. The only way into the chamber is a spiraling stair leading down into the chamber. We know this of course because Kyrin sketched it.

Sunday, 15th of Undecimus, 1497

20:30

Short rest

We take a few days to properly prepare our excursion to Muspelheim. Fearghas casts Legend Lore on the Chain of Rovagug, and learns it is actually the name of a mountain range that goes around the Elemental Planes. These mountains keep the end of the world sealed away by restraining Rovagug, a god of destruction. The item we are looking for is in fact stolen links from this mountain chain. Odd… the chain is giant in size, but not mountain-size. We figure out the metal chain was originally laid around the Elemental Planes, and the mountain range grew around the links. Some of these links have been stolen. Not ominous at all, that. The links can enslave Fire Elementals by consuming and destroying their essence.

Fearghas casts another Legend Lore on Obsidian's Cradle. It is a fortress of black stone in the middle of a lava lake, that lies between the twin peaks of Surtr's Jaws. The only way in is across a large bridge and through a gate. The fortress used to be a temple to a deity of fire, Imix. It is still guarded by the warlocks of Imix. A prophecy says "Obsidian's Cradle will fail only when Surtr's tears dry up or he chokes on them".

At this Aviana suggests to frighten Surtr to make him cry, by making use of Emilio. Hm. Fearghas ritually casts Contact other Plane while Aviana very incorrectly babbles about ther memories of Muspelheim. He contacts the spirit of a long-dead sage Boogle the Moogle to ask five questions:

Are Fire Giants weak to cold damage? - Some.

Are they resistant to radiant damage? - No.

Is Rovagug close to breaking free? - Unclear.

Are there any other entrances to Obsidian's Cradle? - No.

Can the Fire Giants be bribed with dwarven ale? - Unclear.

Shalkoc cooks up some food for us all: a big pot of cool ghoulash for Emilio, himself, and me. Fearghas gets a spicy jacket potato which makes him very happy. Kyrin gets a bento box with teriyaki grilled chicken and it looks absolutely delicious! Aviana gets the Fire Resistance Pie (tm).

We teleport to Muspelheim and oh my god it's hot. At least it doesn't reek of sulphur. Vast expanses of obsidian are criss-crossed by rivers of lava and dotted with molten lakes. On a more stable piece of ground stands an encampment surrounded by a palisade made of long icicles rammed into the ground. Fearghas puts up Rary's Telepathic Bond. In the distance, a large volcano with two peaks dominates the landscape. Aviana changes the colour of her wings to a bright red. The ground shifts and cracks constantly; we assume the Frost Giant camp is only on stable rock thanks to the icicles cooling the ground.

We carefully make our way to the camp, but it still takes a couple hours. There are things swimming in the lava… ah yes lava sharks. The young ones are the size of a bull. Aviana, Fearghas, and Shalkoc remember these lava sharks can jump really far… and they are extremely aggressive. How do we dodge them? Fearghas suggests Wind Walk but we decide to save the spell slot. Aviana stands at the ready with the Dented Iron Flask. We try to be stealthy but I squeak, Aviana complains loudly, and Emilio turns around to shout at her "We're trying to be sneaky will you SHUT UP!"

A lava shark jumps out and Aviana throws the Pokéball Iron Flask. She catches the shark and yells back at Emilio. Nobody knows where Kyrin is. She's telepathically yelling at us but we can't see her. Aviana suggests she will release the shark and we all murder it immediately. She looks around for other sharks and with a natural 20 feels them watching her from the lava.

We get concerned Aerelia might be smelling burnt toast but it's just burnt code.

Shalkoc misses his attack and the shark isn't stunned, but we pummel it so hard it dies anyway. Shalkoc starts singing Lava Shark and we all have it stuck in our heads now. He makes theories with Aviana on how to cook the shark, because aren't they already cooked?

The other lava sharks are now… mad at us. Yeah I wonder why. Some of the stone plates in the distance are bobbing up and down as if something really big was hitting it from below, hmmm. We're about 500 feet from the camp. Time to run for it!

We hatch a plan. Fearghas gives his Bag of Scolding to Kyrin, and he jumps into the Portable Hole. Emilio, Aviana, Shalkoc (after giving the Snack Pack to Kyrin), and myself follow him in. We have to squeeze a bit so I tell Aviana to sit and I get on her shoulders. Kyrin picks up the hole and makes a run for it with Psychic Teleportation. She runs on moving ground, dodging lava and shifting rock. A vent spews gas and she tanks the poison like a champ. A big boulder next to her starts to move! It was never a big boulder, it's a Cinderslag Elemental and it's BLAZING hot.

The elemental takes a swing at her and misses, but the second one hits. She Uncanny Dodges to halve the damage, and endures the scorching heat. A lava shark lands next to her! She dodges the impact but gets pushed a step back. It bites; one miss, one hit. The hit is really spicy but her armour is enhanced by the realm effect so it takes a tiny bit off. She's almost there… Another Psychic Teleportation, Dash… she narrowly dodges another shifting plate of rock and reaches the Frost Giant camp! The giants are so baffled, they are staring with their mouths open completely floored.

She lands from her leap in between the two speechless Frost Giants. She unfolds the hole and lets us all out, and returns the bags. I begin to treat her burns and wounds as Fearghas uses an Ioun Stone to speak Giant and greet them, saying General Ragvond sent us. They ask for proof, so Fearghas pushes Aviana forward, saying she carried the Nullstone. "There is no way she was that small," they say to each other. Aviana pulls out the anchorchain, which convinces them. As well it should, it's a unique item…

They apologise, saying there has been a lot of trickery, and let us into the camp. It's comfortably cool here… for the others probably. My teeth are chattering so I snuggle up to Aviana. The guards escort us to the tent of their general. On the way we see bolar pear polar bear pelts that Kyrin eyes a little too long for comfort. One of the guards wears a necklace made of Griffon beaks and skulls. He said his father brought it from a raid when he was a child. Kyrin says that's neat, we killed Griffons earlier today. We realise the guard's dad raided… the Green Sea. He asks us where it is, he'd like to raid it in his father's memory. Sadly Aviana speaks Giant as well and answers in a very straightforward manner. (Fearghas was trying to not translate Kyrin's answers precisely…)

Kyrin gives a Griffon feather to the guard. He is astounded, he didn't think those things had feathers as his father described the Griffons as tiny dragons. Fearghas uses Minor Illusion to show him what a Griffon looks like. He doesn't believe us. Kyrin is disappointed but eh, it was a nice thought. Aviana wants to pour the Potion of Growth into her ale so there will be more of it. That's not how potions work. She just wants to share her Bugman's Ale with the giants but there is not enough of it.

pages.name: 91 - Hot rocks and blackmail, Shalkoc repainted
pages.content:
Sunday, 15th of Undecimus, 1497

21:30

Plex spent the last few days (and a lot of forks of increasingly dubious origins) finding his people and bringing them to Promise. In doing so he met the brothers Antx and Prantx who helped procuring the forks. Because of the Planetrotting spell, he ended up visiting… pretty much every plane known to goblinkind. And missing Promise a couple times. Plex is currently in an extradimensional space… which turns out to be Kyrin's Bag of Holding. She reaches in to grab a Griffon feather, he bites her finger (normal response for Plex), she yelps and pulls the goblin out of the bag, causing him to grow back to his normal size.

Fearghas pulls out his magic tankard to relieve the headache caused by Plex' appearance. The Frost Giants ask why we keep our pets in our bag. Why do we keep our Plex in our bag? We try to ask Plex how we got into the bag, and whether there are any more goblins in the bag. Shalkoc offers him food, as Shalkoc does. Kyrin asks me to check the bite on her finger, in case Plex has rabies and her finger turns black and tries to fall off. She'll be fine, I'm sure. I rolled a 4 so she is definitely totally fine.

We're just waiting outside the tent of the Frost Giants' leader as Shalkoc pulls out his frying pan, but just then the tent opens and we are invited in. Shalkoc grumbles and puts away his pan, Plex isn't too hungry after chomping down on our rogue's finger. The leader's tent is largely occupied by an immense table covered in a map, and a model of the volcano (big enough for me to live in). The leader is covered in tattoos, and his beard is very short for a Frost Giant. He introduces himself as Commander Frengald.

Fearghas is the only one paying attention and he spots a big ornate chest next to the bedroll, securely locked. Each of these locks is about the size of ME. Frengald asks us in Common whether we are the ones hired by Loki. We say yes, so he places a shield on the ground and bids us all get on it. Plex helps by making Fearghas lighter, indirect fat-shaming of our dwarf again, how sad. We all get on the shield, which Frengald lifts onto the table 10 feet up so we can get on it. Giants, man… would have been an entire adventure for me to get up on that table.

Frengald asks us to bring Rovagug's chain to him. Hmmm. Ragvond on Promise just asked us to retrieve it. Kyrin, looking like a somewhat charred little child, says she ran through the lava fields. Frengald is bamboozled, reaches up to stroke his beard, finds there is not enough beard for this, is sad. He says the Frost Giant campaign here has been going on for two years with no progress. We are confused by timey-wimey stuff, but Jotunheim and Muspelheim being both located in Limbo, it's not too surprising time sometimes flows differently from back home.

We confirm the only entrance to the fortress is through the bridge, and the main gate. The fortress is surrounded by lava except for the road leading to the main gate. Kyrin asks if the fortress every gets deliveries through the gate, but they get Elementals to do their deliveries through the lava… We peer at the model and start thinking. The Frost Giants sent hawks, but they all died so the air defence is up there. There are arcane golems, without a body, inside the fortress. Outside, flying elementals called Exuls take down anything that so much as gets off the ground for more than a jump.

Aviana wants to dig a hole deep in the ground to drain the lake of lava. I don't think Fearghas has enough ale to explain to her why this cannot work. Frengald suggests the Frost Giants create a diversion, while we small people sneak in. He strongly advises against flying. An all-out assault would be very costly to them, so our cold boys can only do it once. Hypothetically that would draw most of the Obsidian's Cradle forces outside to defend the bridge, allowing us to get in. He suggests we scale the mountain instead of going through the main gate. It's about 3000 feet up. Plex wants to be carried.

Fearghas suggests casting Wind Walk and hugging the ground. Plex suggests dressing up as rocks, also known as camouflage. I was thinking invisibility but I guess that's the budget option. Frengald says invisibility is no good here, creatures can sense us. Plex is distracted and looks for pebbles to glue onto himself. We discuss whether this is a time for Stone Whaleghas to shine, but he wouldn't be immune to fire so nope. The fortress is of course warded against teleportation spells.

Commander Frengald advises we don't worry about the giant lava worms, as they're harmless. We're probably way too small for them to notice us anyway. Plex suggests riding in the mouth of a giant lava worm. Fearghas suggests casting Planar Ally, or Conjure Elemental. Plex tries to bite Fearghas, but he is wearing armour. We think we can manage the climb even without too much magic, and plan the diversion with Frengald. Kyrin shows her sketch of the lava chamber with the fishing hole. Frengald is intrigued so she shows him the Sheeshah of Revelations. He says to put it away and keep it hidden, drugs are strictly forbidden in his camp. "It's not drugs," she says. "That's what they all say," he grumbles.

Plex Fey Steps into a small chest off to the side. Plonk! Then a small door opens into the chest and Plex walks back out. "Sorry about that," he says casually. Plex-core. We go talk to the quartermaster in case he has any supplies he can spare. Aviana wants to buy 7 waterskins because it sure is hot in here. The quartermaster asks whether we are adventurers. We say yes, so he assumes we have a lot of gold and could be interested in an item he wants to get rid off. Keep talking, Emilio says. The giant asks if we have 100.000 gold. Stop talking, Emilio says. Kyrin rolls a natural 1 on Performance, which turns into a dirty 23 by the power of Reliable Talent. Rogues, man.

We say we know someone with that much gold. The giant asks us to swear we won't tell anyone else. "Is that a contract?" Shalkoc asks. I want to hug this Dragonborn. He has learnt. We promise we won't tell anyone in this camp, after Plex grumbling it doesn't make any sense. The giant murmurs he might have acquired… a Decanter of Endless Water. In Muspelheim, that is precious indeed. But we do not have the muns. As we leave, he calls us back and says he can sell the Decanter for just 10.000. Fearghas is very suspicious. We ask whether the Decanter was stolen and this is why the quartermaster is so desperate to get rid of it. He refuses to talk about it… though he all but admits it under Fearghas' clever questioning.

Fearghas bargains his brains out, and when it fails he downright threatens the quartermaster. Kyrin covertly uses her Echo Stone to try to get evidence. After much grumbling and blackmailing and I-wish-I-had-a-candle, Fearghas buys the Decanter. NOW the quartermaster agrees to talk and claims he "found" the Decanter inside the camp. Emilio is muttering in the corner. Kyrin quietly palms 3 Potions of Force Resistance, 6 Potions of Heroism, and 5 Potions of Superior Healing. She gains inspiration for being sneaky sneaky, she did roll a dirty 20 with a 5 on the die. Rogues, man.

Shalkoc starts doing math on how much money we could make selling water on this plane. Aviana hands waterskins to everyone. Fearghas recasts Rary's Telepathic Bond; "Alright everyone telepathic bond is up. Kyrin, did you get that on your rock?" After we leave the camp, Kyrin shares her 5-finger-discount potions. We walk up to the volcano, and have to dodge boulders tumbling down the slopes. Behind us, a large lava shark has spotted us and is coming our way. I don't want to be shark snack, time to run!

Kyrin warns us about elementals that look like rocks but are a lot nastier (Cinderslag Elementals). The ground is also very unstable. By the gods, my legs are too short for this… We roll initiative for turn-based movement crossing the lava. Plex asks if we're in the Ethereal Plane and Fearghas' headache increases.

Karnack and Sobame trade candy.

We see telegraphs for the falling boulders aaaaand we're all in the aoe. Aviana tries to spot hidden elementals, but all rocks look like rocks. She gets out of the aoe, chugs a Potion of Fire Resistance, and goes "looking for traps the Barbarian way". Fearghas and Shalkoc follow, though Shalkoc gets ahead and looks for anything suspicious, but all rocks once again look like rocks. A lava shark comes to say hello, how nice, but really a little too friendly for our taste. Emilio cracks his knuckles. Aviana cries out just before the shark jumps out of the lava, landing on top of her and Fearghas. Ouchie.

Fearghas is knocked prone, Aviana is pushed back, and she responds by using her Rod of Unwilling Retribution, forcing a DEX save. The shark fails and eats lightning damage. I dash out of the aoe and run up to Aviana, unfortunately that puts me very close to the lava shark so I drink up a Potion of Fire Resistance and hope for the best. Kyrin uses her bonus action to dash. Rogues, man.

Kyrin attacks the lava shark with a swing of the Sun Blade and it's a sneak attack for 45 damage. Et bim! A Cinderslag Elemental appears! Aviana shouts "Guys, watch out!" in our minds. It attacks Shalkoc and crits. BONK! Shalkoc is resistant to fire so he takes "only" 25 damage and falls prone. Emilio moves up, goes into Void Form, and uses Phase Shift to teleport up to the Cinderslag Elemental and slices him good. One hit, one miss, and 14 damage.

Plex casts Vortex Warp and swaps places with the Cinderslag Elemental. He appears in front of Emilio with claws raised. Then he casts Grasping Vine to grab Aviana and yoink her out of the aoe. The boulders come crashing down! Only the enemies get hit, Fearghas narrowly dodges. Aviana rages and grapples the lava shark, who is regretting being overly friendly. She grabs it real tight, and murders it. Then she uses Battering Ram on the confused Cinderslag Elemental. Kyrin telepathically cheers her on.

Fearghas blasts a Ray of Frost on the Cinderslag Elemental and we realise it's not vulnerable to frost damage, but it flinches from the steam. He climbs onto the corpse of the lava shark, Monster Hunter style, and guzzles a Potion of Heroism. And… it's one of the potions he got from the Blood Hags' lair! It's actually an Elixir of Corruption! He passes the CON save and resists the poison, but promises to feed Shalkoc that poison later so his breath can get a brand-new stink. Lovely.

Shalkoc forgets he can fly and casually walks up to Plex. We kindly remind him. He unfolds his wings, and does an aerial dash to another boulder just right of the path. I walk forward carefully and look around, anxious to spot enemies. I swear this rock we're standing on is looking at me funny! So I squeak a little bit, everyone shakes their heads, it's really just a rock.

Aviana gets crit. BAM Unflinching. She frightens the elemental, which earns her a thumbs up from Emilio. And that's a surge, blasting necrotic damage to all within 30 feet and coming back to her. And another surge right behind that, blinding her. The elemental proceeds to burrow into the rock, and get the hell out of here. Emilio Phase Shifts to the rock where Shalkoc and Kyrin are happily standing, and looks around to spot enemies. He has advantage in Void Form and spots another elemental chilling just ahead. Well toasting, rather. Roasting, even.

Plex uses his vine to drag Fearghas a little closer, and attempts a Blink spell but… no luck. A Series of Unfortunate Events triggers, and the Cinderslag Elemental duplicates! A boulder falls towards Plex! Sick dodges, he rolls a nat 20 on the DEX save and takes half damage, but loses concentration on Grasping Vine. The vine, which sweated and wilted as soon as it appeared, completely withers out of existence.

Aviana's voice echoes in the telepathic bond: "Fearghas… Fearghas! Magic happened. I'm blind." She tries to find her way, decides to just charge straight ahead… right at Fearghas. She brakes 10 feet away from him. Fearghas tries to guide the poor harpy, in great part by getting out of her way. She does not know where north is. That's okay neither do I. Fearghas takes Aviana's hand to guide her, and pulls out the Decanter of Endless Water.

The two elementals up ahead are just punching each other, to very little effect. Shalkoc flies ahead and angers the rocks on the way. They swing at him, one misses but the other crits. I walk up to Aviana and touch her knee, casting Remove Curse. It's a bit of a flashbang but she is thrilled to see again! Kyrin uses Psychic Teleportation to get past the two fighting elementals. Emilio uses Netherwalk, followed by Phase Shift, and also runs past the elementals, stopping in between two aoes. He looks around to spot enemies, doesn't see shit, except of course for the two fighting rocks.

Plex casts Fey Step.

Oh boy.

A calculated risk.

He somehow does not end up in the lava.

He casts Vortex Warp, yoinking me to a spot behind Shalkoc. Wheeeeee! And then he disappears into the Ethereal Plane. However this gets me a little too close to a lava shark who looks very hungry for roasted potato. I dodge the Deadly Leap and take only 11 damage. I get knocked back… not into the lava. PHEW.

Fearghas asks Aviana to throw him, but "don't tell the goblin." She obliges, grabs the dwarf, and CHARGES. She barrels into one of the elementals, and whacks him onto Emilio, who quietly swears in an unholy language from beyond the stars. Then she jumps, still holding Fearghas, and they crash on the other side of the lava shark that's looking at me funny. Fearghas proceeds to uncork the Decanter and blasts a geyser on the shark. Oddly reminiscent of spraying a misbehaving cat with water.

Emilio gets whacked and knocked prone, twice. Shalkoc flies back to punch the shark because he wants to know how it tastes. He goes into Mantis Style, then casually stuns the shark. A Flurry of Blows later, aaaaaand that's a major surge. Shalkoc is now a rabbit who can only move by jumping his maximum distance, which seems perfectly reasonable to him and no one can talk him out of it. NO ONE.

I slip around the shark to get out of the boulder aoe, draw my dagger… AND STAB THE THING TO DEATH. Always carry a sharp dagger, y'all. I may be a healer, BUT. Then Kyrin pulls out the Tinkertop Boltblaster 1000 and fires at another shark, and marks the soul. Emilio gets scorched by just standing next to an elemental. He's distracted, prone, on fire… and very angry. He leaps up and starts slashing, then Phase Shifts away.

Plex pops back into reality. He Fey Steps, ends up on the very edge of a rock, flails with his arms and… dips his foot into the lava. Smells like grilled goblin suddenly. He reacts with Absorb Elements, reducing the damage, and scrambles backwards, jumping over rocks to get next to Emilio. Aviana runs over the rocks, looking around and feeling like… this one is giving me the side eye. Fearghas tiptoes past her. The elemental that got pushed into Emilio is now angry at him, and burrows to go and get a void-tainted snack. He misses and stands there awkwardly.

Shalkoc shifts to Turtle Stance and… with his wings out, he hops over the rocks like a happy bunny?! Aviana was not entirely wrong, the boulder was giving a side eye, but at Fearghas. It swings at him and misses, then burrows. I move up to Shalkoc and look around for the elemental, spot it still next to Fearghas. Kyrin teleports up to Fearghas, I telepathically point the spot where I last saw it, and she stands at the ready with the Sun Blade.

So anyway, Emilio started blasting. He grabs the elemental and yanks it closer, causing Plex to get scorched. He casts another Absorb Elements, then casts Shocking Grasp on the elemental who effortlessly dodges. Plex uses telekinesis to shove the elemental away, and runs up to me. Emilio takes a boulder to the face and gets dazed. Aviana gets scorched by the elemental's aura, takes it like a champ with Stone's Endurance and tries to grapple it but it's difficult to grab a bunch of burning rocks. Ah, whatever, she jumps on it instead. Then she charges up the mountain completely disregarding petty things such as gravity.

The angry elemental is still looking for Emilio but he is also dazed from the small matter of big boulder to the face. Fearghas is waterboarding the other elemental with the Decanter. Shalkoc jumps to it and breathes poison on it. This rock does not look too good… and Kyrin murders it with the Sun Blade in a feat of absolute overkill. Kyrin draws her bow and takes aim, readying to shoot the life out of the angry elemental. We telepathically shout at Emilio to leave this thing and get over here! But he shoots three Eldritch Blasts at it and kills it, but since he is dazed he can't move.

The last elemental is happy in the knowledge it is the real one, since its evil twin was killed. We are finally able to gather at the foot of the mountain. As we start to walk up, I treat my friends' burns. Aviana claims she has a scratch and wants healing too. I give her a little magic smooch and say she is fine. She wants to spend a girls' night out in the city… wait, we don't have a city yet, we're still building it.

The mountain is… really steep. Burning gas hisses out in places, boulders tumble down, and fiery monsters give us the side eye. Fearghas puts up Leomund's Tiny Hut so we can heal up and cook. Shalkoc is really uncomfortable with the jumping surge, we discuss it and decide I should cleanse it. I take a deep breath, remove the protection of my spellwards and place my hands on him. Drawing immense power through my body, I channel the most purifying spell into him and… HE TURNS GREEN. SHALKOC WHY ARE YOU GREEN. "Naami what did you do to me," he cries. I shakily put my bracelets back on, close to tears from the sheer awe of the flood of magic fading from my mind… my friend changed colour. What even.

Aviana disappointedly puts away her chains, ropes, and manacles. Fearghas urges us to go up the mountain instead of tying up the now-green dragonborn. Shalkoc starts climbing, dodging falling rocks with ease. Kyrin rolls Survival to find a safer route, then Acrobatics to dodge falling rocks. She rolls a 2, Reliable Talent, dirty 20. Rogues, man.

My head is still spinning from that big spell… I roll Survival, fail to find a good route, roll Nature to dip into a vent to escape the falling rocks but misidentify the vent and stumble into poisonous gas. I pass the CON save only thanks to the Belt of Dwarvenkind, and take minor poison damage. Emilio is much luckier and sees the pattern of falling rocks. Fearghas slaps Guidance on himself, fights his cat who sat her bum on the mouse, and rolls Survival and Investigation to find a spot to take cover.

Aviana is the only one who didn't dump Strength and she ZOOMS up the mountain by sheer power of biceps. Plex gives a good look at the rocks, hides behind a rocky outcrop, and takes no damage. Shalkoc fails to dodge the falling rocks, but uses inspiration to turn it into a success! Kyrin absolutely dances out of the way. Rogues, man.

I get into another puff of toxic gas, my eyes are streaming and I'm coughing but I'm fine, trust. Plex casts Adjust Density to make Emilio lighter, but despite that he doesn't get anywhere because his arms are noodles. He does dodge the rocks and earns Aviana's respect for attempting the Athletics check. Fearghas scrabbles up with the power of Guidance, but gets hit by a rock and tumbles back down, shouting Dwarven curses all the way. He starts arguing with Aviana in the telepathic bond so they scream back and forth in all our heads…

Aviana flexes, then gets hit by two rocks for her trouble. Plex is happy to see Aviana coming back for him because he was feeling a bit lost and confused. Plex did not think things through, but he is inspired so he re-thinks his life choices. It does not go well. He casts Mold Earth to shield himself from incoming rocks. Shalkoc is bathing in the toxic gas, enjoying the smell. She dances past Shalkoc who is sitting there sauna-style… wait where did he get the towel?!

With impressive consistency, I once again dodge into a toxic vent and inhale poisonous gas. It burns my throat… I'm tougher than that, and catching up to Shalkoc. Emilio is right on my heels and climbs up to me with the power of Guidance and a high Wisdom score. Fearghas squints at the rocks real hard, and sees all the way into the Weave with a 28. Aviana casts Resistance and once more zooms up the mountain with her legendary strength, then rolls a nat 20 on Acrobatics, catching up to Kyrin.

Plex is struggling to keep up, but he manages to hide from the rocks and joins me and Emilio. Shalkoc takes two rocks to the face and falls, zooming past us on his way down. He lands next to Fearghas, pretty beat up. Meanwhile Kyrin is casually climbing and close to the top. Rogues, man.

True to myself, I get into the poison again but roll a nat 20 on the save. Well I still take damage but it's minor. Emilio takes a rock right on the nose and tumbles down, he really has problems with Strength saves…

Fearghas: Polymorph is the solution to all of life's problems.

Plex: YESSSSSSS turn into a GOAT.

DM, the devil on his shoulder: A goat gets +10 to all the checks.

Fearghas resists the evil that is goats and rolls Investigation again. Aviana claims her pride demands she rolls Athletics, proceeds to roll a 3, but gets a nat 20 on the Nature check and gets into the vent right next to mine, which is safe, and I'm sitting here crying in the poison. "Why are you sitting over here, this one is the safe one," she says. I cough and sneeze in response. Plex gets it, he ducks into the poison as well but takes major damage and gets poisoned.

Shalkoc gets into the poison sauna again. Kyrin easily gets to the top of the volcano and peers into it. I want to heal Plex but can't see him, so I climb up and hope he can make it up as well. THIS TIME I can smell the poison from a mile away. A-HA! This vent is safe! I huddle happily as the rocks tumble past. Emilio fumbles on Survival and takes a rock to the face. He's pretty badly bruised. Fearghas once more resists the temptation to Polymorph into a giant goat, hops into a poisonous vent, and casts Resistance to pass the CON save.

Aviana scuttles up the mountain like some lava monkey, joining Kyrin at the top. Plex is now rolling with disadvantage because of the poison and he makes slow progress, taking more damage on the way. I get to the top and peer inside! Ooooh intimidating. Emilio rolls a natural 20 and easily dodges the rocks. Fearghas Guidances himself up, gets into poisonous gas, and he is poisoned. Aviana is posing and flexing at the top of the mountain, how like her.

Plex uses Mold Earth again to shield himself from all damage. Shalkoc makes it to the top in pretty rough shape. Emilio is catching up but it is not his day. The two wizards make it up, and Emilio is last to join us. Shalkoc pulled out snacks and is grilling skewers over the lava. The crater is massive, 3000 feet radius, and nested inside is an immense fortress. Aviana's harpy eyes see… "a rainbow-fire-elemental-that-looks-like-a-human". We assume it's one of the arcane golems. And "a lot of black people standing on the walls ready to throw Fireballs." Aha. Something about metal statues made of spikes? Nobody knows what she is talking about.

pages.name: 92 - No touchy our spell slots
pages.content:
Monday, 16th of Undecimus, 1497

1:30

The climb down into the caldera looks about as bad as the climb up the mountain was. We peer inside, spotting a lot of hostiles; fire giants, elementals, and warlocks of Imix. The rainbow people Aviana was talking about are hovering above the castle. Plex seems to be out of paint, to his despair as he wanted to camouflage himself by painting rock texture on his body. Aviana suggests shoving a rock down Plex' throat instead. We decide to contact Frengald to let him know to start his diversion, and Fearghas wants to put up the dome so we can heal for a little bit.

Plex finds us a lovely little cave to hide in, the small issue is the entrance is barely bigger than Plex-size. Not an issue for me or Kyrin who is slender, but Fearghas pushing himself through makes a lot of screeching noises when his armour scrapes against the rock. He puts up Leomund's Tiny Hut. Shalkoc whips up some unspiced hardtack to help us heal, Aviana requests liver paste but we are out so she suggests eating Fearghas' liver instead. Both Fearghas and me disagree, but then Fearghas gets a surge that deafens him, and he enjoys the silence a little too much. Plex rejoices, now he can steal Fearghas' liver. The dwarf promptly begins grumbling and Shalkoc distracts the goblin with chocolate biscuits.

We assume it will take about 2 hours for the wizards to climb down into the caldera, though Kyrin would be much faster. Being relatively safe, we decide to take a short rest and sleep through the night.

Monday, 16th of Undecimus, 1497

9:45

Short rest

In the morning, I cast a Wellspring of Life to heal us all up, after the best night Fearghas ever spent. When the healing touches him, it cures his deafness and immediately Aviana's yapping returns to his ears, making him very sad. As the Wellspring heals us, Fearghas casts Blood Barrier, drawing blood from Aviana, Kyrin, and Emilio to grant himself a large amount of temporary HP. Emilio's blood is black?!

Turns out Emilio was bad at going up the mountain, but he is very good at going back down the mountain. Shalkoc whips up hardtack with even less spices to grant the rest of us temp HP. It's so crumbly… Aviana applies Abyssal Nail Polish, and receives the Wolf Spirit's Blessing, which will allow her to be the damsel in distress while Emilio is blasting left right and centre (as he does). Fearghas bullies me.

I use a spell scroll of Sending to let Frengald know we are about one hour's travel from the bridge, inside the caldera. He responds he will start the attack on the fortress so we can slink in. Fearghas puts up Rary's Telepathic Bond. We all attempt to sneak in, but even with the power of Guidance, Fearghas is bumping down the mountain clanking and yelping. Plex exclaims something in the butt language Sylvan and Aviana replies "Who are you calling a cooked chicken?!"

Somehow we don't attract attention, but we're not about to question divine intervention. Aviana grabs and chokes Plex, as usual, and Emilio shouts a warning that an "arrow" is coming our way. Plex has no chance to dodge as he is struggling to breathe. Aviana holds him up as a shield. The rest of us have sick dodges and a second later a ballista shot the size of a tree trunk cleaves the ground where we stood just a heartbeat ago. Now we have attracted attention, clearly, and Plex has to get a large splinter out of himself.

We venture onto the bridge, have no choice but to cross it. The first gate is not part of the fortress but instead a gatehouse. We drink our Potions of Fire Resistance, anticipating… fiery resistance to our intrusion. Kyrin is super stealthy, hiding behind Aviana and Plex. Only 30 feet below us, lava churns. One of the rainbow people, Manastorm Golem, is floating 90 feet above ground by the guardhouse's wall to our right.

Kyrin suggests sneaking us all in with the Portable Hole. We discuss sniping the one golem. Oh well, initiative it is. Aviana could use a mythic power to jump up, the wizards could cast Dimension Door, we could all fight. The Fire Giant on top of the gatehouse wall has spotted us for sure. Plex casts Arcane Gate, placing the other one on top of the wall. Stepping through, he uses Telekinesis to push the giant through the portal, which surprisingly works! I channel Hold Monster through Lioriel's staff and as the Fire Giant woman struggles in vain agains the spell, I mentally yell at my friends to GET HER!

Kyrin steps up and slices and dices with the Sun Blade (guaranteed crit thanks to paralysis), but then a major surge teleports her all the way to Plex. She steps through the portal, returning to her spot, and adds a Psychic Blade to the damage. Emilio casts Eldritch Blast so that's 3 crits, with 9d12 from Aviana's Hamstringing. "And that's what we call an overkill," Aerelia says as Karnack chants "Dice! Dice! Dice!" Very little remains of the Fire Giant, mainly a lot of blood. Emilio skips through the portal to see what Plex sees. He sees another warlock casting a Fireball at him and Plex, who casts Absorb Elements. They take light damage and Plex loses concentration on the Arcane Gate.

Fearghas grabs me and casts Dimension Door to get us on top of the gatehouse. Wheeeeeee! The golem spots us and fires a Draining Bolt at me, sucking the spell slots out of me?! I use an inspiration to reroll my save and barely pass it! The golem ducks behind cover, which makes Fearghas angry. By the fortress a Fire Giant Dreadnought wielding 2 tower shields is guarding the gate and it sprints to us, then jumps up and lands right in front of Fearghas and me.

Aviana does a little jump and lands closer to the main gate. Plex assumes the rest of us have matters well in hand, how foolish. He casts Ice Knife, hitting Fearghas and me as well. Plex tries to hide, rolls a natural 1, he is convinced he is very well hidden indeed. I'm mindful of my teammates so I skirt around the giant to put distance between me and Fearghas, then cast Sword Burst, dealing minor damage. Kyrin uses Psychic Teleportation, then hides and I have no idea where she is.

Emilio is also mindful of this teammates and carefully excludes me from the radius of his Void Grenade (Abhorrent Apparition). Then he aura farms. One warlock atop the fortress wall shoots a Fireball at us. Fearghas and me dodge for half damage but Emilio takes the full blast. Fearghas chugs a proper, non-Hag Potion of Heroism, then casts Shocking Grasp but misses despite the advantage, such sad times we live through.

The Manastorm Golem peeks from behind the wall, shoots a Draining Bolt at me, misses (phew) and ducks back behind cover. The Dreadnought charges, pushing Fearghas and Emilio and knocking them both prone. He also slaps Emilio with his shields, and as a bonus action jumps to get closer to Plex (who still thinks himself well-hidden). Aviana jumps so perfectly, her thunder damage hits EVERYONE (enemy and allies). Plex considers intercepting her with his Rocket Straps but realises considering the size of Aviana, it's likely a bad idea.

Aviana happily slaps a crit on the Dreadnought but it raises its shields, blocking the blow. Plex casts a Shocking Grasp which hits, dealing big damage thanks to his Sneaky Spellshite's Amulet. And that's overkill?! I dash in an attempt to hide behind Aviana, but my legs are too short to run all this way. Kyrin teleports, still so well-hidden none of us knows where she is (Plex could never) and pulls out the Tinkertop Boltblaster to light up the golem.

Emilio jumps to his feet and readies an Eldritch Blast for the Manastorm Golem. In the meantime we take another Fireball to the face; Plex uses Absorb Elements and only Aviana dodges it. Fearghas gets up and moves up to Emilio; he summons his Spectral Hand and then readies to cast Revelation Through Battle on the golem. The golem pops up, proceeds to take 3 Eldritch Blasts to the face, somehow is not dead yet so Emilio yanks him 10 feet closer, just in range for Kyrin. Fearghas takes one look at the golem, mutters "that's mean". The golem is immune against anything except force, and resistant to physical damage. It slaps Kyrin, she dodges by sucking in the belly and bending the back, masterful Rogue moves indeed.

Kyrin whacks the golem with the Sun Blade but it takes no damage at all. Aviana rages and crouches, readying a jump. Plex casts Adjust Density on Aviana to make her lighter and she immediately leaps, soaring like a very large chicken and landing with a bang. I give Emilio a lv 1 Cure Wounds, a little afraid to start burning (more) sorcery points. Kyrin shoots the golem and it plummets towards the lava, dissipating before it can touch the surface. Emilio climbs down the wall to the bridge below.

More elementals are flying around, keeping an eye on us but not attacking or coming close enough to risk getting shot by us. Fearghas goes down through the hatch. I follow him and oh gods the giant-sized stairs are a CHALLENGE. The size of the ballista bolts stored here makes this room look like a logging camp. We walk up to the gate, and Fearghas tells Plex to use the Instant Door! Sadly it does not work, but this sets a precedent of Fearghas approving the use of Plex's magic key. Aviana has no use for things like keys as she leaps up to the battlements.

Aviana finds a heavy lever and pulls on it to try to open the portcullis, but only gets it stuck. She tosses down a rope so we can climb. From up on the battlements, we see a giant staircase in the middle of the courtyard, leading down. There are no warlocks in sight… we suspect an ambush, and hurry to the stairs. Plex licks his finger, sticks it up, estimates the giants' battle will take about 10 hours. Kyrin offers to scout and look for the warlock of Imix who retreated while the rest of us go on ahead down the stairs.

We realise, hang on a second, these stairs are WAY oversized even for giants. 10 giants could walk down here side-by-side. Kyrin is scouting a torchlit hallway that seems to lead to a forge or smithy. The walls are very decorated with murals depicting a giant flame surrounded by smaller giants. Concerning… We find nothing but siege engines up on the wall, so we decide to climb down. As we walk through the buildings, we see living quarters through the windows. As we walk past one of the buildings, we smell burning incense… Drawn by the strange smell, I investigate but it is coming from the first floor. Plex pulls out the Instant Door… and a surge silences us all. Oh we can still think to one another but casting spells is off the table for the next hour.

We find a simple bedroom, though all the furniture is made of metal. We find the incense on the table and it's… reasonably-sized?! Clearly not made by giants. We find 4 Incense of Recovery (Minor)! Plex wants to use them to cover his sneaking so I do a bit of yelling at the goblin. I take 2 of them and each wizard takes one, just in case they eat up all their arcane recovery charges I guess? In the meantime Kyrin is on her own adventure, triggers a trap but dodges, finds an audience hall, finds alcohol and smoked food. She warns us of tripwires.

We decide to go down the stairs to rejoin with Kyrin. What's odd is… none of us has seen anyone since the battle ended. We meet up in the council hall; big table with 6 chairs, one of them knocked over as if in haste. On the table are stone slabs engraved with runes and a chisel. These runes aren't Giant, none of us understands them. Fearghas prepares to cast Comprehend Languages but Aviana takes ONE peek at the slabs and says "Well obviously that's written in Ignan, the Fire Elemental language, you can tell by the scorch marks. I still can't read it though." We realised although the tablets are written in Ignan, they are signed in Giant by one High Priest Vrummohr.

Fearghas casts Comprehend Languages and reads an exchange between some kind of Fire Elemental royal figure named Ignatio and the Fire Giants; a demand to return a stolen artefact. The Fire Elementals threaten the Giants to return the chains within three months, as they are part of the prison of a god. If they are not returned, grave danger will befall every plane of existence. The Fire Giants' response accuses Ignatio of lying; the Giants claim they received the chains from Surtr himself.

Kyrin is very restless, and ghosts down the stairs to scout as the rest of us take a break in the larder, nibbling on the food but mostly waiting out the silence surge. Emilio looks murderous, and confirms in the telepathic link that yes he is in fact always looking to kill things. N-not helping… I hesitantly go to fix him up while Plex discusses options to poison the Giants.

Kyrin tiptoes on ill-fitting metal plates barely covering lava beneath. She finds a shield with a wooden front but metal lining, covered in arrow and javelin holes. She also finds a chapel with murals, and beckons us in, so we join her there. Before we leave the council hall, Plex makes a door in three of the chair legs because… just because.

I roll a natural 1 on Religion and I am sure Imix is actually a Fire Elemental cast out for being too hot, and so it came to the Fire Giants who appreciated Imix' hotness and started revering him, which made Surtr jealous. Fearghas mutters this sounds like "one of Aviana's books". I insist it makes a lot of sense, and vehemently deny reading Aviana's books. He rolls a 25 on Insight against my 2 on Deception and gives me a blank stare. Is… is it obvious on my face that I um… borrowed one of Aviana's books? Oh dear…

We have to remind Plex that we are below a lava lake and opening random doors in the walls or ceiling may not be a great idea. Or at least it is a feat he could only do once. We find some oddities in the murals; one depicts mortals drawn tiny next to the giants, bringing gifts to Imix: books, scrolls, and gems. I notice a lot of burnt blood on the altar, most of it old. Fearghas places a pyrope on the altar. In the reflection of the gem, he sees us but it looks like our eyes are red and we seem creepy and greedy…? Plex decides to experiment and place a fork of fine quality on the altar. Nothing happens.

Fearghas picks up the pyrope again, but oddly it feels like stealing. Plex feels nothing of the sort as he retrieves his fork. I roll a natural 20 on Medicine and identify the blood as Fire Giant blood, some of it spilled less than 30 minutes ago! Kyrin has 0 fear and climbs up on the altar then slices her hand to spill blood on the altar. We all get near-blinded as Kyrin is engulfed in flames… and disappears. We don't hear her in the telepathic bond anymore. Fearghas replicates the ritual, and the same happens to him. Aviana grabs Plex and chokes him, then slices into him. His blood goes up in flames but he remains in Aviana's hand. At my urging she releases the goblin, who defends himself with Jim's Lance of Compensation, which sadly does not reach.

Just as Plex tries to stab Aviana again, he goes up in flames and vanishes. I ask Aviana to boost me up to the altar. I cut into my arm to drop blood onto the altar, and I am whisked away as well. Aviana follows after me and we all find ourselves in a large circular cavern. A big stone platform rises in the middle. The only exit is a pathway to the side, leading to a smaller cavern. The passage looks well-used, lined with braziers lit by a burning orange sphere. Kyrin steps out of the shadows, and Fearghas recasts Rary's Telepathic Bond, which had just ran out.

We walk down the pathway and hear an agitated discussion between 6 people, in Giant, up ahead. "Unfortunate timing for intruders to come in, with the Frost Giants attacking. The entrances to the library and the treasury have been sealed. The master has ordered to not seal the entrance to the core chamber. The giants decide to go set an ambush into the entrance chamber. We decide quickly to out-ambush their ambush! Fearghas generously offers himself up as bait.

Plex, Kyrin, and myself drink our Potions of Heroism. Aviana casts Death Ward on Emilio, and then drinks Bugman's Ale. Plex casts Mold Earth, presumably to hide, and only manages to trigger a major surge: for a WEEK, every door will slam shut behind him and become locked. Fearghas readies Globe of Invulnerability. Plex is thinking in terms of goblin engineering, trying to devise catapults around his major surge.

We roll initiative, and A Series of Unfortunate Events happens! So Plex… how do they die? "Is there a door nearby?" Plex asks confidently. It's a cave. There is no door. "What's the big stone called from the Indiana Jones movies, the big boulder?" A perfectly circular boulder drops from the ceiling, crashes down perfectly between 2 giants, one panicks and runs and the boulder rolls after him, picking up speed on the flat floor of this perfectly stable cave, and flattens the giant. The others come out and see Fearghas standing in the open, casting Globe of Invulnerability around him.

Plex readies a Silence spell. Kyrin readies to assassinate one of the last giants. One War Mage dashes forward, followed by a Dreadnought who jumps forward and spots Emilio and Aviana, charges them, steps on me on its way and both Emilio and me also fall prone. Ouch… Fearghas casts Command on the Dreadnought and orders it to Halt and take no actions next turn. It rolls a natural 1 on the save! The lich hand flicks him on the nose, saying BAD!! and the giant is so stunned, he has no idea what to do with himself. Aviana rages and attempts to grapples the Dreadnought, earning an inspiration for the wrestling contest! He breaks out of the grapple, so she slashes at him with perfectly painted nails.

Another War Mage walks up and casts Scorching Ray on Aviana but only 2 out of 6 hit. I move the previously placed Wellspring of Life (trust) to cover me and Emilio, and cast Cone of Cold on the Dreadnought, but he passes the save and takes only minor damage. Another Dreadnought appears and charges Plex in his bunker who succeeds on the STR save?!

The Wellspring heals Emilio, who gets up from the ground and activates Void Form and starts attacking with Reaping Claws. The giant raises his shields and blocks, but Emilio attacks again, connecting this time. Kyrin attacks with the Sun Blade, but hits a Shield spell. Plex pulls out "Smoke Granades" and chucks one in the middle of the pathway, creating a cloud of pitch-black spores, on top of his Silence spell. He shoves his Dreadnought into the cloud of spores with Telekinesis and forces him prone with Crushing Impact.

Kyrin attacks with the Sun Blade, then uses Phantom Pain for more damage. She hides with a 32 on strealth, the giants are scrambling to find whatever little rat bit them and they cannot see it?! A War Mage steps through the passageway and casts Dispel Magic to remove the Command on the Dreadnought. Emilio reacts with Counterspell, but the same War Mage uses her reaction to cast… Counterspell. Emilio threatens the War Mage but she doesn't understand Common and Fearghas understands her saying in Giant "what is that pipsqueak saying?".

The Dreadnought with the Command dispelled identifies a healer and bashes me in the face. This allows Aviana to use Coordinated Hunt, giving Emilio a free attack and he crits! The Dreadnought's attacks on me miss, but he steps into my healing spell… Joke's on you, it heals at the beginning of your turn and I'm about to move it move it. The Warlock of Imix understands by communicating with her allies that Emilio is a THREAT and casts Banishment on him. He passes the save with negative issues, rolling a 28 and all.

Fearghas casts Chain Lightning! IT'S A CRIT!! 20d8?! "Listen Fearghas," says Aviana, "hit me. Just fcking FRY me. I'm the conduit!" He's popping inspirations to re-roll failed attack rolls, and hits every target, triggering Aviana's Unflinching. The harpy explodes, the Warlock next to her keels over and dies. Fearghas slaps Toll the Dead on the Dreadnought, which also dies. "Is that enough firepower for you Plex?" Fearghas asks.

Aviana grabs at the War Mage. She understands the mage shouting at her allies to run, and then she starts to pray without defending herself. Aviana drags the terror-stricken mage to Emilio, but as she jumps and lands, the thunder damage kills the mage. Aviana proceeds to crit the Dreadnought and bites him through the heavy armour. She somehow murders the Dreadnought and proceeds to apologise profusely to Emilio for stealing his kill. The harpy is having a really good time showering in blood. Emilio isn't judging her.

The last War Mage alive is out of sight and just blasts a Fireball in our general direction. Kyrin dodges it, taking no damage. The giant shouts something Kyrin can't understand, and starts backing off. Kyrin tells us through telepathy were the last giant is, but I can neither see her nor get to her, so I defend myself as Emilio dashes towards the mage. He uses Netherwalk, then Eldritch Energies, slapping an Eldritch Blast on the last giant. The mage Counterspells in panic. Plex Fey Steps into the Wellspring, lights his pipe, and sits down to chill. We're still in combat.

Kyrin attacks with her Psychic Blade, but it's not enough yet. Fearghas dashes up to the spore cloud. Aviana slurps up some blood, bathing in the Wellspring. The giant mage casts Misty Step, Emilio Counterspells, she Counterspells, Misty Step goes off and she dashes, fleeing from us. I return to the Wellspring, trying to ignore Aviana's barbaric moment of triumph. Years of practicing medicine, my stomach is too strong for a little (well, a lot really) blood, and I almost wish it wasn't.

Emilio blasts the mage and drags her closer, chasing with Phase Shift. Kyrin shoots a Tanglefoot Arrow. The mage rolls a natural 1 on the save and is slowed. Fearghas joins the chase as he moves through the spore cloud. Dwarves being natural-born sprinters, he dashes after our fast and murderous friends. The mage is still trying to run and Misty Steps away. Emilio chases with more Eldritch Blasts; she Shields. Kyrin shoots and misses, then steps into the shadows.

I hear Emilio and Kyrin's thoughts, feel their desire to kill. I can sense their bloodlust and I want nothing more than to cut my mind off from the telepathic bond. Primal fear makes me try to silence my thoughts, they wouldn't hurt me would they? We're friends. My friends are giving their all to kill a creature that is desperately running from them… Kyrin thinks to Fearghas, "Yell at her we won't stop the chase, she might as well stand and fight! I don't speak Giant, tell her!" I want to cover my ears, if only it could stop the voices. Kyrin's anger overpowers all her thoughts. Emilio is all instinct, no emotion.

Still chasing the mage, Emilio rounds a corner into a big cavern full of piles of gold, a veritable hoard of gold. The mage runs into this cavern screaming for help. Emilio relays her screams to the rest of us and we realise she is screaming for help… in Draconic. Emilio casts another Eldritch Blast and yanks the mage back, but does not succeed in killing her yet. He does get a surge making him faster for a week, and by the sound of Fearghas shouting in all our heads to GET OUT OF HERE NOW, he will need it.

Plex is painting with blood and rolls a natural 20.

Kyrin sneaks up to the injured mage, rolls a natural 20 with her bow, and shoots THE ARROW OF DESTINY. It takes the giant in the back of the head, sends her tumbling forward and into one of the gold piles, scattering the coins in a shower of metallic noise and then… silence.

pages.name: 92 - summary
pages.content:
No touchy our spell slots

Plex despairs, he is out of paint and cannot camouflage himself as a rock. Shalkoc cooks unspiced hardtack, tastes like hit points. Aviana suggests eating Fearghas' liver, Plex agrees, I yell at them. Fearghas is deafened by a surge and enjoys the best night of his life as we take a short rest and he is free of our yapping.

Monday morning rolls around and I heal up the rest of our wounds, accidentally making Fearghas hear again and he is very sad. Fearghas requests volunteers for a little bloodletting, Emilio's blood is black, I'm sure that's nothing to worry about. We eat hardtack with somehow even less spices, Shalkoc are you okay? Aviana does her nails, and I contact Frengald who responds he will start his attack on the fortress. Plex calls Aviana a cooked chicken, she is not too happy.

We try to sneak in but the bridge over the lava lake has 0 cover so Plex gets shot by a giant ballista, on account on Aviana using him as a shield. We fight at a gatehouse, I paralyse a fire giant so everyone can beat her up. Overkill! But there are more enemies, including one of the rainbow golems and it's sucking the spell slots out of me?! War crime. The biggest threat this campaign has ever seen. I squeak MY SPELL SLOTS and Kyrin says, "hmmm Fearghas sounded very female just now?"

We do some more fighting against a giant with two shields, Emilio is aura farming, Fearghas drinks a proper non-Hag potion, we have a difficult time getting the golem but Kyrin puts an arrow in it and it dissipates. Fearghas and me have a personal battle with stairs (legs are small, y'all). Plex' Instant Door doesn't work on the main gate but Aviana has no use for petty thinks like doors and jumps to the top of the wall then tosses us a rope (she got the door stuck of course).

In the castle courtyard, it is much too quiet for comfort. Kyrin does a lot of scouting and relays information to us telepathically, we do a bit of looting and find incense with a wonderful smell of spell slots, we all get silenced by a surge (thanks Plex). Down the stairs, we find a council hall. Aviana the scholar spots stone slabs on the table and says they are obviously written in Ignan, you can tell by the scorch marks. No she can't read it, so Fearghas casts Comprehend Languages.

He reads us an exchange between Ignatio, Fire Elemental royalty, and High Priest Vrummohr of the Fire Giants. Ignatio demands the return of Rovagug's chains as they are part of the prison of a god of destruction. Vrummohr calls Ignatio a liar and claims the chains are a gift from Surtr himself. This is what we call foreshadowing. We take a little break in a nearby larder and nibble on the Fire Giants' food like we are rats. To them, we are probably rats.

Kyrin leads us to a chapel where I read interesting things in the murals and Fearghas says it sounds like one of Aviana's books. I deny. He rolls 25 on Insight against my 2 on Deception. Fine, I borrowed one of Aviana's books, is it my fault if these murals make Imix look so hot?? Books aside, we investigate the altar and find out it can teleport us away! We offer our blood as a tribute and get whisked away to a cavern.

We hear Fire Giants talking in an adjacent cavern, and set an ambush with Fearghas as bait, how refreshing. A giant gets inexplicably flattened by a round boulder, Plex is twisting fate again. The giants come through the tunnel, we start fighting, looks like it will be a difficult fight! But. Get this.

  • Plex stacks up a Silence spell and a cloud of spores from a Lightshy mushroom grenade
  • Kyrin is stabbing from the darkness with stealth checks in the 30 range
  • Counterspell gets Counterspell'd
  • Emilio attempts trash talk, but the giants don't understand Common
  • Because of Plex' aoes, the giants are all lined up neatly
  • Fearghas casts a 6th-level Chain Lightning and fries the living daylight out of them and Aviana

From there the fight ends quickly, or it should have. The last giant runs away screaming for her life. Emilio and Kyrin give chase, relaying her screams in the telepathic bond. Aviana is drinking blood and Plex is painting with the blood, I am sitting here stunned, these are my friends…? Fearghas runs after the giant too but he cannot catch up. Cue a horror film chase scene where Emilio and Kyrin are shouting in our heads about "killing that bitch" and the giant evades them with Misty Step.

They don't give up until they enter a new cavern full of gold, piles of gold coins, and the giant switches languages and screams for help in Draconic. Kyrin murders her with an arrow, Fearghas shouts in the bond to GET OUT OF HERE NOW, and silence falls.

I think we lost Shalkoc in the larder where he was toasting marshmallows but he caught up very quickly when he heard us think about piles of gold!

pages.name: 93 - Suspicious winking, Fearghas give me strength
pages.content:
Monday, 16th of Undecimus, 1497

11:30

As the Fire Giant falls dead into a pile of gold, the ground and walls rumble with a deep growl. Kyrin hides to sneakily check on the situation, but Emilio strategically decides to book it. Kyrin describes the room to us telepathically; islands floating in lava, one large and four small, some stairs at the back, four pillars on the main island. Plex and Aviana are arguing about how blood-bathing should be done, Fearghas shouts "This is not the time for —", Aviana grabs Plex by the throat, and they both disappear.

Kyrin is extremely sneaky and scouts the cave a little more. The roof is high up, the islands reach about a hundred feet out of the lava. Kyrin sends us a question, none of us hear it… We figure out pretty quickly something is interfering with the telepathic bond, and Fearghas marches off to look for her. We all follow into a room bursting with treasure… Shalkoc's eyes go saucer-wide, and even though I can't see Kyrin, I feel her little thieving heart rejoice. Fearghas calls Kyrin in a whisper, then we find the barrier messing with our telepathy.

Kyrin teleports to the island to our right and picks up something. Runes on the pillars start to glow, filling the cavern in a blinding light. We are forcefully teleported into another cavern with matching runes… in mid-air above a bubbling lake of lava. Fearghas casts Fly from a spellgem. I scream for Shalkoc to grab me and his wings pop into existence. Fearghas grabs Emilio, Shalkoc grabs me, Kyrin teleports and we safely land on the nearby rocky outcropping. In front of us are bones, a circular altar covered in old blood, and two sarcophagi behind it.

Funerary urns surround the altar. Fearghas flies over the altar, I start going around it, Emilio steps onto it. We hear a sound like an exhale, not unlike Shalkoc's fire-breath. The walls shake, then go still. Emilio walks across the altar unharmed, we are all spooked. Emilio is frosty as can be, examines the altar for a mechanism, rolls a natural 1. He yanks out a brick that seemed out of place… and they all tumble like dominos, the altar crumbling, leaving our warlock standing here with one brick in his hand. Fearghas examine the sarcophagi, there is Draconic script on them but he can't make sense of any words. The top is sculpted with a Dragonborn skull.

Shalkoc licks it, tastes old. I try to dissuade Fearghas from opening the left sarcophagus, saying we should let the dead rest. Naturally, he opens it. Kyrin is sneaking up ahead, though we agree the time for subtlety is long past. She comes to a metal gate with tiny holes in it, too small even for her hand to pass through. There is another sarcophagus beyond it. Fearghas casts Detect Magic, sensing necromancy from inside the coffins, and remains of other magic on the (former) altar. As he opens it, the necromantic ward inside activates and a clawed skeletal hand rises up, helping him push the lid up. The skeletal remains of a big Dragonborn-like, quadrupedal creature, rises from the grave.

The creature speaks in Draconic, which Fearghas and Shalkoc understand (and translate for us). Shalkoc casually starts chatting with the dead guy, asking how long he was asleep. "I was entombed not long after Imix' exile," he says, then adds he is (was?) a priest of Tiamat. Oh shit. Fearghas carefully says we're not followers or enemies of Tiamat. The undead deducts we are grave-robbers. N-nooooo. We say the year is 1497, and the undead says it makes no sense and our brains must be cooked.

Shalkoc learns other races used to serve Dragonborn and he wants to go back in time. He let slip he was a leader of a village, then went "oop". Fearghas asks why this guy is buried under a Fire Giant fortress in Muspelheim. "This should be Imix' fortress, in Imix' Jaws!" Aha… it's called Surtr's Jaws now… Our undead guy is very confused; he died in the year 3741, when Fire Giants were slaves of dragon folk! Fearghas launches into a lecture of dwarven history for our man Xurvanthrax, who first wakes up his friend Sulythas (and not Silithus).

To Fearghas' credit, he covers a lot. The undeads ask if the Dragon Empire fell aeons ago, and if "lesser" races rule now. Fearghas confirms, yea dragons are pretty much myth and legend now. They are aghast; that goes against the will of Tiamat! They ask where Imix the god of fire is, but we don't know exactly. Fearghas asks about the chains of Rovagug. If these guys had eyes, they'd narrow. "What about the imprisoned god?" Um… he hasn't broken free. Yet. That we know of.

Xurvanthrax lectures Shalkoc, "this is what happens when you let slaves run free". So we're Shalkoc's followers now it seems. "What happened to the altar?!" "Oh this, it was like this when we got here!" Fearghas says. Thankfully Emilio put down his brick. The altar was for blood sacrifices to open the door. Which of Shalkoc's followers should be bled out on the altar? Shalkoc is not a fan of the idea, we're good friends! He asks for the location of "Imix' stash", we are going there but first we need a lot of blood.

The telepathic bond ends, so no one is translating Draconic anymore. Shalkoc winks at me and steps onto the altar. Fearghas' response is "Emilio? Duck!" as he casts a Lightning Bolt. One of them casts Absorb Elements. Fearghas adds a Vicious Mockery, saying "Dwarves are best." Dwarvenkind number one? Xurvanthrax against berates Shalkoc for letting his slaves run wild, and Shalkoc protests, you cannot call people slaves nowadays, I told you not to use the bad word. Kyrin takes out her crossbow and starts blasting, then ducks behind a sarcophagus to hide.

Sulythas roars a war cry so powerful we have to roll WIS saves. 3, 3, 2, 3… and a 16 for Shalkoc. Even after bonuses, he is the only one not frightened. Then Sulythas the Chieftain raises his axe and… that's a surge, blasting necrotic damage. Fearghas takes a greataxe to the face, gets knocked prone, then Shalkoc runs in and starts throwing hands. One legendary resistance later, no stun is happening. All good, Shalkoc punches the other guy straight back to sleep.

Emilio goes right into Void Form, though it's his last charge. Fearghas doubts the strategic value of this but Emilio says "trust me". Concern. He starts slicing with Reaping Claws, rolling a crit, and runs off a little way. I dodge a tail sweep attack of opportunity, and blast a 5th-level Lightning Bolt through Lioriel's staff. It fries Sulythas, reminding him he is dead. Fearghas follows through with Shocking Grasp, then Toll the Dead.

Kyrin shoots a bolt through Xurvanthrax' eye sockets, dropping him to the floorstones. Emilio in the background is casually snacking on essence shards to regain a Void Form charge and avail himself a few temp HP. Well that was easier than we thought… We start looting but there isn't much to be had in this room. Please tell me we won't have to bleed anyone on the altar… We go ahead and examine the metal gate on the left. They are magically sealed but we can see through the tiny holes in them. We consider teleporting through but decide to check the gate across the hallway first.

The other gate is similar, sealed but we can peer through. There is a passageway beyond the right gate but we have no idea where it leads. Fearghas is trying to find a way to break open the gates; summon an earth elemental? He can't see the hinges on the gates, welp. I offer to use my Shadowslip to scout, we agree it's a good idea, and I slip into a quivering puddle of darkness radiating anxious energy.

I ghost along the floorstones… and immediately stop. G-guys…? Dragon up ahead. I sneak along the wall. It's not a living dragon at least… a skeleton held up by metal fixtures, but these look far too small to hold the dragon bones. I assume it's undead and can move if it gets in the mood for it. In the same hall are more sarcophagi, richly decorated. I slink back and slip under the right gate, finding down the hallway a similar dragon skeleton… and a way out! We decide against looting the place, yes Fearghas I am ashamed of grave-robbing, I may have been adventuring for a while but I have not abandoned my principles thank you very much.

Shalkoc punches the gate, misses, oddly slippery this one. Fearghas and Emilio start blasting the gate with cantrips, and call Kyrin over to have a go at it with the Sun Blade. After a lot of loud whacking, the gate shatters, the sound bouncing between the walls. We hear cracking noises, and steps come stomping towards us! It's a Dragonbone Golem! I love the smell of initiative rolls in the evenings!

Fearghas casts Revelation Through Battle, but it doesn't seem to work on the golem, like it's resistant to magic? He drinks a Potion of Maximum Power. The Golem walks up, nearly steps on Kyrin without noticing her, gives Shalkoc a strange look and promptly starts beating up Fearghas. Kyrin whacks it with advantage, boom Sneak Attack! The Golem swipes at Shalkoc with such reach, I also need to dodge. Shalkoc evades, I take some damage.

I summon Fade and retreat, in great part because the Golem's fear aura is making me cry. Kyrin is also frightened, she retreats, hides, and shoots with her crossbow. Shalkoc steps up, rolls a nat 1 on the WIS save (sad trombone) and he is quaking in his boots. He proceeds to whack anyway, believing in Fearghas who believes in him. That doesn't work great as he is rolling with disadvantage, so he believes in himself a little bit too, and hits! "Go to sleep go to sleep… please?" He attempts a Stunning Strike, but the Golem pops a legendary resistance. Flurry of Blows! Miss. Another punch on top of it? Miss. Ah, well…

Emilio tries Eldritch Blast, two misses and a poor damage roll. Guys, Karnack says, we really need to ROLL BETTER. He's taking advantage of Domi's absence and the lack of stream to say it… He proceeds to fail the WIS save too, which only proves his point. Lightning Bolt, 3rd level, and the Golem fails the save! Fearghas Shields against one attack, Shalkoc dodges a Bite. Fade takes a nibble, and then… well cantrips won't work (ignore the earlier Eldritch Blast) because of the Golem's magic resistance, so I pull out my sling and fling a pebble into its eye.

Kyrin shows us how to do damage and pops up from behind the sarcophagus long enough to shoot it for big damage. Shalkoc finally passes the save, shifts to Mantis Style, and begins to put the Golem to sleep with his fists (unsuccessfully). He eats a surge causing him to permanently forget 2 languages he knows and replace them with 2 new ones. It can't ever be undone! Shalkoc only knows Common and Draconic! Kyrin decides to use a Martyr's Locket to take the curse off him, forgetting Undercommon and Elvish and learning Draconic and… Abyssal?!

Emilio is pissed off Eldritch Blast doesn't work, so he grows his claws with Void Form and starts reaping the essence shards… murdering the Golem on the spot. He immediately crunches on the shards to regain his Void Form. Fearghas mumbles "Who's not dead, sound off." We all speak up, and he goes to check the body for alchemical components. Kyrin dips down the hallway to loot, I'm chilling with Emilio and Fade who's offering emotional support in the absence of my shadow.

Kyrin finds one flask of Oil of Immovability (essentially super glue) while Fearghas picks up Core Crystals and Essences of Legend. We talk shit IRL and proceed. As we round a corner, we find ourselves in a puzzle room! It has three exits, the one straight ahead leads to the dragon hoard we were teleported from, but we can't see into the left or right exit from here. Lava bubbles below, and many pillars rise out of it, each of them painted with a rune. Every rune is unique.

Fearghas runs his hand through his beard as he contemplates the room, searching for patterns. The two runes on either side of the door we came in through are glowing. Some pillars look like they've been dipped into lava more than others, like shiny worn keys on a keyboard. Fearghas gives Shalkoc a push to jump on the closest pillar; when he does, the rune lights up. He jumps onto another one… both pillars' symbols go out, and they start sinking into the lava, barely leaving Shalkoc enough time to jump to safety. The pillars resurface quickly, and Fearghas begins to instruct Shalkoc to jump to different pillars to try to identify a correct sequence.

We theorise a Fire Giant could touch 2 pillars at the same time while standing in lava. Fearghas and Shalkoc start experimenting standing on 2 pillars simultaneously. Nothing happens with 2 people on the same symbol. Shalkoc jumps to the right exit and sees through the gate… the room Kyrin described in her vision, with the lava pool and the chain! The left exit leads to a library. Fearghas' wizard senses are tingling…

We find a path to the hoard, using the power of symmetry! But we want to loot the place before going to the "obvious boss room". Using this logic, we quickly figure out the pattern to disable all the force fields blocking the doors. We make a beeline to the library and find a book in Draconic called The Birth of the Soul. It has fascinating information and theories about souls forming and interacting with Ley Lines.

We also find spell scrolls: Alarm, Find Familiar, Ashen Memories, Instant Siege Weapon (which Fearghas quickly grabs before Plex can reappear and get his hands on), Instant Fortification, Unseen Servant, and Word of Recall. Fearghas and Emilio split the scrolls between them, as they can transcribe them into their spellbook or Book of Shadows.

We proceed to the hoard. Doing our best to contain Shalkoc who is near-consumed by sheer greed, we investigate with Emilio's Detect Magic. The room is full of magic items of course, but the platform we initially came onto is magical, the one we are standing on right now (which is broken) is not. Touching nothing, we jump to the middle island and investigate the pillars. We suspect the pillars' magic is what teleported us earlier. They seem to be wards against intruders.

We think over it, and with the help of an Augury spell, decide to use a spellgem Fearghas gave me a long time ago; a 6th-level Mordenkainen's Private Sanctum. Protected by the spell, we vaccuum up the magic items and gold. As we divide items among us, Fearghas takes out Guardian Scales he's not using, so I get the Divination one and Emilio gets the Enchantment one. There is an item that only a Sorcerer can attune to; an Elemental Essence Shard (Air) that allows me to fly after using Metamagic. I'll have to give up my Belt of Dwarvenkind to use it though…

I give Fearghas gems I picked up, for spellscribing. Kyrin grabs the Elemental Gem, Red Corundum. Emilio picks up the Badger Hide, a set of magical armour. Fearghas picks up the Eyes of Minute Seeing and the Wardstone. Kyrin hops to the corpse of the Fire Giant she shot, and finds a Dragon Compass that will point to dragons. How incredibly convenient… She gives it a try, and it does not point towards Shalkoc! But it points that-a-way… oh that's the direction in which we saw the chain…

We only have so much time while Frengald is attacking the fortress, so we return to the rune puzzle room and go right, towards the room with the lava pool and the chain, the reason we came here, even! Fearghas puts up Leomund's Tiny Hut, and I use the Wand of Catnap to magically put Emilio, Kyrin, and Shalkoc to sleep for 10 minutes. Fearghas and me stay awake and keep watch. Shalkoc is not snoring, Kyrin does little snore-lets in between Emilio's… noises?! He's making conversation difficult. "Torag's teeth, that boy," Fearghas grumbles. No wonder he needed a bubble to survive in the Void.

I peek through the entrance, and from the chain room I see… Fire filling the entire room, a face forming in the fire. Fearghas turns around and says that's probably Imix. It… it makes eye contact with us, right through the bubble. It shouldn't be able to do that?! Then it quietly returns to the chamber with the chain. Emilio snores himself awake, waking the other two. Fearghas talks to Emilio about his snoring. Then he talks about Imix.

We walk into the chain room. Just as Kyrin described it, a bridge of stone barely 5 feet over lava, with a pool in the middle, and at the end of it an altar over a circular pool, with the chain hanging in the lava. Kyrin's Dragon Compass is pointing straight ahead, but there is neither dragon nor elemental in sight. It's unbearably hot in this room. Emilio, Kyrin, and Fearghas drink their remaining Fire Resistance potions. A deep voice rumbles above our heads: "So there are the thieves. Why are you taking so long?" Fearghas asks the voice where it is hiding. Emilio calls it rude. Kyrin asks: "Are you Imix?"

"That's what people call me," the voice responds. It accuses us… truthfully, really, of sneaking in and murdering its disciples. I telepathically prompt Fearghas to say we came for the chain. Imix is unimpressed, and says if we take the chain, the Frost Giants will slaughter them. Are… are we the baddies…? Imix says we could run back to Loki and leave his people alone. Fearghas says "You're not the first dragon we met, Imix," and that Imix must have fled the Material Plane to escape Vrazzak's grasp.

Fearghas offers Imix a peace-talk with Loki. Imix says although the Fire Giants revere him, he has no part in their war. He does have problems with people murdering his followers and stealing his treasure, though. At Kyrin's sassy prompting, Imix appears, a column of fire rising from the pit the chain hangs into. He says the chain has been a recent gift from the Fire Giant leader Narsund, whose god had acquired the chain. A quake shook the elemental planes when The Key to the World was shattered and woke Rovagug from his slumber, who in his rage managed to break a chunk of the chains. Surtr caught it, but Torag didn't trust Surtr's skill to reforge the chain to strengthen Rovagug's prison. Surtr was insulted and it came to a conflict between the two gods.

At this moment, the Frost Giants invaded Muspelheim, reigniting an ancient war. The Fire Giants prayed for Surtr's aid, who bestowed upon them Rovagug's chain. The Fire Giants' survival now hangs from this piece of chain. Imix says only Shalkoc should be speaking to him, and he has been silent. Shalkoc looks up from making smores over the lava. Imix asks him if a wild magic surge turned him green. "Can you turn me back to black?!" Shalkoc asks hopefully. Imix is confused because Shalkoc shows none of the traits of green dragons such as cunning or trickery. "I would have taken you for a white dragon, for there seems to be nothing in you but hunger." Shalkoc is now similarly confused, standing here with his smores.

We somehow telepathically push Shalkoc forward to talk to the big guy. Ya can make more smores later, come on now, this is kind of about you mate. Shalkoc goes "Now that you mention it…" and begins talking about his dreams. Imix asks if Shalkoc even knows about the name he inherited; hasn't Vrazzak told him? Imix reveals Shalkoc is the heir of Nabu-Anshar and doesn't even know it. Imix, of Girra's line (though Girra would deny it!), says Azag would be very amused to see Shalkoc. I yell out lore about the Dragon Aspects in the telepathic bond, and sense vague satisfaction from some kind of deity beyond the veil of reality. Should I maybe have been a Cleric of Knowledge…?

At Imix' urging, Shalkoc steps closer and sees his real form; a wingless red dragon. Fearghas wonders if Imix is a Drake instead of a true dragon. From Shalkoc's mind, we see Imix has a long serpentine body, and the fire only shrouds him. Of course, Shalkoc pisses off Imix by asking "If you don't have wings, how can you fly?" Imix taunts Shalkoc, "How did YOU lose your wings?" He is confused, doesn't think he was born with wings.
